english: Tottenham has won eight FA cup competitions.

english: The Tottenham team has beaten the Rochadale team 6-1in their FA cup competition.

english: This victory means that Tottenham is to compete with Swansea in the FA cup quarter final on the 17th of March.
igbo: Mmeri a pụtara na Tottenham na otu Swansea ga-asọ mpi Quarter Final n'iko FA a ga-agba n'ụbọchị 17 nke ọnwa Maachị.

english: Son Heung-min scored the first and the fifth goal. Fernando Llorente scored hatrick within twelve minutes of the second half, while Kyle Walter-Peters scored the sixth goal.
igbo: Son Heung-min nyere goolu nke mbụ na nke ise. Fernando Llorente nyere goolu atọ n'ime nkeji iri na abụọ n'okara nke abụọ, ebe Kyle Walter-Peters nyere goolu nke isi.

english: Tottenham will play at the Wembley stadium on the 3rd of March. They will play Huddersfield in the Premier League before meeting Juventus in Champions League on the 7th day of March.
igbo: Tottenham ga-aga ọgbọ egwuregwu Wembley n'ụbọchị atọ nke ọnwa Maachị. Ha na Huddersfield ga-asọ mpi n'iko Premier League, tupu ha na Juventus ga-asọmpị nke ha n'iko Champions League n'ụbọchị asaa n'ọnwa Maachị.

english: Rochadale have sixteen outstanding matches to save themselves from relegation in the league.
igbo: Otu egwuregwu Rochdale nwere asọmpị 16 ịzọpụta onwe ha tụpụ ha baa relegation na league otu.

igbo: Asompị ha nke mbụ ga-abụ ha na Plymouth n'ụbọchị atọ n'ọnwa Maachị.

english: The head of police force (The Inspector General of Police): open/establish cattle ranch before you ban grazing.
igbo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii: Mepe ọdọ ehi tupu ị machie ịchịgharị ha

english: The Inspector General of Police has told Governors to first establish cattle ranches before they ban grazing of cattles in their states.
igbo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii agwala ndị Gọvanọ ka bụrụ ụzọ mepe ebe a na-azụ ehi tupu ha machie ịchịgharị ehi n'steeti ha.

english: Ibrahim Idris
igbo: Ibrahim Idris

english: The Inspector General of Police, Ibrahim Idris, has said that states should first provide rranches before banning of cattle grazing.
igbo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii bụ Ibrahim Idris ekwuola ka steeti bụrụ ụzo wapụta ala ebemaka ọzụzụ ehi tupu ha amachie ịchigharị ehi

english: The Inspector General of Police said this in yesterday's security meeting at Kaduna, adding that it will help to avert problems among farmers and herders.
igbo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii kwuru nke a ụnyaahụ na kaduna na nzukọ ndị nchekwa obodo metụtara sịrị na ọ ga-enye aka igbara nsogbu na adapụta n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi.

english: He further said that the problem in Benue was because the government did not establish cattle ranch before they banned cattle grazing.
igbo: Ọ gara n'ihu kwuo na nsogbu dapụtara na Benue bụ maka na gọọmenti steeti ahụ ehibeghị ọdọ ehi tupu ha machie ịchịgharị ehi

english: In that meeting whose topic was 'Development: Security challenges and the importance of proffering adequate solution.' The farmers-herders problem did not start at the era of President Muhammadu Buhari.
igbo: Na nzukọ ahụ nke isi okwu ya bụ, 'Nkwalite obodo: Nsogbu nchekwa na mkpa ọ dị ịchọta ụzọ zuru oke ịkwụsị ya,'nsogbu dị n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi ebidoghị n'oge ọchịchị onyeisiala bụ Muhammdu Buhari.

english: Idris said: 'In my opinion, to curb farmers-herders clash, state governments should strive and build cattle ranches before they make policy to ban open grazing.
igbo: Idris kwuru sị:'N'uche m, iji belata ọgbaaghara dị n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi, gọọmenti steeti ga-agba mbọ wuo ebe ọzụzụ ehi na steeti ha tupu ha eme iwu ikwụsị ịchịgharị ehi.

english: When it comes to winning in the most prominent award in the movie world known as Oscars, other Africans beat Nigeria hands down.
igbo: A bịa n' ihe nturugo kachasị ada ụda n' ụwa ihe nkiri a kpọrọ Oscars, ndị mpaghara Afrịka na-egosi Naijiria narị.

igbo: Akpụrụakpụ ihe nrite Oscars

english: 2018 marked the 90th year of Oscars award in Hollywood.
igbo: 2018 a mere ya afọ 90 a na-eme nturugo Oscars na Hollywood

english: After the events of 2018 Oscars, which is the most prominent award in the movie world, BBC Igbo investigated and found out that other African countries are better than Nigeria in the area of movie production.
igbo: Ka e mechara Oscars nke bụ emume nturugo kachasị ada ụda n'ụwa ihe nkiri nke 2018, BBC Igbo nyochara ma hụ na mba Afrịka ndị ọzọ ka Naijiria mma n' ihe gbasara ihe nkiri.

english: Oscars 2018: Between Africa and Nigeria
igbo: Oscars 2018: N' etiti Afrịka na Naijiria

english: BBC found out that despite that some Nigeria movie producers feature Hollywood stars in their movies, it has not made them to be among those named for winning any award in Hollywood.
igbo: BBC chọpụtara na n' agbanyeghi na ụfọdụ ndị na-emepụta ihe nkiri na Naijiria na-etinye ụfọdụ ndị Hollywood n' ihe nkiri ha, o mebeghi ka ha soro na ndị a na-akpọ aha inweta nturugo ọbụla na Hollywood.

english: Nollywood are those responsible for producing movies in Nigeria and other known African countries. Other African countries have shown them superiority.
igbo: Nollywood bụ ndị na-emepụta ihe nkiri na Naijiria na mpaghara Afrịka ndị ọzọ so na ndị a na-anụ aha ya, ndị mba Afrịka ndị ọzọ egosila ha nkarị.

english: Lupita Nyong'o, an American based Kenyan won the award of 'best woman producer' in the year 2013.
igbo: Lupita Nyong'o bụ nwa afọ Kenya bi n' Amerịka nwetara ihe nrite 'nwaanyị kacha akwado ihe nkiri' n' afọ 2013

english: Few years ago Nigeria was seen as the hero of movie production in Africa but now, it seems others have surpassed them.

english: While Nollywood themselves who are in second position in movie production produce over 1000 movies in one year, Hollywood produce less than that number of movies but it does not stop them from being those whom the whole world look up to as the producers of best movies.

english: Group of masquerades who were celebrating the feast of 'Uzo Iyi' at Uke in Idemili North Local Government Area, Anambra state, attacked a Catholic prayer group and destroyed more than thirty vehicles, injured many people. One of the stabbed persons died on Saturday.

english: The priest in charge of the Catholic prayer group Father Emmanuel Obimma, popularly known as Ebube Muonso, and other priests and ordained women escaped from the youths that attacked those who came to worship God with a vigil from Friday night through to Saturday morning.

english: The assistant priest Francis Okoye told BBC on phone that the masqueraders attacked the vigil mass by 8pm at night and injured some members of the congregation and destroyed more than thirty vehicles.

igbo: Ha merụrụ ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ahụ.

english: They stabbed one person who was taken the hospital with a knife.
igbo: O nwere ọtụ onye ha sụrụ mma e bugara ụlọ ọgwụ.

english: We don't know yet whether the person is alive or dead.
igbo: Anyị amabeghị ma ọdị ndụ ma ọ nwụrụ anwụ.

english: It is clear that the youths of Uke who did the thing were prepared to persecute the congregation members because when Uzo Iyi is being celebrated, masquerading stops at 6pm but those masquerades attacked the adoration ground by passed 8pm.
igbo: O were anya na ndị ntorobịa Uke mere ihe a kwadoro akwado imekpa ndị ụka ahụ n'ihi na, a na-eme 'Uzọ iyi', mmọnwụ na-agbadebe ma ọ kụọ elekere isii nke mgbede mana ndị mmọnwụ a wakpọrọ ebe a na-eme ụka abalị ka ọ kụchara elekere asatọ nke abalị.

english: They started from beating commercial drivers who were conveying people to church, and collecting their money and their phones.
igbo: Ha bidoro na-eti ndị ji ụgbọala ebute ndị mmadụ bịara ụka ihe, na-anara ha ego ha nakwa ekwentị ha.

english: Masquerades destroyed many vehicles in the adoration ground.
igbo: Mmọnwụ mebiri ọtụtụ ụgbọla n'ọgbakọ ahụ

english: Our security operatives did their best to stop them from destroying things but when we saw that what they were doing has gone out of control, we called on the police.
igbo: Ndị ọrụ nche anyị nwara ike ha ịkwụsị ha imebi ihe mana mgbe anyị hụrụ na ihe na-eme akarịala, anyị kpọrọ ndị uweojii.

english: They came and arrested some of them.
igbo: Ha bịara nwụchie ụfọdụ n'ime ha.

english: Anambra state police said that really, masquerades attacked the congregation at Uke but they said that nobody was dead.
igbo: Ndị uweojii Anambra steeti kwuru n'ezie na mmọnwụ wakporo ndịụka n'Uke mana ha kwuru na onweghị onye nwụrụ.

english: The spokesperson of the Anambra state police, Nkiru Nwode told BBC 'We arrested three mosqurades, we are investigating what happened there.
igbo: Ọnụ na-ekwuchitere ndị uweojii na steeti ahụ bụ Nkirụ Nwode gwara BBC na 'Anyi nwụchịrị mmọnwụ atọ, anyị na-enyocha ihe mere ebe ahụ.'

english: News said that this was not the first time the youths of the village were persecuting the participants of the adoration organised by Catholics which takes place every Friday night, which attracts more than two thousand people every week.
igbo: Akụkọ kwuru na nke a abụghị mbụ ndị ntorobịa obodo ahụ na-emekpa ndị na-aga ọgbakọ a pụrụiche ndị ụka Katolik na-eme kwa abalị Fraide nke na-adọta ihe karịrị pụkụ iri abụọ kwa izuụka.

english: Those who were present at the scene confirmed that the youths of the village were persecuting commercial drivers and the congregation, collecting money, phones and other valuables from them.
igbo: Ndị nọ ebe ihe meere kwuru na ndị ntorobịa obodo ahụ na-esogbu ndị ọkwọụgbọala na ndịụka na-anapụ ha ego ma na-etikwa ụfọdụ ihe.

english: Not long ago, they beat Father Obimma's worker that made the priest to complain to police who arrested the youths of the village, although they were released when the King and the elders of the village intervened.
igbo: Na nsonso, ha tiri onye ọrụ Fada Obimma ihe nke mere ụkọchụkwụ ahụ ji kpesara ndịuweojii ndị nwụchịrị ndị ntorobịa ahụ ma ahapụrụ ha oge eze obodo na ndị okenye obodo gboro ọgụ.

english: An allegation was made that the youths always attack the commercial drivers that convey people to the church.
igbo: E boro ebubọ na ndị ntorobịa na- emekpa ndị ọkwọụgbala na-akwọga ndị mmadụ ụka ahụ kwa mgbe

igbo: Akụkọ ndị ga-amasị gị:

igbo: Ụmụaka ruru puku 88 nwere ike ịnwụ n'oke agụụ

english: Benue: Herders have killed twenty people.
igbo: Benue: Ndị ọchịehị egbuola mmadụ 20

english: Which political parties will merge to take over power from APC?
igbo: Kedụ otu pati ndị ga-ekpoko iwepụ APC?

english: Ezeife: The Igbos will reject Buhari again.
igbo: Ezeife: Ndigbo ga-ajụ Buhari ọzọ

english: Eseife and other prominent people have said that telling Igbos to support Buhari for them to get presidency in 2023 is deceitful.
igbo: Ezeife na ụfọdụ ndị ọnụ na-eru n'okw ekwụola na ịgwa Igbo kwado Buhari ka ha nweta ọkwa na 2023 bụ okwu aghụghọ.

english: Chukwuemeka Ezeife and some Igbo elders
igbo: Chukwuemeka Ezeife na okenye ndị Igbo ụfọdụ

english: Chukwuemeka Ezeife, former governor of Anambra state from Igboukwu, one of the Igbo advocates in Nigeria
igbo: Chukwuemeka Ezeife,onye Igbo-Ukwu bụbu gọvanọ na Anambara Steeti bụ otu onye na-ekwuchitere Ndigbo na Niajiria

english: Prominent Igbos have said that Igbos will not support Buhari in 2019 like they did in 2015.
igbo: Ndị nwere agba n'ala Igbo ekwuola na ụmụafọ ịgbo ga-ajụ nkwado onyeisiala Buhari na ntulika nke 2019 dịka ha mere n'afọ 2015.

english: They made the Igbos to understand that it is an empty promise that Igbos will get presidency in 2023 if they support president Buhari to win again in 2019.
igbo: Ha dọrọ Ndigbo aka na ntị ka ha mata na ngwa na ọ bụrụ na ha kwado onyeisiala Buhari ka ọ banye n'ọchịcihị ọzọ n'afọ 2019 na ọkwa onyeisiala ga-erute Igbo aka bụ nkwa a na-ekwe nwaanyị n'elu akwa, nihi na ọ bụ okwu aghụghọ.

english: Not long ago, some members of APC which include the Minister of Transport , Rotimi Amechi, Secretary to the state government, Boss Mustapha and the Chairman of Voice of Nigeria, Osita Okechukwu, told the Igbos to vote for Buhari in 2019 in order to get their own share in www.
igbo: Na nsọnsọ, otụtụ ndị otu APC gụnyere, Minista na ahụmaka njem bụ Rotimi Amaechi, onye odeakwụkwọ nke gọọmenti etiti bụ Boss Mustafa na kwa onyeisi ndị ụlọọrụ Voice of Nigeria nbụ Ọsita Okechukwu gwara Ndị Igbo ka ha tụnyere Buhari na'afọ 2019, ka oke were rute ha na 2023.

english: Give the Igbo 2019 presidency: Balarabe Musa
igbo: Nye Ndigbo onyeisiala 2019 - Balarabe Musa

english: The Igbos are victimised like war vanquished.
igbo: A na-emegbu Ndigbo ka ndị emeriri n'agha'

english: But some prominent Igbos said that that statement was a deceit in order to get votes from the Igbos,
igbo: Mana ụfọdụ ndị nwere ọnụ n'igbo kwụrụ na okwu ahụ bụ okwụ aghụghọ iji nweta votu Ndigbo, kwụkwọ na ndị dịka Buhari bọrọ ndị Igbo maka entinghirị ya akwụkwọ n'afọ 2015, na ha agahị enyere ya na ntuliaka 2019.

english: In a discussion he had with the Sun Newspaper, the former governor of Anambra state said: 'There is no way it will be possible.'
igbo: Na mkparịtaụka ya na ụlọọrụ ntaakụkọ Sun nwere onye chịbụrụ Gọvanọ n'Anambara Steeti bụ Dr Chukwuemeka Ezeife si: 'A hụghị ka ọ ga e si mee.

english: I don't think we should be begging people for presidency.
igbo: Echeghị na anyị kwesịrị ị na-arịọ ndị mmadụ ọkwa onyeisiala.

english: My view is that we should go and ask God, who knows that if an Igbo emerges as the president that the Fulani, the Yoruba and the different parts of Nigeria will be satisfied because we will restructure the treasury of Nigeria for progress
igbo: Uche m bụ na anyị ga-aga rịọ Chineke, Onye mara na ọ bụrụ na onye Igbo were ọkwa dịka onyeisiala, obi ga-adị ndị Fulani mma, dị ndị Yoruba mma, dịkwara ndị mpaghara dị ichiche na Naijiria mma n'ihi na anyị ga-ahazigharị ọnọdụ akụnaụba Naijiria ka ọ ga n'ihu.

english: Talking of 2023 is irrelevant, whoever does that is up to deceiving the Igbos.
igbo: Ikwu maka 2023 bụ okwu akwụghị ọtọ, onye ọbụla na-ekwu ya bụ iji ghọgbụ Ndịgbo.'

english: On the same hand, the former president of Ohanaeze Ndigbo, Dozie Ikedife, said that the Igbos who were promised presidency did not participate the last time.
igbo: N'otu aka ahụ, onye bụbu onyeisi Ohanaeze Ndigbo bụ Dozie Ikedife, kwuru na Ndigbo bụ ndị ekwerela nkwa inweta ọkwa onyeisiala apụtaghị ihe ọbụịla n'oge gara aga.

english: He told Sun Newspaper 'The Igbos were promised the same way in the past, we were equally deceived.
igbo: Ọ gwara ụlọọrụ ntaakụkọ Sun sị: 'E kwela Ndigbo ọtụtụ nkwa dị otu a n'oge gara aga, aghọgbukwara ndị be anyị.

english: If someone deceived you two or three times, once he comes the fourth time, you have to think deeply.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na mmadụ ghọgbụo gị ụgboro abụọ ma ọ bụ atọ, ọ bịa nke anọ, i cheba echiche ime.

english: One is tired of this nation.
igbo: Ike ala a agwụla mmadụ.

english: Ikedife equally added: 'My interest is how Biafra will be actualized through lawful procedure anddialogue.
igbo: Ikedife gara n'ihu kwuo sị : 'Ihe bụ mkpa m bụ otu a ga-esi gbaso iwu na mkparitaụka nweta Biafra na alụghị ọgụ maọbụ kpalia onye ọbụla.'

english: Recall that in 2015, majority of the Igbos did not vote for Buhari in the election which made him say that he would not treat those who gave him 95% support and those who gave him 5% support the same way, a statement many thought he has fulfilled through his appointments since he assumed leadership.
igbo: Cheta n'afọ 2015, ọtụtụ Ndigbo atụnyerịghị Buhari akwụkwọ ntuliaka nke mere ka mere o jiri si na ya aghị nye ndị nyere nkwado pasent 95 na ndị nyere ya pasent ise otu ụgwọ, okwu ọtụtụ na-eche o mezuru site ndị o nyere ọkwa ọchịchị kemgbe ọ banyere n'ọchịchị.

english: The police said that a naked man has killed four people in a restaunt at Nashville in America.
igbo: Ndị uweo ji kwuru na otu nwoke gba ọtọ egbuola mmadụ anọ n'ụlọoriri dị n'obodo Nashville na mba Amerịka.

english: The man rushed into the restaurant at about 8am in Antioch and began to shoot people.
igbo: Nwoke ahụ tibara n'ime ụlọoriri ahụ ebe elekere asatọ nke ụtụtụ n'Antioch ma malite ị gba ndị mmadụ egbe.

english: Four other people were injured before another person who was also eating in the same restaurant snatched the was holding, he then ran away.
igbo: Mmadụ anọ ndị ọzọ merụkwara ahụ tupu onye ọzọ na-eri nri ebe ahụ anapụ ya egbe oji, o we gbapụ ọsọ.

english: The police gave the man's name as Travis Reinking, 29 years old from Illinois where they keep on looking for him.
igbo: Ndị uweoji enyela aha nwoke ahụ ka Travis Reinking dị afọ iri abụọ n'itoolu bụ onye si obodo Illinois ebe ha jisiike na-achọ ya.

english: The Nobel Prize winner Soyinka has said that Nigeria is devoid of good leadership.
igbo: Onye nwere nzere Nobel bụ Wole Soyinka ekwuola na ezi ọchịchị akpụọla afọ n'ala na Naijiria.

english: Wole Soyinka has advised Nigerians
igbo: Wole Soyinka adọrọ ndị Naijiria aka na ntị ka ha

english: Wole Soyinka, a well known writer, has advised Nigerians to be at alert and not to allow politicians deceive them in the forthcoming 2019 election.
igbo: Wole Soyinka bụkwa odee akwụkwọ a mara amara adọọla ndị Naịjirịa aka na ntị ka ha saa anya mmiri ghara ikwe ka ndị ndọọndọrọ ọchịchị ghọgbu ha ọzọ na ntuliaka na-abịa n'afọ 2019.

english: Soyinka, who said this on Sunday in the posthumous birthday ceremony of a well acclaimed lawyer Gani Fawehinmi which took place in Lagos said that democracy is in danger in Nigeria.
igbo: Soyinka, onye nke kwuru nke a ụbọchịụka n'emụme ncheta ọmụmụ onye ọkaiwu a mara amara nwụrụ anwụ bụ Gani Fawehinmi nke e mere na Legọs kwuru na obodo Naijiria na ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya nọ na nsogbu ugbua.

english: He said that those who put Nigeria in her present situation through their policies have again presented themselves as messiah because election is forthcoming, and advised Nigerians to reject old politicians in order to give new age politicians the opportunity to take over power.
igbo: Ọ si na ndị tinyere Naịjirịa na nsogbu ọ nọ na ya ugbua site na atụmatụ ha, e jikerela onwe ha ọzọ dịka ndị nzọpụta ka ntuliaka na-abịa, ma dụọ ndị Naijiria ọdụ ka ha jụ ndị ndọrọndọrọ ochie iji nye ohere ka ndị agba ọhụrụ were ọchịchị.

english: Buhari and APC leaders have had discussion.
igbo: Buhari na ndị isi otu APC enwela mkparịta ụka

igbo: Wole Soyinka: Chikọtanụ onwe ụnụ ọnụ ka okenye zuo ike

english: He said: 'It is not in doubt that democracy is in danger.'
igbo: Ọ sịrị: 'A naghị enyo ya enyo na ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya nọ na nsogbu.

english: It is not only democracy, our country is in trouble.
igbo: Ọ bụghị sọsọ ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya, obodo anyi nọ na nsogbu.

english: I don't think that there was a time in the entire world, most especially in this nation, a time where protection of everything is soured like this.
igbo: Echeghị m na o nwere oge na ndụ niile n'ụwa , ọkachasị n'ala a oge nchere ihe niile dakpọrọ adakọ otu a.

english: We all know this.
igbo: Anyị niile maa nke a.

english: The question is whether we are seeing it as a redeeming opportunity or are we seeing it as an opportunity to keep doing those things that made our nation a failure?
igbo: Ajụjụ bụ anyị ana-ahụ ya dịka ohere nzọpụta ka anyị a na ahụ ya ha ohere ị ga n'ihu na-eme ihe ndị ahụ mere na ala anyị na akpụ afọ n'ala?

english: It is no longer a news how important it is to do the things that will save the unity of our nation Nigeria.
igbo: Ọ bụghị akụkọ ọhụrụ mkpa ọ dị imee ihe ga-azọ ịdịkọnotu ala Naijiria.

english: It is surprising that the enemies of democracy who on their own brought in policies that caused our present situation are those who showcase themselves as the messiah that Nigeria look up to, a nation that has twenty million people.
igbo: Ọ bụ ihe mgbagwojuanya na ndị bụ ndị iro ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya ndị ji aka ha webata atụmatụ nke butere anyị n'ọnọdụ anyị nọ taa bụ ndị pụtara na egosi onwe ha dịka ndị nzọpụta nke ala Naijiria na-ele anya, obodo nweere ọnụọgụgụ mmadụ nde 200.'

english: Soyinka went on to advise Nigerians to be conscious
igbo: Soyinka gara n'ihu dụọ ndị Naijiria ọdụ ka ha saa anya mmiri iji gbalahụ.

english: It surprises me that while talking of redeeming Nigeria, one or two groups emerged that represent some prominent people.
igbo: Ọ gbara m gharịị na ka a na-ekwu okwu ịzọpụta ala Naijiria, otu otu maọbụ abụọ pụtara ndị nwere ndị nọ n'isi ya na eso.

english: I am telling people to suspect them because those who exert themselves on these groups are those who kept democracy in Nigeria in its today's bad situation.
igbo: A na ma agwa ndị mmadụ ka ha na-enyo ha enyo n'ihi ndị na awanye onwe ha na otu ndịa bụ ndị soro dowe Naijiria na ọnọdụ ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya nọ taa.

english: Why didn't Nigerians attend the meeting held in America?
igbo: Kedu ihe mere ndị Naịjirịa agaghị nzụkọ mgbere n'Amerịka?

english: Government of Nigeria have exonerated themselves from the meeting between investors and ministers held in America
igbo: Gọọmentị Naịjirịa agọrọla ọnu ha maka ihe mere na nzụkọ ndị chọrọ itinye ego na Naịjirịa na ndị minista nwere n'Amerịka.

english: Yemi Osibanjo and Abuja
igbo: Yemi Osibanjo na Abuja

english: Yemi Osibanjo is among those whose names are in the book for organising the meeting.
igbo: Yemi Osibanjo so na ndị aha dị n'akwụkwọ eji hazie ha bụ nzụkọ

english: So many ambassadors of Nigeria who were expected to be in the meeeting organised by Nigeria embassy in Washington DC in America were not present in the event.
igbo: Ọtụtụ ndị na-anọchịte anya gọọmentị Naịjirịa atụrụanya na ha nọ n'ọgbakọ ụlọọrụ na-ahụ maka Naịjirịa na mba Amerịka haziri n'obodo Washington DC egosịghị ihu na ya bu emume.

english: The absence of the government officials made the people hopeful that Nigeria will not get loan from overseas.
igbo: Ọbịbịa ndị gọọmentị ahụ abịaghị mere ka ndị mmadụ na-enwe ịtụnanya na Naịjirịa agaghị enweta ntunye ego site na mba ofesi.

english: Those who were supposed to be present include the vice president Yemi Osibanjo, Minister of finance Kemi Adeosun, Minister of petroleum Ibe Kachikwu, Minister of Agriculture Audu Ogbeh, Minister of technology Ogbonnaya Onu,Minister of Information Lai Mohammed, Minister of Mineral resources Kayode Fayemi and Minister of Commerce Okechukwu Enelamah.
igbo: Ndị kwesiri ịga ebe ahu gunyere osote onyeisiala bụ Yemi Osinbajo, mịnịsta na-ahụ maka ego bụ Kemi Adeosun, mịnịsta nke mmanụ agbịdị bụ Ibe Kwachukwu, mịnịsta nke ọrụugbo bu Audu Ogbeh, mịnịsta nke tecknụzụ bụ Ogbonnaya Onu, mịnịsta mgbasaozi bụ Lai Mohammed, mịnịsta nke okwute ndị bara uru bụ Kayode Fayemi na mịnịsta nke mgbere bụ Okechukwu Enelamah.

english: Tax on tobacco and drinks has increased.
igbo: Ụtụ anwụrụ na mmanya etinyela ego

english: Switzerland has agreed to return Abacha's loot.
igbo: Switzerland ekwetala iweghachite ego Abacha buuru

english: An individual, Sanusi Lamido, the king of Kano and once the governor of central bank of Nigeria, was dissatisfied with the action of the government.
igbo: Otu onye ihe a ndị gọọmentị mere na-ewute bụ Emir nke Kano Sanusi Lamido, bụ onye rụbụrụ ọrụ ka onye nhazi ụlọakụ ukwu na Naịjirịa.

english: What Sanusi said
igbo: Ihe Sanusi kwuru

english: Sanusi said that one who supports investing money in Africa should take Nigeria, Ghana, Ruwanda, Kenya, and South Africa.
igbo: Sanụsi kwuru na onye na-akwado itinye ego n'Afịrịka, 'o nwere Naijirịa, onwere Gana, o nwere Rụwanda, Kenya na Sawụt Afịrịka'.

english: He went further to say 'Nigeria maybe better than others in trading but an investor may say, instead of investing $500 in Nigeria let him invest $100 in Ghana, $100 in Ruwanda, $100 in Coted'Ivoire to get robust gain.
igbo: Ọ gakwara n'ihu kwuo, 'Naịjirịa nwere ike karịa ndi ọzọ niile n'ịtụ mgbere, mana o nwere ike sị kama ya ga etinye dọla 500 na Naịjirịa, ka m tinye dọla 100 na Ghana, dọla 100 na Rụwanda, dọla 100 na Code Vuwa, ka o nweta nrite mgbasa aka.'

english: We went to have a meeting with foreign investors, we were supposed to start by 9 o'clock but started by 10 o'clock.
igbo: Anyị gara ka anyị na ndị nwere ego ha na-etinye na mba mee nzụkọ, anyị kwesiri ibido na elekere itoolu, anyị wee bido na elekere iri.

english: When I got to that place, they took m to the office of the Nigeria Ambassador.
igbo: Mgbe m ruru ebe ahụ, ha kpọrọ m ga n'ụlọọrọ onye na-anọchịte anya Naịjirịa.

english: Those who came for the meeting were there, the Vice president was absent, the Ministers were absent, said Sanusi.
igbo: Ndị bịara nzụkọ ahụ nọ ebe ahụ, osote onyeisiala anọghị, ndị mịnịsta anọghị, Sanusi kwuru.

english: Sanusi said that what they did was not good, because it showed that Nigeria was not yet prepared for what was being talked about.
igbo: Sanusi sị na ihe a mere adịghị mma, maka na ọ na-egosi na Naịjirịa adịbeghi nkwadobe maka ihe a na-ekwu okwu ya.

english: He said 'You called people to come and hear how trading is done in Nigeria but you did not come. '
igbo: O kwuru, 'Unu kpọrọ ndị mmadụ ka ha bịa nụrụ etu e si atụ mgbere na Naịjirịa, mana unu abịaghị.

english: This is not how to get people that will invest in Nigeria.
igbo: Ọbụghi etu a ka esi enwete ndị ga-etinye ego na Naịjirịa.

english: If it were to be Ruwandans that organised this meeting, their president, Paul Kagame would be there telling the people to start coming to Ruwanda.
igbo: Ya bụrụ na ọ bụ ndị Rụwanda haziri ọgbakọ a, onyeisiala ha bu Kagame ga-anọ ebe ahụ na-agwa ndi mmadụ bịawa Rụwanda.

english: People lent their voices on social media
igbo: Ndị mmadụ tinyekwere ọnụ n'okwu a na soshal midia.

english: The owner of the handle @SegunAndrews agreed to what Sanusi said.
igbo: Onye nwere akara @SegunAndrews kwenyere n'ihe Sanusi kwuru.

english: But, the government have denied that it was not how the thing happened.
igbo: Mana, gọọmentị ekwuola na ọbụghị etu a ka ha bụ ihe siri ga.

english: Lai Mohammed, the Minister of information has sent out message explaining that it was not true that those who were supposed to go for the meeting did not go.
igbo: Laị Mohammed bụ mịnịsta na-ahụ maka mgbasaozi zipuru ozi na-akọwa na ọ bụghị eziokwu na ndị kwesịrị ịga ya bụ nzụkọ agaghị.

english: Mohammed explained that the ministers whose names were in this event did not receive invitation to come, or were in Washington DC when this meeting was going on.
igbo: Mohammed na-akọwa na ndị mịnịsta aha ha dị n'emume a enwetaghị akwụkwọ e ji si ha bịa ya, maọbụ nọdụ na Washịntịn DC mgbe ọgbakọ a na-eme.

english: He said that the Ministers of Agriculture, electricity and Labour, and Wealth creation did not get invitation despite that they were scheduled to give talk in the meeting.
igbo: O kwuru na mịnịsta ọrụugbo, nke ọkụ latrik na ọrụ na nke okike ego na-ahazi enwetaghi akwụkwọ agbanyeghị na aha ha dị n'akwụkwọ ndị ga-ekwu okwu na ya bụ ọgbako.

english: Minister of Commerce himself went to the meeting of the commonwealth leaders in London with the President.
igbo: Mịnịsta nke mgbere na onwe ya so onyeisiala gawa nzụkọ ndị na-achị mba ndị so na Commonwealth bi na London.

english: Minister of Finance was in Washington DC, but she was there for the meeting of world bank and IMF.
igbo: Mịnịsta na-ahu maka ego nọ na Washịntịn DC, mana ọ bụ maka nzụkọ ndị ụlọakụ ụwa na IMF.

english: He went further to say that Minister of Information and culture got invitation, but he told the organisers of the meeting that he would not make it because of other things.
igbo: Ọ gakwara n'ihu kwuo na mịnịsta na-ahu maka mgbasa ozi na omenala nwetere akwukwọ, mana ọ zara ya were gwa ndị na-ahazi ọgbako a na ya agaghị aganwu maka ihe ndị ọzọ aka ya di na ya.

english: Lai Mohammed said 'These things showed that it should not be said that the ministers refused to go for the meeting. '
igbo: Lai Mohammed kwuru na 'Ihe ndị a gosiri na e kwesịghị ikwu na ndị Minista ekweghi ịga ya bu nzụkọ.

english: Don't allow Igbo to into extinction.
igbo: Ekwela ka Igbo nwụọ'

english: Ikeogu Oke won $10,000 as the winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature.'
igbo: Ikeogu Oke ritere puku dọla 100 dịka onye ọkachasị ede mbem na Naịjira n'afọ 2017.

english: The winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature,' Ikeogu Oke has said that Igbo will not go into extinction if the Igbos value it
igbo: Onye ritere ihe nrite dịka onye bụ ọkachasị n'ide akwụkwọ na Naịjirịa n'afọ 2017 bụ Ikeogu Oke ekwuola na asụsụ Igbo agaghị anwụ ma ndị Igbo kpọọ ya mkpa.

english: Ikeogu received $10,000 as the winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature' for his book 'The Heresaid.'
igbo: Ikeogu ritere ego puku dọla 100 dịka onye kachasị ede mbem na Naịjirịa nke a kpọrọ 'Nigerian Prize of Literature' maka akwụkwọ ya ọ kpọrọ “The Heresiad”.

english: What made the book the best was that he wrote it in the form of Igbo oral poem.
igbo: Ihe mere akwụkwọ ahụ ọdị iche bụ na o dere ya n'usoro ndị Igbo ji agụ mbem.

english: In his discussion with the BBC Igbo Mr Oke talked of the promotion of Igbo language and those whose duty it is to do it.
igbo: Na mkparịta ụka ya na BBC Igbo nwere, Maazị Oke kwuru okwu gbasara nchekwa asụsụ Igbo, na onye o chere na o kwesịri ịdị n'aka ya.

english: The federal government has decided on what to do with Abacha's loot.
igbo: Gọọmentị etiti ekwuola ihe a ga-eji ego Abacha zuru mee

english: The Minister of Finance Kemi Adeosun has said what the government will use Abacha's loot for in Nigeria.
igbo: Kemi Adeosun bụ minista na-elekọta ihe gbasara ego ekwuola ihe gọọmentị etiti ga-eji ego Abacha mee na Naịjirịa.

english: Kemi Adeosun and Christine Lagarde, the chairman of IMF
igbo: Kemi Adeosun na Christine Lagarde bụ onyeisi oche na IMF

english: The Nigerian government have mapped out what to do with more than three hundred million dollars Abacha's loot returned by Swiss.
igbo: Gọọmentị Naijiria akwadola iji ihe kariri dọlla nde dọlla narị atọ bụ ego Abacha zuru nke gọọmentị Swiss weghachitere ga-eme.

english: Minister of Finance, Kemi Adeosun, has said that the money would be given to the poor as contained in campaign promises of President Buhari.
igbo: Minista na-ahụ maka ihe gbasara ego bụ Kemi Adeosun ekwuola na a ga-eji ego ahụ zụọ ndị ụbiam dịka Onyeisiala Buhari kwere na nkwa mgbe ọ na-azọ ọchịchị.

english: She said this while speaking to journalists at the end of the meeting International Monetary Fund in Washington DC, America.
igbo: O kwuru nke a ebe ọ na-ezi ndị ntaakụkọ ozi na ngwucha nzụkọ ngalaba na-eke ego n'ụwa niile bụ IMF na-aha ịchafụ nke mere n'obodo Washington na Amerịka.

english: Adeosun also said that the money has been deposited in Nigeria's special treasury in the central bank of Nigeria in order to think out best idea for the poor.
igbo: Adeosun sị kwa na-etinyela ego a n'akpa pụrụiche n'ụlọakụ Niajiria a kpọrọ CBN n'aha ịchafụ iji bido mepụta atụmatụ ndị ga-enyere ndị ogbenye aka.

english: Tax on tobacco and drinks has increased.
igbo: Ụtụ anwụrụ na mmanya etinyela ego

english: The Senate has invited the governor of Central Bank.
igbo: Ndị sinetị akpọọla onyeisi ụlọakụ ukwu

english: In his message, he said that the federal government is hopeful that if it implements the policy it has, it shall well with Nigeria .
igbo: Na ozi ọ na-agbasa, ọ sị na gọọmentị etiti nwere olileanya na ha mepụta atụmatụ ha bu n'obi, n'ihe ga na-adịri Naịjiria mma.

english: In his own world 'If we put these policies into production, the property of Nigeria will appreciate.'
igbo: N'olu ya 'Anyị tinye atụmatụ ndị a na mmepụta, akụ na ụba obodo Naịjiria ga-arị elu'

english: What does Nigeria benefit from CHOGM?
igbo: Kedu ihe Naịjirịa na-erite na CHOGM?

english: An Igbo indegene has won Big Brother.
igbo: Nwaafọ Igbo emeriela Big Brother Naija

english: Nigerians did not attend meeting in America.
igbo: Ndị Naịjirịa agaghị nzụkọ n'Amerịka?

english: Three things single exchange rate will cause
igbo: Ihe atọ inwe ọtụtụ ọnụ mgbanwe ego na-ebute

english: IMF told Nigeria to harmonize its exchange rate to a single price, while professionals are talking of disadvantages of having more than one exchange price.
igbo: IMF gwara Naijiria ka ọ chịkọta ọnụ mgbanwe ego ya ka ọ bụrụ otu, ebe ndị ọkacharamara na-ekwu ọghọm dị na inwe ọtụtụ.

english: Naira
igbo: Naira

english: EFCC said that Umar wants ten million naira.
igbo: EFCC kwuru na Umar chọ nde naira ịrị

english: To have a steady exchange rate, IMF has advised Nigeria to harmonize its exchange rate to a single price.
igbo: Iji mee ka mgbanwe ọnụ ego Naijiria kwụdosie ike, IMF adụọla Naijiria ọdụ ka o jikọta mgbanwe ego ya ọnụ.

english: Nigeria has at least five exchange rates: one for petroleum exporters in Nigeria, one for Muslim faithful going for Mecca in Saudi Arabia, one for Christians going for Pilgrimage, another for those studying overseas and one fixed by government.
igbo: Naijiria nwere opeka mpe mgbanwe ego ise ; otu maka ndị na-atụbata mmanụ ụgbọala na Najiria, otu maka ndị ụkaalabụkụba na-aga njem okwukwe na Saudi Arabia, otu maka ndị ụka Kraist na-aga ala nsọ, ọzọ maka ndị na-agụ akwụkwọ na mba ofesi na otu ọnụ nke gọọmenti hiwere.

english: Property experts Pat Utomi and Uche Uwaleke explained to BBC journalists that it is disadvantageous to have many exchange rates.
igbo: Dịka ndị ọkacharamara n'okwu akụnaụba bụ Pat Utomi na Uche Uwaleke siri kọwara onyentakụkọ BBC, inwe ọtụtụ mgbanwe ego nwere ọghọm.

english: These are some of the disadvantages of many exchange rates
igbo: Lee ụfọdụ ọghọm inwe ọtụtụ mgbanwe ego:

english: It causes soiling of the hands
igbo: Ọ na-ebute mmerụaka

english: Pat Utomi explained that it causes favouritism as it gives someone who knows those in charge the opportunity to buy money at a cheaper rate while another who does not have such opportunity but needs the money to import materials for production of goods will not get it.
igbo: Pat Utomi kọwara na ọ na-eme ' Onye maa mmadụ enwe ohere igote ego n'ọnụala ma were ya tụọ mgbere, mana onye nwere mkpa ego ahụ iji tubata ihe ọ ga-eji mepụta ngwa ahịa n'ala anyị na amaghị mmadụ ọ gaghị eru ya aka.

english: It is not good for the progress of buying and selling.
igbo: Ọdịghị mma maka ọganihu azụmahịa.'

english: Where Abacha's money will go into
igbo: Ebe ego Abacha ga-aba

english: Money exchange: Has the exchange of dollar for naira reduced
igbo: Mgbanwe ego: Dọla ọdaala n'akụkụ Naịra?

english: In his words, Uche Uwaleke gave an analogy saying 'As government exchange rate is N305, if it is sold to someone at that rate, that person may sold it to another at N365, thereby making profit. But if there is a single fixed rate, you cannot resale it.'
igbo: N'okwu ya, Uche Uwaleke nyere ọmụmatụ sị, 'Dịka ọnụ ego mgbanwe nke gọọmenti bụ N305, e resi mmadụ n'ọnụ ahụ, o nwere ike hapụ ihe a sịrị ya gote, resi ya onye ọzọ N365, nweta ọmụrụnwa. Mana ọ bụrụ na e nwere otu mgbanwe ego, ị gaghị enwe ike iregharị ya.'

english: It kills the spirit of productivity in a nation.
igbo: Ọ na-emenyụ ọkụ itinye uchu na imepụta ihe n' obodo.

english: Uwaleke said that multiple exchange rate causes many to be lazy.
igbo: Uwaleke sịrị na inwe mgbanwe ego dị ọtụtụ na-eme ọtụtụ ha dị uwengwụ.

english: The only thing they will do is to engage in the sale of low exchange, there will be no productivity.
igbo: Sọọsọ ihe ha ga na-eme bụ ire ego dị ọnụala, agahị na-enwe mmepụta ihe.

english: It lowers multiplication of wealth in a nation.
igbo: Ọ na eweda mmụbanye akụnaụba obodo

english: Utomi said 'if people get foreign exchange at cheaper rate to send their children overseas for study, it will make everybody to want to send their children overseas and the schools in our country will suffer.
igbo: Utomi kwuru na 'ọ bụrụ na ndị mmadụ na-enweta ego mgbanwe ego n'ọnụ ala iji ziga nwa ha obodo oyibo maka ịgụ akwụkwọ, ọ ga-eme ka onye ọbụla chọọ iziga nwa ya obodo oyibo, ụlọ akwụkwọ ndị dị n'obodo anyị ga akpụ afọ n'ala.

english: Saraki and Ekweremadu: What people are saying about stopping them
igbo: Saraki na Ekweremadu: Ihe ndị mmadụ na-ekwu maka mgbochi ha

english: Ekweremadu hid his wealth
igbo: Ekweremadu 'zoro akụnaụba ya'

english: Ekweremadu was again charged for peace in Nigeria.
igbo: E tinyela udo Naịjirịa n'aka Ekweremadu ọzọ

english: There are 109 senators, if 108 senators are in Ekweremadu's house now, it means that all of them are in his house.
igbo: Ndị omeiwu sineti dị mmadị 109, ọ bụrụ na mmadụ 108 nọ na be Ekweremmadu ugbua, ọ pụtara na ha niile nọ na be ya.

english: Remember that the Senate resolved today that security agents should immediately leave the deputy senate president's house, where they attacked him today.
igbo: Cheta na ụlọomeiwu sineti kpebiri taa ka ndị ọrụ nchekwa pụọ n'ụlọ osote onyeisi sineeti bụ Ike Ekweremadu ozugbo, ebe ha wakporo taa.

english: Ekweremadu was blocked from leaving his house this morning, which stopped him from attending today's Senate meeting, where 14 senators defected from APC to PDP.
igbo: E gbochiri Ekweremadu ịpụta n'ụlọ ya n'ụtụtụ taa, mere ka ọ ghara ịbịa nzukọ ndị ụlọomeiwu ukwu mere taa, ebe ndị omeiwu ruru 14 hapụrụ APC gafee PDP.

english: Uche Anichukwu, Ekweremadu's spokesperson, told BBC Igbo that it was EFCC that blocked him from leaving his house in Abuja, not DSS as was formerly written by us.
igbo: Uche Anichukwu bụ ọnụ na-ekwuchitere Ekweremadu, gwara BBC Igbo na ndị EFCC gbochiri ya ịpụ n'ụlọ ya n'Abuja, na ọ bụghị DSS dịka anyị dere mbụ.

english: @MrBanksOmishore, Special Assistant to Saraki, this morning wrote the message EFCC sent to Ekweremadu on Twitter.
igbo: @MrBanksOmishore bụ onye enyemaka pụrụiche nke Bukola Saraki, depụtara akwụkwọ ozi ndị EFCC ziteere Ekweremadu n'ụtụtụ a, na Twitter.

english: In that message, EFCC said that they want to probe Ekweremadu for planning to use his position to manipulate carrying out of the country called money laundering in English.
igbo: N'ime akwụkwọ ozi ahụ, EFCC kwuru na ha chọrọ inyocha Ekweremadu maka ịkpa nkata, mmerụ ikike ọkwa ya nyere ya na ibupu ego nke Bekee kpọrọ 'money laundering'.

english: When Saraki entered the Senate building and started plenary, he said that Ekweremadu could not come, and said that they should strive to see that democracy did not die.
igbo: Ka Saraki banyere n'ụlọomeiwu ma bido 'plenary', o kwutere okwu na Ekweremdu abịanwughị, ma kwuo na-ekwesịrị ịgba mbọ hụ na ọchịchị onyekwuouche ya emebighị.

english: Senator Sam Anyanwu said that he was with Ekweremadu yesterday but he did not get a warrant of being wanted by the police.
igbo: Omeiwu Sam Anyanwu kwuru na ya na Ekweremadu nọ ụnyaahụ, mana onweteghị akwụkwọ gosiri na ndị uweojii na-achọ ya.

english: After the plenary, the senators resolved that the security agents should leave the house of the Deputy Senate President to enable him utilize the authority due to him.
igbo: Ka e mechara 'plenary', ndị omeiwu kpebiri na ndị ọrụ nchekwa kwesịrị ịpụ n'ụlọ osote onyeisi sineeti bụ Ike Ekweremadu ozugbo, ka o nwee ike rite ikike ruru ya.

english: This morning, Saraki is among those blocked from leaving their houses.
igbo: N'ụtụtụ a, Saraki so na ndị egbochiri ịpụ n'ezi ụlọ ya.

english: On the other hand, Nigeria President, Muhammadu Buhari thanked those that defected from APC today and wished them well.
igbo: N'aka ọzọ, onyeisi ala Naịjirịa bụ Muhammadu Buhari kelere ndị siri na APC pụọ taa ka ọ gara ha nke ọma.

english: He said this through His Twitter handle, @MBuhari.
igbo: O kwuru nke a site na akara Twita ya bụ @MBuhari:

english: EFCC blocked Ekweremadu's door in Abuja.
igbo: Ndị EFCC gbochiri ọnụụzọ Ekweremadu n'Abuja

english: Television was showing EFCC's gun pointing at the front of Ekweremadu's house.
igbo: Ihe onyoonyo na-egosi ebe ndị EFCC chewere n'ihu ụlọ Ekweremadu:

english: Those who kidnapped and killed a Catholic priest have been sentenced to death.
igbo: A maala ndị tọọrọ ma gbuo ụkọchuckwu ụka Katolik ikpe ọnwụ

english: High court has sentenced those who kidnapped and killed Father John Adeyi to death by hanging.
igbo: Ụlọikpe ukwu amaala ndị tọrọ ma gbuo Fada John Adeyi ikpe ọnwụ site na nkwugbu.

english: Court has given order to hang the criminals.
igbo: Ụlọikpe enyela iwu ka akwụgbu ndị omekome

english: High court in Makurdi, Benue state, have decided to hang two people, Hartuna Idi and Suleiman Gina, who are the remnant of those who kidnapped and killed Father John Adeyi till they died for what they committed.
igbo: Ndị ụlọikpe ukwu dị na Makurdi, Benue steeti ekpebiela ka a kwụgbuo mmadụ abụọ, Hartuna Idi na Suleiman Gina bụ ndị fọrọ na ndị tọrọ ma gbuo Fada John Adeyi rue oge ha nwụrụ maka ihe ha mere.

english: Remember that four kidnappers which include Saidu Abdullahi and Aliyu Garba kidnapped Father Adeyi, the Vicar-General of Catholic church in Otukpo Diocese, Benue state, killed him and dumped his corpse in a farm near Otukpo in 2016.
igbo: Cheta na ndị ntọọ mmadụ anọ gụnyere Saidu Abdullahi na Aliyu Garba tọrọ Fada Adeyi, onye Vika-Jenaraalụ ụka Katọlik n'Otukpo Dayosis, Benue steeti, gbuo ya ma tufuo ozu ya n'ime ugbo dị nso na Otukpo n'afọ 2016.

english: What I experienced from kidnappers.
igbo: Ihe m gabigara n'aka ndị ntọ

english: Mikel Obi's father has been redeemed from kidnappers again.
igbo: A gbapụtala nna Mikel Obi n'aka ndị ntọ ọzọkwa

english: But the police later arrested four of them, they confessed that they collected N1.7m ransom but they shot him to death when they heard that the villagers were coming to redeem him from their captivity.
igbo: Mana e mechara ndị uweojii nwuchie ha anọ, ha kwupụta na ha natara ezinaụlọ ụkọchukwu ahụ otu nde naira na ụma(N1.7m) dịka ego isi ya mana ha gbagburu ya oge ha nụrụ na ndị obodo jikere ịbịa gbapụta ya ebe ha nwụchiri ya.

english: One of them confessed that he was the one that shot him to death. The remaining two were sentenced to death today being Wednesday.
igbo: Otu n'ime ha kwupụtara na ọ bụ ya gbara ya egbe gburu ya, ebe a mara mamdụ abụọ fọrọ n'ime ha ikpe ọnwụ taa bụ Wenezde.

english: In the message the family of the priest sent to Daily Post, they expressed their gratitude that at the end they got justice.
igbo: N'ozi ezinaụlọ ụkọchukwu ahụ zigara ụlọakụkọ Daily Post, ha gosiri afọ ojuju na n'ikpeazụ, ikpenkwụmọtọ erutela ha aka.

english: But they grieved that the judgement reminded them of the murder of Adeyi, who was a professor.
igbo: Mana ha tụrụ arịrị na mkpebi ahụ chetara ha ogbugbu n'ike e gburu Adeyi, onye bụ ọkammụta.

english: The Senate have ran to Ekweremadu.
igbo: Ndị sineti agbakutela Ekweremadu

english: Saraki and Ekweremadu: What people are saying about their blockage.
igbo: Saraki na Ekweremadu: Ihe ndị mmadụ na-ekwu maka mgbochi ha

english: APC pay for their autocratic leadership--Expert
igbo: APC na-akwụ ụgwọ ọchịchị nchịgbu ha na-achị - Ọkachamara

english: There is a spirit living in a child that is born with dreads.
igbo: O nwere mmụọ bi na nwata bu isi dada pụta ụwa?

english: What the Igbo culture said about dreads in the ancient time and views about it presently.

igbo: A na-enwetakarị akụkọ gbasara ụfọdụ ndị ntorobịa maọbụ agbọghọbịa hụrụ onwe ha n'anya, ma kwekọrịtara ibikọta ọnụ dịka di na nwunye, mana ha emeghị omenala alụmdinanwunye dịka ha kwesịrị.

english: Sometimes unforseen circumstances arise in this situation, especially the woman dieing in the man's house when the cultural marriage rites were not performed.
igbo: A na-ahụtakwa mgbe ụfọdụ ihe mberede dị iche iche n'ọnọdụ a, ọkachasị nwaanyị ịnọ n'ụlọ nwoke ahụ nwụọ na-enweghị mmemme alụm ọbụla emere n'ụzọ omenala.

english: Women's title in Igbo land
igbo: Echichi nwaanyị n'ala Igbo

english: Five things that interest women
igbo: Ihe ise masịrị ụmụnwaanyị

english: Is 'Omugwo' a tradition to abolish in Igbo land?
igbo: Ọmụgwọ ọ bụ omenala ga-akwụsị n'ala Igbo?

english: However, this causes confusion in different families.
igbo: Ka o sila dị, nke a na-etinyekarị ezinaụlọ dị iche iche na gbagharịa.

english: Because of this bad condition, many villages in Igbo land, made it a law that a man will marry the corpse of a woman whom he was living with him without paying the complete dowry
igbo: N'ihi ajọ ọnọdụ a, ụfọdụ obodo dị n'ala Igbo, mere ya ka ọ bụrụ iwu na nwoke ga-alụ nwaanyị ya na ya bi n'ozu, bụ nke ọ na-emeghị mgbe ọ dị ndụ.

english: The reason for marrying a woman's corpse.
igbo: Ihe mere eji alụ nwaanyị n'ozu:

english: Igbo land, a man is not married unless he paid the woman's dowry.
igbo: N'ala Igbo, anaghị ekweta na nwoke alụọla nwaanyị, maọbụrụ na o mezubeghị ihe n'isi ya.

english: If even he married in court, he is expected to go to the woman's family and do things as they want.
igbo: Ọ bụrụgodu na o mere nke ụlọikpe, a tụrụ anya na ọ ga-abịa mekwaa ihe dịka ndị nwe nwa siri chọọ.

english: Like an expert in culture, Nze Olueze Ukaejuoha (Duruagwu the second) of Umuakara, Isu in Nwangele of Imo State, told BBC Igbo, this law is very potent in their village, it goes different punishments.
igbo: Dịka ọkachamara n'okwu gbasara omenala bụ Nze Olueze Ụkaejuoha (Duruagwụ nke abụọ) n'Ụmụakara, Isu dị na Nwangele nke Imo steeti siri gwa BBC Igbo, iwu a dị ezigbo ire n'obodo ha, bụkwa nke nwere ntaramahụhụ dị iche iche so ya.

english: He who does not marry alive, marries in death, is the system most villages adopted.
igbo: Onye n'alụghị na ndụ, ọ lụ ọ n'ọnwụ, bụ usoro ọtụtụ obodo si eme

english: But in Akokwa village also in Imo State, this thought is not potent at all, where the woman's family come and take the corpse of their daughter home for burial.
igbo: Mana n'obodo Akọkwa dịkwa n'Imo steeti, atụmatụ a adịghị ire ọbụla, ebe ezinaụlọ mụrụ nwaanyị na-abịa eburu ozu nwa ha ma gaa lie n'ụlọ ha.

english: The system for marrying a woman's corpse
igbo: Usoro esi alụ nwaanyị n'ozu:

english: The man will first come and told the family that their daughter is sick (he will not tell them that she is dead at first).
igbo: Onye ahụ ga-abịa gwa ndị mụ nwa na nwa ha nwere ahụ ọkụ (ọ gaghị ebu ụzọ agwa ha na ọ nwụọla).

english: They will follow him to visit their daughter, when they have seen her, they will accuse the man of killing their daughter, and the man will start denying it.
igbo: Ha ga-eso ya gaa 'leta' nwa ha, mgbe ha hụrụ ozu ya, ha ga-ebo nke nwoke ebubo na ọ bụ ya gburu nwa ha, nke ga-eme ka ọ gọwa ụkwụ na aka ya

english: To prove that he did not kill her he would agree to marry the woman's corpse.
igbo: Iji gosi na ọ bụghị ya gburu ya ọ ga-ekwenye ịlụ ozu nwaanyị ahụ

english: He will come and marry it.
igbo: Ọ ga-abịa lụọ ya

english: He would come back and tell the family that their daughter has died.
igbo: Ọ ga-abịaghachị gwazie ndị mụ nwa na nwunye ya anwụọla

english: The man will proceed to do her burial ceremony
igbo: Nwoke ahụ ga-agazi n'ihu mee mmemme akwamozu ya.

english: What will happen to who refused marrying a woman's corpse
igbo: Ihe ga-eme onye jụrụ ịlụ nwaanyị n'ozu:

english: Like Nze Ukaejuoha explained, these are what will befall who refused to marry a woman he did not pay her dowry at death
igbo: Dịka Nze Ụkaejuọha siri kọwaa, ihe ndị a bụ ihe ga-eme onye jụrụ ịlụ nwaanyị omeghị ihe isi ya n'ozu:

english: That person would receive different punishments
igbo: Onye ahụ ga-enweta ntaramahụhụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche

english: He will also be met with different bad things.
igbo: Ihe ọjọọ dịkwa iche iche na-ezute onye ahụ

english: Things will not go well with such a person.
igbo: Ihe anaghị agara onye dị otu a nke ọma

english: That person may also die a miserable death.
igbo: Onye ahụ nwekwara ike ịnwụ ọnwụ ihere

english: But such person may repent, most especially when all these things started befalling him.
igbo: Mana onye ahụ nwere ike ichegharị, tụmadụ ma ọ bụrụ na ihe ndakwasị niile a bido ịdakwasị ya.

english: What that person will do when he repents
igbo: Ihe onye ahụ ga-eme ma o chegharịa

english: If that man was stubborn but later repented because of the problems he was getting, these are the things he will do:
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na nwoke ahụ kpọchiri ntị ma mechaa chegharịa n'ihi ihe mkpọbi ụkwụ ọ na-enweta, ihe ndị a ka ọ ga-eme:

english: That person will send the elders of his village to pacify the land
igbo: Onye ahụ ga-ezite ndị okenye obodo ha ka ha bịa mee ka ala daa jụụ

english: He would be punished by doing all he should do in double folds.
igbo: A ga-enye ya ntaramahụhụ site n'ịhụ na o mezuru ihe ndị o kwesịrị ime n'ụzọ okpuku abụọ.

english: Nigeria 2019 elections: characteristics of those contesting presidency -Muhammadu Buhari
igbo: Nigeria 2019 elections: Njirimara ndị na-azọ oche Onyeisiala – Muhammadu Buhari

english: The Nigeria President, Muhammadu Buhari is vying presidency the second term in democracy dispensation under the ruling party.
igbo: Onyeisiala Naịjirịa bụ Muhammadu Buhari na-azọ ọkwa dịka onyeisiala nke ugboro abuọ ya n'ime ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya n'okpuru pati na-achị.

english: President Muhammadu Buhari
igbo: President Muhammadu buhari

english: President Muhammadu Buhari is presently seeking vote to be Nigeria's president the third time.
igbo: Onyeisiala Muhammadu Buhari na-achụ nta vootu ugbua iji bụrụ onyeisiala Naịjirịa nke ugboro atọ.

english: He first assumed leadership in December 1983 (1984) when the Nigerian military took over leadership by force, but some of his neighbours forced Buhari out of government in 1985.
igbo: O bu ụzọ bata ọchịchị n'ọnwa Disemba 1983 (1984) ka ndịagha Naijirịa nara ọchịchi n'ike, mana ụfọdụ ndị agbatobi ya chuturu Buhari n'ike n'afọ 1985.

english: BBC debate is still on going.
igbo: Nrụrịtaụka BBC ka na-aga n'ihu ugbua

english: Buhari later became president through election in democratic era in 2015, after three failed attempts at the position.
igbo: Buhari mechara bụrụ onyeisiala site na ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya na'afọ 2015, ka ọgbara mbọ ịnweta ya bụ oche ugboro atọ n'efu.

english: When he was ruling as a soldier, Buhari was not known for respecting human right.
igbo: Dịka mgbe ọ na-achị dịka onyeagha, Buhari enweghị ezigbote aha banyere ikike diri onye.

english: Despite that we are in democracy, many people are in prison because Buhari did not agree to release them as the court decided.
igbo: Agbanyeghi na-anọ n'ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya, ọtụtụ mmadụ nọ na mkpọrọ maka Buhari ekweghị ịtụhapụ ha dịka ụlọikpe sị ka eme.

english: This man at age 76 took oath of service in 2015, and promised that he will fight corruption and insurgency, and improvement of Niger's economy.
igbo: Nwoke a dị afọ 76 ṅụrụ iyi ọrụ n'afọ 2015, ma kwe nkwa na ya ga-ebuso agha megide mpụ na nrụrụaka na ọgbaghara, nakwa kwalite akụnaụba Naịjirịa.

english: Four years is elapsing but many people do not agree that he has made any remarkable achievements.
igbo: Afọ anọ na-abịa na ngwụcha mana ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ekweghị na ihe o mere pụtara ihe anya na-ahụ.

english: He promised to defeat Boko Haram in the war Nigeria fights against the sect that wants an Islamic state in Northern Nigeria, but presently, this sect torments this intention of Buhari through its invasion of this area.
igbo: Okwere nkwa na ya ga emeri Boko Haram na-agha Naịjirịa na-ebuso ndị a chọro ikewapụta mba ofufe alakuba na ọwụwa anyanwụ ugwu Naịjirịa, mana na nso a, ndị a na-akpazị ike na-enye ebumnobi Buhari inọdụ n'oche onyisiala nsogbu site n'etu ha si awakpo mpaghara ahu.

english: Prominent individuals believe that Buhari will face strong contest with a more prominent non-ruling. The flag bearer of PDP, Atiku Abubakar is also an Islam from Northern Nigeria like Buhari.
igbo: Ndị ọnụ ha na-eru n'okwu kwenyere na Buhari ga-ezute ezigote ọgụ n'aka pati na-anọghị n'ọchịchi aha ha na-ada ụda karịa - onye bu ọkọlọtọ PDP bụ Atiku Abubakar bụkwa onye ofufe alakuba ma sikwa ugwu Naịjirịa dịka Buhari.

english: Buhari, the flag bearer of All Progressive Congress (APC) is known to be upright among Nigerian politicians, despite that some see his campaign as waste of resources.
igbo: Buhari bụ onye buu ọkọlọtọ All Progressives Congress (APC) nwere aha dịka onye aka ya kwụ ọtọ n'ime dị ndọrọndọro na Naịjirịa, agbanyeghị na ọtụtụ mmadụ na-ahụ achumta vootu ya ka ihe na-egosị mkwafu akụnaụba.

igbo: Ndị ngalaba 'Operation Puff Adder' nke uweojii Imo Steeti anwụchiela mmadụ isi ọrụ ha bụ ịtọrị ụmụaka.

english: On April 24, 2019, a woman named Immaculata Edward who said she is 31 from Okondo, Cross River State, kidnapped five children living in his boyfriend's house in Ngor Okpala of Imo State.
igbo: N'ụbọchi 24 nke ọnwa Epurel, 2019, nwaanyị aha ya bụ Immaculata Edward sị na ya dị afọ 31 si obodo Okondo dị na Cros Riva Steeti tọọrọ umụaka ise bi na be enye ya nwoke a kpọrọ Ifara Isong bi na Ngor Okpala dị n'Imo Steeti.

english: NAPTIP has arrested child traffickers.
igbo: NAPTIP anwụchiela ndị na-atụ mgbere ụmụaka

english: A doctor child trafficker has been arrested.
igbo: Aka akparala dibia na-atụ mgbere ahia ụmụaka

english: Immaculata stole five children of his boyfriend's neighbours whom their father and mother asked him to look after.
igbo: Immaculata zuru ụmụaka ise ndị agbataobi enyi ya nwoke ahụ bụ ndị nne na nna ha sịrị ya lekọta ha anya.

english: These children born of the same mother include: Somto Eke, female who is six years, Kelechi Eke, male who is five years
igbo: Ụmụaka a bụ ndị otu nne mụrụ gụnyere; Somto Eke, nwaanyị dị afọ isii, Kelechi Ekeh, nwoke dị afọ ise.

english: Others are Chisom Ekeh, female who is three years, Ebuka Enwerem, male who is three years, Chioma Enwerem, female whom is five years and Lucky Ida, who is six years.
igbo: Ndị ọzọ bụ Chisom Ekeh, nwaanyị dị afọ atọ, Ebuka Enwerem, nwoke dị afọ atọ, Chioma Enwerem, nwaanyị dị afọ ise na Lucky Ida, nwoke dị afọ isii.

english: The children who were saved and their families
igbo: Ụmụaka azọpụtara na ezinaụlọ ha

english: Immaculata took them to a known child trafficker Perpetual Iwuji from Obokwu Ulakwo, Imo State.
igbo: Immaculata kpọgara ha n'aka onye ama ama n'ịtụ mgbere ụmụaka bụ Perpetual Iwuji si n'Obokwu Ulakwo, Imo Steeti.

english: Perpetual took two out of the children and sold them to Grace Nwachukwu from Aboh Mbaise living in Mpape Abuja.
igbo: Perpetual kpọrọ ụmụaka abụọ n'ime ndị a ma ree ha n'aka Grace Nwachukwu si Aboh Mbaise ma biri na Mpape Abuja.

english: Immaculata also bought two of her father's sibling's children from Cross River State and sold them to Ifeoma Ndubuisi from Lokpanta , Abia State.
igbo: Immaculata zukwara ụmụaka abụọ bụ ụmụ nwanne nna ya si na Cross River Steeti ma ree ha n'aka Ifeoma Ndubuisi si na Lokpanta Abia Steeti.

english: The child who was saved and his/her mother and father
igbo: Nwata azọpụtara na nne na nna ya

english: Through thorough investigation of the Police, all the children who were kidnapped are found and reconciled to their family.
igbo: Site na nyocha tara ọchịchị ndị uweojii, a chọtala ụmụaka niile ahụ a tọọrọ ma tinye ha n'aka ezinaụlọ ha.

english: In the course of the investigation five other children were saved from Perpetual Iwuji and were sent to the motherless Babies' home.
igbo: N'ime nyocha ahụ, azọpụtara ụmụaka ise ọzọ n'aka Perpetual Iwuji ma ziga ha n'ụlọ ebe a na-elekọta ụmụaka.

english: Those suspected to have a hand in this include Perpetual Iwuji, I song Ifara, Immaculata Edward, Grace Nwachukwu, Ifeoma Ndubuisi and Stephen Ezenwa.
igbo: Ndị a na-enyo enyo n'aka ha dị na nke a gụnyere Perpetual Iwuji, Isong Ifara, Immaculata Edward, Grace Nwachukwu, Ifeoma Ndubuisi na Stephen Ezenwa.

english: Child trafficking is not a thing not known in Eastern Nigeria.
igbo: Ịtụ mgbere ụmụaka abụghị ihe amaghị maka na mpaghara Ọwụwa Anyanwụ Naịjirịa.

english: INEC Server: We have recorded the number of all the card readers in a computer.
igbo: Inec Server: 'Anyị achịkọtala ọnụọgụgụ 'card reader' niile otu ebe na kọmputa'

english: INEC said that the names of those that registered for 2019 elections are in their computer.
igbo: Inec sị na aha ndị niile debere aha na ntuliaka 2019 dị na kọmputa ha.

english: Festus Okoye and Emeka Unachukwu
igbo: Festus Okoye na Emeka Unachukwu

english: INEC messenger Festus Okoye strongly says that the commission does not have server that will give them opportunity to transmit the result of 2019 elections.
igbo: Onyeozi Inec bụ Festus Okoye ka an-ekwusi ike na ndị ụlọọrụ ahụ enweghị 'Server' bụ nke nyere ha ohere izipụ mpụtara ntuliaka 2019.

english: Okoye said that Nigeria constitution does not permit them to do that.
igbo: Okoye si na iwu Naịjirịa enyeghị ha ohere ime otu ahụ.

english: Justice Garba has taken over the case between Atiku and Buhari.
igbo: Ọkaikpe Garba eburula oche n'ikpe Atiku na Buhari

english: National Assembly have approved the 2019 budget.
igbo: Ụlọomeiwu ekwuola gaa n'ihu maka bọjetị afọ 2019

english: In his speech, 'Nigeria constitution gave provision to carry all the results of elections in Form EC8A at hand to collation centres of their wards.
igbo: N'olu ya, 'iwu Naịjrịa nyere ikike iburu mpụtara ntuliaka niile nke dị na 'fọm̀ EC8A' n'aka buga ebe a ga-egbokọba ha na wọdụ.'

english: The Nigeria constitution we used for the elections does not know the use of computer to send any message.
igbo: Iwu Naịjirịa anyị ji mee ya bụ ntuliaka amaghị iji igwe kọmpụta zipu ozi ọbụla.

english: It is the duty of the collation officers to carry the papers to where they are needed by hand.
igbo: Ndị 'Collation Officer' ka ọ bụ ọrụ ha iburu akwụkwọ ndị a n'aka buga ebe a chọrọ ya.

english: There was never a time we used computer to send election results.
igbo: O nweghị mgbe anyị jiri igwe kọmpụta zipụ mpụtara ntuliaka.

english: Okoye agreed that all who registered their names for 2019 elections are recorded in computer, that all the parties were given the names of those people.
igbo: Okoye kwetara na ndị debere aha ha n'akwụkwọ maka ntuliaka 2019 niile dị na igwe kọmputa, na enyere ndị otu pati niile aha ndị a.

english: The use of incident form will not stop manipulations going on in election.
igbo: Ejighị 'Incident Form' ga-akwụsị nrụrụaka na-aga na ntuliaka

english: He strongly affirmed 'It is only when computer is used for voting that one would say that something is in the server.
igbo: O kwusiri ike na 'ọ bụ naanị mgbe eji igwe kọmuta tụọ vootu ka a ga-asi na ihe dị na sava'.

english: He said that he does not know about the result of 2019 elections being in the server.
igbo: Ọ sị na ya amaghị maka mpụtara ntulika 2019 ị dị na sava ọbụla.

english: On the same hand, BBC asked a renowned computer operator, Emeka Unachukwu what is server?
igbo: N'otu aka ahụ BBC jụkwara onye ọrụ kọmpụta ama ama bụ Emeka Unachukwu gịnị bụ 'server'?

english: Unachukwu said 'Server is a computer that links other computers used for storing different information together.
igbo: Unachukwu sị na 'Server' bụ kọmpụta na-ejikọ kọmpụta ndị ọzọ ọnụ eji edewe mkpụrụozi dị iche iche'.

english: He said that INEC can say that they don't have server because there is another office storing data for them but it is not true that they don't have server since they have data.
igbo: O kwuru na Inec nwere ike ikwu na ha enweghị 'server' maka na o nwere ụlọọrụ ọzọ na e jidere ha mkpụrụozi mana ọ bụghị eziokwu na ha enweghị server' ebe e nwere mkpụrụozi.

english: He said that the internet has its own server where many people keep their information.
igbo: Ọ sị na Intanet nwere 'server' nke ya ebe ọtụtụ mmadụ na-edowe ozi ha.

english: Unachukwu said 'INEC cannot say that don't have because they have where they store data.
igbo: Unachukwu sị na 'Inec agaghị asị na ha enweghị sava maka na ha nwere ebe ha na edowe mkpụrụozi bụ data.

english: They may call this data base but it is server because that computer unites others together which can receive from or send message to it.'
igbo: Ha nwere ike kpọ nke a 'data base' mana ihe ọ bụ bụ sava maka na kọmpụta ahụ jikoro ndị ọzọ ọnụ bụ ndị nke nwere ike ịdọro ọzi maọbụ zite ọzi na ya'.

english: He said it is difficult for INRC to say they don't have server.
igbo: Ọ sị na ọhịara ahụ Inec isi na ha enweghị server'.

english: If they are calling people to come and collect their PVCs they should be ready for elections.
igbo: Ha na-akpọ ndị mmadụ bịa were PVC ha dịrị njikere maka ntuliaka

english: Unachukwu said that even if voting was done and transmitted manually to where it was counted, INEC will still put it in the server.
igbo: Unachukwu kwuru na ọ bụrụgodi na a tụrụ vootu n'aka buru ya n'aka buga ebe a gụrụ ya, na Inec ga-etinyekwa ya na ya bụ 'server'.

english: But they can say they have not keyed the result of 2019 election in the server which shows that they have not finished their work.
igbo: Mana ha nwere ike ikwu na ha etinyebeghị mpụtara 2019 na ya bụ 'server' nke gosiri na ha arụchabeghị ọrụ ha.

english: Diet and Dementia: How you will cure dementia with chocolate and vegetables.
igbo: Diet and Dementia: Etu ị ga-esi jiri chocolate na-akwụkwọ nri chụọ nsogbu ụbụrụisi

english: Read this composition and learn how to make your brain healthy and strong with good food.
igbo: Gụọ edemede a ka i muta etu ị ga-esi jiri ezigbo nri mee ka ụbụru gị kaa aka ma gbasie ike.

english: Fruit and vegetable arranged to resemble the brain.
igbo: Mkpụrụ osisi na akwụkwọ nri ahaziri ka ha yie ụbụrụ isi.

english: Learn about food that nourishes your brain and gives you prolonged health.
igbo: Mụta maka nri na-edozi ụbụrụisi ka enye kwa gị ogologo ndụ na ahụisiike.

english: Do you know the seven foods that will help you drive away dementia entirely?
igbo: Ị ma nri asaa nwere ike ịnyere gị aka ịchu nsogbu ụbụrụisi ọsọ ụkwụ eru ala?

english: Fifteen billion people in the whole world suffer dementia which causes much forgetfulness in learning, and also about ten billion people get dementia every year (WHO).
igbo: Mmadụ ijeri iri na ise n'ụwa nile gburugburu na aria ọria nsogbu ubụruisi nke na-ebute oke nchefu na nsogbu ọmụmụ ihe, tinyekwara ihe ruru mmadu ijeri iri na enweta oria a kwa afọ (WHO).

english: Despite that it is found out that feeding is part of what nourishes the brain, having no knowledge of the symptoms support it.
igbo: N'agbanyehi na a chọpụtala na erimeri sonyere n'ihe na-edozi ubụrụisi, mana enweghi ọmụmụ ihe ama na akwado ya.

english: Red wine, coffee and chocolate as well as champagne have trended as the appropriate food for dementia.
igbo: Mmanya 'Red Wine', Kọfịị, na Chọkọlet nakwa mmanya 'Champagne' ewuola ewu dịka nri ebube maka ihe gbasara nsogbu ụbụrụisi.

english: But, is there truth in the statements?
igbo: Mana, enwere eziokwu dị n'okwu ndị a?

english: Now read what Sheila Dillon, a BBC worker, found out when he interviewed professors about this statement.
igbo: Ngwa gụọ ihe Sheila Dillon bụ onye ọrụ BBC chọpụtara mgbe ọ gbara ndị ọkammụta ajụjụ ọnụ maka n'ihe gbasatara okwu a .

english: As you will find out, these foods help for the betterment of the brain.
igbo: Dịka ị ga-achọputa, nri ndị a na-enyere aka maka ọdịmma ụbụrụisi gị:

english: Aquatic food
igbo: Nri sitere n'mmiri

english: Good protein, with little fat and filled with omega fatty acids.
igbo: Ezigbote protein, gbara obere abuba ma juputakwa na 'Omega Fatty Acids' .

english: Eating food with much fish in it once or more in a week helps the brain very much.
igbo: Iri nri azụ juputara na ya otu mgbe maọbụ karia n'izuka na-enyere ụbụrụisi aka nke ukwu.

english: Vine fruit and other fruits like it.
igbo: Mkpụrụ osisi 'vine' na mkpụrụ ndị ọzọ yiri ya.

english: Take very good care of your brain with vine fruit.
igbo: Were Mkpụrụ osisi vine leta Ụbụrụisi n'ahụ gị mma

english: Fruits like strawberries and blueberries prevent dementia.
igbo: Mkpụrụ osisi dị ka 'Strawberries' na 'blueberries' nwere ihe na-egbochi mbido nsogbo ọmụmụ nke ụbụrụisi.

english: Groundout and different other nuts
igbo: Ọpupa na akị dị iche iche

english: Nuts and different fruits boost health and nourishe the brain.
igbo: Aki na mkpuru di iche iche n'enye ahu-ike ma na edozi kwa ụbụrụisi

english: Whoever eats only 30mg of different nuts, maize, rye, brown rice, millet, oats, as well as protein, minerals and fibre will see that dementia will be far from him/her.
igbo: Onye n'eri nani 30mg nke akị dị iche iche, ọka,'rye', osikapa nke n'acha ncharanchara, ọka milet, ọka 'oats' ma na-eri kwa 'protein', 'minerlas' na kwa 'fibre' ka ahụta na nsobgu ụbụrụisi ga agbara ya ọsọ.

english: Pumpkin
igbo: Ụgụ

english: Pumpkin boost blood and nourishes the brain.
igbo: Ụgụ na-enye ọbara ma na edozi kwa ụbụrụisi

english: Whoever says that pumpkin and other vegetables nourishes the brain knows what he/she is saying.
igbo: Ọnye kwuru na ụgụ na akwụkwọ nri ndị ozo na-edozi ụbụrụisi, onye ahụ mara ihe ọ na-ekwu.

english: Vitamin B
igbo: Vịtamịn B

english: Vitamin B: It has been used to sing.
igbo: Vịtamịn B : e ji la ya gwuo egwu

english: Few who had dementia that were given vitamin B showed good improvement from dementia.
igbo: Mkpụrụ mmadụ ole nwere ọbele nsogbu ụbụrụ isi enyere Vịtamịn B kosiri ezigbote mgbake nke ụbụrụisi.

english: Do you drink cocoa tea?
igbo: I na aṅu kwa ihe ọṅuṅụ mmiri koko?

english: Let's be thankful to Olmec-Mexico for introducing cocoa tea to the world.
igbo: Ka anyi kelee ndi gboo nke 'Olmec-Mexico' maka i gosi ụwa niile ihe ọṅụṅụ mmiri koko.

english: Cocoa is good for the nerves and also
igbo: Koko na-adị mma maka akwara-ozi ma na-edozi kwa mkpụrụ-ndụ.

english: But remember to take cocoa tea with less sugar.
igbo: Mana cheta kwa ka i na-aṅu mmiri koko nke nwere ọbere shuga.

english: Avocado pear
igbo: Ubebekee

english: You get avocado pear everywhere in the world.
igbo: I nwere ike inweta Ubebekee uwa nile gburugburu

english: Part of why avocado pear is known everywhere is because it helps for the well-being of the brain.
igbo: Ihe sonyere mee ka ube Bekee na-ewu ewu n'ụwa niile bụ maka na ọ na-enyere aka maka ọ dị mma ụbụrụisi.

english: Are you now cleared?
igbo: Ugbua odoola gị anya?

english: These foods are not difficult to get but there are others you can substitute any one you can't find in your area.
igbo: Nri ndị a niile araghị ahụ ị nweta ma enwe kwara ndị ọzọ enwereike iji gbanwe nke ị na-achọtaghi n'ogbe gị.

english: But also remember, these foods are not only for your brain, they nourish your body and make you strong!
igbo: Ma cheta kwa, nri ndị a abụghị nani maka ụbụrụisi gị, ha na-edozi ahụ gị were mee ka ị kwụrụ chịm!

english: This is a special composition is about change in 'Diet and Dementia' from 'The Food Programme of BBC'
igbo: Edemede a bụ mgbanwe edemede 'Diet and Dementia', nke pụrụiche nke ndị 'BBC's The Food Programme' .

igbo: Onye ndu ndị na-agbara otu Super Eagles bọọlụ ekwechirila sị na ọ bụ mmeri ka ha bịara ime na Iko AFCON 2019.

igbo: Mikel Obi

english: The captain of the Nigerian football team - Mikel Obi
igbo: Ọnyeisi Ndị otu Bọọlụ Naịjirịa - Mikel Obi

english: Mikel Obi who will lead the Super Eagles of Nigeria to Egypt for the African cup of nations competiton called AFCON 2019 has said that he didn't come to play because to win and also carry the AFCON Cup is a burning desire in him.
igbo: Mikel Obi ga-edu ndị otu Super Eagles nke Naịjirịa gaa mba Ijipt maka asọmpi Iko mba Afịrịka akpọrọ AFCON 2019 ekwuola na ọ bịaghi igwu egwu n'ihi na imeri ma buru kwa iko AFCON na-agusi ya ike.

english: It is up to six years Mikel Obi touched the African cup of Nations.
igbo: O ruola afọ isii Mikel Obi metụrụ Iko Mba Afịrịka aka.

english: That was when Nigeria won South Africa.
igbo: Mgbe ahu bụ mgbe Naịjirịa meriri na mba Saụt Afịrịka.

english: Mikel will not join in the competition against Poland.
igbo: Mikel agaghị eso sọọ mpi na Poland

igbo: Mgbe ọzọ Mikel gbata ihe n'Afịrịka bụ n'afọ 2006 na 2010 bụ mgbe otu Super Eagles gbatara ndị nke atọ.

english: In this AFCON, Mikel will lead vibrant youths to this year's competition in Egypt.
igbo: N'oge AFCON a, Mikel ga-edu ndị ụmụ okorobia ọbara ha dị ọkụ were sọọ asụmụpị nke afọ a na Ijipt.

english: Mikel said 'Despite that the present Super Eagles team is not the former one in meeting other African teams greater than it, this competition will give people like Samuel (Chukwueze) and Paul (Onuachu) the opportunity to showcase their skills.
igbo: Mikel kwuru: 'N'agbanyeghi na ndị otu Eagles nke ugbua abụghị ndị aka ochie n'izute mba Afịrịka ndị ọzọ ka ya, asụmpị a ga-enye ndị dị ka Samuel (chukwueze) na Paul (Onuachu) ohere igosiputa nka ha.

english: I am also hopeful that will go to Egypt and come back with victory.'
igbo: Enwekwara m olileanya na anyị ga aga ijiptu ma tụrụ ugo lọta.'

english: Super Eagles team
igbo: Ndị otu Super Eagles

english: He also said that he is happy about how Supper Eagles struggle despite their poor performance in the world cup.
igbo: O kwukwara n'obi dị ya ụtọ etu ndị Super Eagles siri agba mbọ n'agbanyeghi ọnyụpa ha dara n'asụmpị Iko Mba Uwa.

english: Mikel agreed that this competition will be tough but he believes that the skill and the preparation of the Super Eagles will help them to win in this competition.
igbo: Mikel kwetere na asụmpị a ga-esi ike mana o kwenyere na nka na nkwado ụmụ Super Eagles ga enyere ha aka imeri asụmpi a.

english: Recall that Mikel Obi played for Nigeria for the first time in 2005 when the Super Eagles played against Libyan football team.
igbo: Chetakwa na Mikel Obi gbaara Naịjịria bọọlụ nke mbụ n'afọ 2005 mgbe Super Eagles na otu egwuregwu mba Libya zutere.

english: Mikel said that this competition may be his last in the Super Eagles' Jersey.
igbo: Mikel kwuru n'asọmpị a nwere ike ị bụ nke ikpeazu ya n'uwe Super Eagles.

english: He said 'However it is I will try to make it better.'
igbo: Ọ sị; 'otu ọbula ọ dị aga m agbalị ka ọ di nma.'

english: The South Koreans struggled for a long time but Ukraine did not allow them to score but scored a third goal from Giorgi Tsitaishvili in eighty nine minutes.
igbo: Ndị Korea kpọkwara ganịganị ọtụtụ mgbe mana Ukraine gwara ha na ogologo abụghị na nwa m etoola mgbe ha mezuru ya ọkpụ atọ site n'aka Giorgi Tsitaishvili na nkeji iri asatọ na itoolu.

english: Buhari and Jonathan have disagreed over the abducted students at Dapchi in the Northern parts of Nigeria.
igbo: Ọgụ ọnụ adaala n'etiti ndị nke Buhari na Jonathan maka ntọrọ ụmụakwụkwọ Dapchi na mpaghara ugwu nke Naịjirịa.

igbo: Onyeisiala Mohammadu Buhari kwuru na ọ ka onye bụburu onyeisiala n'oge gara aga bụ Goodluck Jonathan mma na-ileba anya na ntọrọ ụmụaka akwụkwọ.

igbo: Ọ katọrọ ọchịchị Jonathan na nleghara anya ụmụakwụkwọ Chibok mgbe atọrọ ha n'afọ 2014,ma kwuo na ọ bụ enweghị uche.

igbo: Onye na-ekwuchite ọnụ ndị otu 'Bring Back Our Girls' bụ Sesugh Akume ekwuola na onyeisiala agbalịghị.

english: Akume said 'we are not happy' for it has been four years that those Chibok girls were abducted, it has now seem to Dapchi community that Buhari will treat them same way Jonathan did during his own government.
igbo: Akume kwuru, 'Obi adịghị anyị ụtọ, ihe a bụ afọ anọ atọrọ ụmụaka Chibok, ugbua o meela n'obodo Dapchi dịka ọchịchị Buhari na-eme otu njehe Jonathan mere n'oge nke ya.

igbo: Onye enyemaka pụrụiche nke Jonathan bụ Reno Omokiri kwuru na nwa Buhari bụ Yusuf Buhari nwere mgbuchi karịa ụmụaka Dapchi.

english: He said that Jonathan calls for more effective security during the period of the abduction chibok children but Buhari was against this call for the security during the abduction in Dapchi.

english: He explained that when the son Yusuf Buhari had an accident, Buhari cancelled all his appointments and visited him at the hospital
igbo: O kwukwara n'oge Yusuf Buhari nwere ihe mberede okproụzọ na Buhari kagburu njem niile onwere, ma gawa ileta nwa ya n'ụlọọgwụ.

english: Taking dry fish, hot cooked yam with local spices ( utazi,uda) to a woman that is newly delivered of a child is what is known as postnatal care
igbo: A mụọ nwa ọhụrụ, e jiri azụ, ji mmiri ọkụ, ụda na ụtazị gaa leta nne mụrụ ya. Ya bụ ihe a kpọrọ ọmụgwọ.

igbo: Ile ọmụgwọ n'omenala Igbo bụ oge nne na-abịa ileta nwa ya nwaanyị na nwa ọ mụrụ (nke bụ nwa nwa ya).

english: mother feeds her daughter with foods that helps in the production of breast milk

english: mother gives her daughter food that will help build her body
igbo: Nne ga na-esiri ya nri ndị ga-eme ka ahụ ya gbakee ọfụma

igbo: Nne ga na-ama ya mmiri ọkụ n'afọ na ebe ndị ọzọ ọ chọrọ, ma tekwaa ya ihe ga-ekpo ya ahụ ọkụ (robb, aboniki)

english: mother will feed, bath and wash the new baby's clothes
igbo: Nne ga na-enye nwata ọhụrụ nri, saa akwa ya ma saa ya ahụ

english: she will stretch and massage the baby's body
igbo: Ọ ga-adọtịkwa nwa ọhụrụ ahụ, ma hịa ya aka n'ahụ ọfụma

english: she will make sure that the daughter sits on a bucket that contains hot water and disinfectant to enable free flow of blood
igbo: Ọ ga na-ahụ na nwa ya nọ ala n'elu bọketị awụnyere mmiri ọkụ na nnu na ọgwụ eji achụ nje, nke ga-eme ka ọbara ọjọọ nwee ike gbapụta

igbo: Ọ ga na-ekekpa ya afọ ka o nwee ike taa ma hara etu ọhabu tupu ọ dị ime
