igbo: Onyeisiala mba Amerịka bụ Donald Trump emela mgbasa ozi nke mbụ gbasara etu ọchịchị Amerịka si aga kamgbe o were ọchịchị n'afọ 2017.

english: Trump through the media said that he would give the Democrats the opportunity to work with him.
igbo: Trump site na mgbasa ozi ahụ o mere kwuru na ya na-enye ndị otu pati Demokrat ohere ka ha rụkọ ọrụ.

english: Trump said that he wants the Guantanamo Bay prison to be reopened in reverse of the law made by the former president of America Obama for it to be closed down.
igbo: Trump kwukwara na ya chọrọ ka ụlọmkpọrọ a na-akpọ Guantanamo Bay ghere oghe na-eweghachi iwu onye buburu onyeisiala Amerịka bụ Obama nyere ka emechie ya.

english: The economy of America is on the increase yet people have not accepted their president Trump.
igbo: Akụnaụba mba Amerịka na-arị elu mana ndị mmadụ anabataghị onyeisiala ha bụ Trump.

english: the actors of 'Black Panther' show cased Africa in their opening ceremony.
igbo: Ndị ome ihe nkiri 'Black Panther' gosiri Afrịka n'emume mbido ha

english: The actors of 'Black Panther' are being talked of for portraying Africa in their opening ceremony..
igbo: Akpụ ndị mere ihe nkiri 'Black Panther' n'ọnụ maka otu ha si gosi Afrịka n'emume mbido ha.

english: Actors of the movie 'Black Panther' portrayed African tradition in the unveiling of this movie produced by Marvel studio.
igbo: Ndị so mee ihe nkiri 'Black Panther' goziri omenala Afrịka mgbe ha gara mmeme mbido ya bụ ihe nkiri nke ụlọọrụ Marvel mepụtara.

english: They all dressed like people from different African countries in other to portray Africa well.
igbo: Ha niile kere ekike mba Afrịka di icheiche maka na ha kwuru sị na ọ dị mkpa igosi Afrịka nke ọma.

english: Chadwick Boseman who acted as T'Challa, king of Wakanda, who the movie 'Black Panther' was made for, led other actors to Los Angeles where the ocassion was held.
igbo: Chadwick Boseman bụ onye jere ozi dịka T'Challa, Eze mba Wakanda, bụ onye e ji maka ya mee ihe nkiri 'Black Panther', duuru ndị ọzọ nọ n'ihe nkiri a gaa ebe emere mmeme a na Los Angeles.

english: People like Lupita Nyong'o, David Oyelowo, Daniel Kaluuya, Michael B Jordan, Danai Gurira and Angela Bassett dressed like Africans.
igbo: Ndị dịka Lupita Nyong'o, David Oyelowo, Daniel Kaluuya, Michael B Jordan, Danai Gurira na Angela Bassett kere ekike ndị Afrịka.

english: In the invite for this occassion, they were asked to dress like 'African kings'.
igbo: N'akwụkwọ eji gwa ndị mmadụ maka mmeme a, e dere sị ha jikere ka 'ndị eze Afrịka'.

english: David Oyelowo who is a Nigerian and his Jessica also came for this occasion.
igbo: David Oyelowo bụ nwa afọ Naịjirịa na Nwunye bụ Jessica so bịa emume a

english: Janeshia Adams-Ginyard replaced Danai Gurari as older Dora Milaje in this movie
igbo: Janeshia Adams-Ginyard nọchitere anya Danai Gurari dịka Okoye Dora Milaje na ihe nkiri a

english: Lupita Nyong'o from Kenya got an Oscar award because of this movie.
igbo: Lupita Nyong'o bụ onye Kenya nweterela ihe nrite ndị na-eme ihe nkiri a na-akpọ Oscar

english: Chadwick Boseman acted as T'Challa in this movie
igbo: Chadwick Boseman bụ onye mere ka T'Challa n'ihe nkiri a

english: Danai Gurira from Zimbabwe acted as older Dora Milaje in this movie.
igbo: Danai Gurira bụ nwa afọ Zimbabwe mere ka Okoye Dora Milaje n'ime ihe nkiri a

english: Would it be good for other actors in Hollywood to immitate their behaviour.
igbo: Ọ ga-adị mma ka ndị ome ihe nkiri ndị ọzọ na Hollywood bido ije omume ha a?

english: Prostitution business: eleven people have been arrested in Spain.
igbo: Mgbere Akwụna: Anwụchiela mmadụ iri na otu na Spain

english: Nigerian women that were used for prostitution in Spain said that charms were used to scare them on phone.
igbo: Ụmụnwaanyị Naijirịa eji agba mgbere akwụna na Spain sị na-eji ọtụmọkpọ yi ha egwu na ekwenti.

english: Prostitutes in Benin
igbo: Ndị akwụna nọ na Benin

english: The Nigerian government have expressed great grief on women traffiking.
igbo: Izupu ụmụnwaanyị n'ala Naijirịa na-eweta nwute nye ndị gọọmentị Naijirịa

english: The police in Spain have arrested eleven persons that are involved in prostitution business.
igbo: Ndị ụweojii nọ na Spain anwụchiela mmadụ iri na otu ndị asi na-atụ mgbere akwụna.

english: it was also said that they sent some Nigerian women out for money.
igbo: Akụkọ kwukwara na ha ji ụfọdụ ụmụ nwaanyị Naijirịa ezupuru n'obodo akpa ego.

english: They were locked up in Zaragoza where the police rescued sixteen women from sexual slavery.
igbo: Anwụchiri ha na obodo akpọrọ Zaragoza ebe ndị uwe ojii zọpụtara umu nwaanyi iri na isii emere ohu mmetọ ahụ.

english: charm was used to scare them on phone.
igbo: E ji ọtụmọkpọ yi ha egwu n'ekwenti.

english: They were mandated to pay some sum that was used to send them out.
igbo: A manyere ha iwu ikwụ ụgwọ akpakọtara ejị si na Naijirịa zupu ha.

english: These women were convinced that they would live better lives in Europe.
igbo: Aghọriri ụmụnwaanyi ndịa n'ikwete na ha ga-ebi ndụ kacha nma na yuropụ

english: It was said that the members of this group have meetings in Italy, Germany and also Denmark.
igbo: E kwuru na ndị otu a nwere njikọ na Italy,Germany nakwa Denmark.

english: US and EU have expressed disapproval of Odinga's swearing in of himself to office.
igbo: Mba US, EU akatọla idu iyi ọrụ Odinga dụrụ onwe ya

english: US and the European Union have shown disapproval to Raila Odinga of Kenya who took over the government forcefully.
igbo: Mba US na otu jikọrọ mba ndị ọcha akpọrọ EU n' aha ịchafụ akatọla iyi ọrụ Raila Odinga nke Kenya dụrụ onwe ya

english: The US president Donald Trump has said that he is in great sorrow for African nations.
igbo: Onyeisi ala US bụ Donald Trump kwuola na ya nwere 'nnukwu mkwayere ugu nye ndị mba Afrịka

english: In the 'US Department' publication on the internet, they said that: ' The United States is saddened by the swearing in to office of Raila Odinga on the thirtieth of January who is in opposition to the Kenyan government.
igbo: N' akwụkwọ ozi, ngalaba 'US Department' tinyere na websait ha, ha kwuru sị: ' Yunaited Steeti na-enwe obi mwute n' iyi ọrụ nke onye ndu ndị na- ama gọọmenti Kenya aka n'ihu bụ Raila Odinga duru onwe ya ka ọnwa Jenuwari gbara ịrị atọ.

english: We reject any form of opposition to the Kenyan government.
igbo: Anyi na-ajụ agwa ọbụla nke megidere Iwu ala Kenya.

english: 'Uhuru Kenyatta was elected as the president of Kenya on the twentieth of October 2017. That was adopted by the Kenyan high court'.
igbo: 'A họpụtara Uhuru Kenyatta dịka onyeisi ala Kenya ka ọnwa Ọctoba afọ 2017 dị iri abụọ na ntuliaka nke ụlọikpe kachasị elu na Kenya kwadoro.

english: Anyone who does not agree to this should follow the due process.
igbo: 'Onye ọbụla nwere mkpesa ọbụla kwesiri isoro usoro iwu ala debere.

english: US also showed their displeasure on the Kenyan government that shut down a press house in Kenya saying that it is a democratic system that the leaders in Kenya, should start creating room for peaceful dialogue and unity.
igbo: US katọkwara otu gọọmentị Kenya siri mechie ụlọ ntaakụkọ na Kenya si, na ohere onye kwue ka ọ dị ya dị mkpa na ọchịchị onyekwueuche ya, ma rịọ ka ndị ndu na ndị a na-achị na Kenya bido mkparịta ụka maka ịkpa udo na ịdịnaotu.

english: In the same vein, the EU union said that the swearing in of Raila Odinga is against the law and also showed disapproval in the shutting down of the media house, Uhuru Kenyatta .
igbo: N' otu aka ahụ, otu EU kwuru na iyi ọrụ Raila Odinga duru onwe ya megidere iwu ma katọkwa mmechi gọọment Uhuru Kenyatta mechiri ụlọ ntaakụkọ atọ.

english: Remember that the government has previouly shut down three TV stations for showing the swearing in of Raila Odinga as the president of Kenya, while the court in Kenya stopped this on Wednesday.
igbo: Cheta na Gọọmenti etiti mechiburu ụlọọrụ ngosi TV atọ maka na ha gbasara ozi gosịrị Raila Odinga ebe ọ na-edu onwe ya iyi ọrụ ma kpọkwa onwe ya onyeisiala mba Kenya, ebe ulọikpe Kenya akwụsịrị mmechi ahụ ụbọchị Wenesde.

english: Urinary cancer has killed more people than breast cancer.
igbo: Ọrịa Kansa akpamamịrị egbuola karịa kansa ara

english: Research has shown that many men die of urinary cancer
igbo: Nchọpụta ekwuola na ọtụtụ ụmụnwoke na-anwụ site n'ọrịa kansa akpamamịrị.

english: A cancer patient
igbo: Onye na-arịa kansa

english: Urinary cancer is more evidenced in men that are up to forty years old.
igbo: Ọrịa Kansa akpamamịrị na-aka egosi oge ụmụnwọke ruru afọ iri anọ

english: The number of men who die of urinary cancer has outnumbered the number of women who die of breast cancer as research has shown in UK.
igbo: Ọnụọgụgụ ụmụnwoke na-anwụ site n'ọrịa kansa akpamamịrị akarịala ọnụogụgụ ụmụnwaanyị na-anwụ site n'ọrịa kansa ara dịka nchọpụta siri kwuo na mba UK.

english: Men grow old means that many still die from that illness.
igbo: Ụmụnwoke na-aka nka pụtakwara na ọtụtụ ka na-enweta mana anwụ site n'ọrịa ahụ.

english: scientists for cancer in UK have sid that the search for the cure of breast cancer is yielding fruits while investing on urinary cancer would be helpful.
igbo: Ndị nyocha gbasara ọrịa kansa nọ na mba UK kwuru na nchọpụta na ọgwugwọ a na-eme maka kansa ara na-amịta mkpụrụ ebe itinye ego gbasara kansa akpamamịrị umụnwoke ga-enyekwa aka.

english: Statistics has shown that from 2015, 11,819 people died from urinary cancer while 11,442 people died from breast cancer
igbo: Nchọpụta ọnụọgụgụ pụtara site n'afọ 2015 gosiri na mmadụ 11,819 nwụrụ site na ọrịa kansa akpamamịrị ebe mmadụ 11,442 nwụrụ site na ọrịa kansa ara.

english: Cancer of the bladder is common among men in UK
igbo: Kansa akpamamịrị kachasị n'ụmụnwoke nọ na UK

english: health workers have said their findings on the best time to cure cancer
igbo: Ndị ọrụahụike ekwuola na nchọpụta n'oge kachasị mkpa iji gwọ akpụ kansa.

english: BBC Igbo asked doctor Remi Ajekibe a question, he said that breast cancer kills more than urinary cancer in Nigeria
igbo: BBC Igbo gbara Dọkịnta akpọrọ Remi Ajekigbe ajụjụ ọnụ,o kwuru na ọrịa kansa ara ka egbu karịa ọrịa kansa akapamamịrị na Naijirịa.

english: He said that the problem comes more when the men do not come for test on time. They always come when the situation is worse.
igbo: O kwukwara na ebe nsogbu na dịkari bụ na ụmụnwoke anaghị bia nyocha ahụ n'oge.Ha na bia mgbe ihe ọ ka njọ.

english: They go round teaching people in schools, churches, banks and other places about cancer and how to prevent it.
igbo: A na-agagharị na-akuziri ndị mmadụ n'ulọ akwukwọ,chọọchị,ulọakụ na ebe ndị ọzọ maka ọria Kansa nakwa ka esi egbochi ya'.

english: These activities will be held to commence the day for fight against cancer on the fourth of Februry.
igbo: Emume ndị a ka a ga-eji nabata ụbọchị nrụbama ibuso agha ọrịa kansa bụ Februwarị anọ.

english: Tinubu: Obasanjo's letter is a campaign joke.
igbo: Tinubu: Edemede Obasanjo bụ egwuregwu ndọrọndọrọ

english: Bola Tinubu has called Obasanjo's famous letter to Buhari 'a campaign joke'.
igbo: Bola Tinubu akpọọla edemede n'ewu ewu nke Obasanjo degara Buhari 'egwuregwu ndọrọndọrọ'.

english: Tinubu in an APC gathering of 2015 election said 'the letter is a cunny one'.
igbo: Tinubu ebe ọ nọ na ọgbakọ ndị otu ya bụ APC na ntuliaka nke afọ 2015 kwuru sị 'Edemede ahụ bụ nke aghụghọ'

english: The leader of the political party, APC, Bola Ahmed Tinubu has spoken about Obasanjo's letter to Buhari.
igbo: Onyeisi otu nọ n'ọkwa ọchịchị nke a na-akpọ APC bụ Bola Ahmed Tinubu ekwupụtala okwu maka ihe edemede Obasanjo degara Buhari.

english: He said that Obasanjo is playing 'campaign joke' in that letter.
igbo: Ọ sị na Obasanjo na-egwu 'egwuregwu ndọrọndọrọ' n'edemede ahụ.

english: He said that they both ruled under the military regime, Obasanjo was supposed to privately advice him instead of a public display.
igbo: Ọ sị na ebe ha abụọ bụ ndịchịrị n'okpuru ndị agha, Obasanjo kwesiri ịkpọ ya n'azụ dọọ ya aka na ntị kama ị gwa ya n'ihu ọha.

english: It is about two weeks Obasanjo wrote a letter to Buhari asking him not to run for the 2019 election.
igbo: O ruola izuụka abụọ Obasanjo degara Buhari edemede ahụ na-asị ya ritue n'ọkwa, ghara ịzọ ọchịchị na afọ 2019.

english: He said that if Obasanjo was sincere, he would have called president Buhari in private.
igbo: Ọ sị na ọbụrụ n'obi dị Obsanjọ ocha, o kwesiri ịkpọ onyeisiala Buhari n'akụkụ gbaa ya izu.

english: He said this to press men who asked him questions in Owerri as he was about going for the ceremony in honour of Alex Ekwueme.
igbo: O kwuru nke a ebe ndị ntaakụkọ gbara ya ajụjụ ọnụ na Owere (Owerri) ka ọ na-akwado ịga mmemme nkwanye ugwu Alex Ekwụeme.

english: The wife of the boko haram doctor has surrendered to the soldiers.
igbo: Nwunye dibia Boko Haram achịliele aka elu nye ndị agha

english: Rabi Abu-Yasir told the Nigerian soldiers that her husband is the doctor to the boko haram leader Abubakar Shekau.
igbo: Rabi Abu-Yasir gwara ndị agha Naịjirịa na di ya bụ dibia onyeisi ndị otu Boko Haram bụ Abubakara Shekau.

english: Boko haram members.
igbo: Ndị agaha Boko Haram

english: Lafia Dole is the name given to the war against boko haram since 2015.
igbo: Lafia Dole bụ aha agha ebidoro ibuso Boko Haram kamgbe afọ 2015.

english: The wife of the doctor that sees to the health of the boko haram leader Rabi Abu-Yasir surrendered to the Nigerian soldiers on saturday third of February in Lafia Dole war.
igbo: Onye bụ nwunye dibia na-ahụ maka ahụike onyeisi otu Boko Haram bụ Rabi Abu-Yasir chiliri ndị agha Naịjirịa aka elu ụbọchị Satodee abalị atọ nke ọnwa Febuwarị dịka ha naebu agha a na-akpọ Lafia Dole.

english: The commander of the Lafia Dole war, Major general Rogers Nicholas said this when he gave the Borno State police seventy-two women and children rescued from boko haram.
igbo: Onye nchịkwa agha Lafia Dole bụ Major General Rogers Nicholas kwupụtara nke a oge o nyefere ụmụnwaanyị na ụmụaka dị mmadụ iri asatọ na abụọ ha gbapụtara n'aka ndị Boko Haram ma nyefee ha n'aka ndị ọrụ nchekwa na Borno steti.

english: Rabi told news men that her husband is the doctor in charge of the well being of the boko haram leader Abubakar Shekau.
igbo: Rabi gwara ndị ntaakụkọ na di ya bụ dibia na-elebanye anya n'ahụike onyeisi Boko Haram bụ Abubakar Shekau.

english: She said that she was rescued on Friday as the Nigerian police chased the boko haram members out from Sambisa forest.
igbo: O kwuru na a gbapụtara ya ụbọchị Fraide dịka ndị agha Naịjirịa chụpụrụ ndị Boko Haram nọ nime ọhịa Sambisa.

english: As she told of her ordeal with them, Rabi said that she was pleased with the care she got as Shekau's doctor's wife.
igbo: Dịka ọ na-ekwupụta ka ya na ihe si gaa, Rabi kwuru na ọ masịrị ya etu esi na eledo ya anya maka ọkwa ọ nọ dịka nwunye dibia Shekau.

english: In her words, 'my husband, Abu-Yasir Shekau's doctor also takes care of other sick persons that are in pains.
igbo: N'okwu ya, 'Dị m, abu-Yasirbụ dibia Shekau, ọ na-eledokwa ndị ọzọ ahụ na-adịghị ma na-emekwa iwe ahụ.

english: I was treated as the wife of doctor Shekau
igbo: Etu esi eme m Rabi dịka nwunye dibia Shekau

english: The food I eat is different from the food given to women and children in the forest.
igbo: Ụdị nri m na-eri dị iche n'ihe a na-enye ụmụnwaanyị na ụmụaka ndị ọzọ nọ n'ogige ahụ.

english: We suffered in their hands and they warned us that the Nigerian soldiers would kill anyone who surrenders himself to them.
igbo: Anyị tara ahụhụ n'aka ha, ha dọkwara anyị aka na ntị na ndị agha Naịjirịa ga-egbu onye ọbụla nyefere onwe ya n'aka ha.'

english: Shekau is most wanted in Nigeria now.
igbo: Ana chosi Shekau ike na Naịjirịa ugbua.

english: They told us to always be for them and obey their members but the Nigerian soldiers takes care of us beyond what the Boko Haram told us
igbo: Ha gwara anyị oge ọbụla ka anyị nọnyere ha ma rube isi nye ndị otu ha, mana ndị agha Naịjirịa na-eledo anyị anya na-abụghị ihe ndị Boko Haram gwara nyị.

english: Rabi praised the Nigerian soldiers for releasing them and beckoned on others who were kidnapped and are still in the forest to come out and surrender themselves to the soldiers.
igbo: Rabi toro ndị agha Naịjirịa maka mgbapụta agbapụtara ha ebe ọ kpọkuru ndị a tọrọatọ bụ ndịka nọ nime ọhịa ka ha pụta bịa nyefee onwe ha n'aka ndị agha.

english: Nicholas the press man in the Lafia Dole war explained that Rabi is one of the seventy-four people released by the soldiers.
igbo: Nichola bụ onye nchịkọta agha Lafia Dole kọwara na Rabi sọ na mmadụ iri asatọ na anọ ndị agha gbapụtara.

english: He said that seven out of seventy-four people released are receiving treatment in good Nigerian hospitals.
igbo: O kwuru na mmadụ asatọ nime mmadụ iri asatọ na anọ ahụ agbapụtara na-anata ọgwụgwọ n'ụlọọgwụ ndị agha elu Naịjirịa.

english: The press man said that those people kidnapped by Boko Haram are passing through great pain/punishment.
igbo: Onye nchịkota ahụ kwuru na ndị ahụ a tọrọ na-agabiga ntaramahụhụ di egwu n'aka ndị Boko Haram.

english: Nicholas revealed that those people were released by Boko Haram, chased them away and took over the headquarters Shekau in Sambisa forest.
igbo: Nicholas mere ka a mata na a gbapụtara ndị ahụ site n'aka ndị Boko Haram,chụpụb ha ma nọchie isioche Shekau dị n'ọhịa Sambisa.

english: civil servants in Imo will go back to working for five days in a week.
igbo: Ndị ọrụ Imo ga-alaghachị ịrụ ọrụ abali ise n'izuụka

english: Rochas Okorocha said that the crisis has ended thus, civil servants will start working all through the working days of the week.
igbo: Rochas Okorocha sị na ọtanisi ebeela, yabụ na ndị ọrụ ga-ebido ibịazu ọrụ n'izu.

english: Rochas Okorocha has instituted the minisrty of happiness that is headed by his sister.
igbo: Rochas Okorocha wepụtara ụlọọrụ na ahụ maka aṅụri nke nwanne ya nwaanyị bụ onye ndu.

english: The governor of Imo State, Rochas Okorocha has lifted the law of civil servants working for just three days in a week.
igbo: Gọvanọ Imo Steeti bụ Rochas Okorocha eweliela iwu ahụ o tinyere maka ndị ọrụ bekee ịbia ọrụ abalị atọ n'izuụka.

english: Okorocha said this when he met with news men in the seven years celebration of no payment of school fees in Imo State.
igbo: Okorocha kwuru nke a mgbe ya na ndị ntaakụkọ zukọrọ ka ọ na-akwado ime mmemme o ji echeta na ụmụ akwụkwọ n'Imo steeti anọọla afọ asaa ma akwụghị ụgwọ akwụkwọ.

english: Rochas mandated against payment of school fees in Imo State when he resumed office.
igbo: Rochas machiri ịkwụ ụgwọ akwụkwọ n'Imo steetị mgbe ọ banyere n'ọchịchị.

english: He said that workers will start going to work five days in a week starting from the first day of March because Nigeria is no longer in crisis.
igbo: Ọsị na ndị ọrụ ga-amalite ịga ọrụ ụbọchị ise n'ime otu izu site n'ụbọchị mbụ n'ọnwa Machị maka na ọtanisi nke jibu obodo Naịjirịa ebeela.

english: The witness has said that he was called to join the killing.
igbo: Onye akaebe ekwuola na a kpọrọ ya n'ọrụ ọchụ Ozubulu

english: The eye witness to the Ozubulu killings of 2017 has said in court that he was called to join in the killing
igbo: Onye akaebe n'ikpe ọnwụ mere n'ụlọụka Ozubulu n'afọ 2017 ekwuola na-akpọrọ ya ka o soro ga ọrụ ahụ.'

english: Saint Philip Catholic Church, Ozubulu.
igbo: Ụlọụka St Philip Catholic Church Ozobulu

english: Gun men went to Saint Philip Catholic Church and killed thirteen people who came to church in the month of August, 2017.

english: gun men killed thirteen people in church at St. Philip Catholic Church, Ozobulu in the month of August 2017.

english: we want peace and justice.

english: Chukwujekwu Eze said: There was a young man whose name is Okpanda that told me that they wanted to go for work in Bishop's place at Ozubulu

english: I asked him what type of work it is, he told me that bishop is owing people in South-Africa, that they want to go to his place and kill every living thing there.

english: I asked him who sent him, he said Obrocho.
igbo: 'A jụrụ m ya onye zigara ha, ya asị na ọ bụ Obrocho.

english: When I brought it up, Okpando said that he would help me if I go with them for the work at Bishop's place. I told him that I did not want to soil my hands with blood.
igbo: Mgbe m kwulitere ya, Okpanda, kwuru na ọ ga-enyere m aka ma ọ bụrụ na m soro gaa ọrụ n'ụlọ Bishọp. Agwara m ya na achọghị m ịkwọ aka ọbara.

english: Eze went on to say that it was when he went to answer Okpanda's invite to his house on that day was one of the days he saw Doby (Onyemaechi Mbanefo), one of the people accused to have committed the crime, the two persons tried to convince him to join them in the crime but he refused.
igbo: Eze gara n'ihu kwuo na ọ bụ mgbe ọ gara ịza oku Okpanda kpọrọ ya n'ụlọ ya ụbọchị so ụbọchị ahụ ka ọ hụrụ Dobby (Onyemaechi Mbanefo), otu na ndị eboro ebubo na ha kpara mkpamkpa ahụ, ha abụọ ndị gbara mbọ rịọ ya ka o soro gaa ije ahụ mana o kweghị.

english: In the crime investigation is : Onyebuchi Mbanefo.
igbo: Ndị e boro ebubo na ọ bụ ha kpara nkata ghọrọ ngịga n'okwu mkpamkpa ahụ mere bụ: Onyebuchi Mbanefo, 46, Chukwudi Ugwu, 30 na Great Chinedu Akpunonu, 44.

english: Others who were said to have joined in this vice have not been caught.
igbo: E jidebeghị ndị ọzọ e kwuru na ha soro mee mpụ a.

igbo: Mụta ya ebe a

english: Just as the minister of Agriculture Sen Heineken Lokpobiri said, Nigerians consume about 3.2 million metric tone of fish yearly that seventy percent from it are imported.
igbo: Dịka Mịnịsta nta na-ahụ maka ọrụugbo bụ Sen Heineken Lokpobiri siri kwuo, ndị Naijiria na-eri azụ ruru nde 3.2 metrik tọn kwa afọ nke a na-atụbata ihe karịrị pasentị iri asatọ n'ime ya.

english: ten thousand metre and metric ton is produces three hundred and thirty- four thousand containers.
igbo: Mata na metrik tọn puku iri pụtara kọntena puku nari atọ iri atọ na anọ.

english: cocoyam
igbo: Ede

english: cocoyam is becoming expensive
igbo: Ede na-agalazị oke ọnụ

english: Uri cocoyam or Koko cocoyam or bread, cocoyam is food for the wretched, food for the poor because they cannot afford yam.
igbo: Ọ bụ ede ụrị ka ọ bụ ede koko ma ọ bụ achịcha, ede bụ nri ụganị, nrị ndị onweghị ka ọra ha ji agbado ume n'ihi na ha enweghị ego zụrụ ji.

english: But now, cocoyam is common because everbody eats it.
igbo: Mana ugbua, nri ede bụzị ụkwa achị n'aka ya a na-agba n'ihi na oke na ngwere na-erizi ya.

english: Aside the towns that cocoyam pounds is one of their famous meals, those who are diabetic, hypertensive, weight lossers has made cocoyam unreachable to the poor, that buying cocoyam for cooking is as though one is buying contraband.
igbo: Ewepụ obodo jiri ụtaraede mere nnukwu nri, ndị na-asọ nsọ nrị n'ihi ọrịa dịka ọrịa shuga, ọbara mgbalielu na ndị chọrọ ịta ahụ ekweghịzị ka aka ogbenye rute ede, nke na i go ede e ji esi ofe dịzị ka igo ahịa iwu.

english: 3. Cow skin
igbo: 3. Kanda

english: Cow skin populary called 'kpọmọ' by the yorubas, was eaten by the poor when there was no money for beef or chicken.
igbo: Akpụkpọanụ ehi nke ndị Yoruba na-akpọ, 'kpọmọ', bụbu ihe ndị ogbenye ji emegharị ọnụ oge ha ahụghị ego zụrụ anụ ehi ma maọbụ anụ ọkụkọ.

english: As it is now, the rich has taken it to be a healthy food, it is used to cook vegetable soup or mix it with pepper and drink with it.
igbo: Dịka ihe si aga ụgbụa, ndị ọgaranya ewerela ya mee ezi nri, ebe e ji ya esi nri ọpụrụiche dịka edikakong maọbụ gwọ ya na ose ma were ya anụ mmanya.

english: In 2014, when the government spoke through the former minister of Agriculture Akinwumi Adesina that they want to ban people from eating cow skin. This was not accepted by the people which made the government to refrain from the idea.
igbo: N'afọ 2014 mgbe gọọmenti si n'ọnụ onye bụbu Mịnịsta na-ahụ maka ọrụugbo bụ Akinwumi Adesina kwuo na ha chọrọ ịmachi ndị mmadụ iri kanda nke butere oke iwe ndị mmadụ ma mekwa ka gọọmenti kpofuo atụmatụ ahụ n'ọhịa.

english: Just as scientists said, cow skin does not have fats or cholesterol just as beef, which they said that too much consumption of it causes a terminal illness like hypertension.
igbo: Dịka ndị ọkachamara sị kọwa, kanda enweghị abụba maọbụ mmanụ ọjọọ a kpọrọ kọlesịtọrọl na bekee dịka anụ ehi nke ha kwuru na oke iri ya na-ebute ajọ ọrịa tara nchara dịka ọrịa obi na ọbara mgbalienu.

english: Plantain
igbo: Ojoko

english: Some people call it ogede, some abịrịka, others plantain, while many call it une or unere.
igbo: Ụfọdụ na-akpọ ya ogede, ụfọdụ abịrịka, ndị ọzọ ojoko, ebe ọtụtụ na-akpọ ya une maọbụ unere.

english: The poor eat the roasted one with red oil, and also use it to cook beans but now, the rich has made plantain a food on high demand.
igbo: Ụmụ ogbenye na-eji mmanụ eri nke ahụrụ n'ọkụ, ma jiri ya sie agwa mana ugbua, ọgaranya emeela ojoko nnukwu nri.

english: Plantain is a good food that replenishes the body because it has fibre and other minerals that are good for the health such as magnesium, phosphorous na potassium.
igbo: Ojoko bụ ezi nri na-edochi ahụ nihi na o nwere faiba, na mineral ndị ọzọ na-enyere ndụ aka dịka magnesium, phosphorous na potassium.

english: Just as health scientists have said, plantain gives blood when cooked unripped.
igbo: Dịka ndị ọkachamara ahụike siri kọwa, ojoko na-enye ọbara mgbe e siri ya na-achaghị acha.

english: Snail
igbo: Ejula

english: Snail is a good food that is nutritious but it is expensive now
igbo: Ejula bụ ezi nri na-enye ihe n'ahụ ma ọ na-adazi oke ọnụ ugbua

english: If there is no meat or fish, the poor goes into the forest in search of snail.
igbo: Ma anụ adighị, azụ adịghị, ogbenye na-aba n'ọhia kpara ejula, were sie nri.

english: The rich had no time for snail just as the Igbo says that there is suffering in its preparation.
igbo: Ogaranya, enwebughị efe ejula mgbe mbụ n'ihi na, dịka ndị Igbo ji ya ekwu okwu, ahụhụ dị na imecha ejula.

english: But now, cooking with snail is a sign that one is rich because of the high price of snail in the market
igbo: Ma ugbua, iji ejula isi nri bụzị akara ejiri mara ọgaranya n'ihi oke ọnụ ahịa ya.

english: Snail is a good food that gives protein, calcium, selenium, magnesium and gives blood.
igbo: Ejula bụ ezi nri nwere proten, calcium, selenium, magnesium ma na-enye ọbara.

english: Garri.
igbo: Garị

english: Garri is food for both the poor and the rich
igbo: Garị bụ nri ma ogbenye ma ọgaranya na-erizi

english: In the past, eating garri especially when it is drank is regarded as food for the poor or food eaten when one is broke.
igbo: Iri garị, ọ kachasị mgbe aṅụrụ ya aṅụ, bụ ihe a na-ewe dịka nri ndị ụwa na-atụ n'ọnụ maọbụ mgbe ego kọrọ gị n'akpa na mbụ.

english: If you ask students who live in school, they will tell you how drinking garri with groundnut, fried fish or roasted meat has saved their lives
igbo: Ị jụọ ụmụakwụkwọ bi n'ụlọakwụkwọ ha ga-akọwara gị etu ịji ọpapa, azụ e ghere eghe maọbụ anụ mkpọ aṅụ gari si zọọ ha ndụ.

english: Now garri is a contraband
igbo: Ugbua garị bụzị ahịa iwu.

english: Now the rich and the poor struggle for garri that a painter costs more than five hundred naira.
igbo: Ọgaranya na ogbenye na-azọzị garị nke otu ọba a na-akpọ 'painter' na-ada ihe karịrị nari naira ise (N500).

english: A cancer specialist in the Lagos University Teaching Hospital, Dr Remi Ajekigbe said that many Nigerians are suffering from cancer because they no longer eat our local foods like garri, yam that has fibre rather they eat foreign foods.
igbo: Onye ọkammụta ọrịa kansa n'ụlọọgwụ Lagos University Teaching Hospital, bụ Dr Remi Ajekigbe kwuru na ihe mere ọtụtụ ndị Naijiria ji arịa ọrịa kansa ugbua bụ na ha anaghị erizi nrị ala anyị dịka garị, ji nke nwere faiba ka ma ha na-eri nri ndị bekee.

english: Beans
igbo: Agwa

english: Beans is a good food for the health
igbo: Agwa bụ ezi nri na-edozi ahụ

english: Beans is another peculiar food for the poor but the rich now eat it.
igbo: Agwa bụ nri ọzọ e jiri mara ndị ogbenye mana ọtụtụ ọgaranya na-erizi ya.

english: beans gives protein and also blood
igbo: Agwa na-enye proten ma na-enyekwa ọbara.

english: Food nutritionists are saying that beans is a better protein source than meat because it does not contain cholesterol
igbo: Ndị ọkachamara n'ihe gbasara nri na ihe ha na-enye na-ekwu na agwa kacha mma maka nweta protein karịa anụ ehị n'ihi na onweghị abụba ọjọọ nke a kpọrọ Kọlesịterọl.

english: Breadfruit
igbo: Ukwa

english: Breadfruit is a special food prepared by a hardworking person
igbo: Ụkwa bụ oke oriri pụrụ iche onye ike dị na-akwado

english: Breadfruit was usually over looked by the rich probably because of the tedious task of its preparation but now only those who can afford it can eat it.
igbo: Ụkwa bụ nrị ndị ọgrlanya na-eleghara anya na mbụ, ikekwa n'ihi ahụhụ dị na-ikwado ya, mana ugbua, ọ bụzị onye ji ego na-eri ụkwa.

english: Breadfruit gives protein, blood, potassium and other healthy nutrients.
igbo: Ụkwa na-enye proten, ọbara, potassium nakwa ngwa ndị ọzọ na-edozi ahụ.

english: Water yam.
igbo: Ji mmiri

english: Water yam has fibre
igbo: Ji mmiri nwere fibre

english: Water yam is not usually eaten by people probably because it is not tasty.
igbo: Ji mmiri bụ nri ndị mmadụ anaghị erikarị na mbụ n'ihi na ọ naghị atọ ka ji.

english: only the poor used it to satisfy their hunger
igbo: Sọọsọ ndị ogbenye jibu ya achụ agụụ.

english: But now lots of people including the rich eat it.
igbo: Mana ugbua, ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ gunyere ndị ọgaranya na-eri ya.

english: diabetes patients still take sugar
igbo: Ndị na arịa ọrịa shuga na-erikwa ya.

english: Scientists explains that water yam contains lots of fibre, small 'sodium' and a lot of 'potassium' that it is said to be good for diabetic patients.
igbo: Ndị nchọpụta na-akọwa na ji mmiri nwere fibre rie nne, obere 'sodium' na nnukwu 'potassium' nke mere e ji kwuo na ọ na-adị ndị na-arịa ọrịa shuga mma n'ahụ.

english: Remember that 'fibre' helps in digestion, too much 'sodium' causes hypertension, while 'potassium' regulates the blood, and prevents one from having kidney stone.
igbo: Cheta na 'fibre' na-enyere nrị aka igwepịa n'afọ (digestion), oke 'sodium' so ebute ọbara mgbalienu, ebe 'potassium' na-akụjulata ọbara, chụmie mmadụ inwe ọrịa okwute akụrụ (kidney stone).

english: crayfish
igbo: Isha

english: crayfish is now expensive that some poor people can no longer afford it
igbo: Isha na-adazị oke ọnụ nke na aka ụfọdụ ogbenye eruzi ya

english: The poor usually cooked with crayfish when they could not afford fish or meat. But now, periwinkle is now for the rich because of its cost in the market.
igbo: Ndị enweghi ego na-ejibu isha esi nri oge ha e nweghị ego anụ maọbụ azụ, ma ugbua, isha bụzikwa maka ndị nwere ego n'ihi oke ida ọnụ ahịa.

english: Why people now prefer food meant for the poor
igbo: Ihe mere ndị mmadụ ji achụzị nrị ndị ogbenye

english: Just as a doctor of food and nutrition Dr Florence Uchendu explained why a lot of people now eat food that were avoided is because of the illness that are in Nigeria now such as diabetes, high blood pressure, stroke, cancer.
igbo: Dika ọkammụta na ihe gbasara nri na ihe ọ na-arụ n'ahụ bụ Dr Florence Uchendu si kọwa ihe mere na ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ na-eri nri a na-agbara ọsọ ugbua karia bụ maka na ọrịa dị na Naijiria ugbua dịka ọrịa shuga, ọbara mgbalienu, ọtụrụọkara (stroke), kansa.

english: The illness in Nigeria now are foreign illnesses we did not suffer from before now.
igbo: Ọrịa dịzị na Najiria bụ ọrịa dị n'obodo oyibo anyị anaghị arịabu mbụ.

english: Such illnesses as diabetes and hypertension are very common now.
igbo: Ihe dika ọbara mgbalienu, ọrịa shuga juziri kịta.

english: People now know the food that are not good for the health.
igbo: Ndị mmadụ amatago ihe ị ga-eri onyewe gị nsogbu n'ahụ ma nwekwa ike nyewe gị nsogbu n'ahụ.

igbo: Ụgbọ agha Saụt Korịa agala Ghana

igbo: Anthony Joshua Vs Joseph Parker: Onye bụ dike?

english: did Igbo start from here?
igbo: Ebee ka Igbo malitere?

english: The king of Nri Emelie Okika has insisted that Nri is the origin of the Igbo race.
igbo: Eze na-achị Nri bụ Emelie Okika kwụdosiri ike na-ekwu na Nri bụ isi mmiri Ndigbo.

english: masquerade in occassions
igbo: Mmanwụ n'ọgbọ mmemme

english: Masquerade is one of the Igbo culture
igbo: Mmanwụ bụ otu njirimara Ndigbo

english: The king of Nri chief Emelie Okika has warned Aguleri and Igboukwu to refrain from claiming to be the origin of the Igbo race.
igbo: Eze na-achị Nri bụ Ichie Emelie Okika adọọla obodo Aguleri na Igboukwu aka na ntị ka ha kwụsị ịzọ onye bụ isi mbido Ndigbo niile.

english: Okika vehemently said that the Igbos originated from Nri and also added that the discussion of the origin of the Igbos is a spiritual one that should not be used for political ambition.
igbo: Okika kwuru kusie ike na ọ bụ Nri bụ ebe Ndigbo siri pụta, ma kwukwa n'ihe gbasara isi mmiri Ndigbo bụ okwu mmuọ na e kwesịghị iji mee ihe ndọrọndọro ọchịchị.

english: He scolded Aguleri and Igboukwu for their efforts in trying to change the Igbo history and told them to refrain from their actions.
igbo: Ọ bara obodo Aguleri n'Igboukwu mba maka mbọ ha na-agba idegharị akụkọ mbido ala Igbo, ma gwa ha ka ha wepụ aka enwe n'ofe ka iwe ghara iwe ndị chi e nwere.

english: importance of post-natal visitation in the Igbo tradition.
igbo: Uru ọmụgwọ bara n'omenala Igbo

english: Do you know how to make tapioca?
igbo: Ị ma etu esi agwọ abacha ?

english: learn it here
igbo: Mụta ya ebe a

english: What is your view on mourning?
igbo: Kedụ ihe bụ ebumnuche gị maka ịgba mkpe?

english: He said that ' it is true that we are one with peole from Aguleri but they are politically ambitious
igbo: O kwuru sị 'Ọ bụ eziokwu na anyị na ndị Aguleri bụ otu mana ihe dị iche bụ na agụ ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị dị be ha.

english: Igboukwu did not commit sacriledge in this story.
igbo: Igboukwu abịadịghị nso n'ihe gbasara akụkọ a'.

english: Okika said that Eri is the ancestoral father of the Igbo race from the tribe of Isreal, fifth son of Gad the seventh son of Jacob.
igbo: Okika sị na Eri bụ nna ala Igbo niile si ala Israel mapụta bụ ọkpara nke ise Gad bụ nwa asaa nke Jacob.

english: And Eri and other tribes left Egypt before other tribes left Egypt.
igbo: Nakwa Eri na ndịotu ndịọzọ sị ala Egypt pụta njem tupu ọpụpụ ndị ala Israel n'Egypt.

english: He said ' they sojourned across the river till they got to the meeting point of Omambala and Ezu river called 'Agbanabo' in Aguleri where the spirit leading them told them to stop and build a community.
igbo: O sị 'Ha mere njem n'elu mmiri ma rue ebe mmiri Omambala na Ezu zuru onwe ha a na-akpọ 'Agbanabo' dị n'obodo Aguleri ebe mmụọ na-edu ha sị ha kwụsị rụọ obodo'.

igbo: Akụkọ ga-amasị gị:

igbo: Maaida Bio abụrụla onyeisiala Sierra Leone

english: Lasa fever has spread through twenty states.
igbo: Iba Lasa ekesala rue steeti 20

english: Convenant university disobeyed the law-court
igbo: Mahadum Covenant dara iwu - ọkaiwu

igbo: Kukah: Ọgbaghara ga-ada na 2019

english: Bishop Matthew Kukah has said that might be crisis in the 2019 election if things continue the way they are.
igbo: Bishop Matthew Kukah ekwuola na ọgbaghara nwere ike ịda na ntuliaka 2019 ma ihe dịrị otu a gawa n'ihu.

english: Matthew Kukah in Nigeria
igbo: Matthew Kukah na Naịjirịa

english: Bishọp Kukah said that killing and destruction of properties is on the increase in Nigeria.
igbo: Bishọp Kukah sị na mwufu obara na mmebi akụnaụba obodo Naịjiria karịrị akarị.

english: Bishop of the catholic diocese of Sokoto Bishọp Matthew Kukah has said that there might be crisis in the upcoming 2019 election
igbo: Bishọp nke Sokoto Katọlik Dayọsis bụ Bishọp Mathew Kukah ekwuola na ọgbaaghara nwere ike ịda na Naịjiria dịka ime ntụlịaka ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị nke 2019 nna-abịa nso.

english: He said that nothing can stop the country from being in crisis unless the fights are stopped in the different parts of the country.
igbo: Ọ sị na onweghị ịhe ga eme ka ọgbaaghara aghara ịda na Naịjirịa ma ọbụrụ na akwụsịghị ọgụ na mgba a n'ada ebe niile na Naịjirịa.

english: Kụkah said this in his report in Africa Report Magazine of April
igbo: Kụkah kwuru nke a na-ozi ya na Africa Report Magazine nke Eprelu.

english: Bishọp Kukah said that it would be very difficult to prevent the crisis of the 2019 election.
igbo: Bishọp Kukah kwuru na ọ ga ata akpụ ị gbanahụ ọgbaaghara na ntụliaka nke 2019.

english: In his words, 'it would be a great miracle if there is no crisis in the 2019 election'.
igbo: N'ọnụ okwu ya, 'ọ ga abụ ezigbo ọlụ ebube ma ọbụrụ na ọgbaaghara adaghị na ntụliaka 2019'.

english: story that would interest you
igbo: Akụkọ ga-amasị gị

english: soldiers have replied TY Danjuma
igbo: Ndịagha asaala TY Danjuma

english: Dapchi children have met with Buhari
igbo: Ụmụaka Dapchi ezutela Buhari

english: We don't have anything to say to the mother of Boko Haram
igbo: Anyị enweghị okwu ịsa ihe Mama Boko Haram kwuru'

english: He said that it is because of the many crisis across Nigeria now.
igbo: Ọ sịrị na ihe ojiri kwuo nke a bụ maka ọgụ na mgba juru ebe niile na Naịjiria ugbua.

english: I have not felt this way before
igbo: O metubeghị m n'obi otu a mbụ.

english: He said that the condition of Nigeria is supposed to be of uttermost concern to every Nigerian citizen.
igbo: O kwuru na ọnọdụ Naịjirịa ugbua kwesiri ịna-emetu nwafọ obodo a ọbụla n'obi.

english: What of the billions of dollars the government allocated for security?
igbo: Kedụ maka ijeri dọla gọọmenti weputere maka nchekwa obodo?

english: When Bishọp Kukah and BBC workers met, they asked him about the money allocated for security in the country
igbo: Mgbe Bishọp Kukah na BBC gbaritara ụka anyị jụrụ ya maka nde naịra gọọmenti tinyere na nchekwa obodo.

english: Bishọp Kukah resoponded that the extravagant lives of the politicians would not in any way help the citizens of the country
igbo: Bishọp Kukah zara na ihe kacha mkpa abụghị ị me gbanụgbanụ me ihe ga enye aka ị me ntụliaka ọchịchị nke ga eme ka ndị ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị biwakwa ndụ okeọzụ ka ha si ebe, nke a gaghị abara ndị ha n'achị ụrụ.

english: He said that killing must be stopped before peace would be restored in Nigeria.
igbo: Ọ sị na tupu udo abata na Naịjirịa na nkwafu obara ga akwusị kpamkpam.

english: Bishọp Kukah responded to this by saying that ' peace cannot be bought with money'.
igbo: Bishop Kukah zara na ajụjụ a sị: 'Ejighị ego egote udo.

english: Listen well to what he said in English
igbo: Nụrụ ihe okwuru na ụjụ na asụsụ bekee.

english: It is not lack of money that has caused crisis in Nigeria, rather, too much money.
igbo: Ọbụghị ụkọ ego mere na udo adịghị na Naịjirịa, ka ma ọ bụ oke ego dị na obodo a kpatara ya.

english: A lot of money has been invested in politics but it yielded nothing
igbo: Etinyela otụtụ ego na ndọrọndọro ọchịchị onweghị isi.

english: Investing too much money is not the problem especially in a country like Nigeria where money rules.
igbo: Ya bụ itinye ọtụtụ egọ abụghị nsogbụ, ọkachasị na obodo ihe niile bụ ego dịka Naịjirịa.

english: Government has invested a lot of money in water, yet we do not have water.
igbo: Gọọmenti etinyela ọtụtụ ego na mmiri, anyị enweghị mmiri.

english: They have invested so much in electricity, yet we do not have light.
igbo: Ha etinyela ọtutụ ego na ọkụ, anyị enweghị ọkụ.

english: What will bring peace to Nigeria is not guns and bullets .
igbo: Ihe ga enweta udo na Naịjịrịa abụghị egbe na mgbo.

english: He went on to say that politicians are only after the elections and not what would be beneficial to the citizens.
igbo: Ọ gara n'ihu kwuo na ihe ndị ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị na-eme bụ ka enwe ike mee ntụliaka ọzọ ma ghara ime ihe ga-abara ndị mmadụ uru.

english: Title holders- the council of title holders is the highest group in the community, they are the last resort to every case.
igbo: Ndị nze na ọzọ - Ndị nze na ọzọ bụ dị kachasị n'obodo, ha bụ ndị ikpeazụ okwu na-agakwu.

english: They have the final say in the community
igbo: Ha bụ ekwucha ọgwụ n'okwu niile gbasara obodo.

english: They are the holders of the tradition and 'ọfọ' of the community to ensure justice and also see that everyone is just.
igbo: Ha bụ ndị na-eji omenaala na ọfọ obodo ịhụ na a na-ekpe ikpe ziri ezi nakwa ịhụ na aka mmadụ niile kwụ ọtọ.

english: Before one is accepted into this group, the person must be an extremely wise person who has show cased it
igbo: Tupu anabata mmadụ n'otu a, ọ ga-abụ onye amamihe ha na-akpụ n'ala site n'ihe ọ hụrụla na ihe ọ gabigarala

english: That is why men who went to fight in wars in the past, come back sometimes with human skulls.
igbo: Ya mere o ji abụ ụmụnwoke garala ọgụ na agha na mgbe mbụ, merie n'agha ma oge ụfọdụ jiri okpokoro isi mmadụ lọta.

english: They are accorded great respect in Igbo land while members of the title holders wear eagle on their cap to show that they are reverenced in the community because Eagle is the most beautiful bird in Igbo land.
igbo: A na-akwanyere ha ugwu pụrụiche n'ala Igbo ebe ndị nọ n'otu nze na ọzọ na-eyi ugo n'okpu ha igosi na ha bụ ndị e ji eme ọnụ n'obodo maka na ugo bụ nnụnnụ kachasị mma n'ala Igbo.

english: The white clothes they wear signifies purity of hear and character and also in justice.
igbo: Akwa ọcha ha na-eyi na-egosi ndị dị ọcha n'obi nakwa n'agwa nakwa n;ikpe ziri ezi.

english: Their red cap signifies that the progress of the community lies in their sacrifice of blood and pain.
igbo: Okpu mmemme ha na-ekpu na-egosi na site n'ahụhụ ha nakwa ọbara ha mefuru n'agha ka ndị obodo ha ji aga n'ihu.

english: They are divided into two: elders and chiefs.
igbo: E kere ya udo abụọ; ndị nze na ndị ọzọ.

english: The elders are higher in rank than the chiefs.
igbo: Ndị nze karịrị ndị ọzọ n'ọkwa.

english: Kinsmen - These are the first born sons from every family in the community.
igbo: Ụmụnna - Ndị a bụ ụmụnwoke ụmụọkpala si n'ezinaụlọ dị icheiche n'obodo.

english: They are the decision makers of the different decisions made for the progress of the community.
igbo: Ha bụ ndị na-eme mkpebi gbasara okwu dị icheiche n'obodo etu o si gbasara agamnihu na ọdịmma obodo.

english: All defaulters are reported to the kinsmen, they go to the deities to find out about the things concerning the community or their families.
igbo: Ndị ụmụnna ka a na-ekpesara ma onye ọbụla mee ihe ọjọọ, ha bụ ndị na-aga n'ọnụ arụsị ịchọpụta ihe arụsị na-ekwu gbasara obodo maọbụ gbasara ezinaụlọ ha.

english: Every house hold has kinsmen to whom they take cases concerning land dispute, sharing boundaries, inheriting wives and crime against the land such as murder, theft, fornication or adultery.
igbo: Ezinaụlọ niile na-enwe ndị ụmụnna ha bụ ebe a na-ebido ikpe ọbụla gbasara esemokwu dịka okwu ala, okwu ime obi, okwu gbasara ihe nketa nwaanyị na arụ megidere ala dịka onye gburu mmadụ, izu ohi, ịkwa iko maọbụ idina nwunye maọbụ di mmadụ.

english: Any decision they take stands in the whole community
igbo: Mkpebi ọbụla ha mere na-adịgịde n'obodo niile.

english: The kindsmen are seen as representatives of different families
igbo: A na-ahụ ụmụnna dịka ndị nnọchite anya si ezinaụlọ dị icheiche.

english: First daughters- this is the female group in the community, this is where women unite to discuss about their house holds, husbands and children
igbo: Ụmụada - Otu nke a bụ otu ụmụnwaanyị n'obodo, ebe a ka ụmụnwaanyị na-ejiko onwe ha ọnụ kpaa maka ọdịnaihu ezinaụlọ ha na ihe gbasara di ha na ụmụaka ha.

english: The first born daughters are called to enforce peace in the dispute between two communities and their decisions are not refuted.
igbo: Ndị ụmụada ka a na-akpọ ikpe udo oge ọbụla e nwere esemokwu n'etiti obodo na obodo ma ihe niile ha kpebiri, anaghị agbagha ya agbagha.

english: The first born daughters are also called to ensure peace between their brothers and their wives for unity in the family.
igbo: Ndị ụmụada bụkwa ndị na-ekpe udo n'etiti ụmụnne ha ụmụnwoke na ndị nwunye ha iji hụ na e nwere otu ihu maọbụ otu obi n'ezinaụlọ.

english: The first born daughters include women born into the family or women married into the family .
igbo: Ndị ụmụada gụnyere ụmụnwaanyị ndị a mụrụ n'ezinaụlọ nakwa ụmụnwaanyị ndị alụbatara n'ezinaụlọ.

english: Age grade - This is a group for men who are of the same age bracket
igbo: Otu ọgbọ - Nke a bụ otu ebe ndị bụ ọgbọ dịka ụmụnwoke a mụrụ n'otu oge.

english: The see to the security of the community
igbo: ha bụ ndị na-ahụ maka nchekwa obodo niile.

english: They also go for war whenever there is war
igbo: Ha bụkwa ndị na-aga agha maọbụ ọgụ oge ọbụla ọgụ dapụtara.

english: They are in charge of keeping the roads, rivers and market clean.
igbo: Ha bụ ndị na-ekpocha ụzọ, mmiri na ahịa ma o nwee ihe gbochiri ya maọbụ na mmiri buru ahịhịa nọchie ụzọ.

english: They also enforce the law made by the kinsmen or council of title holders such as sending one on exile or anbody penalized.
igbo: Ọ bụkwa ha na-emepụta ihe ọbụla otu ụmụnna maọbụ ndị nze na ọzọ nyere n'iwu dịka ọ bụrụ na o nwere onye a ga-achụpụ n'obodo maọbụ onye a ga-amachị.

english: They would see that the person leaves the community and goes far beyond it
igbo: Ha ga-agba mbọ hụ na onye ahụ pụrụ n'obodo ma gatee aka.

english: The masquered cult is a group that only receives those who have undergone their initiation rites
igbo: Mmanwụ - otu mmanwụ bụ otu na-anabata naanị ndị gabigara otu nnabata ha.

english: They function as the police and see that there is order in the community
igbo: Ha na-arụ ọrụ ndị uweojii hụ na e nwere usoro n'obodo.

english: Any time there is dispute like land dispute, masquerade goes to the land and plants palm frond to signify that nobody will be permitted to use the land until a decision is made concerning it.
igbo: Oge ọbụla e nwere esemokwu dịka ala, mmanwụ na-aga kụọ ọmụ n'ala ahụ nke gosiri na o nweghi onye ọbụla a ga-ekwe ka ọ banye n'ala ahụ rue oge a mere mkpebi gbasara ya.

english: Masquereds also come out to make the people happy by dancing
igbo: Mmanwụ nwekwara oge ọ na-apụta iji mee ndị obodo obi aṅụrị site na ịụ̀ba egwu.

english: Similarities of the old and new leadership
igbo: Nyiri dị n'ọchịchị oge ahụ na nke ugbua

english: Council of title holders is the last resort for any dispute that could not be settled by the kinsmen or the group of first born daughters.
igbo: Ndị nze na ọzọ dịka ndị na-achị obodo, ha bụ ndị ikpeazụ okwu ga-erute ntị, ọ bụ okwu ọbụla na-ekweghi mmeta n'etiti ndị ụmụnna na ụmụada ka a na-ewetara ha.

english: They have the final say in every decision
igbo: Ha bụ ekwucha ọgwụ n'okwu ọbụla

english: Kinsmen and first born daughters are like the community representatives.
igbo: Ndị ụmụnna na ndị ụmụada dịka ndị nnọchite anya n'obodo.

english: The kinsmen make laws concerning the community. It is meant for all first born sons of every family in the community.
igbo: Ndị ụmụnna na-eme iwu gbasara obodo ebe ụmụ ọkpara n'ezinaụlọ dị icheiche n'obodo na-anọ na ya

english: The age grade are like the soldiers of the community that secures the community and sees that there is peace in the entire community.
igbo: Otu ọgbọ dịka ndị agha obodo, na-echekwa obodo ma na-ahụ na obodo niile bi n'udo.

english: they go or organize anything in the community that is not the way it should be
igbo: H na-aga agha maọbụ hazie ihe dị n'obodo na-adịghị eti o si kwesi.

english: The masquered is like the police that fishes out culprits in the community.
igbo: Mmanwụ bụ uwejii obodo na-eje akpụpụta ndị mere ajọ ihe n'obodo.

english: This was how the Igbos functioned before the whites introduced the 'Warrant Chiefs' system.
igbo: Otu ndị a ka ala Igbo ji aga n'oge mbụ tupu ndị ọcha eweta usoro ha kpọrọ 'Warrant Chiefs' ebido.

english: these groups worked and ensured the progress of the Igbos without anyone being the king but as it is now, kings are being corronated for political reasons.
igbo: Otu ndị a rụrụ ọrụ n'oge mbụ mee ka ala igbo na-aga n'ihu na-enweghi onye ọbụla ha kpọrọ eze mana etu ọ dị ugbua, a na-echizi eze e ji eme ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị.

english: The question being asked now is, is the new system better than the old system of governance?
igbo: Ajụjụ a na-azjụzị bụ, usoro ndị Igbo ji aga ugbua ọ na-eme ha nke ọma karịa usoro ha ji aga oge gara aga?

igbo: N'ọnwa Disemba n'afọ 2014, otu nwaanyị aha bụ Juliet bụbu onye enyemaaka tọrọ ụmụnwata abụọ n'otu ezinaulọ biri na Magodo na Legos steeti.

igbo: Nne ụmụaka aha ya bụ Onajite Esharegharan gwara ndị uweojii na ya nụrụ maka onye nyemaaka n'elu webusait a kpọrọ OLX.

english: There are also two children kidnapped by their househelp in Shagamu, another kidnap case of three children in Shasha, Lagos.
igbo: O nwekwara ụmụaka abụọ ndị odibo tọrọ na Shagamu, ọzọ bụkwa ụmụaka atọ a tọrọ na Shasha na Legos.

english: Mary Akinloye was kidnapped by their househelp who asked for a ransom of about fifteen million naira from her parents on phone.
igbo: Mary Akinloye bụ onye nyemaaka ha tọrọ oge ahụ kpọrọ nne na nna ụmụaka n'elu ekwe ntị na-ajụkwa ha maka ego ntọhapụ ruru nde naira 15.

english: Many families maltreat their househelps.
igbo: Ọtụtụ ezinaụlọ na-emegbu ndị nyemaaka ha

english: It was in this situation that the police cautioned parents to get to know their househelps and where they live.
igbo: O bụ oge okwu pụtara ka ndị uweojii dọrọ ndị nne na nna aka na ntị na ọ dị ezigbo mkpa ka ha maa maka onye ga-abụ nyemaaka na bee onye ọbụla.

english: As the world is now, lots of families are looking for househelps.
igbo: Mana maka ụwa sị dị ugbua, ọtụtụ ezinaụlọ na-achọ onye ga-abụ onye nyemaaka n'ezinaụlọ ha.

english: The important things while searching for a househelp.
igbo: Ihe niile diri mkpa ma ị na-achọ onye nymemaaka

english: BBC Igbo asked Joke Afolabi the head of the organization in charge of sending househelps called 'Conciege and Home Care Services' about this
igbo: BBC Igbo gbara otu nwaanyi aha ya bụ Joke Afolabi bụ onyeisi ụlọọrụ na-ezipu ndị ọrụ nyemaaka a kpọrọ 'Conciege and Home Care Services' ajụjụọnụ gbasara okwu a.

english: Afolabi said that it is true her organization sends out househelps to different families, but they ensure that all their staff are trust worthy.
igbo: Afolabi kwuru na ọ bụ eziokwu na ụlọọrụ ha na-ezipu ndị mmadụ dịka ndị nyemaaka gawa ụlọ dị iche iche mana ha na-agba mbọ hụ na ndị niile a tinyere n'ọrụ bụ marị ihe a chọrọ n'ụwa.

english: Another person Christanah Akindolie who is a counsellor told news men that it is very important to be an observant and a curious person.
igbo: Onye ọzọ aha ya bụ aha bụ Christanah Akindolie bụ onye ọrụ ndụmọọdụ gwara onye ntaakụkọ anyị na ọ dị ezigbo mkpa ka ị bụrụ onye na-edo anya, onye nwere ọchịchọ ịmata ihe niile.

english: Seven questions you should ask anybody that wants to be your aid
igbo: Ajuju asaa ịkwesiri ịgba onye ọbụla chọrọ ịbụ onye nyemaaka gị

english: strive that it is not a child who is your aid
igbo: Gba mbọ hụ ọbụghị nwatakịrị bụ onye nyemaka gị

english: Why did you leave your former place of work?
igbo: Gịnị mere i ji hapụ ebe ị na-arụ n'oge mbu?

english: As she explains, check if her words are coherent.
igbo: Ọ na-eme nkọwa a, lee anya ka ị mara n'okwu ya ọ na-adaba.

english: Where are you from?
igbo: Ebe ka i si bịa?

english: Who are your parents?
igbo: Onye bụ nne na nna gị?

english: Your family?
igbo: Ezinaụlọ gị?

english: Collect the name and phone number of her previous employer.
igbo: Nata ya aha na akara ekwenti onye ọ rụrụ ọrụ n'aka ya tupu ọ bịa na nke gị.

english: Observe his tone and character while answering you
igbo: Lee uda olu ya nakwa omume ya mgbe ọ na-asa gị okwu.

english: Give the police her name to investigate if she is a defaulter or wanted by the law.
igbo: Nye ndị uweojii aha ya, ka ha nyocha ọfụma mara ma ọ bụ onye nupuru isi n'iwu, maọbụ onye ha na-achọ achọ.

english: Take her to the hospital to test if she is free from HIV, hepatitis or tuberculosis.
igbo: Kpọrọ ya gaa ụlọọgwụ ka ha nyocha ya, ka ha mara ma ọ dị ime, maọbụ o nwere ọrịa mmịnwụ(HIV), ịba ojii (hepatitis) nakwa ụkwaranta (tuberculosis.)

english: They should also check her blood group for eventualities.
igbo: Ha nyochakwa ụdi ọbara dị ya na-ahụ(blood group) maka adịghị a ma ama.

english: Look into his referees
igbo: Lebanye anya na ndị kwudoru ya dịka onye akaebe.

igbo: Okammụta n'odee akwụkwọ a ma ama bụ Okey Ndibe kwuru etu o siri bie ndụ mgbe agha bidoro.

igbo: Okey Ndibe sị na, 'Agha abụghị ihe onye ọbụla hụrụ ihe mere n'afọ 1967 ruo 1970 ga-asị ka o mee ọzọ.'

igbo: O kwukwara ihe mere ogbaghara jiri ka dị n'ala Naịjirịa ruo taa.

igbo: Nke a bụ mbụ a na-ehibe ọgbakọ 'International Parliament for tolerance and peace (IPTP)' iji wee kwado mmekọrịta na mkparitaụka gbasara ọdimma nakwa nsogbu na-esogbu akụkụ mbaụwa dị iche iche.

igbo: Ọgbakọ a nke e mere n'izu ụka mbụ n'ọnwa Julaị n'obodo Malta họpụtara Taullant Balla nke si ụlọomeiwu Albania dịka onyeisi mbu, ebe osote onyeisi ụlọomeiwu ukwu Naịjirịa bụ Ike Ekweremadu bụ onyeisi kọmiti na-ahụ maka imepụta iwu na ya.

english: Nigerians have said that they are glad that Atiku Abubakar chose Peter Obi to be his running mate in the 2019 election.
igbo: Ụmụ Naijiria ekwuola na obi dị ha ụtọ na Atiku Abụbakar họrọ Peter Obi iso ya zọọ ọkwa onyeisiala na ntuliaka 2019.

igbo: Peter Obi, Dave Umahi

english: Although the recent news shows that the Northern PDP governors are not happy that Atiku Abubakar chose Peter Obi as his running mate in the 2019 election, many Igbos and other Nigerians are in support.
igbo: Dịka akụkọ pụtara na-egosi na obi adịghị ndị gọvanọ PDP n'ọwụwa anyanwụ nakwa ndị ndu ha na mpaghara ahụ mma maka nhọrọ Atiku Abubakar họrọ Peter Obi dịka osote ya n'ịzọ ọkwa n'2019, ọtụtụ ụmụ afọ Igbo nakwa ndị Naijiria ndị ọzọ dọnyere Obi ukwu.

english: Many people are expressing their thoughts concerning the Igbo PDP governors who are saying that it is their decision and not the Igbos that Atiku Abubakar chose Peter Obi.
igbo: Ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ na-ekwu uche gbasara ihe ndị Gọvanọ PDP n'Ala Igbo na-ekwu maka nhọpụta Atiku Abubakar họpụtara Peter Obi sị na ọ bụ uche aka ha, na ọ bụghị uche Ndigbo.

english: PDP- We chose Peter Obi to support 'Not Too Young To Run'
igbo: PDP: Anyị họrọ Peter Obi maka ị kwado #NotTooYoungToRun

english: Atiku: who would be his vice?
igbo: Atiku: Onye ga-abụ osote ya?

english: Remember that David Umahi the governor of Ebonyi State and also the the chairman of the 'South East Governors' Forum', said that the choice of Peter Obi by Atiku is ' A shame to the Igbos because it there was no delibration on it'.
igbo: Cheta na David Umahi bụ gọvanọ Ebonyi steeti mabụrụkwa onyeisioche 'South East Governors' Forum', kwuru na nhọrọ Atiku họpụta Peter Obi bụ 'imenye Ndigbọ ihere n'ihu' n'ihi na 'akpaghị ya akpa'.

english: They swore to work against him for overlooking their agreement.
igbo: Ha nụrụ iyi na ha ga-agba ya mgba okpuru maka ịgbakụta nkwekọrịta ha nwere azụ.

english: An anonymous person who was also in the meeting told Sun broadcasting house that their agreement was for Atiku to take the former CBN governor Charles Soludo.
igbo: Otu onye a chọghị ka a kpọ aha ya nọ n'ọgbakọ ha mere gwara ụlọ ntaakụkọ Sun na mkpebi ha nwere bụ ka Atiku were onye chịbụrụ ụlọakụ etiti bụ CBN n'aha ịchafụ bụ Charles Soludo.

english: The person said that 'there would have been peace if he had taken Soludo because that was our agreement'.
igbo: Onye ahụ sịrị, 'Udo karịrị ịdị ma ọ bụrụ na ọ họrọ Soludo nihi na ọ bụ ka anyị kwekọrịtara.'

english: Another rumour reaching BBC Igbo said that many PDP Eastern are interested in this position given to Peter Obi.

igbo: Uche ọha Igbo

igbo: Mana ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ na-ekwu na okwu ndị gọvanọ PDP na-ekwu abụghị uche Ndigbo kama ọ bụ nke onwe n'ihi na obi dị Ndigbo mma na ihe Atiku mere.

english: The Igbo youth leader Mr. Okechukwu Isiguzo advised the Eastern governors to leave their their personal interest and focus on the interest of the Igbos.

igbo: Calista Udomma Meka gwara BBC na ọ bụ otu onye aka kpara ebe o bu akpa ọgwụ ike efedrin gbara ama eji nwụchie ndị a na-akpa ike a, ma chọpụta ebe nsogbu mmiri ndị bi na Trans-Ekulu na-agabiga.

english: NDLEA said that the leader of this gang is a man who lives in South Africa called Christian Chibuzor.
igbo: NDLEA sị na onye nọ n'isi ndị na-akpa ike a bụ otu nwoke bi Saụt Afịrịka aha ya bụ Christian Chibuzor.

english: Calista said; 'Christian was not there when we went to work in that house, but it was seen that it was in the garage that these hard drugs were planted.
igbo: Calista kwuru sị; 'Christian anọghị mgbe anyị gara ọrụ n'ụlọ ahụ, mana a hụrụ na ọ bụ ebe a na-akpọsa ụgbọala ka a nọ na-aku ọgwụ ike a.'

english: Those that were caught in this house were Christopher Eze, Ikechukwu Umahi and Paul Eze.
igbo: Ndị e jidere n'ụlọ a bụ Christopher Eze, Ikechukwu Umahi na Paul Eze.

english: A man who lives in Phase 2 in Trans-Ekulu named Ogunedo Emeruole, told newsmen from Vanguard that they 'started seeing changes in the water that we fetched, but before that happened, we were perceiving awful smell from our neighbour's house.
igbo: Otu nwoke bi na mpaghara Phase 2 na Trans-Ekulu aha ya bụ Ogunedo Emeruole, gwara ndị ntaakụkọ Vanguard na ha 'bidoro hụwa mgbanwe n'ime mmiri ha na-ekute n'ọmị mmiri, mana tupu nke ahụ emee, anyi na-anụ ajọ isi si be agbataobi anyị.'

english: He said: 'We thought that the new tenant sprayed insecticide but the foul smell has not stopped.'
igbo: Ọ sị: 'Anyị che na onye kwatara ọhụrụ gbara ọgwụ anwụ mana ya bụ ajọ isi akwụsịghị.

english: It got to a point we started seeing oil in the water we fetched.
igbo: O ruru mgbe anyị bidoro ịhụ mmanụ n'ime mmiri anyị na-ekute.

english: The water stunk.
igbo: Mmiri a na-esi ajọ isi.

english: We called water drillers but it was too much for them to handle.
igbo: Ya mere anyị ji kpọọ ndị na-egwu ọmị, mana isi ahụ ka ha ike.

english: We were surprised when the NDLEA that it was caused by our neighbours.
igbo: Ọ tụrụ anyị n'anya mgbe ndị NDLEA bịara gwa anyị na o si n'aka agbataobi anyị.'

english: Mr. Emeruole went on to say that they do not know their neighbour, because he does not come out of his car when he comes.
igbo: Maazị Emeruole gara n'ihu kwuo na ha amaghị onye agbataobi ha a, makana ọ naghị apụta n'ime ụgbọala ya ma ọ bịa.

english: Meka told BBC Igbo that the hard drugs are produced in this house abroad.
igbo: Meka gwara BBC Igbo na a na-ere ọgwụ ike a na-arụpụta n'ụlọ a na mba ofesi.

igbo: Otu onye anya hụru ihe mere kwuru na mmechị a aka na-achị Lagos Steetị bu Akinwunmi Ambode nyere iwu ya bụ nke ebe a na-atupu aghighia na Olushosun ogbughi ebe ndi mechanic na arụ ọrụ.

igbo: Ndi ụlo ha di na gbụrụgbụrụ Olushosun na enwe ezigbote nsogbu ahuike make aṅụrụ na-akwa ha kemgbe ọku bara abe ahu na izuụka gara aga.

igbo: Tupu awaa ọjị n'ala Igbo, a na-ebu ụzọ gọọ ọjị (kpeere ya ekpere). Ọ bụ iwu na onye kachasị bụrụ okenye ga-agọ ọjị, ebe ụfọdụ na-enye onye kacha bụrụ nwata ka ọ waa ya ma kesaa ya.

english: A man does not break kolanut at his father-in-law's residence, neither will he do such in the midst of his elders unless permission is granted.
igbo: Nwoke anaghị awa ọjị na be ndị ọgọ ya, ọ gaghị awakwa ọjị ebe ndị tọrọ ya nọ na-abụghị ma ha nyere ya ikike ịwa ya.

english: It is also mandatory for a woman not to break kolanut in Igbo.
igbo: Ọ bụkwa iwu na nwaanyị anaghị awa ọjị n'ala Igbo.

english: Women and kolanut
igbo: Ọjị na ụmụnwaanyị

english: In Igbo, a woman does not climb a kolanut tree neither will she pluck down a kolanut from its tree
igbo: N'ala Igbo, nwaanyị anaghị arị elu ọjị, ọ naghị aghọtu ọjị n'osisi ya.

english: A woman does not pray over kolanut.
igbo: Nwaanyị anaghị agọ ọjị.

english: A woman does not climb a kolanut tree but she sells kolanut
igbo: Nwaanyi anaghị arị oji elu mana nwaanyị na-ere oji

english: a woman would not be allowed to collect her share of kolanut if all men in the gathering have not collected theirs.
igbo: Anaghị ekwe ka nwaanyị tinye aka n'ime efere were ọjị ma ọ bụrụ na ụmụnwoke nọ ebe ahụ ewerechabeghị.

english: Some even go to the extent of giving kolanut to a woman so that she will not have the opportunity to collect it from the plate.
igbo: Ụfọdụ na-aga n'ihu were aka ha nye nwaanyị ọjị ka ọ ghara inwe ohere tinye aka n'efere e jiri kee ọjị.

english: Watch the movie to see how Pete Edochie prayed over the kolanut for Igbo BBC
igbo: Lee ihe nkiri a ịhụ ka Pete Edochie si gọọrọ BBC Igbo ọjị:

english: The coming of the church did not prevent people from praying with kolanut as they were doing in the olden days.
igbo: Na ụka bịara egbochighị ndị mmadụ iji ọjị ekpe ekpere dịka esi eme ya mgbe gboo.

english: Here are 10 poor foods that the rich are now eating.
igbo: Lee nri ogbenye 10 ọgaranya na-erizi

english: Some of the foods formerly known as the poor are now eaten by the rich because of health issues.
igbo: Ụfọdụ nri a ma na mbụ dịka nke ndị ogbenye bụzi ihe ndị ọgaranya wakporo n'ihi okwu gbasara ahụike.

english: In Nigeria, about 30 or 40 years ago, some of these foods were meant for the poor.
igbo: N'ala Naijiria, ihe dịka afọ iri atọ maọbụ iri anọ gara aga, a na-ahụ ụfọdụ nri dịka nri ndị ihe na-esiri ike.

english: Most of these foods are foods people either get from their farms or buy cheaply in the market because demands are not much.
igbo: Ọtụtụ nri ndị a bụ nri ndị mmadụ na-enwetara onwe ha n'ugbo ha maọbụ zụta ọnụ ala n'ime ahịa n'ihi na ndị na-achọ ha adịghị ọtụtụ.

english: Nowadays, these foods are being consumed by the rich because of the high rate of diseases such as high blood pressure, diabetes, heart disease, stroke, cancer and obesity.
igbo: Mana ugbua, nri ndị a bụzị ihe na-amasị ndị ọgaraanya n'ihi mbawanye ọrịa tara nchara dịka ọbara mgbalielụ, ọrịa shuga, ọrịa obi, ọtụrụọkara (stroke), kansa na oke ibu bụ ọrịa ndị a na-ewe dịka 'ọrịa ndị ọgaranya'.

english: In 2008, the World Health Organization investigated on a study which shows that out of 11.2 percent of Nigerians, 169 million had hypertension while 2.7 percent had diabetes.
igbo: Na nchọpụta ngalaba na-ahụ maka ahụike na mba ụwa bụ WHO n'aha ịchafụ mere n'afọ 2008, ndị Naijiria pasenti 11.2 n'ime nde 169 bụ ndị nwere ọbara mgbalielụ ebe pasenti 2.7 nwere ọrịa shuga.

english: The panic is the reason why so many people are returning to the once-despised diet. Nowadays, these foods are so expensive that the poor cannot afford them.
igbo: Egwu ọrịa ndị a mere ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ji alaghachị na nri a na-eleda anya na mbụ nke mere na ugbua nrị ndịa a na-ada oke ọnụahịa nke bụ na aka ụmụogbenye anaghị eruzị ha.

english: Here are 10 of the foods:
igbo: Lee 10 n'ime nri ndị ahụ:

english: Iced fish
igbo: 1. Azụ friji

english: Iced fish was once seen as a poor food
igbo: A na-ahụbu azụ friji dịka nri ndị ogbenye

english: More than thirty years ago, iced fish were used to cook in poor homes, schools or when there was no money, while beef or chicken were for the rich.
igbo: Ihe karịrị afọ iri atọ gara aga, a na-ahụ iji azụ 'friji' sie nri n'ụlọ ndị ogbenye, ụmụakwụkwọ maọbụ mgbe ego adịghị mmadụ n'akpa, ebe anụ ehi maọbụ anụ ọkụkọ bụ maka ndị rijuru afọ.

english: Lagos resident Kingsley Udofa described how iced fish was not recognized as a good food: 'There was a time in Nigeria when iced fish was meant for the poor.'
igbo: Otu onye bi na Lagos bụ Kingsley Udofa kọwara anya a na-eleda azụ mbụ n'okwu ya sị: 'O nwere oge n'ala anyị bụ Naijiria mgbe azụ friji bụ maka ndị ogbenye.

english: At that time, iced fish were labeled with bad names such as 'Dead Fish'. People stopped buying and eating it.
igbo: Oge ahụ, a na-akpọ azụ friji aha ọjọọ dị icheiche iji kwaa ya emo dịka, 'Ozu azụ' n'asụsụ Igbo; 'Ókù Ékò' n'asụsụ Yoruba nke pụtara, 'Ozu Lagos' ; 'Àkpa asuko nse' n'asụsụ Ibibio nke pụtara, 'ọ nwụrụ anwụ ma mụrụ anya.' Ndị mmadụ na-ahara ịzụ ma rie azụ ndụ.

english: Now, things have changed. Iced fish are too costly in the market because many people including the rich buy it.
igbo: Ugbua, egwu adagharịala. Azụ friji bụ ahụghị ma erighị nke ọtụtụ mmadụ gunyere ndị ọgaranya nke bụ na azụ na-adazị oke ọnụ n'ahịa.

english: What you don't know about breadfruit you eat
igbo: Ihe ị na-amaghị maka ụkwa ị na-eri

english: What does melon soup give to the body?
igbo: Kedu ihe ofe Egusi gị na-enye ahụ gị?

english: Do you know how to prepare African salad? Learn it here
igbo: Ị ma etu esi agwọ abacha? Mụta ya ebe a

english: According to Minister of Agriculture, Sen Heineken Lokpobiri, Nigerians consume up to 3.2 million metric tons of fish annually, importing more than 80 percent.
igbo: Dịka Mịnịsta nta na-ahụ maka ọrụugbo bụ Sen Heineken Lokpobiri siri kwuo, ndị Naijiria na-eri azụ ruru nde 3.2 metrik tọn kwa afọ nke a na-atụbata ihe karịrị pasentị iri asatọ n'ime ya.

english: Be aware that 10,000 metric tons means 300,034 containers.
igbo: Mata na metrik tọn puku iri pụtara kọntena puku nari atọ iri atọ na anọ.

english: Cocoyam
igbo: 2. Ede

english: Cocoyam is very expensive
igbo: Ede na-agalazị oke ọnụ

english: The poor eat different species of cocoyam during famines because they have no money to buy tubers of yam.
igbo: Ọ bụ ede ụrị ka ọ bụ ede koko ma ọ bụ achịcha, ede bụ nri ụganị, nrị ndị onweghị ka ọra ha ji agbado ume n'ihi na ha enweghị ego zụrụ ji.

english: But now, cocoyam is expensive because everybody eats it.
igbo: Mana ugbua, nri ede bụzị ụkwa achị n'aka ya a na-agba n'ihi na oke na ngwere na-erizi ya.

english: Apart from some communities that take foo foo as their main food, others who do not eat it due to diseases like diabetes, hypertension and obesity go for cocoyam. Thus, making its demand to be high.
igbo: Ewepụ obodo jiri ụtaraede mere nnukwu nri, ndị na-asọ nsọ nrị n'ihi ọrịa dịka ọrịa shuga, ọbara mgbalielu na ndị chọrọ ịta ahụ ekweghịzị ka aka ogbenye rute ede, nke na i go ede e ji esi ofe dịzị ka igo ahịa iwu.

english: who took Zakzaky to court was the Kaduna government who accused him of killing a Nigerian soldier when his followers and the soldiers were in trouble in 2015
igbo: Ndị kpọrọ Zakzaky gawa ụlọikpe bụ gọọmenti Kaduna bu ndị na ebo ya ebubo na o gbụrụ onye agha Naịjirịa mgbe ndị na eso ya na ndịgha nwere nsogbu n'afọ 2015.

english: Federal government, does it prefer a court decision?
igbo: Gọọmenti etiti ọ na-ahọrọ mkpebi ụlọikpe?

english: Important story today: Release Elzakzaky - Shiite
igbo: Akụkọ dị mkpa taa: Tọghapụ Elzakzaky - Shiite

english: We arrested one hundred and fifteen Shiites members- Police
igbo: Anyị nwụchiri ndị Shiite 115- Uweojii

english: two other suspects Yakoub Yahaya Katsina and Sansi Abdulkadar Koki did not appear in court today.
igbo: Mmadụ abụọ ọzọ eji aka bụ Yakoub Yahaya Katsina na Sanụsi Abdulkadar Koki apụtaghị n'ụlọikpe ta.

english: In court, Zakzaky was acquitted of the charges, but said he was not involved
igbo: N'ụlọikpe, agụọrọ Zakzaky ebubo a na-ebo ya, mana o kwuru na aka ya adịghi na ya.

english: Maxwell Kenyon, Zakzaky's attorney, asked the court to release him from prison, but the judge disagreed
igbo: Maxwell Kenyon, bụ onye ọkaiwu Zakzaky, si ka ulọikpe nye ohere igbapụta ya na mkporo, mana ọkaikpe ekweghị.

english: Judge Kurada asked Kenyon to write down what he wanted
igbo: Ọkaikpe Kurada si ka Kenyon de ihe ọchọrọ ede.

english: A Kaduna government spokesman said the court should allow the DSS to arrest Zakzaky.
igbo: Onye nọchịtere anya ndị gọọmentị Kaduna sị ka ụlọikpe kwere ka DSS ka jide Zakzaky.

english: Justice agrees that Zakzaky Abuja should be restored.
igbo: Ọlụikpe kwenyere na nke a, sị ka akpọghachie Zakzaky Abuja.

english: And the court further stated that on June 21 they will put another verdict in the case.
igbo: Ụlọikpe gakwara n'ihu kwuo na ọ bụ n'ụbọchị 21 nke ọnwa Juun ka ha ga etinye ọnu ọzọ n'ikpe a.

english: However, the Shiites objected to this move.
igbo: Mana, ndị Shi'a si na ha ekweghị n'ije a mere.

english: In their book, Abdulhamid Bello, one of their leaders, said they would continue to protest.
igbo: N'akwụkwọ ha dere, Abdulhamid Bello, bu otu n'ime ndi isi ha, kwuru na ha ga aga n'ihu na-eme ngaghari iwe ha.

english: We are to blame the federal government if something happened to Zakzaky, Bello said.
igbo: Ọ bu gọọmentị etiti ka anyị ga ata ụta ma ya bụrụ na onwere ihe mere Zakzaky, Bello kwuru.

english: our wedding dress
igbo: Uwe anyị na-eyi agba nkwu

english: Marriage is an important thing in Igbo.
igbo: Ịlụ di maọbụ nwaanyị bụ ihe dị mkpa n’ala Igbo.

english: What kind of clothes do our people wear?
igbo: Kedụ ụdị uwe ọ ndị be anyị na-eyi?

english: Igbo dresses are very unique
igbo: Ejiji ndị ndị Igbo pụụ iche nke ụkwuu

english: Getting married is a great journey in one's life.
igbo: Ịlụ di maọbụ nwaanyị bụ ezigbo njem na ndụ mmadụ.

english: It's something that few people want to get their hands on before leaving the world.
igbo: Ọ bụ ihe mmadụ ole n'ole chọrọ ijide aka tupu ha ahapụ ụwa.

english: In Igbo land, a man who wants to marry knows that he is not going to marry only his wife.
igbo: N'ala Igbo, nwoke gara ịlụ nwaanyị ga-amara na ọ bụghị sọọsọ nwunye ya ka ọ na-alụ.

english: He is marrying all his people
igbo: Ọ na-alụkwa ndị be ya niile.

english: In the same way, the bride is also married to her husband's people.
igbo: N'otu aka ahụ, nwaanyị na-alụ di na-alụkwa ndị be ya.

english: As a result, everyone from both families cooperates to make sure that the ceremony related is successful.
igbo: N'ihi nke a, onye ọbụla siri n'ezinụlọ ha abụọ na-etinyekọta aka ịhụ na mmemme gbasara ndị a na-achọ ịlụ onwe gara nke ọma.

english: Ụmụnya road, is it difficult for the government to fix?
igbo: Okporoụzọ Umunya ọ nyịala gọọmentị idozi?

english: Unity, has it been in the land of Ozalla?
igbo: Ịdịnotu ọdịla n'ala Ozalla?

english: The great thing in marriage is the dress they wear and the ones for the guests.
igbo: Ihe ukwu nke dị n'alụm di na nwunye bụ uwe ha ga-eyi n'ahụ makwa nke ndị ga-abịanụ ga-eyi.

english: These are the different clothes our people wear in Igbo land.
igbo: Ndị a bụ uwe dị icheiche ndị be anyị na-eyi n'ala Igbo.

english: Special costumes
igbo: Ejiji pụrụ iche

english: The dress of a bride is different because everyone watches her on the day.
igbo: Uwe nwaanyị na-alụ dị na-adị iche maka ọ bụ ya ka onye ọbụla ga-ekiri ụbọchị ahụ.

english: And a man's attire is different as well.
igbo: Nke nwoke na-apụkwa iche nke ya.

english: Everyone watches the bride on that day
igbo: Ọ bụnwaanyị ka onye ọbụla ga-ekiri ụbọchị ahụ.

english: A lot of brides do wear shirts and skirts.
igbo: Ọtụtụ ụmụ nwaanyị na-eme ịgbankwu na-eyị uwe elu na nke mwụda.

english: It's not compulsory that the clothes will have one colour, but the colour of a bride's dress will complement each other
igbo: Ọbụghị iwu na uwe a ga-enwe otu agwa, mana agwa akwa nwaanyị ga-eyi ga-emejurịta ibe ya.

english: The sleeves of this shirt can stop anywhere.
igbo: Aka uwe elu a nwere ike ịkwụsị ebe ọbụla.

english: It could be decorated with various jewelry.
igbo: E nwere ike iji ọla akwa dị icheiche achọ ya mma.

english: Gowns are the type of dress that appeal to the bride and her maids. Married women usually tie wrappers.
igbo: Uwe mwụda bụ ụdịrị akwa na-amasị ndị ibe nke nwunye na ndị agbọghọ bịara mmemme a. Ndị nwaanyị lụrụla di na-adị ama akwa n'ukwu.

english: Men wear shirts and trousers
igbo: Ndị nwoke na-eyi uwe elu na traụza.

english: Some tie wrapper on their waists
igbo: Ụfọdụ na-ama akwa n'ụkwu.

english: Headtie
igbo: Uwe isi

english: This is another important wedding dress according to Igbo culture.
igbo: Nke a bụkwa uwe ọzọ dị mkpa n'ejiji alụm dị na nwunye dịka omenaala Igbo sịrị dị.

english: Horsetail , caps and necklaces are some of the ornaments
igbo: Ọdụ ịnyịnya, okpu na ọla olu bụ ụfọdụ ihe eji achọ mma

english: A woman may wear a scarf.
igbo: Nwaanyị nwere ike ịsụ ịchafụ n'isi.

english: Jewelry can be added to the bride's scarf to make it look attractive.
igbo: E nwere ike itinye ola uwe n'ịchafụ nke nwaanyị ka ọma ezigbo mma.

english: A man wears a cap.
igbo: Nwoke na-ekpu okpu isi.

english: It may be a yellow, red and other hats.
igbo: O nwere ike ịbụ okpu na-acha uhie uhie, edo na ndị ọzọ.

english: Jewelry, shoes and more.
igbo: Ọla, akpụkpọ ụkwụ na ihe ndị ọzọ

english: A wedding garment is not complete if there is no jewelry.
igbo: Uwe a na-eyi n'igba nkwụ nwaanyị anaghị ezu oke ma ọbụrụ na ola dị icheiche adịghị na ya.

english: Silver , gold, coral and jewelry added to clothes.
igbo: Ọla ọcha, ọla edo, kọral, ọdụ na ọla a na-etinye n'akwa.

english: They are many.
igbo: Ha juru eju.

english: A woman and a man are wearing necklace and bangle.
igbo: Nwaanyị na nwoke na-agba uwe olu na nke aka.

english: Again, a woman and a man can use a horse tail.
igbo: Ọzọkwa, nwaanyị na nwoke nwere ike iji ọdụ ịnyịnya.

english: A woman can also use handfan if she wishes
igbo: Nwaanyị nwekwara ike iji akụpe n'aka ma ọ chọọ.

english: With respect to shoes, women wear beautiful shoes.
igbo: Abịa na akpụkpọ ụkwụ, ndị nwaanyị na-eyi akpụkpọ ụkwụ mara mma.

english: some clothes seem to be high or low for them to have a chance to dance
igbo: Ufọdụ na-eyi nke dị elu maọbụ nke ala ka ha nwe ohere ịgba egwu.

english: Men's clothe is made of leather
igbo: Nke ndị nwoke bụ nke e ji akpụkpọ anụ mee.

english: Staff makes male fashion
igbo: Mkpọrọ na-eme ka ejiji nwoke

english: Finally, a man can hold his walking staff
igbo: N'ikpeazu, nwoke nwere ike jide mkpọrọ o ji aga ije.

english: Stories that will interest you
igbo: Akụkọ ndị ga-amasị gị:

english: will you have this kind of tribal marks our forefathers had in the olden days
igbo: I ga-egbu ụdịrị ichi a egburu mgbe gboo?

english: Things you should not do close to an Igbo man
igbo: Ihe ndị ị na-ekwesịghị ime n'akụkụ onye Igbo

english: the value of a woman is not the kitchen
igbo: Uru nwaanyị abụghị sọ n'ụsọekwu

english: Will the 2018 Nigerian budget help youth?
igbo: Bọjetị Naịjirịa nke 2018 ọ ga-enyere ndị ntoroọbịa aka?

english: After signing up for the Nigerian Budget, we look forward to seeing how different categories are allocated
igbo: Ka emechara binye aka na Bọjetị nke Naịjirịa anyị na-ele anya ịhụ etu esiri kenye ngalaba dị icheiche ego.

english: House of Senate
igbo: Ụlọomeiwu Sineti

english: Buhari gave 2018 budget to the Senate for the past six months.
igbo: Buhari nyere ndị ụlọoimiwu Bojet afọ 2018 ọnwa isi gara aga.

english: On Tuesday, May 15, the Nigerian Senate signed a bill that would rule the 2018 Budget.
igbo: N'ụbọchị Tusde bụ Mee 15, Ụlọomeiwu nke Naịjirịa binyere aka n'akwụkwọ ga-achị mkpata na mmefụ nke akpọrọ Bọjeti 2018.

english: According to the budget, Nigeria would spend 9.120,334,988,225 naira, 500 naira more on the loan issued by President Muhammadu Buhari.
igbo: Bọjeti a ha binyere aka kwuru na Naịjirịa ga-emefu naira 9.120,334,988,225, bụ ọnụ ego jiri njere naira 500 karia ego dị na akwụkwọ onyeisiala Muhammadu Buhari nyere ya na mbụ.

english: The president gave them tarry of 8.612.
igbo: Onyeisiala nyere ha tari naira 8.612.

english: And the evidence is that the government has emphasized in its statement that it will focus on community development while the Departments of Electricity, Labor and Housing are the largest revenue earners in the budget with extra 682 billion naira.
igbo: Na ihe gosiri na gọọmentị kwusiri ike na okwu ya na ọ ga-etinye anya n'ọrụ banyere mmepe obodo ka ngalaba na-ahu maka ọkụ latrik, ọrụ na ụlọ (bụ nke akpọrọ Minsitry of Power, Works and Housing na asụsụ Bekee) bụ ndị nwetakarị ego mmefu na Bọjetị ka ha wetera Njeri naira 682 na mmanye.

english: Buhari's seven promises and what he did
igbo: Nkwa asaa Buhari kwere na ihe o mere

english: I tried - Buhari
igbo: Agbalịkwaranụ m- Buhari

english: Similarly, the tourism department received $ 251 billion on top.
igbo: Na otu aka ahụ, ngalaba na-ahụ maka njem nwetara njeri naira 251 na mmanye.

english: The president and the APC executives have just a few months to show Nigerians if they have good ambition
igbo: Onyeisiala na ndị isi otu APC nwere sọsọ ọnwa ole na ole iji gosi ndị Naịjirịa ma eji ọganịrụ bịa

english: Others are the 157 billion in the health sector; the Department of Agriculture and Rural Development received $ 149 billion extra; the water department got 147 billion naira; the Commerce Department earned extra 105 billion naira in sales.
igbo: Ndị ọzọ bụ ngalaba na-ahu maka nchekwa nwetara njeri 157 n'ọma; ngalaba na-ahụ maka ọrụ ugbo na mmepe ime oboso nwetara njeri 149 na mmanye; ngalaba na-ahụ maka mmiri nwetara njeri naira 147 n'ọma; ngalaba na-ahụ maka azụmahịa nwetara njeri naira 105 n'ọma.

english: Those at the lowest level are the Department of Education and Health.
igbo: Ndị nọ na okpuru bụ ngalaba na-ahụ maka akwụkwụọ na nke ahuike.

english: The Education sector got 102 billion naira while Health received 86 billion naira.
igbo: Ngalaba akwụkwọ nwetara njeri naira 102 n'ọma ka Ahuike nwetara njeri naira 86 na ọma.

english: The Niger Delta sector received 58,082,611,977 billion of the total, while department of Environment least of the money .
igbo: Ngala na-ahụ maka ihe banyere Naịja Delta nwetara njeri 58,082,611,977 ka nke na-ahụ maka gbụrụgbụru nwetara mpekatampe n'ime ha niile.

english: They got 17 billion naira on top.
igbo: Ha nwetara njeri naira 17 n'ọma.

english: The Ministries of works, electricity and housing received more money from 2018 Budget.
igbo: Ngalaba na-ahụ maka ọrụ, ọkụ na ụlọ bu ndị nwetara ego karịa na Bọjetị 2018

english: 'Another indication which shows that the government concentrated on projects development is how they gave the Department of 'Special Intervention Program' 150 billion naira'
igbo: Na ihe ọzọ gosiri na gọọmentị tinyere uche na ọrụ mmepe bu etụ ha sị nye ngalaba ha kpọrọ 'special intervention programme' njeri naira 150, nye nke ha kpọrọ

english: Grants and donor funded projects worth $ 169 billion, and the so-called zonal intervention projects' earned 100 billion naira. '
igbo: grants and donor funded projects njeri naira 169 na ọma, na nke ha kpọrọ 'zonal intervention projects' nwetara njere naira 100.

igbo: Ndi ntoroọbịa ga-erite oru na ọrụ nwereike ipụta n'ego etinyere na ngalaba na-ahu maka ọrụ.

english: The benefits will be through the construction of roads and houses.
igbo: Oru a ha ga-erite bu site na ọru ha ga-enweta ma ọru ụzọ na ọrụ ihiwe ụlo bido n'ike.

english: Remember that the ruling party APC has promised to create three million jobs during their campaign in 2015.

igbo: Ndị 'Restoration Group' kwuru na amanyere ha iwu ka ha rịọ Gọvanọ Rochas tupu agba ụlọ APC ọkụ.
