english: Anambra state citizens, especially those of the Njikoka, Dunukofia and Anaocha councils have been reassured of abundant democracy dividends by Chief Dozie Nwankwo, who took oath of office last Thursday as he was formally inaugurated by the leadership of the Federal House of Representatives, Abuja.
igbo: Ụmụ afọ Anambra Steeti, ọ kachasị ndị nọ n' okpuru ọchịchị Njikoka, Dunukọfịa na Anaọcha, ka Chifu Dozie Nwankwọ, onye ñuru iyi ọrụ ka ndị ndu ụlọrụ ọmebe iwu 'Federal House of Representatives' guzobere ya ụbọchị Tọzdee, kwegoro nkwa ịrite ihe nketa ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya n' uju.

english: Nwankwo was sworn in after successfully reclaiming his mandate at the Court of Appeal Elections Petitions tribunal, Enugu Division on Nov 1,2019.
igbo: E duru Nwankwọ n' iyi ọrụ ka ọ nwetachara mmeri n' ụlọikpe ekpecha ekpegharịa ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị (Court of Appeal Elections Petitions Tribunal), ngalaba Enugu na November 1, 2019.

english: The inauguration which was witnessed by all and sundry, including the Minister of Transportation, Chibike Amechi, Anambra deputy Governor Nkem Okeke, Senators Victor Umeh and Rochas Okorocha, Obiora Okonkwo, national and state assemblies members, ended with a dinner.
igbo: Nguzobe a nke ndị ukwu na ndị nta gụnyere Minista njem, Chibike Amechi, osote gọvanọ Anambra Steeti Nkem Okeke, ndị sinetọ Victor Umeh na Rochas Okorocha, Obiora Okonkwọ, ndị ọmebe iwu nke gọọmenti etiti nakwa nke steeti biara bụ nke e ji oriri abalị mechie.

english: Nigeria may miss SDG on healthcare, says Soludo
igbo: Naijiria nwere ike enwetaghị SDG nleta ahụ ike, Soludo na-ekwu

english: Former governor, Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Prof. Chukwuma Soludo, has said that if the Federal Government does not initiate good reforms, the country may miss out on the Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) on healthcare.
igbo: Onye jibu ọkwa gọvanọ ụlọ akụ nke etiti n' ala anyị nke bekee kpọrọ Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Ọkammụta Chukwuma Soludo, ekwuola na ọ bụrụ na gọọmenti etiti ewebataghi ezigbo atụmatụ nhazigharị, ala anyị nwere ike ghara inweta nlekọta ahụ ike nke 'Sustainable Development Galeshia (SDG).'

english: Soludo spoke at the 26th Annual Lift Above Poverty Organisation (LAPO) Development Forum themed 'The Nigerian Healthcare Situation: The Way Forward' in Abuja.
igbo: Soludo kwuru okwu na ọgbakọ nke iri abụọ na isii ọgbakọ na-abịa kwa afọ nke otu a kpọrọ 'Lift Above Poverty Organisation' nke isiokwu ya bụ 'Ọnọdụ nlekọta ahụ ike na Naijiria: Ụzọ Agamniihu' nke e mere n' Abuja.

english: According to him, tackling healthcare challenges in the country requires decisive and comprehensive war on poverty, inequality, illiteracy or poor public health education, nutrition, water and sanitation, as well as provision of adequate and accessible public health facilities and insurance schemes.
igbo: N' okwu ya, ibuso agha nye ihe iche aka mgba nlekọta ahụ ike n'ala anyị kwesiri ezi mkpebi na ibuso agha zuru okè nye ụbịam, aghaghị nhatanha (inequality), amaghị ede na amaghị asụ ma ọ bụ enweghị ezi nkụzi na ọmụmụ ahụ ike ndị mmadụ, ihe oriri na-edozi ahụ, mmiri na adịmọcha tinyekwara inye na ime ka ndị mmadụ nweta ezigbo ngwa ahụ ike na usoro ikike.

english: 'The United Nations SDG 3 envisions that by 2030 all countries should ensure healthy lives and promote wellbeing for all at all ages.'There are about 13 specific targets to meet.
igbo: Ebumnuche SDG 3 nke 'United Nations' bụ na n' afọ 2030 obodo ọ bụla kwesiri ịhụ na enwere ezi ahụ ike ma kwalite obibi ndụ nye onye ọ bụla. E nwere ihe dịka iri na atọ e bu n' uche ịmepụta.

english: From all indications, Nigeria is set to miss the targets and the SDG on health except some dramatic and systematic reforms are initiated and sustained from now until 2030,' he said.
igbo: 'Site n' ihe niile a na-ahụ, Naijiria dị nkwadebe enwetaghị ebumnuche a nakwa SDG nke ahụ ike beeresọ ma a malitere ma jigidekwa nhazigharị dị egwu n' usoro e si eme ihe bido ugbua ruo 2030,' o kwuru.

english: Government's expenditure on health (like other sectors) needs to be ratcheted up and its facilitation and regulatory functions strengthened, he said, adding that serious attention at fora like that, should also focus on maximising the latent potential of the 'other hand' (individuals and non-state actors) in reversing what LAPO identifies as the 'progressive decline' of healthcare delivery in Nigeria.
igbo: Gọọmenti kwesiri iwelite aka n' ego ọ na-emefu n' ahụ ike (dị ka ngalaba ndị ọzọ) ma mekwuazi ka nkwalite na ọrụ igbazi ya siwanye ike.

english: He noted that the country's healthcare statistics was as scary as its poverty and unemployment statistics, using the average life expectancy as summary indicator.
igbo: O kwuputara na nchịkọta ọnụ Ọgụgụ ahụ ike obodo anyị na-eyi egwu dịka nchịkọta ọnụ Ọgụgụ ụbịam na enweghi ọrụ ya, site n' iji ụdị ndụ a tụrụanya ya dị ka ihe mgba ama.

english: The former governorship aspirant in Anambra State identified a strong correlation between poverty/inequality and health.He explained that the 1999 Constitution (as amended) provided for free and compulsory primary education, as well as free secondary education.
igbo: Ya bụ onye zọburu ọkwa gọvanọ Anambra Steeti gosiri nnukwu ihe Njikota dị n' etiti ụbịam/aghaghị nhatanha na ahụ ike. Ọ kọwara na iwu ala anyị nke 1999 (dị ka esi megharị ya) nyere ohere maka agụmakwụkwọ praịmarị n' akwụghị ụgwọ ma bụrụkwa iwu nakwa agụmakwụkwọ sekondrị n' akwụghị ụgwọ

english: In his opening remarks, chairman, LAPO Board of Directors, Dr. Osarenren Emokpae, called on the federal and state governments to increase budgetary allocation for the health sector.He said the increment would help reduce medical tourism, as some of the elite would begin to patronise local health facilities rather than go abroad.
igbo: N' okwu o ji meghe emume, onyeisi, 'LAPO Board of Directors', Osarenren Emokpae, kpọkuru gọọmenti etiti na nke steeti ka ha welite aka n' ego ha na-amapụta iji rụọ ọrụ na ngalaba ahụ ike. O kwuru na iwelite aka a ga-enye aka belata ije mba ofesi maka ihe gbasara ahụ ike n' ihi na ụfọdụ ndị e ji okwu ha agba izu ga-ebido iji ngwa ahụ ike anyị nwere kpọrọ ihe kama ijewe mba ofesi.

english: In 2018, Nigeria was ranked 187 out of 191 countries in the world that are not complying with the Universal Health Coverage (UCH), he noted, adding that LAPO, in its inclusive services to its clients and the general public, made healthcare a very important component of its services.The Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of LAPO, Godwin Ehigiamusoe, said the country's health sector required urgent and collective attention and action, adding that the healthcare statistics in some cases were very depressing.
igbo: N' afọ 2018, Naijiria gbara ndị nke 187 n' ime mba 191 na anaghị esonyecha n' atụmatụ 'Universal Health Coverage (UCH)' n' ụwa niile, o kwuru, ma gbakwunye na LAPO, n' akaghị ọkè n' ọrụ ya nye ndị ọ na-arụ ọrụ nakwa ọha niile, mere ahụ ike akụkụ dị nnukwu mkpa n' ọrụ ya. Onyeisi ọrụ ((Chief Executive Officer (CEO)) nke LAPO, Godwin Ehigiamusoe, sịrị na ngalaba ahụ ike ala anyị kwesiri ezi nleta na mkpaso agwa nke mmadụ niile n' egbughi oge, o tinyere na nchịkọta ọnụ Ọgụgụ ahụ ike n' Ọnọdụ ụfọdụ na-ewute nke ukwuu.

english: Nnamdi Kanu's lawyer declared wanted
igbo: A kowaputara ọka ikpe Nnamdị Kanụ dị ka onye ndị uweojii na-achọ achọ.

english: The police in Anambra State have declared Ifeanyi Ejiofor, a lawyer to leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) Nnamdi Kanu wanted.
igbo: Ndị uwe ojii Anambra Steeti emeela Ifeanyị Ejiofor, ọka ikpe nyere onye ndu 'Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) Nnamdị Kanụ, onye ha na-achọ achọ.

english: 'I will like to let Nigerians to know that as we speak, Barrister Ejiofor, an IPOB member and his cohorts have been declared wanted by the command,' Anambra police commissioner in the state, John Abang, said on Tuesday.
igbo: 'Achọrọ m ime ka ndị Naịjirịa mara na dị ka anyị na-ekwu ugbua, Ọka ikpe Ejiofor, onye otu IPOB na ndị otu ya abụrụla ndị ndị uwe ojii nke mpaghara Anambra Steeti na-achọ achọ,' Cọmishọna uweojii nke Anambra Steeti, John Abang, kwuru n' ụbọchị Tuzdee.

english: 'And I will seek the cooperation of law-abiding Nigerians from North, South, East and West, wherever they find this individual, they should report to the nearest police station or any other security agency for possible arrest and prosecution.'
igbo: Anakwa m arịọ mmekọrịta ndị Naịjirịa na-edobe iwu na mgbago ugwu ugwu, mgbada ugwu, ọwụwa anyanwụ na ọdịda anyanwụ, ebe ọbụla ha hụrụ onye a, ha gaa nye mkpesa n' ụlọ ọrụ ndị uweojii ọbụla dị nso ma ọ bụ n' ụlọ ọrụ ndị nchekwa ọzọ maka ijide ma taa ya ahụhụ kwesiri ya.

english: One dead, two injured in road crash on Lagos-Abeokuta expressway
igbo: Otu anwụọla, abụọ meruru ahụ n' ihe mberede okporo ụzọ mere n' ụzọ awara awara Legosi-Abeokuta.

english: The Ogun Traffic Compliance and Enforcement Corps (TRACE), on Sunday, said that one person died, while two others sustained injuries in a road accident that occurred at Onihale area, near Owode-Ijako, on the Lagos-Abeokuta expressway.
igbo: 'Traffic Compliance and Enforcement Corps (TRACE) nke Ogun, n' ụbọchị ụka, kwuru na otu onye nwụrụ ebe mmadụ abụọ ndị ọzọ nwetara ihe mmeru ahụ n' ihe mberede okporo ụzọ nke mere na mpaghara Onihale, nke dị nso na Owode-Ijako, n' ụzọ awara awara Legosi-Abeokuta.

english: Mrs Temitope Oseni, the TRACE Unit Commander, Owode-Ijako, told the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) in Ota, Ogun, that the accident occurred at about 6.15 am. on Sunday.
igbo: Odoziakụ Temitope Oseni, onyeisi TRACE mpaghara Owode-Ijako, gwara ụlọ ọrụ nta akụkọ nke Naijiria, 'News Agency of Nigeria (NAN),' n' Ọta, Ogun steeti, na ihe mberede okporo ụzọ a mere n' ebe 6.15 nke ụtụtụ ụbọchị ụka.

english: She explained that a truck, with no registration number, heading to Sango-Ota from Abeokuta, lost control due to tyre burst.
igbo: Ọ kọwara na otu ụgbọ ala trọkụ, n' enweghị akara e ji mara ya, si Abeokuta na-eje Sango-Ota, ekweghi nkwụsị n' ihi na taya ya gbawara.

english: Oseni said that the vehicle somersaulted twice, resulting in the death of the motor boy, while the driver and one other sustained injuries.
igbo: Oseni kwuru na ụgbọala ahụ tụgharịrị ugboro abụọ nke butere ọnwụ nwa ikorobịa na-eso ụgbọala ahụ, ebe onye na-anya na onye ọzọ meruru ahụ.

english: READ ALSO: Auto Accident: One died, nine injured in Anambra
igbo: Gụkwuazị: Ihe mberede ụgbọala: otu nwụrụ, itoolu meruru ahụ n' Anambra (

english: Oseni explained that the motor boy was trying to jump out of the vehicle when he hit his head on the road, which resulted in his death.
igbo: Oseni kọwapụtara na nwa ikorobịa ahụ na-eso ụgbọala ahụ na-achọ isi ụgbọala ahụ mapụta mgbe ọ kụrụ isi n' ala nke butere ọnwụ ya.

english: 'The corpse of the victim has been taken for burial by the family members, while the survivors are receiving treatment in a disclosed hospital in Ifo, Ogun,' 'she said.
igbo: 'Ndị ezinụlọ ya eburula ozu ya maka ili ya, ebe ndị nke dị ndụ na-anara ọgwụgwọ n' ụlọ ọgwụ a kpọghị aha dị n' Ifo, Ogun steeti, ' o kwuru.

english: The TRACE unit commander said that the vehicle had been towed to Ifo police station to ease traffic flow in the area.
igbo: Onyeisi 'TRACE' mpaghara a kwuru na a kpụrụla ụgbọala ahụ kpụga ụlọ ọrụ ndị uweojii dị n' Ifo iji ka ọgịga ụgbọala n' ụzọ dị mfe.

english: She advised motorists to ensure that their vehicles were properly maintained and desist from the use of used tyres to avoid unnecessary loss of lives and property.
igbo: Ọ dụrụ ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala ọdụ ka ha kawa ahụ hụ na ha n' akpachapụrụ ụgbọala ha anya nke ọma ma wepu aka n' itinye taya a nyagoro anya n' ụgbọala ha iji gbochie itufu ndụ na akụnụba n' ụzọ n' ezighi ezi.

english: Ooni, Eze, Nwodo preach unity at World Eri Festival
igbo: Ooni, Eze, Nwodo kwusara ozi maka udo n' oriri Eri nke ụwa niile.

english: Nwodo excited as African-Americans 'return' home
igbo: Obi bụ Nwodo sọ añụrị dị ka ndị Afrika-Amerika lọtara ụlọ.

english: Obi of Onitsha, others grace occasion
igbo: Obi Ọnịcha, ndị ọzọ bịara mmemme ahụ.

english: It was the real handshake across the Niger—royal fathers from Igbo land and their counterparts from Yoruba land charging Nigerians on national unity as a path to peaceful coexistence among ethnic nationalities regardless of religious backgrounds.
igbo: Ọ bụ nnọọ nzukọ nke ndị mmadụ si ebe dị iche iche-- ndị Igwe ala Igbo nakwa ndị ogbo ha si ala Yoruba na-agwa ndị Naịjirịa ka ha nabata ịdịkọnotu dị ka ihe ga-eweta mbikọrịta n' udo n' etiti agbụrụ dị iche iche n' agbanyeghi ndabere okpukperechi dị iche iche.

english: At the historical Eri Festival in Aguleri, Anambra State, and in separate speeches, HRM Eze Chukwuemeka Eri, Eze Eri Kingdom in Enugwu Aguleri and HRM, Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi, Ooni of Ife, royal fathers from ancient stools of authority, showed the way forward and identified national unity as the key that will accelerate the pace of peace, development and progress of the country in all areas.
igbo: N' oriri akụkọ ihe mere eme Eri a n' Agụleri, Anambra Steeti, nakwa n' okwu dị iche iche, HRM Eze Chukwuemeka Eri, Eze obodo Eri n' Agụleri na HRM, Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi, Ooni nke Ife, ndị eze ọdịnala dị iche iche, gosiri ebe ụzọ agamniihu dị ma kọwa na ịdịnotu nke ala anyị bụ igodo ga-akpọghe ụzọ udo, mmepe na agamniihu nke ala anyị n' akụkụ ọbụla.

english: It is certainly auspicious that such occasion was witnessed at the World Eri Festival, held at Enugwu Aguleri in Anambra State, where Eze Eri hosted the Ooni of Ife, Obi of Onitsha, HRM Igwe Nnaemeka Achebe, President-General of Ohanaeze Ndigbo, Chief Nnia Nwodo, and other dignitaries.
igbo: Ọ bụ ihe ịtụnanya n' ezie na ụdị emume a pụtara ihe n' oriri Eri nke ụwa niile, nke a chịkọbara n' Enugwu Agụleri, Anambra Steeti, ebe Eze Eri kpọrọ Ooni nke Ife, Obi nke Ọnịcha, HRM Igwe Nnaemeka Achebe, onyeisi Ọhanaeze ndị Igbo gburugburu, Chief Nna Nwodo, nakwa ndị ọzọ a mara aha ha oriri.

english: Other dignitaries at the occasion were Igwe of Mbaukwu HRM Igwe Peter Anugwu, HRM, an industrialist Igwe Patrick Okolo of Nsukka Urban, Dr Chile Obidigbo, Chairman of Anambra East Local Government Area Hon Obi Nweke, The chairman of Ogbaru LGA Hon Arinze Awogu, Member Representing Anambra East in the Anambra State House of Assembly Hon Obinna Emenaka among others.
igbo: Ndị ọzọ a mara aha ha n' emume a bụ Igwe Mbaukwu HRM Igwe Peter Anugwu, omeputa ihe Igwe Patrick Okolo nke Nsukka obodo mepere emepe, Dr Chike Obidigbo, onye isioche nke okpuru ọchịchị Anambra East Hon Obi Nweke, onye isioche okpuru ọchịchị Ogbaru Hon Arinze Awogu, onye nnọchiteanya Anambra East n' ọmebe iwu Anambra Steeti Hon Obinna Emenaka nakwa ndị ọzọ.

english: The chief celebrator, Eze Chukwuemeka Eri, the Ezeora 34th and Aka Ji Ovo Igbo, described the Festival as a time when the Igbo world-wide gathered to remember their progenitor Eri, who is believed to have migrated from Israel and settled at Aguleri.
igbo: Onye kpọrọ oriri, Eze Chukwuemeka Eri, Eze ọrịa nke 34 na Aka ji Ọvọ Igbo, kọwara oriri ahụ dị ka mgbe ndị Igbo n' ụwa niile gbakọọ iji cheta isi mmalite ha bụ Eri, onye e kwenyere na o si Israel bịa biri n', Agụleri.

english: 'Today, we commemorate and celebrate an African and global historical figure Nna Anyi (our father) Eri.
igbo: 'Taa, anyị na-echeta ma na-eme emume onye isi ojii nakwa onye akụkọ ihe mere eme nke mba ụwa dum nna anyị Eri.

english: Today I welcome my brother and friend from our brotherly land of Yoruba, the Ooni of Ife, HRM Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi, Ojaja 11, the 51st Ooni of Ife.
igbo: Taa ana m anabata nwanne m nakwa enyi m si ala ụmụnne anyị Yoruba, Ooni nke Ife, HRM Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi, Ojaja nke 11, Ooni nke Ife nke 53.

english: I use this opportunity to call for peace and unity among the Yoruba and the Igbo and the rest of Nigerians,' he said.
igbo: E ji m ohere a arịọ maka udo na ịdịnotu n' etiti Igbo na Yoruba nakwa ndị Naịjirịa ndị ọzọ,' o kwuru.

english: Pillars, Abia Warriors resolve feud over Enaholo
igbo: Otu bọọlụ 'Pillars,' 'Abịa Warriors' emeziela ihu mgbarụ dị n' etiti ha maka Enaholo.

english: Nigeria Professional Football League (NPFL) side, Kano Pillars have confirmed that they have resolved the heated transfer feud with Abia Warriors over former Flying Eagles goalkeeper, Joshua Enaholo, Completesports.com reports.
igbo: Akụkụ 'Nigeria Professional Football League (NPFL)', 'Kano Pillars' ekwuputala na ha ekpeziela nnukwu ihu mgbarụ dị n' etiti ha na 'Abịa Warriors' banyere ndị onye cheburu 'Flying Eagles' goolu, Jọshụa Enaholo, ga-echere goolu, 'Completesports.com' kwuru.

english: Enaholo had joined the four-time League winners, Pillars during the summer transfer window, but Abia Warriors claimed the move breached all normal transfer procedures and twice, petitioned league organisers, LMC.
igbo: Enaholo esonyerela ndị bugoro iko egwuregwu a ugboro anọ, 'Kano Pillars' n' ohere ngafe n' oge ekpomoku (summer transfer window), mana Abịa Warriors kwuru na omume a erubeghiri ezi usoro ngafe isi ma gbaa ndị na-ahazi egwuregwu ahụ akwụkwọ ugboro abụọ.

english: The club had then said they were not opposed to the player's desire to move but stressed that though he still had one season left on his existing contract, due process should be followed.
igbo: Otu egwuregwu bọọlụ a kwuru na ha anaghị ekwugide ebumnuche Ọgba bọọlụ a ịpụ mana ha na-ekwusi ike na n' agbanyeghi na ọ ka nwere otu oge egwuregwu fọrọ afọ na nkwekọrịta ọrụ ha nyere, e kwesiri iso ezigbo usoro.

english: But the executive chairman of Kano Pillars board, Surajo Shuaibu Yahaya, has now revealed that the transfer feud has been amicably resolved, heaping plaudits on Abia Warriors chairman, Pastor Emeka Inyama, for his understanding, cooperation, and maturity in ensuring that the issue was amicably resolved.
igbo: Mana onye isioche ọrụ otu Kano Pillars, Surajo Shuaibu Yahaya, egosila ugbua na ihu mgbarụ nke ngafe abụrụla ihe e jiri nwayọọ wee dozie, buruzie ukpa ekele bugara onye isioche Abịa Warriors, Pastor Emeka I ya ma, maka nghọta ọ nwere, nkwekọrịta nakwa ntozu okè ya n' ime ka okwu ahụ bụrụ nke e ji nwayọọ dozie.

english: Police gun down notorious armed robbery suspect in Abia
igbo: Ndị uwe ojii gbaturu ekperima a ma ama a na-enyo enyo n' Abịa.

english: Police
igbo: Ndị uwe ojii

english: The Police in Abia on Tuesday gunned down a suspected notorious armed robber identified as Sampson Nwokocha, aka 'Grave' who has been terrorizing residents of Umuahia and its environs.
igbo: Ndị uwe ojii n' Abịa n' ụbọchị Tuzdee gbaturu onye ekperima a na-enyo enyo a mara dị ka Sampson Nwokocha, 'aka Grave' onye na-ebutere ndị bi n' Ụmụahia na obodo ndị gbara gburugburu ihe ụjọ .

english: The Commissioner of Police in the state, Mr Ene Okon, who made this known to newsmen in Umuahia, said that he was shot dead after a gun battle with his men following a tip off.
igbo: Kọmishọna uweojii n' Abịa steeti, Maazị Ene Okon, onye mere ka ndị nta akụkọ mara nke a n' Ụmụahia, kwuru na a gbagburu ya ka ya na ndị otu ya (ndị uwe ojii) gbakọrịtachara egbe ka e suru ya imi.

english: He said that Nwokocha, who was recently released from prison, had been on the watch list of the command following his alleged numerous criminal activities.
igbo: O kwuru na Nwokocha, onye e si na nga kpọpụta n' oge n' etoghi aka, noburịị n' akwụkwọ ndị ndị uwe ojii mpaghara ahụ na-achọ n' ihi mkpamkpa dị iche iche a sịrị na ọ na-akpa.

english: He said, 'It would be recalled that on Nov. 6 and 10, 2019, Nwokocha and his gang invaded a hotel and robbed staff and guests.
igbo: Ọ sịrị, 'A ga-echeta na November 6 na 10, 2019, Nwokocha na ndị otu ya wakporo họteelu ma zuo ndị ọrụ na ndị ọbịa nọ ebe ahụ ohi.

english: 'During the operation, one policeman on duty was shot dead and his rifle carted away.
igbo: N' oge mwakpo a a gbagburu otu onye uwe ojii n' ọrụ ma were egbe ya gbalaga.

english: 'Also on November 10, 2019, Nwokocha and his gang robbed attendants and customers of a filling station on Bank Road, Umuahia.
igbo: Ọzọkwa na November 10, 2019, Nwokocha na ndị otu ya zuru ndị na-ere ahịa na ndị na-azụ rụrụ ahịa na 'filling station' dị na Banki Rodu, Ụmụahia.

english: READ ALSO: Police arrest woman for poisoning stepdaughter in Katsina
igbo: Gụkwuazị: Ndị uwe ojii jidere nwaanyị maka inye nwa nwunye di ya nsị.

english: 'On different occasions, he led a gang that snatched vehicles from their owners within and outside of the capital city at gunpoint.
igbo: N' Ọnọdụ dị iche iche, o duru ndị otu jiri egbe napụ ụgbọala n' aka ndị nwe ha n' ime isi obodo a nakwa ebe ndị ọzọ.

english: 'He also robbed other locations and planned to attack the Correctional Service Centre (Prison) in Umuahia to liberate his mother and other inmates.'
igbo: O zukwara ohi n' ebe ndị ọzọ ma kpaa nkata iwakpo ụlọ nga dị n' Ụmụahia iji duputa nne ya na ndị mkpọrọ ndị ọzọ.

english: Okon warned criminals to desist from their nefarious activities or relocate as the command would not spare them.
igbo: Okon dọrọ ndị ekperima aka ná ntị ka ha hapụ ajọ omume ma ọ bụ kwapụ makana ndị uwe ojii mpaghara ahụ agaghị ahapụ ha.

english: Police kill notorious armed robbery suspect in Abia
igbo: Ndị uwe ojii gburu ekperima a ma ama a na-enyo enyo n' Abịa.

english: The Police in Abia on Tuesday gunned down a suspected notorious armed robber identified as Sampson Nwokocha, aka 'Grave' who has been terrorizing residents of Umuahia and its environs.
igbo: Ndị uwe ojii n' Abịa n' ụbọchị Tuzdee gbaturu onye ekperima a na-enyo enyo a mara dị ka Sampson Nwokocha, 'aka Grave' onye na-ebutere ndị bi n' Ụmụahia na obodo ndị gbara gburugburu ihe ụjọ .

english: The Commissioner of Police in the state, Mr Ene Okon, who made this known to newsmen in Umuahia, said that he was shot dead after a gun battle with his men following a tip off.
igbo: Cọmishọna uweojii n' Abịa steeti, Maazị Ene Okon, onye mere ka ndị nta akụkọ mara nke a n' Ụmụahia, kwuru na a gbagburu ya ka ya na ndị otu ya (ndị uwe ojii) gbakọrịtachara egbe ka e suru ya imi.

english: He said that Nwokocha, who was recently released from prison, had been on the watch list of the command following his alleged numerous criminal activities.
igbo: O kwuru na Nwokocha, onye e si na nga kpọpụta n' oge n' etoghi aka, noburịị n' akwụkwọ ndị ndị uwe ojii mpaghara ahụ na-achọ n' ihi mkpamkpa dị iche iche a sịrị na ọ na-akpa.

english: Reps seek details of Nigeria-Russia agreement on Ajaokuta Steel Company
igbo: Ụlọ ọmebe iwu chọrọ nkọwa nkwekọrịta nke Naijiria - Russia banyere Ajaokuta 'steeti company'

english: The House of Representatives has mandated its relevant committees to get details of the agreement between Nigeria and Russia on the completion of the Ajaokuta Steel Company.
igbo: Ụlọ ọmebe iwu enyela Kọmitii ha họpụtara iwu ka ha nweta nkọwa nkwekọrịta dị n' etiti Naijiria na Russia banyere ịrụcha Ajaokuta 'steeti company.'

english: The committees which include Steel as well as Treaties, Protocols and Agreements are to interface with the Minister of Mines and Steel Development.
igbo: Ndị Kọmitii nke gụnyere 'steel' nakwa 'Treaties, ' 'Protocols' na 'Agreement' na Minista ihe ngwuputa na mmepe ga-arụkọ ọrụ ọnụ.

english: This was sequel to a unanimous adoption of a motion by Rep. Nkem Abonta (PDP-Abia) at the plenary on Tuesday.
igbo: Nke a bịara ka jicha otu olu nabata iwu nke ọmebe iwu Nkem Abonta (PDP Abịa) wetara na nzukọ ụlọ ọmebe iwu n' ụbọchị Tuzdee.

english: Moving the motion earlier, Abonta said that it was in order to ensure a seamless ratification of such an agreement in line with the provisions of relevant laws.
igbo: N' iweputa iwu na mbụ, Abọnta sịrị n' ọ bụ iji hụ na enweghi ihe ga-egbochi nnabata nkwekọrịta ahụ n' usoro iwu.

english: Residents flee town of Kanu's lawyer after policemen's death
igbo: Ndị bi n' obodo ọka ikpe Nnamdị Kanụ gbapụrụ ka ndị uwe ojii nwụchara.

english: A siege allegedly laid to Oraifite in Ekwusigo Local Government of Anambra State by a combined team of soldiers and policemen forced residents to flee the community yesterday.
igbo: Nnọchibido e mere n' Ọraifite n' Okpuru ọchịchị Ekwusigo nke Anambra Steeti nke si njikọ ndị agha na ndị uwe ojii manyere ndị bi n' obodo ahụ ịgbapụ na ya ụnyaahụ.

english: The desertion of the community came on the heels of declaration of Ifeanyi Ejiofor, the lawyer to the Supreme Leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, wanted by the state police command over an alleged killing of Oliver Innoma Abbey, the Oraifite Area Commander and the SARS Commander, Ichi Sector, Patrick Agbazue.
igbo: Nhapụ obodo ahụ pụtara ihe mgbe ndị uwe ojii mpaghara ahụ mere Ifeanyị Ejiofor, ọka ikpe onye ndu ndị 'Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, onye ha na-achọ achọ maka ebubo ogbugbu Oliver Innoma Abbey, Ọchịagha Mpaghara Ọraifite na Ọchịagha SARS, Mpaghara Ichi, Patrick Agbazue.

english: The two officers led a police patrol team to the compound of Ejiofor in Oraifite, where the police allegedly shot at three persons and wounded scores of others suspected to belong to IPOB.
igbo: Ndị ọrụ nche abụọ duru otu mkpagharị ndị uwe ojii jee nguru be Ejiofor n' Ọraifite, ebe ndị e kwuru na ndị uwe ojii gbara mmadụ atọ egbe ma meruo ọtụtụ ndị ọzọ a na-eche na ha bụ ndị IPOB ahụ.

english: It was learnt that the seeming police invasion of the house of the counsel to Kanu, who had three days earlier buried one of his elder brothers, irked some youths in the area who allegedly launched a reprisal attack, which is believed to have resulted in the death of Abbey and Agbazue whose remains were burnt and buried near a village market.
igbo: A chọpụtara na ihe dịka mwakpo ndị uwe ojii wakporo ụlọ ọka ikpe Nnamdị Kanụ, onye kwara ozu otu nwanne ya nwoke tọrọ ya na mkpụrụ ụbọchị atọ gara aga, kpasuru ụfọdụ ndị ntorobịa nọ na gburugburu ahụ iwe ndị a na-eche na ha bughachiri agha megide ndị uwe ojii, nke butere ọnwụ Abbey na Agbazue ndị a gbara ozu ha ọkụ ma lie ha n' ahịa obodo dị nso.

english: The police and IPOB have given differing accounts of the incident in which not less than 20 houses and shops have been razed.
igbo: Ndị uwe ojii na ndị IPOB nwere akụkọ dị iche iche banyere ihe a merenụ nke ọkụ gbapịrị opekata mpe ụlọ na ọdụ ahịa iri abụọ maka ya.

english: Revving critical national issues as Madueke launches autography
igbo: Ịkpalite okwu ndị dị oke mkpa nye ala anyị dị ka Madueke buputere akwụkwọ o dere banyere onwe ya.

english: Admiral Allison MaduekeNo doubt, the story of the 30-month Nigerian Civil War of 1967 would remain a critical point for discussion anytime Nigeria is being examined in history to project for a better future.
igbo: Admiral Allison Madueke, n' enweghị mgbagha, akụkọ agha ọnwa iri atọ nke ndị na abụghị ndị agha Naijiria nke 1967 ka bụ mgbe dị oke mkpa na mkparịta ụka oge ọ bụla a na-eleba anya n' akụkọ Naijiria iji kwụ maka ọdịmma Naijiria n' ọdịnihu.

english: So also the agitation for restructuring and June 12, 1993, presidential election, acclaimed to have been won by the late business mogul, Chief M.K.O Abiola but annulled by the then military Head of State, Gen. Ibrahim Babangida.
igbo: Otu ahụ ka ọ dịkwa ibu agha maka nhazigharị na ntụli aka onyeisi ala Juun 12, 1993, nke e kwuru na ọ bụ nnukwu oji ego achụ ego nwụrụ anwụ, Chief M.K.O. Abiola meriri, mana onyeisi ndị agha na-achị mgbe ahụ, Gen. Ibrahim Babangida, kagburu ya.

english: These issues seem recurring and cannot be overlooked as they impact on national discourse.
igbo: Okwu ndị a niile na-apụta ihe ugboro ugboro ma agaghị elegharanwu ha anya n' ihi na ha nwere mmetụta n' okwu gbasara ala anyị.

english: Twenty-one years since Nigeria returned to civil rule, those factors that led to the civil war, the unending agitations for restructuring and the perceived domination of governance system by a particular section of the country are still visible markers that still haunt the country and continue to stifle its development.
igbo: Afọ iri abụọ na otu ka mgbe Naijiria lọghachiri n' ọchịchị ndị nkịtị, ihe ahụ niile butere agha ndị abụghị ndị agha, ibu agha maka nhazigharị akwụsị akwụsị na otu agbụrụ ala anyị ijichi usoro ọchịchị nke a na-ahụ ka bụ ihe ndị pụtara ihe ka na-akụda obodo anyị ma na-egbochi mmepe.

english: As a matter of fact, most of the issues have not been adequately tackled many leas put in proper perspectives in a manner that could have helped in reshaping the nation's growth and development.
igbo: Ka o sila dị, e gbochibeghi ọtụtụ ihe ndị a dịka o kwesiri nke a na-etinye ha n' ụzọ ziri ezi ga-enye aka n' ịhazigharị otito nakwa mmepe nke ala anyị.

english: These factors were part of issues that were publicly deliberated upon, when former Chief of Naval Staff and one-time Military Administrator of Anambra and the Imo State, Admiral Allison Madueke (rtd), launched his autobiography last week.
igbo: Ihe ndị a bụ ụfọdụ n' ime ihe ndị a gbara maka ha n' ihu ọha ka onye bụbu 'Chief of Naval Staff' nakwa onye agha lekọtaburu Anambra na Imo steeti n' otu oge, Admiral Allison Madueke (lagoro ezumike nká) buputere akwụkwọ o dere banyere onwe ya n' izu ụka gara aga.

english: It is entitled Riding the Storms, with God in My Sails at MUSON Centre, Onikan, Lagos.
igbo: A kpọrọ ya 'Riding the Storms, with God in my Sails' na MUSON Centre, Onikan, Legosi.

english: Seeking inclusiveness through regional development commissions
igbo: Ịchọ nnabata mmadụ niile site na otu ọrụ mmepe mpaghara.

english: Oduah
igbo: Oduah

english: The quest for the establishment of development commissions for the remaining geo-political zones in the country apart from the South-south and Northeast gained momentum recently with the introduction of three bills to that effect in the Senate.
igbo: Ọchịchọ iguzobe otu ọrụ mmepe maka mpaghara ọchịchị ndị fọrọ afọ n' obodo anyị ma e wepụ South - south na Northeast nwetara ịnụ ọkụ na nso a site n' iwebata iwu atọ banyere n' ụlọ ọmebe iwu sineti.

english: Onyedika Agbedo looks at the genesis of the move, the gimmicks around it and its likely outcome in this report.
igbo: Onyedịka Agbedo lebara anya na mbido nzọ ukwu a, ụzọ aghụghọ dị na ya na ihe ọ nwere ike ịpụta n' nkọwa a.

english: There is a cool 'war' in the Senate among the geo-political zones in the country following penultimate Wednesday's reintroduction of a bill seeking to establish the South East Development Commission.
igbo: E nwere agha zoro ezo na sineti n'etiti mpaghara ọchịchị nke ala anyị nke sitere n' iwebatagharị iwu na-achọ ka ewube ọrụ mmepe mpaghara South East n' Wenzidee abụọ gara aga.

english: The 8th Senate had passed the bill, sponsored by Senator Stella Oduah (PDP, Anambra North) on December 12, 2018, but it did not get President Muhammadu Buhari's assent.
igbo: Sineti nke asatọ anabatala iwu a, Sinetọ Stella Oduah (PDP, Anambra North) kwadoro ya na Disemba 12, 2018, mana ọ nweta gị nkwado onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari.

english: Should the bill secure the nod of the lawmakers again and possibly receive presidential assent this time around, it would give birth to a commission charged with the responsibility of receiving and managing funds specially allocated by the Federal Government for the rehabilitation, reconstruction and reparation for lost houses and businesses of victims of the Nigerian civil war.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na iwu a nweta nkwekọrịta ndị ọmebe iwu ọzọ ma nwekwa ike nata nkwado onyeisi ala n' oge a, ọ ga - amụta otu ọrụ a ga-etinye n' aka ya ịnata na ijikwa ego gọọmenti etiti mapụtara n' ụzọ pụrụ iche maka idozigharị, ịrụgharị na iti aka n' obi nye ndị tụfuru ụlọ ha na azụmahịa ha n' oge agha ndị abụghị ndị agha Naijiria.

english: The commission would also address any other environmental or developmental challenges confronting the zone.
igbo: Otu ọrụ a ga-elebakwa anya n' ihe ndị ọzọ na-chere gburugburu ebe obibi na mmepe mpaghara aka mgba.

english: Clause 15 (2a) of the bill, which identifies source of funding for the commission, stipulates that the equivalent of 10 per cent of the total monthly statutory allocation due to the member states of the commission shall be from the Federation Account.
igbo: Nkebi 15 (2a) nke iwu a, kọwara ụzọ a ga-esi enweta ego maka otu ọrụ a, kwuru na ihe dịka pa senti 10 mgbakọta ego e kwesiri ịmapụtara steeti ọbụla so n' otu ọrụ a kwa ọnwa ga-esi n' akpa gọọmenti etiti.

english: It also seeks the establishment of a governing board for the commission, which shall include one person each from the other five geopolitical zones of the country.
igbo: Ọ chọkwazịrị nguzobe otu ga-achị otu ọrụ a, nke gụnyere otu onye kwa mpaghara ọchịchị ise ndị ọzọ nke ala anyị.

english: South-East NYSC coordinator inaugurates entrepreneurship centre in Aba
igbo: Onye na-achịkọta NYSC na South-East guzobere 'entrepreneurship Centre' n' Aba.

english: Alhaji Ahmed Ikaka, the South East Zonal Coordinator, National Youth Service Corp (NYSC), on Tuesday inaugurated a new Skills Acquisition and Entrepreneurship Department (SAED) Centre built by corps members serving in Osisioma, near Aba.
igbo: Alhaji Ahmed Ikaka, onye na-achịkọta mpaghara South-East, 'National Youth Service Corp (NYSC)' n' ụbọchị guzobere 'Skills Acquisition and Entrepreneurship Department (SAED) Centre' ọhụrụ nke ndị lụrụ ya bụ ndị ntorobịa ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha n' Osisiọma, dị nso n' Aba.

english: Speaking at the event, Ikaka lauded the efforts of the corps members, saying that NYSC was leading the economic revolution in Nigeria with the skill acquisition training given to corps members.
igbo: N' okwu ya na mmemme a, Ikaka toro mbọ ndị ntorobịa a gbara, na-asị na NYSC bu ụzọ mgbanwe nke akụnụba n' Naijiria site n' ọzụzụ mmụta nkà a na-enye ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha.

english: He assured Nigerians of better economy with the series of training given to corps members to make them self-reliant.
igbo: O gwara ndị Naịjirịa na akụnụba ga-aka mma maka ọtụtụ ọzụzụ a na-enye ndị ntorobịa ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha iji mee ka kwụrụ onwe ha.

english: He said that Nigeria had no reason to be patronising foreign goods when its youths creatively produce such goods.
igbo: O kwuru na o nweghị ihe ga-eme ka Naijiria na-azụta ngwa ahịa e mere na mba ọzọ ebe ndị ntorobịa ya na-emepụta ngwa ahịa ahụ.

english: READ ALSO: The NYSC uniform controversy
igbo: Gụkwuazị: Ọ gba aghara maka uwe NYSC.

english: The NYSC boss, therefore, urged Nigerians to patronise local manufacturers and assist them to strengthen their economy.
igbo: Onyeisi NYSC, ya mere, rịọrọ ndị Naịjirịa ka ha na-atụnyere ndị na-emepụta ihe n' ụlọ ma nyere ha aka iji ka akụnụba gbasie ike.

english: 'We should produce what we consume. We have the best skills in the world. You have seen from the exhibition we had here the production of shoes, hats, clothings and other things.
igbo: 'Anyị kwesiri iji na-emepụta ihe anyị na-eri. Anyị nwere nkà kasị mma n' ụwa niile. Site n' anyị gosirila Ị hụla mmepụta akpụkpọ ụkwụ, okpu, ákwà na ihe ndị ọzọ.

english: 'We have seen also those in agro-allied, food production and processing.
igbo: 'Anyị ahụkwala ihe ndị ahụ gbasara ọrụ ugbo, mmepụta nri na nhazi.

english: 'We cannot be deceiving ourselves, no nation develops on importation.
igbo: 'Anyị agaghị na-aghọrị onwe anyị, onweghi obodo na-emepe site ịtụbata ihe.

english: The life of a nation depends on the skills of its citizens and none develops beyond the citizens' skills.
igbo: Ndụ obodo dị n' aka nkà ụmụ amaala ya ma onweghi nke na-emepe karịa nkà ụmụ amaala ya.

english: 'So NYSC is changing Nigeria's narrative by developing the skills of these corps members and they are becoming job creators, instead of job seekers.
igbo: 'Ya bụ NYSC na-agbanwe akụkọ Naijiria site n' imepe nkà ndị ntorobịa ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ma ha bụzi ndị na-eke ọrụ kama ndị na-achọ ọrụ.

english: 'A lot of NYSC members are contributing to the economic development of our nation.
igbo: 'Ọtụtụ n' ime ndị ntorobịa ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha na-atunye ụtụ na mmepe nke akụnụba ala anyị.

english: 'This is the only way we can move forward, we cannot continue to deceive ourselves,' Ikaka said.
igbo: 'Nke a bụ sọ ụzọ anyị nwere ike iji gaa n' ihu, anyị agaghị anọgide n' ịghọrị onwe anyị,' Ikaka kwuru.

english: He said that corps members had learnt to write business proposals, given loan windows with Bank of Industry offering N2 billon, Central Bank providing N400 million, Heritage Bank fund, NYSC Foundation fund and Credit Direct fund.
igbo: O kwuru na ndị so ná ndi ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha amụtala ka e si ede am ụma azụmahịa, nyere ohere mbite ego ụlọaku nke mmepụta na-enye ijeri N2, ụlọaku etiti na-enye nde N400, ego ụlọaku 'Heritage', 'NYSC Foundation Fund' na 'Credit Direct Fund. '

english: He said with about N10 million available for corps members to access, it will be easy for them to succeed outside the service and improve Nigeria's economy.
igbo: Ọ sịrị na ijide ihe dịka nde N10 n' aka maka ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha, ọ ga-adị mfe ha ịganihu ma ha fecha ala nna ha ma kwalite akụnụba Naijiria.

english: The state NYSC Coordinator, Lady Bona Fasakin, said that Osisioma Local Government Area (LGA) had been partners in progress with NYSC.
igbo: Onye nchịkọta NYSC nke steeti ahụ, Lady Bona Fasakin , sịrị na Okpuru ọchịchị Osisiọma bụrịị ndị ha na NYSC na-emekọ n' ọganihu.

english: Fasakin said that the council provided the land, where the centre was built, adding that by that act the council had keyed into the vision of the scheme in its fight against unemployment.
igbo: Fasakin sịrị na Okpuru ọchịchị ahụ nweputara ala, ebe a rụrụ ebe ọmụmụ ihe, ọ gbakwunyere na site n' omume a okpuru ọchịchị a azọnyela ụkwụ n' ebumnuche atụmatụ a n' imegide enweghi ọrụ.

english: She urged other councils and stakeholders in Abia to emulate Osisioma's example by providing skills training equipment to sustain the vision and ensure that corps members become job providers.
igbo: Ọ gwara okpuru ọchịchị ndị ọzọ na ndị niile o metụtara n' Abịa ka ha ñomie ụkpụrụ Osisiọma site iweta ngwa ọmụmụ nkà iji kwado ebumnuche a ma hụ na ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha bụ ndị na-ekeputa ọrụ.

english: She further called for support for NYSC Health Initiative for Rural Dwellers so that rural dwellers would benefit from the programme.
igbo: Ọ gara n' ihu rịọ enyemaka atụmatụ ahụ ike NYSC maka ndị bi n' ime obodo iji mee ka ndị bi n' ime obodo wee rite uru amụma ahụ.

english: The Transition Chairman of Osisioma LGA, Mr Ugochukwu Nwaogu, said the council would continue to assist in making life better for the corps members serving in the area.
igbo: Onyeisi oche mgbanwe nke okpuru ọchịchị Osisiọma, Maazị Ugochukwu Nwaogu, sịrị na Okpuru ọchịchị ahụ ga-aga n' ihu inye aka ime ka ndụ dịrị ndị otu afọ efe ala nna ha na mpaghara ahụ mma.

english: Nwaogu, who was represented by his deputy, Mr Joseph Iguodo, said the council would seek ways to provide a lodge for corps members in the area.
igbo: Nwaogu, nke osote ya, Maazị Joseph Iguodo, nọchiri anya ya sịrị na Okpuru ọchịchị ga-achọ ụzọ inye ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha na mpaghara ahụ ebe obibi.

english: The council boss pledged N50,000 donation to support NYSC programmes in the area.
igbo: Onyeisi okpuru ọchịchị a kwere nkwa puku naịra iri ise iji kwado amụma NYSC na mpaghara ahụ.

english: The Local Government Zonal Inspector, Mrs Ruth Jacob, thanked the council for its support, while commending the corps members for their commitment in actualising the project.
igbo: Onye nlekọta mpaghara ahụ, Odoziakụ Ruth Jacob, kelere Okpuru ọchịchị ahụ maka enyemaka ya, ebe toro ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha maka nkwudosi ike ha n' iweta ọrụ ha ji n' aka ná mmezu.

english: Jacob said that the centre had taught the corps members how to produce many items that could enhance their economy and contribute to the nation's socio-economic development.
igbo: Jacob kwuru na ebe ọmụmụ ihe a akụzierela ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ka e si emepụta ọtụtụ ihe nwere ike ibulite akụnụba ha ma nye aka na mmepe akụnụba na mmekọrịta nke ala anyị.

english: (Updated) Supreme court removes prominent Oyo monarch, Eleruwa of Eruwa
igbo: (Emelitere) Ụlọikpe ukwu wepụrụ eze Oyo a ma ama, Eleruwa nke Eruwa.

english: Eleruwa of Eruwa, Oba Samuel Adegbola
igbo: Eleruwa nke Eruwa, Oba Samuel Adegbola.

english: By Adeola Badru
igbo: Nke si n' aka Adeola Badru

english: Twenty-one years after he ascended the throne of his forebears, the Eleruwa of Eruwa, Oba Samuel Adegbola has been dethroned by the Supreme Court on Friday morning.
igbo: Afọ iri abụọ na otu ka o rigochara oche eze ndị nna nna ya, Eleruwa nke Eruwa, ụlọikpe ukwu achutuola Oba Samuel Adegbola n' oche eze n' ụtụtụ Fraịdee.

english: Vanguard recalls that an Oyo State High Court had on January 26, 2011 removed.
igbo: 'Vanguard' chetere na ụlọikpe dị elu nke Oyo steeti na Jenụwarị 26, 2011 wepụrụla Oba Samuel Adegbola n' oche eze.

english: But not satisfied, he appealed the judgement.
igbo: Mana o jughi ya afọ, ọ wee chọọ mkpegharị ikpe.

english: The sacked monarch was installed the Eleruwa in 1998 by the Oyo State Government amidst protracted protests by members of the rightful ruling house after the last Eleruwa, the late Oba Bolanle Olaniyan, who is from the Akalako ruling house, passed on , on May 1, 1994.
igbo: Gọọmenti Oyo Steeti chiri oba a a chụrụ achụ Eleruwa n' afọ 1998 ka Eleruwa nke ikpeazụ, Oba Bolanle Olaniyan, onye si ụlọ ọchịchị Akalako, nwụrụ n' afọ 1994 n' agbanyeghi ganị ganị ụlọ ọchịchị o ruru ichi oba kpọrọ banyere ya.

english: Although his nomination and selection by the kingmakers were challenged by the Laribikusi house, which argued that he was not a member of the ruling arm, but belonged to Akalako where the previous king emerged, the state government went ahead to inaugurate him, prompting the present action.
igbo: Ọ bụ ezie na ụlọ Laribikusi, nke gbaghara na ọ soghi na ndị na-achị achị mana o si Akalako ebe oba nke gara aga si pụta, anabataghị nhọpụta na nhọrọ ya nke ndị na-eme eze mere, steeti gọọmenti gara n' ihu chie ya oba, nke kpalitere ihe a merenụ.

english: READ ALSO: Hit and run driver kills two vigilante operatives in Anambra, guns removed
igbo: Gụkwuazị: Ọkwọ ụgbọala na-akụ mmadụ gbawara gburu ndị ọrụ nchekwa abụọ, wepụ egbe.

english: Those who challenged the authenticity of Adegbola's claims to the throne are Mr. James Olatunde Idowu and Alhaji Ajao.
igbo: Ndị na-ekwenyeghi na ihe Adegbola kwuru banyere ocheeze ya ziri ezi bụ Maazị James Olatunde Idowu na Alhaji Ajao.

english: Joined in the suit besides Adegbola are: the Governor of Oyo State, the Attorney General, Ibarapa Local Government, Chief Jacob Adewusi, Chief Femi Atanda, Chief Idowu Okeowo, Chief E. Ojebisi and Mr. Kasali I.
igbo: Ndị kwụnyere Adegbola n' ikpe bụ Gọvanọ Oyo Steeti, okpuru ọchịchị Ibarapa, Ichie Jacob Adewusi, Ichie Femi Atanda, Ichie Idowu Okeowo, Ichie E. Ojebisi na Maazị Kasali I.

english: The plaintiffs, represented by the lawyer, Alhaji Lasun Sanusi (SAN) sought eight reliefs in their statement of claims which were all granted by the court.
igbo: Ndị gbara akwụkwọ, ọka ikpe nọchiri anya ha, Alhaji Las unu Sanusi (SAN) chọrọ 'relief' asatọ ha kwuru nke ụlọikpe nyere ya.

english: Having summarized all the submissions of the counsel to both sides, Justice Abimbola resolved all the issues in favour of the plaintiffs.
igbo: Ka Justice Abimbola chịkọtara ihe niile ndị ọka ikpe ndị gbara akwụkwọ na ndị a gbara akwụkwọ, ikpe o kere dabara ndị gbara akwụkwọ.

english: When Nigeria's slow wheel of justice caught up with Uzor Kalu
igbo: Mgbe ikpe ziri ezi Naijiria dakwasara Uzor Kalu

english: After a 12-year trial period, Orji Uzor Kalu, a former governor of Abia State and Chief Whip of the Senate, was yesterday brought to book for offences committed against his people.
igbo: Ka oge ikpe afọ iri na abụọ gachara, Orji Uzor Kalụ, onye bụbu gọvanọ Abịa steeti na Chifu wipu nke sineti, ka a mara ikpe ụnyaahụ maka iwu ọ dara megide ndị nke ya.

english: In the wake of Nigeria's return to democratic governance in 1999, Kalu was one of the governors elected to steer the affairs of the states of the federation and help fulfill the yearnings of the masses for purposeful governance and true development.
igbo: Na mbido Naijiria ịlọghachi azụ n' ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya n' afọ 1999, Kalụ bụ otu n' ime ndị gọvanọ a họpụtara iduzi steeti dị iche iche nke ala anyị na inye aka mezuo ọchịchọ obi ndị mmadụ banyere ọchịchị nwere ebumnuche na ezi mmepe.

english: But amid actions that simulated development and got praise singers christening him 'the messiah,' he plundered the state's till, grossly under-developed his people and set the tone for their sustained impoverishment.
igbo: Mana n' ime mmepe adịgboroja nke mere ndị otimkpu jiri gụọ onye nzọpụta, o zuru ego steeti, mee ka mmepe gbatoo aka n' ebe ndị nke ya nọ ma wetara ha ida ọgbenye.

english: Shortly after stepping down as governor in 2007, the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) took him to court on a 39-count charge bordering on diversion of about N7.65 billion from the state's purse.
igbo: N' egbughi oge o rituru dịka gọvanọ n' afọ 2007, 'Economic and Financial Crimes Commission' kpụgara ya ụlọikpe n' ihi ụzọ ihe iri atọ na itoolu gbadoro ụkwụ inweghara nde N7.65 n' akpa steeti.

english: And yesterday, after a drawn trial, he was handed a 12-year jail sentence at a Federal High Court in Lagos by presiding judge, Mohammed Idris, for money laundering.
igbo: Mana ụnyaahụ, ka e kpechara ikpe ogologo oge, onyeikpe nọ n' isi oche, Mohammed Idris, tụrụ ya nga afọ iri na abụọ n' 'Federal High Court' dị na Legosi, maka izupu ego.

english: In addition to the sentence, Justice Idris ordered that Kalu's company, Slok Nigeria Limited, be liquidated and its assets forfeited to the Federal Government.
igbo: N,' ịgbakwunye n' ikpe a, onyeikpe Idris nyere iwu ka e mechie ụlọ ọrụ Kalụ, 'Slok Nigeria Limited, ' ma were akụ ya nye gọọmenti etiti.

english: The senator, Slok Nigeria Limited and Udeh Udeogu, a former director of finance and accounts in Abia, were found complicit in the diversion.
igbo: Sinetọ a, 'Slok Nigeria Limited' na Udeh Udeọgụ , onye jibu ọkwa 'director of finance and accounts' n' Abịa bụ ndị gbakọrọ aka n' inweghara ego a.

english: Guardian
igbo: 'Guardian'

english: Zamfara NYSC gets new Coordinator
igbo: NYSC Zamfara nwere onye nchịkọta ọhụrụ

english: The National Youths Service Corps (NYSC) has appointed Alhaji Namalam Taura as new Coordinator of the Scheme in Zamfara state.
igbo: Òtù jikọtara ndị ji ótù afọ efe ala nna ha nke a kpọrọ 'The National Youth Service Corp (NYSC) na bekee ahọputala Alhaji Namalam Taura onye nchịkọta ọhụrụ amụma na Zamfara.

english: This is contained in a statement signed by the Public Relations Officer of the scheme in the state, Mr Philip Karayom and made available to newsmen in Tsafe on Monday.
igbo: Nke a dị n' okwu nke onye binyere aka na ya bụ onye nzisa ozi nke amụma a na steeti ahụ, Maazị Philip Karayom, ma mee ka ọ rute ndị nta akụkọ aka n' Tsafe n' ụbọchị Mọndee.

english: Karayom said Taura's appointment followed the retirement of the former Coordinator, Mr Dahunsi Muhammad.
igbo: Karayom kwuru na nhọpụta Taura bịara ka onye nchịkọta nọbu ya, Maazị Dahunsi Muhammad lara ezumike nka.

english: He said until his appointment,Taura was the Assistant Director, Corps Inspection and Monitoring at the state Secretariat of the scheme adding that the new Coordinator had since assumed duty.
igbo: Ọ kwuru na tupu ahọpụta ya, Taura bụbu 'Asistant Director, Corps Inspection and Monitoring' na seketeriet nke amụma ahụ kwuokwa na onye nchịkọta ọhụrụ ebidola ọrụ kamgbe.

english: Meanwhile, the state government has lauded the contribution of the scheme towards the development of the state.
igbo: Ka nke a na-aga n' ihu, gọọmenti steeti ahụ etoola amụma a maka mbọ ha na-agba n' iweta mmepe na steeti ahụ.

english: READ ALSO: NYSC registers 1,054 corps members in Abia
igbo: Gụkwuazị: NYSC denyere aha ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha 1,054 n' Abịa steeti.

english: Gov. Bello Matawalle stated this on Monday at the NYSC orientation camp, Tsafe while speaking at the swearing-in ceremony of the 2019 Batch C stream 2 corps members posted to the state.
igbo: Gov. Bello Matawalle kwuru nke a n ' ụbọchị Mọndee n' ebe nkụzi nnabata, Tsafe mgbe ọ na-ekwu okwu n' emume idu n' iyi ọrụ nke ógbè nke atọ (batch c) otu nke abụọ (stream 2) ndi ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha e zigara steeti ahụ n' afọ 2019.

english: Matawalle represented by the Secretary to the state government, Alhaji Bala Bello reiterated the state government's commitment to partner with the scheme for the development of various sectors of the state.
igbo: Matawalle, onye odeakwụkwọ nke steeti ahụ, Alhaji Baba Bello, nọchiri anya ya kwuputarakwa ọzọ mkpebi gọọmenti ahụ na ya na amụma ahụ ga-ejiko aka ọnụ iji mepee ngalaba dị iche iche na steeti ahụ.

english: He urged the corps members to be committed and face all camp activities with seriousness.
igbo: Ọ rịọrọ ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ka dị uchu ma were ihe niile ha na-eme ebe nnabata kpọrọ ihe.

english: He said that adequate security measures had been put in place by the state government in collaboration with the security agencies to ensure security of corps members.
igbo: O kwuru na gọọmenti steeti na ndị ọrụ nchekwa ejikọọla aka tụọ ezigbo atụmatụ iji hụ na ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha nwere ezi nchekwa

english: In his remarks, Taura said out of 1,000 corps members posted to the state, 840 reported in the camp.
igbo: N' okwu ya, Taura kwuru na n' ime 1,000 ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha e zitere na steeti a, 840 bịara n' ebe nkụzi nnabata.

english: News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that Magistrate Aisha Jibril administered the oath of allegiance to corps members deployed to the state.
igbo: 'News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) kwuru na Majie Aisha Jibril duru ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha e zigara steeti ahụ n' iyi ikwe nkwa nruwe isi.

english: 17 persons escape death in Anambra multiple crash
igbo: Mmadụ 17 gbanahụrụ ọnwụ n' ọtụtụ nkụkọ ụgbọala n' Anambra.

english: No fewer than 17 persons escaped death in a multiple crash involving three vehicles on the old Enugu-Onitsha expressway in Anambra.
igbo: Ọpekata mpe mmadụ 17 gbanahụrụ ọnwụ n' ọtụtụ nkụkọ metụtara ụgbọala atọ n' ụzọ awara awara ochie Enugu-Ọnịcha n' Anambra.

english: The accident occurred on the Nkpor/Umuoji stretch of the road.
igbo: Ihe mberede a mere n' ogologo ụzọ Nkpọ/Ụmụoji.

english: Mr Pascal Anigbo, the Public Enlightenment Officer of the Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) confirmed the crash.
igbo: Maazị Pascal Anịgbọgụ, onye mmepeanya ọha nke 'Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC)' kwuputara ihe nkụkọ a.

english: He said the vehicles included a red Mitsubishi bus with registration number JJT920ZW, a white Hummer bus without registration number and a truck marked KPE686XA.
igbo: Ọ sịrị na ụgbọala ndị ahụ gụnyere Misubishi bọsụ mmemme nwere akara ndebe JJT920ZW, Họma bọsụ ọcha n' enweghi akara ndebe na trọkụ a kara KPE686XA.

english: Anigbo attributed the cause of the accident to wrongful overtaking.
igbo: Anịgbọgụ sịrị na ọ bụ ụgbọala ịgbafe ibe ya n' ụzọ n' adịghị mma butere ihe mberede a.

english: He said 17 persons including 10 males and seven females were involved in the crash while seven persons were injured.
igbo: Ọ sịrị na mmadụ 17 nke gụnyere ụmụ nwoke 10 na ụmụ nwaanyị 7 ka nkụkọ a metụtara ebe mmadụ asaa meruru ahụ.

english: 'The Mitsubishi bus did wrongful overtaking and collided with an oncoming bus and the two buses collided with a truck.
igbo: Misubishi bọsụ mere ngafe n' adịghị mma wee kụọ ụgbọala na-abịa abịa bọsụ abụọ ahụ wee kụọ trọkụ.

english: 'The injured victims had been taken to Crown hospital Nkpor,' he said.
igbo: 'E bugaala ndị meruru ahụ na 'Crown Hospital' Nkpọ' o kwuru.

english: The FRSC officer also said efforts were on to recover the vehicles and valuables.
igbo: Onye ọrụ FRSC a kwukwara na a gbara mbọ ịnaghachi ụgbọala ndị ahụ na ihe ndị bara uru.

english: Betty Akeredolu: We'll not relent until women are treated fairly
igbo: Betty Akeredolu: Anyị agaghị ala azụ ruo mgbe ụmụ nwaanyị nwetara ezi mkpaso agwa.

english: The wife of Ondo State governor, Arabinrin Betty Anyanwu-Akeredolu, has vowed not to relent until women are given equal rights as their male counterparts.
igbo: Nwunye gọvanọ Ondo steeti, Arabinrin Betty Anyanwụ-Akeredolu, ekwela nkwa na ya agaghị ala azụ ruo mgbe e nyere ụmụ nwaanyị ikike ya na nke ndị ogbo ha ụmụ nwoke ha nhatanha.

english: Mrs Anyanwu-Akeredolu spoke on Wednesday during the 2nd summit of Forum for Women Officials of Ondo State and Female Appointees (FOWOSO) held at International Culture and Event Centre in Akure, the state capital.
igbo: Odoziakụ Anyanwụ-Akeredolu kwuru okwu n' ụbọchị Wenzidee na mmemme agba nke abụọ nke 'Summit of Forum for Women Officials of Ondo State and Female Appointees (FOWOSO) a chịkọbara n' 'International Culture and Event Centre' dị n' Akụrụ, isi obodo steeti ahụ.

english: 'We will not faint until we see women everywhere being treated with as much respect as their male counterparts.
igbo: 'Anyị agaghị ada mba ganye n' anyị àhù ụmụ nwaanyị n' ebe niile ka a na-akpaso ha agwa ka ụmụ nwoke ndị ogbo ha.

english: 'The pursuit of gender quality is definitely daunting, many rocks of stereotypes are particularly exerting, but when men join us, we are further strengthened to prevail quickly. But, whatever the case , we shall prevail,' she said.
igbo: Ịchụ nhatanha Okike na-enwe ihe nkụda ala doro anya, ọtụtụ echiche n' eseputa isi, mana ụmụ nwọke sonyere anyị, ọ na-abawanye anyị ume inwe mmeri ọsọ ọsọ. Mana n' ihe ọbụla, anyị ga-enwe mmeri, ' o kwuru.

english: She called for gender inclusiveness in all aspects of the socio-economic, saying that ' spectrum is still miles ahead. We know this and we are not going to relent.'
igbo: Ọ kpọrọ okwu maka njikọta Okike n' akụkụ niile nke mmekọrịta na akụnụba, na-ekwu na ụdịdị ihe dị iche iche ka n' ihu. Anyị ma nke a mana anyị agaghị ala azụ.

english: Anyanwu-Akeredolu, who is the founder of FOWOSO, noted that her motivation was not because she is a woman.
igbo: Anyanwụ-Akeredolu, onye bụ onye nchọpụta FOWOSO, kwuru na mkpalite ya abụghị na ya bụ nwaanyị.

english: She called for a society where continuous development was achieved and sustained.
igbo: Ọ kpọrọ okwu maka obodo ebe a ga-enwete mmepe ga adịgide ma bụrụ nke e jigidere.

english: 'We must come to the understanding that everyone, regardless of gender is needed for sustainable development.
igbo: 'Anyị ga-enweriri nghọta na onye ọbụla, n' agbanyeghi Okike ka a chọrọ maka ijide mmepe.

english: 'I have dedicated my life to driving gender equality, not because I love female folk more ,but because I seek the growth and advancement of humanity as a whole.
igbo: 'Etinyela m ndụ m ịchụ Okike ịha nhatanha, ọ bụghị makana m hụrụ ndị ụmụ nwaanyị n' anya karịa, ma makana achọrọ m otuto na ọganihu nke ndị mmadụ niile.

english: 'I am very delighted to know that I have infected every FOWOSO member with this positive virus that strives for gender equality in every aspect of our socio-economic spectrum,' she explained.
igbo: 'Obi dị m ụtọ ịma na m ebunyela onye ọbụla so na FOWOSO nje dị mma nke ịchụ nhatanha Okike n' akụkụ ọbụla nke ụdịdị mmekọrịta na akụnụba anyị.,' ọ kọwara.

english: Governor Oluwarotimi Akeredolu described as unquantifiable the training and empowerment of women in the state by FOWOSO.
igbo: Gọvanọ Oluwarotimi Akeredolu kọwara ọzụzụ na agbamume FOWOSO nyere ụmụ nwaanyị nọ na steeti ahụ dị ka ihe n' enweghi atụ.

english: He said the activities of the forum, particularly in the areas of training and empowerment of women across the 18 local government areas, had produced many entrepreneurs.
igbo: Ọ sịrị na ọrụ ndị otu a, ọ kachasị n' ebe ọzụzụ na agbamume nke ụmụ nwaanyị n' okpuru ọchịchị 18 steeti ahụ gba gburugburu, azụpụtala ọtụtụ entaprịniọ.

english: Speaking on the theme of the summit; 'Prioritising Women's Health and Well Being In Nigeria', Akeredolu said his administration had prioritised the well-being of women in the state.
igbo: N' okwu ya n' isi okwu ọgbakọ ahụ 'Ịhazi ahụ ike na ọdị mma ụmụ nwaanyị na Naijiria,' Akeredolu sịrị na ọchịchị ya ahaziela ọdị mma ụmụ nwaanyị n' steeti a.

english: He added: 'We have prioritised women health and well-being in Ondo State and that was what led to the Abiyamo Maternal and Child Health Scheme which we launched on Wednesday. All you need to access the free health care for pregnant women is your residency cards. Every child under 5 is entitled to free health care in Ondo State.'
igbo: Ọ gbakwunyere: 'Anyị ahaziela ahụ ike na ọdị mma ụmụ nwaanyị n' Ondo steeti nke butere amụma ahụ ike nne nwa na nwa nke Abiyamo nke e guzo were ụbọchị Wenzidee. Ihe I kwesiri iji wee nweta nleta ahụ ike ụmụ nwaanyị dị ime a n' efu bụ akwụkwọ ebe obibi gị. Nwa ọbụla n' erughi afọ ise nwere ohere nleta ahụ ike n' efu a n' Ondo steeti. '

english: 'Let me commend the efforts of the founder for this laudable initiative geared towards the development of womenfolk in Ondo State,' Akeredolu stated.
igbo: 'Ka m too mbọ onye nchọpụta atụmatụ a kwesiri otito a haziri maka mmepe nke ụmụ nwaanyị n' Ondo steeti,' Akeredolu kwuru.

english: The Chairman of 2nd FOWOSO Planning Committee, Mrs Mercy Femi-Idris, described the forum as significant to health and welfare of women, adding that it was about nurturing and empowering female folks.
igbo: Onyeisi Kọmitii chịkọbara FOWOSO nke abụọ, Odoziakụ Mercy Femi-Idris, kọwara otu ahụ dịka ihe dị mkpa nyere ahụ ike na ọdị mma nke ụmụ nwaanyị, gbakwunye kwuo na ọ bụ ịzụlite na ịgba ume nke ụmụ nwaanyị.

english: Prof. Modupe Adelabu, the Chairman of the occasion, noted that FOWOSO had given women voice of recognition.
igbo: Ọkammụta Module Adelabụ , onyeisi oche nke emume, kwuru na FOWOSO enyela ụmụ nwaanyị ọnụ okwu.

english: Adelabu, the former director governor of Ekiti State, said the forum had eliminated discrimination against women, noting that FOWOSO was a fun-making gathering but a life-impacful organisation.
igbo: Adelabụ, jibu ọkwa daịrector gọvanọ nke Ekiti steeti, sịrị na otu a ewepụla ịkpa oke megide ụmụ nwaanyị, na-ekwu na FOWOSO bụ ọgbakọ inwe obi ụtọ ma bụrụ otu na-emetụta ndụ.

english: Mrs Bisi Fayemi, the wife of Ekiti State governor, Dr Kayode Fayemi and Mrs Kafayat Oyetola, the wife of Osun State governor attended the summit.
igbo: Odoziakụ Bisi Fayemi, nwunye gọvanọ nke Ekiti steeti, Dọkịta Kayode Fayemi, na Odoziakụ Kafayat Oyetola, nwunye gọvanọ Osun steeti bịara ọgbakọ a.

english: How to boost cyber security – experts
igbo: Otu a ga-esi kwalite nchekwa saba - ndị ọkachamara

english: Stakeholders the Nigerian cyber security space under the aegis of the Information Security Society of Africa-Nigeria (ISSAN) have called for collaborations in boosting cyber security in the country.
igbo: Ndị nchekwa saịba metụtara na Naijiria a na-akpọ 'Nigerian cyber security space' site na nkwado Information Security Society of Africa-Nigeria (ISSAN) akpọ latest okwu ijikọ aka wee kwalite nchekwa saịba n' ala a.

english: They made the call while speaking at a Cyber Security Workshop Themed: 'DDoS Evolution – Staying Protected' organised by ISSAN in collaboration with 21st Century Technologies Limited in Lagos.
igbo: Ha kpọrọ okwu a ka ha na-ekwu okwu n' ọmụmụihe nchekwa saịba nke isiokwu ya bụ 'DDoS Evolution - Staying Protected' nke ISSAN chịkọbara site na njikọ aka nke '21st century Technologies Limited' na Legosi.

english: While welcoming stakeholders at the Workshop, President of ISSAN, Dr. David Isiavwe, decried the worsening state of cyber security in the country.
igbo: Ka ọ na-abata ndị o metụtara n' ọmụmụihe a, onyeisi ISSAN, Dọkịta David Isiavwe, katọrọ nkwanye njọ ọnọdụ nchekwa saịba n' ala a.

english: He said, 'Those who watch the cyber space closely, will all agree that there is a lot of happenings each and every day.
igbo: Ọ sịrị, 'Ndị tinyere uche na nchekwa mbara saịba nke ọma ga-ekwenye na ọtụtụ ihe na-eme kwa ụbọchị ọbụla.

english: New forms of attacks are being contrived and implemented by the bad guys, and all they need is one successful attempt.
igbo: Ndị ntorobịa ọjọọ na-echepụta ma na-emejuputa ụzọ mwakpo ọhụrụ, sọ ihe chọrọ otu nnwale gara nke ọma.

english: We hear of all the various attacks both on individuals and companies alike.
igbo: Anyị na-anụ maka ọtụtụ mwakpo ma na ndị mmadụ ma n' ụlọ ọrụ.

english: Indeed, even the cyber security gatekeepers are not spared.
igbo: N' ezie, ọbụrụgodu ndị na-echekwa ọnụ ụzọ nchekwa saịba anaghị ije a.

english: And huge sums of money are at risk each time there is a successful attack.'
igbo: Mana ọkpụrụkpụ ọnụ ego na-anọ n' ihe egwu mgbe ọbụla e nwere mwakpo gara nke ọma. '

english: Dr. Isiavwe who is also the Group Head Operations & Technology, Ecobank Nigeria Limited, further lamented the fact that everyone and every institution was susceptible to these attacks as social engineering attack is unrelenting.
igbo: Dọkịta Isiavwe onye bụkwu 'Group Head Operations & Technology, Ecobank Nigeria Limited,' gara n' ihu kpesa na n' ezioku na ọnye ọbụla na emumewu ọbụla ga-adanyenwu na mwakpo ndị a dịka injinia mwakpo mmekọrịta anaghị ala azụ.

english: He said data based manipulation-insiders and outsiders is on the rise, attack on card data and card processing technology infrastructure via rogue IT infrastructure, spear phishing attack and combination of different methodologies were rampant.
igbo: Ọ sị na njikwa ndị ọnọnime na ndị mbịarambịa dabere na data na-ebili, mwakpo na kaadị data na kaadị nhazi akụrụngwa teknọlọjị site na akụrụngwa 'IT' aghara, mwakpo 'spear phishing' na mgwakota usoro dị iche iche jụrụ ebe niile.

english: He therefore called on all stakeholders to be proactive, create customer awareness activities, continuous and automated monitoring of systems and infrastructure, employment of Artifucial intelligence and Machine Learning as well as robotics and data analytics.
igbo: Ya mere, ọ gwara ndị ọ gbasara ka ha mee ihe ndị ga-eme ka ndị ahịa mata, usoro ilebara anya nganihu na keaka akaghị na akụrụngwa, iji ọgụgụ isi aka mere na igwe ọmụmụ nakwa rọbọtiks na nchịkọta data.

english: He also called for collaborations among stakeholders.
igbo: Ọ kpọrọkwara okwu maka ịrụkọ ọrụ n' etiti ndị ọ gbasara.

english: Speaking on the theme of the workshop in a keynote address, Long Lee Shih – DDoS Security Expert, Nexusguard Ltd, also explained how individuals and organisations could avoid being victims of cyber attacks, including Origin Protection (OP) for large networks, among others.
igbo: N' ikwu banyere isiokwu nke ọmụmụ ihe a n' okwu bụ isi, Long Lee Shih-- ọkachamara DDoS, 'Nexusguard Ltd' kọwa kwara ka ndị mmadụ n' otu n' otu na ụlọ ọrụ ga-esi egbochi ịdaba n' ọnyá mwakpo saịba, tinyekwara 'Origin Protection' (OP) maka nnukwu netwọk, na ndị ọzọ.

english: His keynote address was followed by a robust plenary session that included Dr Wale Obadare, MD/COO, Digital Encode Ltd; Long Lee Shih, Ighoakpo Eduje, Chief Information Security Officer, Heritage Bank Ltd; Igboa Abumere, Chief Information Security Officer, Stanbic IBTC Bank; Bharat Soni, Chief Information Security Officer, Guaranty Trust Bank Plc and Dr. David Isiavwe.
igbo: Ka okwu ya bụ okwu bụ isi gasịrị ọgbakọ mmadụ niile sochiri ya nke nọ ya gụnyere Dọkịta Wale Obadare, 'MD/COO, Digital Encode Ltd;' Long Lee Shih, Ighoakpo Eduje, onyeisi ọrụ ọmụma chekwa, Stanbic I THINK Bank; Bharat Soni, onyeisi ọrụ ọmụma nchekwa, Guaranty Trust Bank na Dọkịta David Isiavwe.

english: Hit-and-run driver kills woman in Awka
igbo: Ọkwọ ụgbọala na-akụ mmadụ gbawara ọsọ gburu otu nwaanyị n' Ọka.

english: A yet to be identified woman was on Sunday killed by a hit-and-run driver in Awka.
igbo: Ọkwọ ụgbọala na-akụ mmadụ gbawara gburu otu nwaanyị a mabeghi onye ọ bụ n' Ọka ụbọchị ụka.

english: The accident occurred at about 11:05pm at Regina Caeli Junction on the Enugu-Onitsha expressway.
igbo: Ihe mberede okporo ụzọ a mere n' ihe dịka 11:50pm n' ụzọ mkpị Regina Caeli n' ụzọ awara awara Enugu-Ọnịcha.

english: According to Mr Andrew Kumapayi, the Sector Commander of the Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) in Anambra, the accident left the woman dead instantly.
igbo: Dị ka Maazị Andrew Kumapayi, onyeisi 'Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC)' nke mpaghara Anambra a, siri kwu ihe mberede a gburu nwaanyị a ozugbo.

english: Kumapayi said the corpse had been deposited at the Chukwuemeka Odumegwu Ojukwu University Teaching Hospital morgue, Awka.
igbo: Kumapayi sịrị na e dewela ozu ya n' ebe nchekwa ozu nke Chukwuemeka Odumegwu Ojukwu University Teaching Hospital, Ọka.

english: The sector commander reiterated the call for pedestrians to be careful on the road, especially during festive periods, because of increased vehicular movement.
igbo: Onyeisi mpaghara a kpọkwara ndị ji ụkwụ aga okwu ọzọ ka kpachara anya n' ụzọ, ọ kachasị n' oge mmemme, maka na ngagharị ụgbọala n' amụbanye.

english: 'My advice to road users especially pedestrians during this season is to be extra careful when crossing the road.
igbo: 'Ndụmọdụ nwere inye ndị na-aga n' ụzọ ọ kachasị ndị ji ụkwụ bụ ka ha kpachara anya nke ọma ma ha na-agafe ụzọ.

english: 'They should endeavour to use the pedestrian bridge provided for them if any, and if there is none, they should look left, right and left again to make sure that the road is free before crossing.
igbo: 'Ha kwesiri ịgbalị na-aga n' akwa a rụrụ ndị ji ụkwụ ma ọ bụrụ n' enwere, ma ọ bụrụ na e nweghị, ha kwesiri ile anya n' aka ekpe, aka nri nakwa aka ekpe ọzọ iji hụ na ụzọ tọgbọ nkịtị tupu ha gafere.

english: 'Let them wear reflective clothes when walking in the night so that they can be seen by oncoming vehicles,' he said.
igbo: 'Ka ha yiri ákwà na-egbuke egbuke ma na-aga n' abalị ka ụgbọala na-abịa abịa were na-ahụ ha,' o kwuru.

english: What Onitsha fire tells us about the petrol tankers from hell [Pulse Opinion]
igbo: Ihe ọkụ Ọnịcha gwara anyị banyere tanka petrolu si ọkụ mmụọ [echiche 'Pulse']

english: The Onitsha fire accident was totally avoidable. Yet again, Nigeria has killed citizens whose only crime was hustling in a country that never got their backs.
igbo: Ọkụ mberede Ọnịcha dị mgbochi kpamkpam. Mana ọzọkwa, Nigeria egbuola ụmụ amadị ndị sọ ihe ọjọọ ha mere bụ na ha na-agba mbọ n' ala na enweghi nchekwa nyere ha.

english: Onitsha, the Anambra state capital, is mourning. And all of Nigeria with it.
igbo: Ọnịcha, isi obodo Anambra, na-eri ụjụ. Nigeria niile sonyere ya.

english: On Wednesday, October 16, 2019, a petrol laden tanker rammed into buildings in an Onitsha market, spilled its contents in the neigborhood and sparked a fire that ravaged buildings, consumed goods worth millions of Naira and ended lives.
igbo: N' ụbọchị Wenzidee, Ọktoba 16, 2019, tanka petrolu juru suru ụlọ n' ahịa Ọnịcha, kwafuo ihe ọ bu na gburugburu ahụ ma nwuru ọkụ mebiri ọtụtụ ụlọ, gbarie ngwa ahịa ruru ọtụtụ nde naịra ma bibie ọtụtụ ndụ.

english: Onitsha was a ball of fire for hours and no one lifted a finger. The city is still counting its losses.
igbo: Ọnịcha bụ sọ ogidi ọkụ ọtụtụ awa ma ọ nweghi onye welitere aka. Obodo a ka na-agụkọ ihe o tụfuru.

english: The casualty figures from the incident are still hazy at the time of writing, but it has been confirmed that a mother and her child were among the dead;
igbo: Ọnụ Ọgụgụ ndị ihe a metụtara edochaghị anya n' oge a na-ede ihe a, mana o doola anya na nne na nwa ya so na ndị nwụrụ anwụ;

english: With the fire searing through their skins and leaving them locked in each other's arms until the very end.
igbo: Ọkụ gbara ha agba agba n' ahụ, ebe ọkụ kpọchiri ha n' ogwe aka onwe ha ruo n' ọnwụ.

english: The fire incident in Onitsha yesterday is sad and regrettable. I am profoundly touched by the sight of the charred remains of an innocent mother and her child, who are victims of this tragedy,' said President Muhammadu Buhari.
igbo: 'Ọkụ gbara n' Ọnịcha ụnyaahụ dị mwute. Ozu nne na nwa ọkụ gbapịrị n' enweghị ihe ọjọọ ha mere, bụ ndị ọdachi a metụrụ, wutere m nke ukwuu,' President Muhammadu Buhari kwuru.

english: Former Nigeria Vice President and presidential candidate in the 2019 elections, Alhaji Atiku Abubakar said: 'We've had many preventable fuel tanker tragedies.
igbo: Onye bụbu osote onye isi ala Naịjiria nakwa onye zọrọ ọkwa onye isi ala na ntụli aka 2019, Alhaji Atiku Abubakar kwuru: 'Anyị enwela ọtụtụ ọdachi tanka mmanụ ụgbọala dị mgbochi.

english: I received with sadness, reports of a tanker explosion in Onitsha, Anambra State, which caused massive destruction to lives and properties in Ochanja Market area.
igbo: Eji m obi mwute nata akụkọ mgbawa tanka n' Ọnịcha, Anambra Steeti, nke butere nnukwu mbibi nyere ndụ na akụ n' mpaghara ahịa Ọchanja.

english: My prayers and thoughts are with the families of the affected.'
igbo: Ekpere na echiche m nọnyere ezinaụlọ ndị o metụtara.'

english: TV personality Ebuka Obi-Uchendu said: 'Last night was a lot.
igbo: Onye a ma ama na 'TV' Ebuka Obi-Uche sịrị: 'Abalị ụnyaahụ dị ukwuu.

english: We really are on our own in this country.
igbo: Anyị nọrọ nnọọ onwe anyị n' obodo a.

english: Those images from Onitsha are still so heartbreaking.
igbo: Oyiyi ndị ahụ si Ọnịcha ka Na-agbawa obi.

english: May the departed Rest In Peace.'
igbo: Ka mkpụrụ obi ndị nwụrụ anwụ zuru ike n' udo.

english: One of the biggest takeaways from the tragedy is that the fire raged for hours with no fire service truck anywhere near the scene of the inferno.
igbo: Otu ihe kasị wee ju anya n' ọdachi a bụ na ọkụ gbara ọtụtụ awa mana onweghi trọkụ ndị ọrụ mgbanyụ ọkụ no nso n' akụkụ ebe ọkụ ọgbụgba a.

english: And like Atiku mentioned, this is one of several petrol tanker accidents in recent times across Nigeria that has led to loss of lives.
igbo: Ma dị ka Atiku kwuru, nke a bụ otu n' ime ọtụtụ mberede tanka petrolu na nso a butere ntufu ọtụtụ ndụ na Naijiria gba gburugburu.

english: Apart from the Otedola bridge fire incident of June 2018 in Lagos that led to loss of lives and the burning of cars, there have been several instances where a petrol laden tanker, flouting all known traffic laws in the land, goes ahead to inflict pain and misery on innocent families and ordinary Nigerians.
igbo: E wezụga ọkụ ọgbụgba àkwà mmiri Otedola nke Juun 2018na Legosi nke butere ntufu ọtụtụ ndụ na ọkụ ịgba ụfọdụ ụgbọala, enwere ọmụma atụ ụfọdụ ebe tanka petrolu juru, dara iwu okporo ụzọ niile n' ala anyị, gara n' ihu weta ụfụ na nhụjuanya nye ezinaụlọ enweghị ihe ọjọọ ha mere na ndị Naịjirịa nkịtị.

english: In Lagos where this writer resides, petrol tanker and articulated truck drivers derive immense joy from intimidating other road users, offloading their containers on busy roads and obstructing free flow of traffic.
igbo: Na Legosi ebe odee a bi, tanka petrolu na ndị na-anya ọkara trọkụ na-enwe nnukwu añurị n' iwakpo ndị ọzọ na-aga n' ụzọ anya, na-ebutu ihe akpati ha bu n' ụzọ enweghị ohere na igbochi ụzọ ịga nke ọma.

english: Articulated trucks and petrol tankers have been a menace in Nigeria for as long as anyone can remember and the regulatory agencies or authorities have largely looked the other way unperturbed for decades.
igbo: Ọkara trọkụ na tanka petrolu abụrụla nsogbu na Naijiria kamgbe dịka onye ọbụla nwere ike icheta mana ndị ụlọ ọrụ ma ọ bụ ikike usoro iwu nefuru anya n' ebe ọdị ukwuu.

english: Until the next disaster.
igbo: Ka ọ dị oge ọdachi ọzọ.

english: 'I call on the Ministry of Transport, the Federal Road Safety Commission and other stakeholders to urgently address the issue of safety standards in Nigeria, with a view to stemming the frequency of these tragedies.
igbo: 'Ana m akpọ ministri njem,' Federal Road Safety Commission' na ndị ọzọ ọ gbasara ka ha gbazie ụkpụrụ nchekwa na Naijiria, n' ụzọ iji belata ọdachi na-adapụta kwa mgbe.

english: May the souls of the dead rest in peace Amen,' President Buhari said, without stating how he will make sure the agencies he mentioned sanitize our roads and put the killer truck drivers in check.
igbo: Ka mkpụrụ obi ndị nwụrụ anwụ zuru ike n' udo Amen, ' Onyeisi ala Buhari kwuru, n' ekwughi ka ọ ga-esi mee ka ndị ụlọ ọrụ ndị ọ kpọrọ aha ga-esi dozie ụzọ anyị ma kwụsị ndị ogbu mmadụ na-anya trọkụ.

english: Without saying how he'll lead the charge in enforcing compliance.
igbo: N' ekwughi ka o siri dị njikere ime ka e huwe isi.

english: It is also a shame that a state as rich as Anambra has no functioning fire service department or emergency response units; and that when tragedy struck, Governor Willie Obiano was not on the ground to provide succour.
igbo: Ọ bụkwuazị ihe ihere na steeti bụ ọgaranya ka Anambra enweghi ngalaba ọrụ ọkụ na-arụ ọrụ ma ọ bụ ngalaba gbata gbata; na mgbe ọdachi dapụtara, Gọvanọ Willie Obiano anọghị ya inweta enyemaka.

english: At the risk of sounding like a broken record, the Onitsha inferno was completely avoidable. Yet again, we have lost lives to poor governance across all tiers. Writer Ayo Sogunro was right after all when he said 'everything in Nigeria is going to kill you.'
igbo: N' ịkọ akụkọ iberibe, ọkụ ọgbụgba Ọnịcha kwesiri mgbochi kpamkpam. Ma ọzọ kwa, anyị etufuola ndụ n' ihi amaghị achị n' ogo ọchịchị niile. Ọdee Ayo Sogunro kwuru ezi okwu n' ezie mgbe o kwuru 'ihe ọbụla na Naijiria na-ga igbu gị.'

english: TRAFFIC CONTROL IN FESTIVE SEASON, TRANSPORT MINISTRY LAUNCH ATMA SPECIAL MARSHAL VESTS
igbo: ỊGBAZI OKPORO ỤZỌ N' OGE EMUME, MINISTRI NJEM EGUZOWE 'ATMA SPECIAL MARSHAL VEST'

english: By Chukwuka Ugokwe /Ifunanya Ajukwu :
igbo: Nke si n' aka Chukwuka Ugokwe/Ifunanya Ajukwu:

english: Awka, Dec. 9, 2019 (MOI) Anambra State Commissioner for Transport, Dr Christian Madubuko has asked officers of the Anambra Traffic Control Agency(ATMA) and other stakeholders in the sector to intensify operations aimed at ensuring safety on the roads.
igbo: Ọka, Disemba 9, 2019 (MOI) Komishọna njem n' Anambra Steeti, Dọkịta Christian Madubuko, agwala ndị ọrụ 'Anambra Traffic Control Agency (ATMA)' na ndị ọzọ ọ gbasara na mpaghara a ka ha mubawanye arụmọrụ n' ịhụ na e nwere nchekwa n' ụzọ.

english: According to him, there is need for all traffic control agencies in the state to work together this festive period to facilitate free vehicular
igbo: Dị ka o si kwuo, ọ dị mkpa na ndị ọrụ mgbazi okporo niile na steeti a ịrụkọ ọrụ ọnụ n' oge emume a iji kwalite ụgbọala ịga nke ọma.

english: In a speech during the 2019 Drivers Seminar and Launch of ATMA Marshal Vests, held at the agency's office, at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat, Awka, the commissioner called on officers to be vigilant and more responsive to their roles as traffic managers.
igbo: N' okwu ya n' oge nzukọ ọmụmụ ihe ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala n' afọ 2019 na nguzo 'ATMA Marshal Vest, ' nke a chịkọbara n' ụlọ ọrụ ndị otu a, na Jerome Udeoji seketeriet, Ọka, onye Komishọna gwara ndị ọrụ ka ha mụrụ anya ma nabata ọrụ ha dịka ndị nchịkwa okporo ụzọ.

english: Dr Madubuko added that volunteers were needed to enlist into newly inaugurated ATMA Special Marshals to complement effort of regular officers for effective traffic control, especially at gridlock-prone points.
igbo: Dọkịta Madubuko gbakwunyere na a chọrọ ndị ga-eweputa onwe ha ịbanye n' 'ATMA SPECIAL Marshal' e guzobere ọhụrụ iji mejuo mbọ ndị ọrụ nọ ya mbe niile maka mgbazi okporo ụzọ dị irè, ọkachasị n' ebe ndị na-enwekarị mkpọchi.

english: He praised the dedication to duty by one of officers of the agency posted to Aroma Junction, Awka, Mr Obinna Ejeagwu, who was honoured in company of other officers during the event.
igbo: O toro nhara onwe nye n'ọrụ nke otu onye n' ime ndị ọrụ otu ahụ e tinyere n' ụzọ mkpị Aroma, Ọka, Maazị Obinna Ejeagwu, onye e tụnyere n' etiti ndị ọrụ ndị ọzọ n' ime emume a.

english: Dr Madubuko noted that as helmsman in the ministry, he often moved around to monitor the performance of officers at their various duty posts to assess their level of commitment.
igbo: Dọkịta Madubuko kwuru na dị ka onye no n' isi na ministri ahụ, ọ na-agagharị mgbe ụfọdụ ileba anya n' arụmọrụ ndị ọrụ n' ebe dị iche iche ha na-arụ ọrụ iji itule ogo agbam mbọ ha.

english: Managing Director/Chief Executive Officer of ATMA, Mr Pat Obiefuna, described the theme of the seminar: 'Drive Right And Save Time' , as apt, especially at this period of the year.
igbo: Daịretọ nchịkwa /onyeisi ọrụ nke ATMA, Maazị Pat Obiefuna, kọwara isi okwu nke nzukọ ọmụmụ ihe: 'Nya nke ọma ma Dewe Oge' dị ka ihe dabara adaba, ọkachasị n' oge dị otú a n' afọ.

english: He emphasised the readiness of the agency to partner with relevant stakeholders in the transport sector to curb challenge of road crashes often caused by drivers.
igbo: Ọ kwusiri ike ịdị nkwadebe ndị otu a na ndị dị iche iche ọ gbasara na ngalaba njem ịrụkọ ọrụ ọnụ iji belata ihe iche aka mgba nke nkụkụ ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala na-ebute mgbe ụfọdụ.

english: The ATMA boss commended Gov. Obiano for installing traffic control lights to assist in easing off traffic jams, stressing that road crashes could be avoided by drivers, who obey signs.
igbo: Onyeisi ndị ATMA toro Gọvanọ Willie Obiano maka iwunye ọkụ na-agbazi okporo ụzọ iji nye aka wezụga okporo ụzọ agaghị aga, na-ekwukwa na ọkwọ ụgbọala na-ehuewere mgbaàmà isi nwere ike ịgbalahụ nkụkọ n' ụzọ.

english: Assistant Corps Commander, Ike Egwuokike, who represented the State Sector Commander of the Federal Roads Safety Corps (FRSC), Mr Andrew Kumakpayi, called on motorists to undergo training at approved Driving Schools before plying the road.
igbo: Onye enyemaka onyeisi ndị agha, Ike Egwuokike, onye nọchiri anya onyeisi 'Federal Road Safety Commission' nke mpaghara Anambra steeti, Maazị Andrew Kumakpayi, rịọrọ ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala ka ha na-enweta ọzụzụ n' ebe a nabatara na-akụzi ịnya ụgbọala tupu ha agbawa n' ụzọ.

english: He enjoined them to present their vehicles for routine checks and abide by traffic rules and regulations to ensure safety on 'the Wheels'.
igbo: Ọ gwara ha ka ba gosi ụgbọala ha maka usoro ileru anya ma rubere iwu na-achị okporo ụzọ isi iji mee ka nchekwa dị n' okporo ụzọ.

english: In a goodwill address, the State Chief Vehicle Inspection Officer (VIO), Mr Emenike Atuegbunam, assured of readiness of his officers to contribute their quota toward guaranteeing accident-free Yuletide.
igbo: N' okwu ekele, onyeisi 'Vehicle Inspection Officer (VIO), ' Maazị Emenike Atụegbunam, kwere nkwa na ndị ọrụ ya dị njikere ịtụnye ụtụ nke ha iji hụ na enweghi ihe mberede okporo ụzọ n' ekeresimesi a.

english: He added that to achieve the objective of the event, motorists must update their vehicle documents, fix their vehicles to be roadworthy and obey all traffic rules. (MOI)
igbo: Ọ gbakwunyere na iji nweta ebumnuche emume a, ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala ga-enweriri akwụkwọ ụgbọala zuru ọkè, ruzie ụgbọala ha ka o kwesi ịgba n' ụzọ ma rubere iwu okporo ụzọ niile isi.

english: Former players of Sunshine Stars, Sunshine Queens, Rising Stars and Rising Queens on Tuesday in Akure, Ondo State, disrupted the training session of Sunshine Stars FC over the non-payment of their sign-on fees.
igbo: Ndị gbagburu 'Sunshine Stars', 'Sunshine Queens', 'Rising Stars' na 'Rising Queens' bọọlụ nọrọ n' ụbọchị Tuzdee n' Akure, Ondo Steeti, kpasa ọzụzụ egwuregwu nke òtù egwuregwu 'Sunshine Stars FC' n' ihi akwụghị ha ụgwọ ha kwekọrịtara.

english: The ex-players chased members of the team away from the Ondo State Sports Complex, Akure.
igbo: Ndị a gbagburu ha bọọlụ chụpụrụ ndị òtù egwuregwu a n' ama egwuregwu nke Ondo Steeti, Akure.

english: Former Sunshine Queens player, Esther Michael, told journalists that she got injured while playing for the club but was abandoned to her fate.
igbo: Onye gbagburu 'Sunshine Queens' bọọlụ, Esther Michael, gwara ndị nta akụkọ na ya nwere ihe mmeru ahụ ka ya na-agbara òtù egwuregwu a bọọlụ mana ha gbahapụrụ ya.
