english: Boxing is all about taking well-timed punches and avoid getting hit.
igbo: Ihe dị n' ịkụ ọkpọ bụ ide ede wee kụọ ma zeere ịkuta gị.

english: That was the game plan, and a disciplined Joshua stuck to the plan from start to finish.
igbo: Nke ahụ bụ atụmatụ egwuregwu a, mana Joshua a zụrụ azụ jidesiri atụmatụ a ike site na mbido ruo na njedebe.

english: Joshua never allowed Ruiz to lock him a close range that is advantageous to a speedy boxer like Ruiz.
igbo: Joshua enyeghi Ruiz ohere ịnọ ya nnukwu nso nke bụ uru onye na-akụ ọkpọ ọsọ ọsọ dị ka Ruiz.

english: He made use of his long legs by pacing in the ring, which not only frustrated his opponent but prevented Ruiz from landing his punches in a close range.
igbo: O jiziri ogologo ụkwụ ya nke ọma site n' ịgbagharị n' ime ogige ịkụ ọkpọ, nke n' emeghị naanị ka onye ya na ya na-eme ihe daa mbà kama ọ gbochiri Ruiz ịkụ ọkpọ ya n' ebe ọ dị nso.

english: Those powerful jabs courtesy of Joshua's long-range paid off in the match against his Mexican rival.
igbo: Ịdụ ọkpọ ndị ahụ dị ike si n' ebe Joshua nọtere aka kwụtara ụgwọ na ọkpọ ya na onye Mexico kụrụ.

english: Joshua practically animated Mohammed Ali's words, 'Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.
igbo: Joshua mere ka okwu Mohammed Ali pụta ìhè nke ukwuu, 'See n' elu ka nru ububa, gbaa ka anwụ.

english: The hands can't hit what the eyes can't see.'
igbo: Aka enweghị ike ịkụta ihe anya enweghị ike ịhụ.'

english: Stay focused on the prize
igbo: Lekwasị anya n' ihe nrite

english: On the road to success, the focus is paramount.
igbo: N' ụzọ ọganihu, nlekwasị anya kasị mkpa.

english: In the build-up to the rematch, Joshua was under immense pressure, and he could not afford a second defeat.
igbo: Na nkwado ịkụgharị ọkpọ, Joshua nọ na nnukwu mgbali, na ọ gaghị ekwe ka e merie ya nke ugboro abụọ.

english: In the ring, it's hard to stay focused on a plan after suffering a devastating hit.
igbo: N' ogige ịkụ ọkpọ, ọ siri ike ịnọ na nlekwasị anya n' atụmatụ ma a kụta gị ọkpọ n' emebi isi.

english: However, it pays to stay focused and avoid any unexpected complications from surprise hooks.
igbo: Ka o sina dị, ọ na-akwụ ụgwọ ịnọ na nlekwasị anya ma zere nsogbu a tụghị anya si nko mberede.

english: Before the rematch, Joshua was hard on himself with a laser-focused training regimen.
igbo: Tupu nkụgharị ọkpọ, Joshua emeghiri onwe ya ebere n' usoro ọzụzụ nlekwasị anya-lase.

english: He trimmed his weight to 237 pounds, his lowest in five years (lost 10 pounds in six months).
igbo: O belatara ibu ya ruo paụndụ 237, ọkasị ala ya n' ime afọ ise (o tụfuru paụndụ 10 n' ọnwa isii).

english: It takes focus and discipline to do that.
igbo: Ọ were nlekwasị anya na ọzụzụ ime nke ahụ.

english: In sharp contrast to Joshua's approach, Andy Ruiz added 16 pounds to his chubby frame, which impacted his movement in the ring.
igbo: Na ndịiche ghe anya oghe n' ụdị Joshua si eme ihe, Andy Ruiz gbakwunyere paundu 16 n' ọdịdị ahụ ya nke metụtara ije ya n' ogige ịkụ ọkpọ.

english: It's hard to keep up with six months of uninterrupted media attention and sudden fame.
igbo: O siri ike ijigide nlekwasị anya ndị nta akụkọ ọnwa isii akwusịghị akwụsị na iwu ewu mberede.

english: Bouncing back from an embarrassing loss is hard.
igbo: Isi na nfulahu mmebọ lọghachi azụ sịrị ike.

english: But Joshua forgot about the mixed feelings of the past and focused on the next 36 minutes of his life in the ring – the moment that decides what happens next in his boxing career.
igbo: Mana Joshua chefuru maka mmetụta agwaraogwa nke ihe gara aga ma lekwasị anya na nkeji 36 nke ndụ ya n' ime ogige ịkụ ọkpọ---oge nta ga-ekpebi ihe ọzọ ga-eme n' ọrụ ịkụ ọkpọ ya.

english: With eyes on the prize and a heart bent on winning, he earned his titles back amidst cheers and applause from a satisfied audience.
igbo: N' anya ịdị n' onyinye nke onye gbara mbọ na obi kpebisiri ike imeri, ọ nwetaghachiri ihe nrite ya azụ n' etiti mkpu ọṅụ na ịkụ aka si na ndị nkiri afọ juru.

english: Punch your fears in the face
igbo: Kụọ egwu gị ọkpọ n' ihu.

english: Preceding the match in New York, Joshua was an undefeated unified heavyweight champion.
igbo: Tupu mgba ahụ na New York, Joshua bụbu onye mmeri jikọrọ 'heavyweight' anaghị emeri emeri.

english: Although he had a close shave with defeat in his match against Wladimir Klitschko, he bounced back after a knockdown in the sixth round.
igbo: N' agbanyeghi n' ọ fọdụrụ obere ka e merie ya na machị ya na Vladimir Klitschko nwere, ọ laghachiri n' ụdị ya n' ugboro nke isii.

english: His first taste of defeat in his professional career was against Ruiz in June, and he lost to an underdog that was unknown to anyone before the match.
igbo: Mmeri izizi e meriri ya n' ọrụ ya bụ ka ọ kụrụ ọkpọ megide Ruiz na Juun, nke onye adịghị ike enweghị onye mara ya tupu machị ahụ meriri ya.

english: The fears of losing again must have haunted Joshua in the past few months, but his fighting spirit during the rematch showed the traits of a champion.
igbo: Egwu ịda ọzọ na-achụgharị Joshua n' ime ọnwa ole na ole gara aga, mana mụọ ibu agha n' oge nkụgharị ọkpọ gosiri agwa onye mmeri.

english: Former heavyweight champion, Mike Tyson, once said, 'Fear is just like fire;
igbo: Onye meriri 'heavyweight' na mbụ, Mike Tyson, kwuru n' otu oge, 'Egwu dị nnọọ ka ọkụ;

english: it can be helpful if you know how to use it.
igbo: ọ nwere ike inye aka ma I jizie ya,

english: If not, you will get burned.'
igbo: ma ọ bụghị ya, ọ ga-agba gị.'

english: Our fears are as strong as the belief we put in them.
igbo: Egwu na-atụ anyị dị ike ka nkwenye anyị tinyere n' ime ha.

english: Joshua stepped into the ring and used his fears to his advantage; he faced his demons and punched them until they got exhausted.
igbo: Joshua zọnyere ụkwụ n' ogige ịkụ ọkpọ ma were egwu ya mee ihe bara ya uru; ọ chere ajọ mmụọ ya ihu ma kụwa ha ọkpọ ganye n' ike agwụla ha.

english: Osho, a mechanical engineer, award-winning writer and public speaker writes from Canada
igbo: Osho, mekaniik enjinia, odeakwụkwọ-na-erite awọdụ na ọka okwu ọha si Canada dete akwụkwọ.

english: FLASHBACK: Undercover Investigation: With Just N70, You Can Buy A Pirated Copy Of Genevieve's 'Lionheart'
igbo: Nchetara: Nchọcha ịgba n' anwụ: Naani N70, ị ga-egote kọpị a wara awa 'Lion heart' nke Genevieve.

english: Today, Nigerians woke up to the news that their first ever submission for best international feature Oscar consideration, 'Lionheart' has been disqualified by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences saying it had too much English dialogue.
igbo: Taa, ndị Naijiria tetara ụra nụrụ akụkọ na 'Academy of Motion Picture Arts' ewepula ihe mbụ na mbụ ha nwegara maka nleba anya ọkachamma Ozuruuwa Oscar, 'Lion heart' na-ekwu na ọ nwere mkparịta ụka dị ọtụtụ ná bekee.

english: An undercover investigation by Sahara Reporters in January this year had revealed that the movie whose right was exclusively bought by online streaming platform, Netflix was been pirated in Alaba Markets, Lagos and sold for just N70.
igbo: Nchọcha ịgba n' anwụ nke 'Sahara Reporters' na Jenụwarị afọ ekpughela na ihe nkiri nke 'Netflix' goro kọpiraịt ya ka a na-awa n' ahịa Alaba mana na-ere naanị N70.

english: In October, wild reactions trailed the selection of 'Lionheart' by the Nigerian Oscars Selection Committee, NOSC, to represent Nollywood at the 2020 Oscars as there was varying reactions and argument as why the movie should have or not have been selected.
igbo: N' Ọktoba, nzaghachi dị ukwuu sochiri nhọrọ nke 'Lion heart' nke ndị 'Nigerian Oscar Selection Committee, NOSC,' mere ị ọchị anya 'Nollywood' n' 'Oscars' 2020 dịka enwere nzaghachi dị iche iche na mgbaghasị banyere ihe kpatara e jiri ma ọ bụ e jighị họrọ ihe nkiri ahụ.

english: Today, Nigerians woke up to the news that their first ever submission for best international feature Oscar consideration, 'Lionheart' has been disqualified by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences saying it had too much English dialogue.
igbo: Taa, ndị Naijiria tetara ụra nụrụ akụkọ na 'Academy of Motion Picture Arts' ewepula ihe mbụ na mbụ ha nwegara maka nleba anya ọkachamma Ozuruuwa Oscar, 'Lion heart' na-ekwu na ọ nwere mkparịta ụka dị ọtụtụ ná bekee.

english: The movie which was directed by ace Nollywood actress, Genevieve Nnaji according to the Los Angeles Times ran afoul of the academy rule which states that an International feature film category must have 'a predominantly non-English dialogue track.'
igbo: Ihe nkiri nke nwaanyị ọkachamara Nollywood, Genevieve Nnaji, duziri dịka 'Los Angeles Times' sịrị kwuo dara iwu na-achị ụlọ mmụta nke kwuru na fiimu nọ ogo Ozuruuwa ga-enwekaririri mkparịta ụka n' asụsụ abụghị Bekee.

english: Amidst all this, we bring to you an investigative report done by us highlighting how deep piracy has eaten into the Nigeria movie industry.
igbo: N' ime ihe a niile, anyị wetara gị akụkọ nchọcha nke anyị mere na-egosi ka paịresi sirila baa ụlọ ọrụ nkiri Naijiria ime nke ọma.

english: Four Nigerian Footballers Detained For Illegally Entering India
igbo: Ndị ọgba bọọlụ Naijiria jere mkpọrọ maka ịbanye India n' ụzọ iwu n' akwadoghi.

english: The men were arrested and detained during a search on a train, Indian Express reports.
igbo: Ụmụ nwoke a ka e jidere ma gbuo oge n' oge ọchụchọ n' ụgbọ oloko, 'Indian Express' kọrọ.

english: Four Nigerian footballers en route Guwahati in India have been arrested at Agartala Railway Station.
igbo: Ndị ọgba bọọlụ Naijiria anọ na-aga Guwahati n' India ka e jidere n' ọdụ okporo ígwè Agartala.

english: The men were arrested and detained during a search on a train, Indian Express reports.
igbo: Ụmụ nwoke a ka e jidere ma gbuo oge n' oge ọchụchọ n' ụgbọ oloko, 'Indian Express' kọrọ.

english: Government Railway Police Sub-Inspector, Snehangshu Marak, said, 'We detained them during a search on the train.
igbo: Gọọmenti 'Railway Police Sub-Inspector, Snehangshu Marak, kwuru, ' Anyị jidere ha n' oge ọchụchọ n' ụgbọ oloko.'

english: 'These four people have got valid Nigerian passports and valid visa to Bangladesh.
igbo: 'Mmadụ anọ ndị a enwela paspọtụ iwu kwadoro na visa iwu kwadoro ịga Bangladesh.

english: However, they don't have any travel papers for their entry in India.'
igbo: Ka o sina dị, ha enweghi akwụkwọnjem ọbụla maka ha ịbanye India.'

english: The official said preliminary investigation suggested that the Nigerians illegally entered the Indian territory through Bangladesh.
igbo: Ndị ọrụ kwuru na nnyocha nke mbido na-akọwa na ndị Naịjirịa a banyere ókèala India site Bangladesh n' ụzọ iwu n' akwadoghi.

english: Some currency notes, four Nigerian passports and North-East Frontier Railway tickets to Guwahati were recovered from them.
igbo: Ụfọdụ akwụkwọ ego, paspọtụ Naijiria anọ na tiketi 'North-East Frontier Railway' nke Guwahati ka a natara ha.

english: Amtali Sub-Divisional Police Officer, Anirban Das, said the GRP hasn't yet handed over the detainees to the police.
igbo: Onye uweojii ngalaba uweojii Amtali, Anirban Das, kwuru na GRP enyefebeghi ndị ha ji n' aka ndị uweojii.

english: #FreeSowore: Chaining A Body Whose Mind Is Free By Modiu Olaguro
igbo: #FreeSowore: ịtụ anụ ahụ onye mmụọ ya nwere onwe ya nke si n' aka Modiu Olaguro

english: The government arrested Sowore in body thinking they could get a hold of his soul.
igbo: Gọọmenti jidere Sowore n' anụ ahụ na-eche na ha ga-ejidenwu mmụọ ya.

english: Those championing #FreeSowore should at least be consoled that no one on earth has the capacity to chain a body whose mind is free.
igbo: Ndị ahụ bu #FreeSowore n' isi kwesiri opekata mpe ịgba ume na onweghi onye nwere ike ịtụ anụ ahụ onye mmụọ nwere onwe ya ịgà n' elu ụwa.

english: Modiu Olaguro
igbo: Modiu Olaguro

english: Sahara Reporters Media
igbo: 'Sahara Reporters Media'

english: 'The young generation of whites, blacks, browns, whatever else there is, you're living at a time of extremism, a time of revolution, a time when there's got to be a change, people in power have misused it, and now there has to be a change.
igbo: Ọgbọ na-eto eto nke ndị ọcha, ndị ojii, ndị aja aja, ihe ọbụla ọzọ dịnụ, unu na-ebi n' oge ngabiga ókè, oge nnukwu mgbanwe, oge e kwesirila inwe mgbanwe, ndị nọ n' ọkwa ọchịchị ejizighi ya mana ugbua e kwesiri inwe mgbanwe.

english: And a better world has to be built and the only way it's going to be built is with extreme methods.
igbo: E kwesiri ka e wube ụwa ka mma mana so otu ụzọ a ga-esi wube ya bụ site n' usoro ndị gabigere ókè.

english: And I, for one, will join in with anyone—don't care what colour you are—as long as you want to change this miserable condition that exists on this earth.'—Malcolm X at the Oxford Union in December, 1964.
igbo: Mana mụ, amara m na ndị ọzọ, ga-esonyere onye ọ bụla----achọghị m ịma agwa gị----kamgbe ị chọrọ mgbanwe n' Ọnọdụ iri ụjụ nke dị elu ụwa a. '--------Malcolm X n' òtù Oxford na Disemba, 1946.

english: A couple of weeks after the 2019 presidential elections, I met Omoyele Sowore at the Sahara Reporters' Civic Media Lab and after we exchanged pleasantries in his usual 'hey professor' way, he told me in a sombre tone how travelling across Nigeria during his one year intensive campaigns had made him (upon his brief return to the United States) value things he had hitherto taken for granted having been practically away for twenty years.
igbo: Ka izu ụka ole na ole gachara ka e mesiri ntụli aka onyeisi ala na 2019, ezutere m Omoyele Sowore na 'Sahara Reporters' Civic Media Lab,' ka anyi kelesiri n' ụdị o si eme ya na mbụ ' heyi Ọkammụta', ọ gwara n' olu mwute ka ịga njem Naijiria gburugburu n' oge nnukwu achụmnta votu emeela ya (n' ime ịlọghachi azụ ya n' Amerịka nwa oge) ịma uru ihe ndị nwere ka ihe efu bara dịka ọ nọrọ Amerịka afọ iri abụọ doro anya.

english: Sowore told me how he came to appreciate the leaders of America for the good roads, stable power, modern schools, world-class health care, mortgage facilities, welfare programs, etcetera.
igbo: Sowore gwara ka o si bido nwewe afọ ojuju n' ebe ndị na-achị Amerịka nọ maka ezigbo ụzọ, ọkụ dị agbanwe agbanwe, ụlọakwụkwọ ọgbara ọhụrụ, nleta ahụ ike bụ ịgba, ngwa ịgba mbibi maka ụlọ, atụmatụ ọdịmma, wee dịrị gawa.

english: I listened to him with rapt attention and pity as he held the stand of the red water tank inside the compound.
igbo: Eji m obi niile na imere ebere gee ya ntị dika o jidere aka n' ihe e ji kwụwa tanki mmiri na-acha ọbara ọbara n' mbala ezi.

english: When he was done talking, I said the following words:
igbo: Ka o kwusiri okwu, ekwuru m okwu ndị a:

english: Sir, please leave us here with our poverty and return to the states.
igbo: Saa, biko hapụ anyị n' ịda Ọgbenye anyị ebe a lọghachi Amerịka.

english: Unknown to many, Sowore is rich and comfortable.
igbo: Ọtụtụ mmadụ amaghị, Sowore bụ ọgaranya na onye obi ruru ala.

english: His children neither live nor school here.
igbo: Ụmụ ya anọghị nke ha ji agụ akwụkwọ ebe a.

english: If I had a twelfth of the opportunity Sowore has, I would have forgotten the location of Nigeria on the world map.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na m nwere nke iri na abụọ n' ohere Sowere nwere, agara m ichefu ebe Naijiria dị n' eserese mba ụwa.

english: I am writing this as clear as I can with a heavy heart.
igbo: Eji m obi mwute ede ihe a ka o do anya dị ka m nwere ike.

english: Nigerians who are most hit by poverty and hunger have shown the most love to those inflicting those indignities on them.
igbo: Ndị Naịjirịa ogbenye na agụụ kacha jide egosila ndị butere ha mweda ala nnukwu ịhụnanya.

english: Although, a friend of his warned that he could dislike me for asking that he leave Nigerians with their poverty, I had to say it nonetheless.
igbo: N' agbanyeghi na enyi ya dọrọ m aka ná ntị na ọ nwere ike ịkpọ m asị maka ịsị ya hapụ ndị Naịjirịa na ogbenye ha, ekwuru m ya n' agbanyeghi.

english: I do not know what could motivate someone as comfortable as 'Sho' to leave his family, job and convenience to fight against base conditions that ordinarily have little effect on him.
igbo: Amaghị m ihe kpalitere onye ihe zuru dịka 'Sho' ịhapụ ezinaụlọ ya, ọrụ na ebe ahụ jụrụ ya oyi ibuso ọnọdụ ntọala nke n' emetụtaghi ya nke ukwuu.

english: Nigeria is a space of dead people.
igbo: Naijiria ebe ndị nwụrụ anwụ.

english: It is a dangerous black hole where no amount of good manifests as a result of its nature of neutralizing anything worthwhile thrown at it.
igbo: Ọ bụ onunu ndị isi ojii jọgburu onwe ya ebe enweghi ụdị ihe ọma ga-egosi maka ihi ọdịdị ya ime ka ihe ọbụla bara uru a tụnyere na ya rụọ.

english: The same people castigating Sowore are dying in hunger, writhing in pain and smiling in agony; yet clutch in vain hope, struggling to take a seat on the podium where praises are heaped on the custodians of their chains.
igbo: Otú ndị ahụ na-akatọ Sowore na-anwụ n' agụụ, na-ede n' ihe mgbu ma na-achị ọchị n' ihe mwute; ma jidesie olileanya nkịtị ike, na-agbalị inwere oche n' ebe a na-eto ndị bụ isi nsogbu ha.

english: How will a country led by established thieves, certificate forgers and freeloaders appreciate a person like Sowore who created something out of nothing?
igbo: Kedụ ka obodo ndị ohi a ma ama, ndị mmebe asambodo adịgboroja, ndị na-enwere enwere n'anaghị enye enye na-achị ga-esi enwe afọ ojuju n' ebe mmadụ dị ka Sowere onye sịrị n' ihe efu mepụta ihe?

english: How did Nigeria treat Professors Wole Soyinka, Chinua Achebe, Pius Adesanmi and Ayodele Awojobi?
igbo: Kedụ ka Naijiria siri meso ndị Ọkammụta Wole Soyinka, Chinua Achebe, Pius Adesami na Ayodele Awojobi emume?

english: Did Awojobi, a genius professor of engineering not threaten to go study law?
igbo: Ọ bụ na e yighi Awojobi, ọkammụta 'engineering' nwere nnukwu amamihe, egwu ka ọ jee gụọ maka iwu?

english: Did the Nigerian government not frustrate him that he once broke down in tears in court?
igbo: Ọ bụ na gọọmenti Naijiria emekpaghị ya ahụ nke n' obere akwa otu oge n' ụlọ ikpe.

english: If I had an herbalist, I will not think twice before taking Sowore's name there and cause him to forget the name of his country.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na m nwere dibịa mgbọrọgwụ na mkpa akwụkwọ, agaghị m eche ya ugboro abụọ tupu m wega aha Sowore ebe ahụ ma mee ya ka o chefuo aha obodo a.

english: For thirty years since he found his voice, Nigeria has chained, arrested and molested him.
igbo: Kamgbe afọ iri atọ o bidoro kwuwe uche ya, Naijiria akpọọla ya ịgà, ejidela ya, ma metọọ ya.

english: Until two years ago when he overcame the fear of death, he used to sneak in and out of the country.
igbo: Ruo afọ abụọ gara aga mgbe o meriri egwu ọnwụ, ọ na-amịbata obodo a na-amịpụ.

english: As it stands, the day I leave this country will be the last I will complain about it.
igbo: Ka ihe si gbata kwụrụ ugbua, ụbọchị m ga-esi obodo a apụ ga-abụ ikpeazụ m ga-enye mkpesa banyere ya.

english: The argument that there is no place like home holds water when there is one to begin with.
igbo: Arụmụka na onweghi ebe dị ka ụlọ ga-abụ eziokwu mgbe enwere nke a ga-esi bido.

english: How has Nigeria been made home for Nigerians?
igbo: Kedu ka e siri mee Naijiria ebe obibi maka ndị Naịjirịa?

english: Did the president not say the southeast was not a part of his constituency?
igbo: Ọ bụ na onyeisi ala ekwughi na mgbadaọwụwa anyanwụ esoghi na ndị ya na-achị?

english: Daily, we live in fear.
igbo: Kwa ụbọchị, anyị bi n' egwu.

english: Fear of insecurity.
igbo: Egwu enweghị ezi nchekwa.

english: Fear of devaluation of a weak currency.
igbo: Egwu mweda ego esighi ike.

english: Fear of war.
igbo: Egwu agha.

english: Fear of an increase in the pump-price of petrol.
igbo: Egwu itinye ego n' ọnụ ahịa mmanụ ụgbọala.

english: Fear of a social uprising.
igbo: Egwu nsogbu mmekọrịta mmadụ n' ibe ya.

english: Fear of everything.
igbo: Egwu ihe niile

english: Anyone resident here with no fear in his/her heart is either dead or delusional.
igbo: Onye ọbụla bi ebe a n' enweghi egwu n' obi ya nwụrụ anwụ ma ọ bụ na ọ na-atụrụ onwe ya asị.

english: The reality is that this country will not get better anytime soon—not with the ruinous path her wicked handlers have intentionally put her.
igbo: Nke bụ eziokwu bụ na obodo a agaghị adị mma na nso---ọbụghị n' ụdị ụzọ ilaniyi a ndị nchịkwa obi ya kpachara anya tinye ya.

english: The thought that the rest of the world left us in the 17th century to move to the 21st is enough to prove my point.
igbo: Echiche na mba ụwa niile ha pụrụ anyị na narị afọ nke 17 gafee na narị afọ nke 21 zuru igosi ihe m na-ekwu.

english: Look around you: from the roads politicians build to the rail, from agriculture to education, and from our hospitals back to our governance system, can you spot a difference between them and those that have been around since the time of Isaac Newton?
igbo: Legharia anya n' akụkụ: site n' ụzọ ndị ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị rụrụ ruo okporo ígwè, site n' ọrụ ugbo ruo n' agụmakwụkwọ, na site n' ụlọ ọgwụ anyị laghachi azụ n' usoro ọchịchị anyị, inwere ike ịtụchaputa otu ihe dị iche n' etiti ha na ndị ahụ nọ ya site n' oge Isaac Newton?

english: Unlike many, Omoyele Sowore is a firm believer in Nigeria and Nigerians.
igbo: N' adịghị ka ọtụtụ, Omoyele Sowore bụ onye kwenyesiri ike na Naijiria na ndị Naịjirịa.

english: In July when he met with Nnamdi Kanu, one of the things he told him was his aversion to the snide remarks members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) make against members of other ethnic stock in Nigeria.
igbo: Ka o zutere Nnamdi Kanụ na Julaị, otu n' ime ihe ndị ọ gwara ya bụ asị ọ kpọrọ nkọcha n' ezighi ezi nke ndị òtù 'Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) banyere agbụrụ ndị ọzọ na Naijiria.

english: Sowore told him everyone outside of the political class is suffering a form of injustice or the other and efforts must be made to speak for all and not to call for the balkanization of the Lugardian Contraption.
igbo: Sowere gwara ya na onye ọ bụla n' esoghị na ndị na-achị achị na-agabiga otu enweghị ikpe nkwụmọtọ ma ọ bụ nke ọzọ mana a ga-agbalị ikwuchite ọnụ onye ọ bụla na ọbụghị ịkpọ oku ka e kerie ngwa ọrụ Lugard.

english: Sowore's vision is to have a borderless African continent in the way and manner our Pan-Africanist ancestor, Kwame Nkrumah envisaged.
igbo: Atumanya Sowore bụ inwe kọntinent Afrịka enweghị oké-ala ka nna nna Afrịka niile, Kwame Nkrumah, si chee.

english: His positions are on the internet.
igbo: Ọkwa ya dị n' ịntanet.

english: Sowore does not and has never advocated for the dissolution of the country although he has a right to do so.
igbo: Sowere akwadoghi ma onwebeghi mgbe ọ kwadoro mgbasa obodo a n' agbanyeghi na ọ nwere ikike ime otú a.

english: His anger, like mine, rests solely on the criminal minds ruining this blessed land of milk and honey.
igbo: Iwe ya, ka nke m, gbasara naanị ndị ekperima na-achị ala a a gọziri agọzi jupụtara mmiri ara na mmanụ aṅụ.

english: While it is within the rights of anyone to fault the methods and timing of his many interventions including the most recent, #RevolutionNow, what is unacceptable is his traducers' penchant at distorting his motives and passion at seeing that this present order of blood and death is put to an end.
igbo: Ka ọ dị n' ikike onye ọbụla ịta usoro na oge ọtụtụ enyemaka ya nke gụnyere ọkacha nso, #RevolutionNow ụta, ihe adịghị nnabata bụ obi ụtọ ndị nkọcha ya imebi mmasị ọ nwere ihụ na e wetara usoro ịkwafu ọbara na ọnwụ dị ugbua na njedebe.

english: A country peopled by individuals who fail to appreciate little things will find it unworthy to reckon with the heavy sacrifices a few persons from amongst them make.
igbo: Obodo ndị jụrụ igosi afọ ojuju n' obere ihe bi ga-ahụ ka ihe erughi eru ịdọnyere nnukwu àjà ụfọdụ mmadụ n' etiti ha na-achụ ukwu.

english: Whether the despotic government of Muhammadu Buhari frees Sowore or not, I have no doubt that individuals averse to the rot in this society will keep up with the momentum as a means to end this condition of suffering and sin firmly in place in Nigeria .
igbo: Ma ọchịchị aka ike Muhammadu Buhari ahapụrụ Sowere ma ọ hapụghị ya, enweghị m mgbagha na ndị achọghị mbibi a dị n' obodo a ga-eji aka a dịka ụzọ a ga-esi kwụsị ọnọdụ ntaramahụhụ na njọ werela ọnọdụ na Naijiria.

english: What is so offensive is that the hypocrites in his Republican base are buying the garbage and defending the impossible because all they care about is supporting the man who is going to put money in their pockets because his greatest motivation for seeking the Presidency is to make money and to make his family and few friends so rich that they would kill to have him removed from office, should it come to that.
igbo: Ihe kacha ewe iwe bụ na ndị ihu abụọ nọ na òtù 'Republican' ya na-ekweta n' ihe n' enweghi isi ma na-agbachitere ihe n' ekwughi omume maka n' ihe niile ha chọrọ bụ ịkwụnyere nwoke ahụ nke ga-etinye ha ego n' akpa makana ihe kachasị kpalite mmụọ ya ịzọ ọkwa onyeisi ala bụ ịnweta ego na ịme ezinaụlọ ya na ndị enyi ya ole na ole nnukwu ọgaranya nke na ha ga-egbunwu mmadụ iji hụ na e wepụrụ ya n' ọkwa, ma o ru otu ahụ.

english: America under Trump is no longer the America we used to know and the Republican Party has become a den of thieves and sexual predators that have lost their moral compass as a major political party in God's own country.
igbo: Amerịka n' aka Trump abụghịzị Amerịka anyị maara ma 'Republican' Pati abụrụla ọgba ndị ohi na ndị ọkwá iko tụfurula ezi akparam agwa ha dịka òtù ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị bụ isi n' obodo bụ nke Chineke.

english: In cahoots with Trump, Republicans have not ended their campaign of calumny to humiliate, blackmail and delegitimize Barack Obama, the first black President.
igbo: N' ịdọnyere Trump ụkwụ n' ihe ọjọọ, ndị 'Repliican' akwụsịbeghi ịchụ nta ikwutọ aha, imebọ na imebi aha Barack Obama, onyeisi ojii izizi bụrụ onyeisi ala.

english: Even though the White House was built with slave labor, as widely documented by historians, no black man was ever expected to live in that majestic building that the arrogant Donald Trump, in one of his craziest moments, has described as a 'dump.'
igbo: N' agbanyeghi na a rụrụ 'White House' site n' ọrụ ndị a gbatara n' ohu, dị ka ọtụtụ ndị akụkọ ihe mere eme, onweghi onye isi ojii a tụrụ anya ka o biri n' ụlọ a dị ebube nke Trump onye okomoko, n' otu n' ime oge nnukwu nkwuyeri ya, kọwarala ka ebe ndọkọba ihe.

english: The guy is just too arrogant to admit that the Obama couple was far superior to him and his Melania in intellect and education.
igbo: Nwoke a nwere nnukwu mpako ikweta na Obama na nwunye ya ka ya na Melania ya nke ukwuu n' ọgụgụ isi na agụmakwụkwọ.

english: Barack earned his education from Columbia and Harvard while Michelle earned her own from Princeton and Harvard.
igbo: Barack gụrụ akwụkwọ na Kolumbia na Harvard ebe Michelle gụrụ nke ya na Princeton na Harvard.

english: It doesn't get any better than that for any American President dead or alive but the 'C' average student from an undergraduate business program would tell you he is the smartest dude in the universe who never makes a mistake or regrets anything.
igbo: Ọ kaghịrị onyeisi ala mba Amerịka ọbụla mma karịa otú ahụ ma ndị dị ndụ ma ndị nwụrụ mana nwata akwụkwọ agbaetiti 'ch' a si ụlọakwụkwọ azụmahịa ga-agwa gị na ya kacha mara ihe n' ụwa niile n' anaghị emehie ihe ma ọ bụ kwa ngaramara banyere ihe ọbụla.

english: He sounds to me like a reincarnated Adolf Hitler who told the Anglo-Saxons they were the most superior white race in the world who must dominate the world.
igbo: N' ebe m nọ ọ na-akọ ka Adolf Hitler onye gwara ndị 'Anglo-Saxon' na ọ bụ ha bụ agbụrụ kasị agbụrụ ndị ọcha n' ụwa niile ndị ga-achịrịrị ụwa.

english: Donald Trump is pretty much preaching the same doctrine today.
igbo: Donald Trump na-agbasa ụdị nkwenye a n' ụzọ pụrụ iche taa.

english: His latest unilateral announcement to make Jerusalem the undivided capital of the Zionist Regime without consultation with any of America's traditional allies is tantamount to suicide and a move that will go down in infamy, to quote the immortal words of Franklin D. Roosevelt.
igbo: Ọkwa ọ mara ime Jeruselem isi ọnọdụ adịghị nkewa nke ọchịchị 'Zionist' n' achọghị ndụmọdụ ndị ha na Amerịka na-mmekọrịta na mmadụ igbu onwe ya bụ otu ihe bụrụkwa nzọ ụkwụ jọgburu onwe ya, iji kwuo okwu dị ọkpụtọrọ ọkpụ Franklin D. Roosevelt kwuru.

english: Donald Trump once boasted that he was far more experienced than all of the American generals combined.
igbo: Donald Trump nyara isi n' otu oge na ya nwere ahụmahụ karịa ngwakọta ndị ọchịagha Amerịka niile.

english: He is therefore seeking to invalidate or demolish anything the first black President had ever done during his 8 glorious years in the White House.
igbo: Ya mere ọ na-achọ ịkagbu ma ọ bụ imebi ihe ọbụla onye isi ojii izizi bụ onyeisi ala merela n' ime asatọ dị ebube na 'White House. '

english: The one-term young Senator from Illinois was elected President in 2008 and re-elected again in 2012 with a wider margin.
igbo: A họpụtara onye ntorobịa bụ sinetọ otu ugboro si Illinois ka onyeisi ala na 2008 ma jiri nnukwu ọnụ ọgụgụ họpụtagharịkwa ya ọzọ na 2012.

english: He turned around the American economy while reducing unemployment in America to the lowest it had ever been in 20 years.
igbo: Ọ tụgharịrị akụnụba Amerịka ka ọ na-ebelata enweghi ọrụ na Amerịka n' ebe ọ kasị dị ala dị ka ọ dịgọrọla n' ime afọ iri abụọ gara aga.

english: He killed Osama Bin Laden and he passed into law the Affordable Health Care Reform Law that offered medical insurance coverage to 46 million Americans with the stroke of his pen.
igbo: O gburu Osama Bin Laden ma mee ka e mebe iwu nke iwu mgbanwe nleta ahụ ike dị ọnụ mma nke nyere nde 46 ndị Amerịka inshọọransị ọgwụ site n' imegharị mkpịsị odee ya.

english: The Teflon outlaw with 9 lives came to town promising to undo everything Obama has done while promising to 'make America great again,' as if America has ever at any time lost her greatness following the end of the Second World War.
igbo: Ọ dara iwu eje nga a nwere isi ọma batara obodo na-ekwe nkwa ime karịa ihe ọ bụla Obama merela ka ọ na-ekwe nkwa 'ime ka Amerịka dị ukwuu ọzọ, ' ka a ga-asị na ọnwela mgbe Amerịka tụfuru ịdị ukwuu ya kamgbe agha mba ụwa niile nke abụọ kwụsịrị.

english: Nothing could be farther from the truth, but his Republican base and some charlatans in the party are buying the cheap blackmail from a delusional outlaw in the White House.
igbo: Onweghi ihe nọtere aka n' ebe eziokwu dị, mana otu 'republican' ya na ndị ihu abụọ ndị ọzọ nọ n' òtù ha na-ekweta n' imebi ha n' enweghi isi si n' ọnụ ọmụ anya arọ nrọ iwu machibidoro nọ na 'White House.'

english: Even though Trump had lost the popular vote by 3 million votes to Hillary Clinton, he still managed to ride on the coattails of Vladimir Putin and the KGB to put himself in the White House against the better judgment of the 65 million Americans who voted for his opponent.
igbo: N' agbanyeghi na Trump enwetaghị votu nke nzuruọha nke nde votu 3 nyere Hillary Clinton, ọ kaara ahụ tinye onwe ya na 'White House' site n' enyemaka Vladimir Putin na KGB nke n' adanyeghi n' uche ka mma nke nde 65 ndị Amerịka ndị tụnyere onye ha abụọ zọrọ ọchịchị.

english: My point is that if Barack Obama had committed just a fraction of the crimes and violations of the norms of decency that Donald Trump has committed less than one year into his Presidency, Obama would long have been thrown out of office and sent to jail and Republicans in their hypocrisy and racism would have made that a justification to bar any colored person from ever aspiring to be President again.
igbo: Isi okwu m bụ na ọ bụrụ na Barack Obama mere mpekere mpụ na nnupụisi n' omume iwu kwadoro nke Donald Trump megoro n' ihe n' erughi otu afọ ọ banyere n' ọchịchị onyeisi ala, a kara ịchụpụgo Obama n' ụlọ ọrụ ma tunye ya na mkpọrọ ebe ndị 'Repliican' n' ihu abụọ na ịkpọ oké agbụrụ ha ga-ejide ya aka ka ihe ga-egbochi onye agbụrụ ọzọ ịzọ ọkwa onyeisi ala ọzọ.

english: It is Donald Trump that I call the Houdini of American Politics for how and why he has survived up to this moment despite all of the atrocities he has committed as a candidate and now as President for close to one year.
igbo: Ọ bụ Donald Trump ka na m na-akpọ Houdini nke ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị Amerịka maka otú na ihe mere o jiri nọruo oge a n' agbanyeghi arụ niile ọ kpagoro dị ka onye na-azọ ọchịchị na ugbua dị ka onyeisi ala na-achọ ime otú afọ.

english: If Barack Obama had uttered half the statements credited to Donald Trump, he would never have secured the nomination of the Democratic Party in 2008 and would have been ostracized for life.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na Barack Obama kwuru ọkara okwu a sịrị na Donald Trump kwuru, ọ gaghị enweta ntupụta nke 'Democratic Party' na 2008, e nwekwara ike ịmachi ya ogologo ndụ ya.

english: I seek your indulgence to go back to memory lane to remind some of the fans of this column about the America we used to know before crazy Donald Trump showed up.
igbo: Ana m nnagide unu ịlaghachi azụ n' ichetara ndị ihe kọlụm a na-amasị maka Amerịka anyị mara tupu onye ara bụ Donald Trump abata.

english: Eagleton was dropped from nomination as running mate due to a history of mental health illness.
igbo: A hapụrụ ịtụpụta Eagleton ka onye nzọkọ ya maka akụkọ ihe mere eme banyere ọrịa isi.

english: Spiro Agnew, Vice President to Richard Nixon, was defrocked for tax evasion and fraud.
igbo: Spiro Agnew, osote onyeisi ala nyere Richard Nixon, ka e wepụrụ n' ihi mgbanahụ ụtụ isi na igwu wayo.

english: Joseph Biden was forced to drop out of his Presidential bid at a point in his career because he was found guilty of plagiarism in one of his stump speeches - he lifted a quotation from Neil Kinnock, a Labour Party leader in Britain without acknowledging his source.
igbo: Joseph Biden ka a manyere ka ọ hapụ ndọrọndọrọ onyeisi ala ya n' otu oge n' ọrụ ya maka ikpe inwere echiche mmadụ n' enyeghi ya nkwupuru mara ya n' otu okwu ya-- o kwuru ihe Neil Kinnock, onyeisi 'Labour Party' na Britain kwuru n' ekwughi ebe o si weta ya.

english: Gerald Ford lost to Jimmy Carter in 1976 in large part because he pardoned Richard Nixon, an unconvicted felon, for obstruction of justice and for displaying ignorance when he stated in one of his debates with Jimmy Carter that the now-defunct Soviet Union did not dominate Eastern Europe.
igbo: Jimmy Carter meriri Gerald Ford n' afọ 1976 ọkachasị makana ọ gbaghara Richard Nixon, onye dara iwu a tụghị mkpọrọ, maka igbochi ikpe mkwụmọtọ na igosi amaghị ama mgbe o kwuru n' otu arụmarụ ụka dị n' etiti ya na Jimmy Carter na 'Soviet Union' nwụgoro anwụ ugbua akpakọghị 'Eastern Europe. '

english: George Bush lost to Bill Clinton for going back on his 'read my lips' pledge not to increase taxes. The voters concluded he had told a lie even though he was one of the most honorable and dependable men of honor ever to serve as American President.
igbo: Bill Clinton meriri George Bush maka ịla azụ na nkwa 'read my lips' ya n' etinyeghi ego ụgwọ ụtụ isi. Ndị ntụli aka kpebiri n' ọ tụrụ asị n' agbanyeghi na ọ bụ onye kasị kwesi nsọpụrụ na ntụkwasị obi n' ụmụ nwoke ndị kwesiri nsọpụrụ gagoro Amerịka ozi dị ka onyeisi ala.

english: I gave all of these examples to show how Donald Trump would appear to have completely changed all the rules of the game for anyone who will be President in America.
igbo: Enyere m ọmụma atụ niile a iji gosi ka Donald Trump ga-esi dị iji tụgharịa kpamkpam usoro iwu niile nyere onye ọ bụla ga-abụ onyeisi ala n' Amerịka.

english: Republicans nominated a man who has had more than 4000 litigations against him in the Court of Law, most of those litigations he had to settle out of Court because he was too embarrassed to let them go forward.
igbo: 'Repliicans' wepụtara nwoke a gbara akwụkwọ karịrị 4000 megide ya n' ụlọ ikpe, ọtụtụ n' ime akwụkwọ ndị a a gbara ya ka a nọghị n' ụlọ ikpe dozie makana ihere mere ya nke ukwuu ịhapụ ha ka ha gawa n' ihu.

english: Republicans nominated a man who falsely tried to delegitimize the man he was going to replace by claiming Obama was not born in America.
igbo: 'Repliicans' wepụtara nwoke gbalịrị ime ka onye ọ na-aga ịnọchi bụrụ onye a jụrụ ajụ n' ụzọ n' ezighi ezi site ikwu na a mughi Obama n' Amerịka.

english: Republicans nominated a man whose Trump Plaza Building in New York was already known to be the money laundering capital of the world.
igbo: 'Republicans' wepụtara nwoke onye a marala nnukwu ụlọ ahịa Trump ya na New York ka isi ebe mbupu ego nke ụwa niile.

english: Republicans nominated a man who claimed he loved to sexually assault women by 'grabbing their pussies' because they allowed him to commit the crime because he was a star who could get away with murder.
igbo: 'Republicans' wepụtara nwoke kwetara na ya hụrụ mwakpo mmekọahụ umu nwaanyị n' anya site ijide ọtụ ha makana ha hapụrụ ya ime mpụ a n' ihi na ọ bụ onye a ma ama nwere ike inafere igbu ọchụ.

english: He actually gloated that his supporters would still vote for him even if he had shot and killed a man on 5th Avenue in broad daylight in Manhattan.
igbo: O nyara isi na ndị nkwado ya ka ga-atụnyere ya ma ọbụrụgodu na ọ gbara egbe ma gbuo otu nwoke na 5th 'Avenue ' n' etiti ehihie na Manhattan.

english: Republicans nominated and elected a pathological liar who is never ashamed to blackmail his opponents by calling them names and insulting them and getting away with everything.
igbo: 'Republicans' wepụtara ma họpụta eze asị onye ihere anaghị eme imebi aha ndị ha na ya akwụghị site n' ịkpọ ha ọtụtụ aha na ịkparị ha mana anafere n' ihe niile.

english: Republicans nominated a man whose financial and business record with American banks and financial houses across the board were so bad that no American Bank was willing to do business with him because he had swindled them time and again.
igbo: 'Republicans' wepụtara nwoke onye ndekọ ego na azụmahịa ya n' ụlọ akụ Amerịka na n' ụlọ akụ niile jọgburu onwe ya nke na onweghi ụlọ akụ Amerịka nwere mmasị ka ya na ya zụkọọ ahịa makana ọ ghọgbuola ha ugboro ugboro.

english: Republicans nominated and elected a man who had been divorced three times and who has filed for Bankruptcy more than five times and a man who has bluntly refused to submit his tax returns for public scrutiny because he has managed to avoid paying taxes for more than 20 years.
igbo: 'Republicans' wepụtara ma họpụta nwoke onye a gbarala alụkwaghịm ugboro atọ na onye gbarala akwụkwọ ọdịda ihe karịrị ugboro ise na nwoke onye juwara isi iweputa akwụkwọ na-akọwa ego ole ọ nwetara ka ọha na eze leba ya anya makana ọ zere ịtụ ụtụ isi ihe karịrị afọ iri abụọ.

english: Republicans nominated and elected a con artist who is not afraid to lie his way out of every problem and a man who has openly tried to undermine NATO and many of the time-honored agreements all of his predecessors in the White House had committed to for more than 70 years.
igbo: 'Republicans' wepụtara ma họpụta onye aghụghọ ụjọ n' anaghị atụ iji asị gọrọ isi onwe ya na nsogbu ọbụla na nwoke onye mere ka ọ leda NATO anya n' ụzọ doro anya nakwa ọtụtụ n' ime nkwekọrịta ndị niile bụ ya ụzọ nọ na 'White House' tinyere uche na ha ihe karịrị afọ iri asaa.

english: They elected a hoodlum who openly colluded or conspired with the KGB while openly casting aspersion on the credibility of the American CIA and FBI.
igbo: Ha họpụtara ekperima onye ya na KGB kpara nkata ikwutọ ntụkwasị obi CIA na FBI nke Amerịka n' ụzọ doro anya.

english: Republicans elected a man who wants to repeat Harry Truman's mistake by becoming the second American President to deploy or detonate the nuclear bomb, this time on North Korea.
igbo: 'Republicans' họpụtara nwoke onye chọrọ imegharị mmejọ Harry Truman site n' ịbụ onyeisi ala mba Amerịka nke abụọ gbasuru ogbunigwe, n' oge a n' mgbago ugwu Korịa.

english: Republicans have elected a man who openly emulates and praises dictators like Vladimir Putin.
igbo: 'Republicans' ahọpụtala otu nwoke onye na-eñomi ma na-eto ndị ọchịchị aka ike dị ka Vladimir Putin n' ụzọ doro anya.

english: He made it clear he would want to be like them if he had his way.
igbo: O mere ka o doo anya na ga-achọ ịdị ka ha ma ọ kwe ya omume.

english: Republicans elected a man who tweets in the early hours of the morning and who has used tweeting as an instrument of policies and presidential orders.
igbo: 'Republicans' họpụtara otu nwoke onye na-etuwiit n' ụzọ ụtụtụ na onye werela ituwiit dị ka ngwa amụma agwa na iwu onyeisi ala.

english: They elected a man who on Wednesday made good on his promise destroy the last vestiges of the Camp David Accord by unilaterally moving the capital of Israel to divide Jerusalem, thereby stroking the embers of fire and fury in the Middle East.
igbo: Ha họpụtara otu nwoke onye n' ụbọchị Wenzidee mere mma na nkwa o kwere mebie akụkụ ikpeazụ nke 'Camp David Accord' site ibupu isi ọnọdụ Israel iji kewaa Jeruselem, nke kpọlitere oke iwe n' etiti ọwụwa anyanwụ.

english: Republicans have elected a man who has made his inexperienced son-in-law, Jared Kushner, the de facto Secretary of State to the United States through the backdoor.
igbo: 'Republicans' ahọpụtala nwoke onye mere ọgọ ya nwoke n' enweghị ahụmihe, Jared Kusher, ọde akwụkwọ nke steeti nyere mba Amerịka site n' azụ ụlọ.

english: The list goes on and on without end but Donald Trump is still there despite an abysmal approval opinion of only 33 percent or less.
igbo: Ngụsịsị a ka na-aga n' ihu enweghị njedebe mana Donald Trump ka nọ ebe ahụ n' agbanyeghi n' ọ bụ sọ pesent 33 ma ọ bụ pekarịa nabatara ya n' ụtụ uche nnabata e mere nke jọgburu onwe ya.

english: Republicans elected a man who has claimed that his own opinion or decision is all that counts and who has proclaimed most institutions of the fourth estate of the realm as 'fake news' disseminators.
igbo: 'Republicans' họpụtara nwoke onye kwuru na ọ bụ uche nke ya ma ọ bụ mkpebi ya bụ ihe kasị mkpa na onye kọwara ọtụtụ ewumewu nta akụkọ ka ndị na-agbasa akụkọ ụgha.

english: He has pointed accusing fingers at networks like CNN and print media like the highly respected New York Times, Washington Post and Wall Street Journal, to mention a few.
igbo: O bola ndị ụlọ mgbasa ozi dị ka CNN na ndi nta akụkọ edere ede a na-akwanyere ùgwù nke ukwuu dị ka 'New York Times', ' Washington Post,' na 'Wall Street Journal,' n' ịkpọ sọ ụfọdụ, ebubo.

english: What atrocity, in less than one year in office, has this President not already committed?
igbo: Kedụ ụdị omume ọjọọ, n' ihe pekarịrị otu afọ n' ụlọ ọrụ, onyeisi ala a emebeghi?

english: The list is inexhaustible.
igbo: Ngwụsịsị a dị agwụ agwụ.

english: The greatest loser in this entire saga has to be the Republican Party and the clear winner has to be Vladimir Putin who now has the American President in his pocket and dictating to him what he must do or not do.
igbo: Ndị ga-akasị tufu ihe n' ime ogologo ihe niile a ga-abụ ndị òtù Pati 'Republican' ebe onye nrite doro anya ga-abụ Vladimir Putin onye nwụ onyeisi ala Amerịka n' akpa ugbua na-agwa ya ihe ọ ga-emeriri ma ọ bụ nke ọ gaghị emeriri.

english: Whoever thought that the whole world is going to turn 180 degrees for America and that Donald Trump is on his way to becoming the Mikhail Gorbachev of American Politics right under our eyes, and Americans appear totally helpless and clueless to do something about it.
igbo: Onye ọbụla chere na mba ụwa niile ga-ewepụ Amerịka ihu, na Donald Trump na-aga ịbụ Mikhail Gorbachev nke ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị Amerịka n' anya anyị ebe ndị Amerịka ga-anọ kpamkpam n' enweghị enyemaka na amaghị ihe ha ga-eme banyere ya.

english: It is a complete outrage and totally incredible!
igbo: Ọ bụ ihe nnukwu oké iwe na nke ekweghị ekwe kpamkpam!

english: I rest my case.
igbo: Awụsị m ọwara.

english: Dr. Wumi Akintide
igbo: Dọkịta Wumi Akintide

english: There's Still Time To Change, Group Tells Buhari
igbo: A ka nwere oge ịgbanwe, òtù gwara Buhari.

english: He also condemned the President on the handling of Omoyele Sowore's case, advising Buhari to take his government back from 'many unelected characters currently ruling the country by proxy'.
igbo: Ọ katọkwara onyeisi ala n' otu o si mee n' ikpe Omoyele Sowore, na-enye Buhari ndụmọdụ ka ọ na-apụta gọọmenti ya n' aka ndị zoro ezo a họpụtaghị ahọpụta na-achị obodo a ugbua.

english: Voice of Reason, a group of Yoruba professionals, has urged President Muhammadu Buhari to turn a new leaf from his current anti-democracy dispositions.
igbo: 'Voice of Reason, ' òtù ndị ọkachamara Yoruba, agwala onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari ka ọ wepụ aka n' agwa igbochi ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya ọ na-akpa ugbua.

english: Chairman of the group, Olufemi Adegoke, said this during a press briefing on Thursday.
igbo: Onyeisi nke òtù a, Olufemi Adegoke, kwuru nke a ka ọ na-agwa ndị nta akụkọ okwu n' ụbọchị Tọzdee.

english: He also condemned the President on the handling of Omoyele Sowore's case, advising Buhari to take his government back from 'many unelected characters currently ruling the country by proxy'.
igbo: Ọ katọkwara onyeisi ala n' otu o si mee n' ikpe Omoyele Sowore, na-enye Buhari ndụmọdụ ka ọ na-apụta gọọmenti ya n' aka ndị zoro ezo a họpụtaghị ahọpụta na-achị obodo a ugbua.

english: He said, 'As keen observers of the goings-on in the polity, we state without any equivocation that the President needs to act urgently not only to restore his integrity and align his lofty rhetoric with his actions but to regenerate in Nigerians faith that it is possible to have leaders that can serve all without discrimination.
igbo: He said, 'Dị ka ndị uche dị n' ihe na-eme n' ọchịchị a, anyị na-ekwu n' ezoghi ọnụ na onyeisi ala kwesiri ime ngwa ngwa ọ bụghị sọ inweghachi eziokwu na ime ka okwu ya na omume ya bụrụ otú kama itinyekwa n' ime ndị Naịjirịa nkwenye na ọ ka kwere omume bụ inwe ndị ndu ga-eje ozi n' akpọghị oké.

english: 'The 'born again democrat' garb lent to the President on the eve of 2015 election needs a lot of stitches to hang well on the wearer.
igbo: Uwe onye kwenyesiri ike na ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya a chịnyere onyeisi ala tupu e mee ntụli aka 2015 kwesiri ka a kwa ya ọfụma ka ọ wee dị onye yi ya mma.

english: Democracy does not end with multi-party elections.
igbo: Ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya akwusịghị n' inwe ọtụtụ òtù ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị na ntụli aka.

english: It includes fairness, transparency and integrity of the electoral process; absolute respect for the rule of law; protection of the independence of the institutions of democracy (parliament and the judiciary).
igbo: Ọ gụnyere ihe ziri ezi, nghọta na eziokwu nke usoro ntụli aka; ịkwanyere usoro iwu ezigbo ugwu; nchekwa nnwere onwe nke ewumewu ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya (ụlọ ọrụ ọmebe iwu na okaiwu).

english: 'We urge the President to borrow a leaf from General Gowon and do that which will strengthen the unity of Nigeria by leading the fight to restructure Nigeria, renew citizens' commitment to Nigeria, galvanise everybody's energy to build a nation where no one is oppressed,
igbo: 'Anyị na-agwa onyeisi ala ka ọ mụrụ n' aka General Gowon ma mee nke ahụ nwere ike ikwalite ịdị n' otu Naijiria site n' ibuzọ agha iwụgharị Naijiria, mee ka inwe mmasị ụmụ amaala dị ọhụrụ, mee ka ike onye ọbụla gaa n' iwulite obodo enweghi onye a na-emegbu emegbu,

english: show by example the need to reduce cost of governance, restore the rule of law, rededicate himself to defending democracy, protect all citizens' human rights and deepen the fight against corruption.
igbo: gosi ọmụma atụ mkpa ọ dị ibelata ịda ọnụ ọchịchị, weghachite usoro iwu, rakwara onwe ya nye n' ịchekwa ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya, chekwaba ikie dịịrị nwa amaala ọbụla ma bawanye ibu agha megide mpụ.

english: 'President Buhari needs deep reflection and his genuine friends need to help him focus on leaving an enviable legacy.
igbo: 'Onyeisi ala Buhari kwesiri iche echiche miri emi ebe ezigbo ndị enyi ya kwesiri inyere ya aka lekwasị anya n' ịtọ ụkpụrụ nlereanya dị ezi nñomi.

english: It is not too late.
igbo: Ọge agabeghi nke ukwuu.

english: He has three years to go.
igbo: Ọ nwere afọ atọ tupu ọ pụọ.

english: We pray for the sake of Nigeria and his place in history he takes our admonition in good faith and acts.'
igbo: Anyi na-ekpe ekpere na maka ihi Naijiria na ọnọdụ ya n' akụkọ ihe mere eme na ọ ga-ewere ndụmọdụ anyị n' ezigbo nkwenye ma mee ya.

english: They Have Started Again By Richard Akinnola
igbo: Ha ebidola ọzọ nke si aka Richard Aminnola

english: There are certain irreducible minimums l can tolerate from people I call my friends.
igbo: Onwere ụfọdụ ihe agaghị ebelatanwu m nwere ike inagidere ndị mmadụ m kpọrọ ndị enyi m.

english: This is not about holding a contrary view but peddling falsehood to save face after such a despicable conduct of Friday.
igbo: Nke a abụghị maka ịhụta ihe n' ụdị dị iche mana ọ bụ ibusa ụgha iji zọrọ isi onwe ka e mesiri omume jọgburu onwe ya ụbọchị Fraịdee.

english: Richard Akinnola
igbo: Richard Akinnola

english: When Dele Giwa was assassinated on October 19, 1986, the major suspects were the two security operatives of the General Ibrahim Babangida junta.
igbo: Mgbe e gburu Dele Giwa n' Ọktoba 19, 1986, ndị bụ isi ndị a na-enyo enyo bụ ndị ọrụ nchekwa abụọ nke iwere ọchịchị n' ike General Ibrahim Babangida.

english: In an attempt to shift the focus from them, they procured some Nigerians to peddle false narratives, accusing Dele's wife and his colleagues as the main suspects.
igbo: Iji mee ka e wepụ anya n' ebe ha nọ, ha nwetara ụfọdụ ndị Naịjirịa ibusa akụkọ ụgha, na-ebo nwunye Dele na ndị otu ya ebubo ịbụ isi ndị a na-enyo enyo.

english: Also in 1986, Alozie Ogugbuaja, then the Lagos spokesperson for police, ran into troubled waters over his accusations against the military government for not funding the police.
igbo: Ọzọkwa n' afọ 1986, Alozie Ogugbuaja, mgbe ahụ okwuchite ọnụ ndị uwe ojii Lagos, dabara na nsogbu banyere ebubo ọ boro ọchịchị ndị agha maka enweputaghị ego maka ndị uwe ojii.

english: He was suspended.
igbo: A kwụsịrị ya ọrụ.

english: Thereafter, the agents of the junta went after his life.
igbo: Ka nke a, ndị ozi inwere ọchịchị n' ike chọwara ndụ ya.

english: A grenade was thrown from a moving vehicle at him but it refused to detonate.
igbo: E si n' ụgbọala na-aga aga tụọ ya ogbunigwe mana ọ jụrụ ịgbasuu.

english: Instead of standing by their man, the police IG, Gambo, said the grenade was 'harmless' and must have fallen from a moving vehicle.
igbo: Kama ịkwụnyere onye nke ha, onyeisi ndị uwe ojii, Gambo, sịrị na ogbunigwe a adịghị ajọ nakwa n' ọ ga-abụrịrị ụgbọala na-aga aga dapụta.

english: Ever heard of a harmless grenade?
igbo: I nunugo maka ogbunigwe adịghị ajọ?

english: They always have odious lies to peddle.
igbo: Ha na-enwe asị jọgburu onwe ya mgbe ọbụla.

english: In 1988, agents of Babangida junta set fire on Gani Fawehinmi's house at 28 Sabiu Ajose Crescent, Surulere, Lagos, housing his library and his second wife and her children.
igbo: N' 1988, ndị ozi inwere ọchịchị n' ike nke Babangida mụnyere ụlọ Gani Fawehimi ọkụ na 28 Sabiu Ajose Crescent, Surulere Lagos, nke bu ọba akwụkwọ ya na nwunye nke abụọ na ụmụ ya.

english: Guess what the police said?
igbo: Kaa ihe ndị uwe ojii kwuru?

english: In an attempt to change the narrative of their dastardly action, they accused Gani Fawehinmi of setting his house on fire 'in order to embarrass the government'.
igbo: Iji mee ka agbanwe akụkọ omume jọgburu onwe ya hà mere, ha boro Gani Fawehimi ebubo ịgba ụlọ ya ọkụ 'iji imechu gọọmenti ihu'.

english: A livid Fawehinmi countered the police - 'You mean l would set fire on my house, housing my wife and children and books worth millions of naira just to embarrass a government that is already embarrassed? You must be insane like your useless government'.
igbo: Fawehimi onye iwe na-eto afọ gbaghara ihe ndị uwe ojii kwuru-- 'I chere na m ga-amunye ụlọ m, bu nwunye m na ụmụ m na akwụkwọ ruru ọtụtụ nde Naịra sọsọ maka imechu gọọmenti ihu? I ga-abụrịrị onye ara ka gọọmenti gị n' abaghị uru'.

english: In 1996, after the assassination of Alhaja Kudirat Abiola by the agents of Abacha junta, the security agencies, also in an attempt to shift the accusations from them, arrested some NADECO chieftains, accused them of being behind the gruesome act till a court ordered their release.
igbo: N' 1996, ka ndị ozi inwere ọchịchị n ike nke Abacha gbusiri Alhaja Kudirat Abiola, ndị ụlọ ọrụ nchekwa, ọzọkwa n' iji mee ka e bupu ebubo a n' ebe ha nọ, jidere ụfọdụ ndị isi NADECO, bo ha ebubo ịma isi omume ajọ obi a ganye n' ụlọ ikpe enye iwu ka a hapụ ha.

english: Of course, Nigerians knew that Abacha's Strike Force was behind the gruesome act.
igbo: N' ezie, ndị Naijiria mara na ọ bụ ndị na-egburu Abacha mmadụ mere omume ajọ obi a.

english: Now, after the show of shame inside the Federal High Court in Abuja on Friday, the perpetrators have equally procured some people to retail some puerile and jejune narrative that it was Omoyele Sowore and his team that simulated the scene in order to blackmail the security agency.
igbo: Ugbua, ka e mesiri ihe ngosi na-eme ihere n' ime 'Federal High Court' n' Abuja n' ụbọchị Fraịdee, ndị aka ha dị na ya enwetala ụfọdụ mmadụ ibusa akụkọ ụmụaka na akụkọ n' atọghị ụtọ na ọ bụ Omoyele Sowore na ndị otu ya cheputara ihe merenụ iji mebie aha ndị ọrụ nchekwa.

english: Unfortunately, one of my friends, Mallam Jaji, is part of those peddling this narrative.
igbo: Ọ na-ewute m ikwu, otu n' ime ndị enyi m, Mallam Jaji, so na ndị na-ebusa akụkọ a.

english: I have told him on his wall that with his position, l'm afraid of him.
igbo: Agwala m ya na n' ụdị ọnọdụ a, ụjọ ya na-atụ m.

english: I can't feel comfortable being friends with people like this.
igbo: Obi agaghị eru m ala ibu enyi ndị dị otú a.

english: In fact, l would have to unfriend him.
igbo: N' ezie, m ga-ewepụ ya na ndị enyi m.

english: It's as serious as that.
igbo: O siri ike ruo otu ahụ.

english: We are not just Facebook friends, we are friends in real life.
igbo: Anyị abụghị enyi nanị na Facebook, anyị bụkwa enyi n' ihe.

english: But not anymore.
igbo: Mana ọ bụghịzi ọzọ.

english: There are certain irreducible minimums I can tolerate from people l call my friends.
igbo: Onwere ụfọdụ ihe agaghị ebelatanwu m nwere ike inagidere ndị mmadụ m kpọrọ ndị enyi m.

english: This is not about holding a contrary view but peddling falsehood to save face after such a despicable conduct of Friday.
igbo: Nke a abụghị maka ịhụta ihe n' ụdị dị iche mana ọ bụ ibusa ụgha iji zọrọ isi onwe ka e mesiri omume jọgburu onwe ya ụbọchị Fraịdee.

english: You can go ahead to continue retailing your false narrative in order to mask an obvious fact but l also reserve the right to distance myself from such 'friends'.
igbo: I nwere ike ịga n' ihu na-ebusa akụkọ ụgha gị iji kpuchie ihe ghe anya oghe mana àkà m nwere ikike iwezuga onwe m n' ndị enyi dị otu a nọ.

english: I'm not emotional about severing relationship with such people.
igbo: Ọ naghị emetụta m n' uche ịkwụsị mmekọrịta ndị dị otu a.

english: As l often posit, this issue is not about Sowore as a person but about principle.
igbo: Dị ka m na-ekwu mgbe ụfọdụ, ihe a abụghị maka onye Sowore bụ kama ọ bụ maka ụkpụrụ.

english: Thugs Shoot Two Children In Edo During Political Rally
igbo: Ndị akpụ obi gbara ụmụaka abụọ egbe n' Edo n' oge nnukwu ọgbakọ ndọrọndọrọ.

english: The thugs shot sporadically into the air to scare away loyalists heading to Osagie Ize-Iyamu's house for the All Progressives Congress rally at Etete, GRA, Benin.
igbo: Ndị akpụ obi a gbakanyere egbe n' ikuku iji tinye ụjọ n' ahụ ndị nwere mmasị na-aga n' ụlọ Osagie Ize-Iyamu maka nnukwu ọgbakọ 'All Progressives Congress' n ' Etete, GRA, Benin.

english: Two teenage boys in Edo State were hit by stray bullets on Friday morning as thugs invaded the city during a political rally.
igbo: Ụmụ nwoke ga-adị afọ iri na ụma n' Edo Steeti ka mgbọ gahiere ụzọ tụrụ n' ụtụtụ Fraịdee dị ka ndị akpụ obi jupụtara n' obodo a n' oge nnukwu ọgbakọ ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị.

english: The thugs shot sporadically into the air to scare away loyalists heading to Osagie Ize-Iyamu's house for the All Progressives Congress rally at Etete, GRA, Benin.
igbo: Ndị akpụ obi a gbakanyere egbe n' ikuku iji tinye ụjọ n' ahụ ndị nwere mmasị na-aga n' ụlọ Osagie Ize-Iyamu maka nnukwu ọgbakọ 'All Progressives Congress' n ' Etete, GRA, Benin.

english: The two kids, Ovbiagele Ohimai and Joshua Samuel, who are seven and 11 respectively, were sent on an errand by their parents when they were hit by stray bullets.
igbo: Ụmụaka abụọ a, Ovbiagele Ohimai na Joshua Samuel, bụ ndị gbara afọ asaa na afo iri, ka nne na nna ha ziri ozi mgbọ gahiere ụzọ wee tụ ha.

english: They are receiving treatment in an undisclosed private hospital in Benin presently.
igbo: Ha na-ara ọgwụgwọ n' ụlọ ọgwụ onwe a kpọghị aha ya ugbua.

english: Many of Ize-Iyamu's loyalists, who were conveyed from the 18 local government areas of the state, sustained various degrees of bullet wounds as a result of the incident.
igbo: Ọtụtụ n' ime ndị ihe Ize-Iyamu n' amasị, ndị e siri n' okpuru ọchịchị 18 nke Steeti ahụ kpọkọba, nwetara mmeru ahụ mgbọ dị iche iche nke sitere n' ihe a merenụ.

english: Tinubu All Smiles As Sanwo-Olu Receives Certificate Of Return
igbo: Tinubu na-amụrị dị ka Sanwo-Olu na-anara asambodo nhọpụta.

english: 'Our resolve to lead the state as Governor and Deputy Governor is not about our personal welfare and that of our families, but a determination to build a state that all of us will be proud of,' Sanwo-Olu said.
igbo: 'Mkpebi anyị idu steeti dị ka Gọvanọ na Osote Gọvanọ abụghị maka ọdịmma nke onwe anyị na nke ndị ezinaụlọ anyị, kama ọ bụ mkpebi siri ike iguzobe steeti anyị niile ga-enwe afọ ojuju na ya,' Sanwo-Olu kwuru.

english: 'We will not disappoint Lagosians for the confidence reposed in us to lead on their behalf.
igbo: 'Anyị agaghị emechu ndị Legosi ihu na ntụkwasị obi ha nwere n' anyị ịchị n' ihi ha.

english: We promise to lead a government that will be responsible and that will work for the greater majority of residents.'
igbo: Anyị na-ekwe nkwa idu gọọmenti ga-ama ọrụ dịịrị ya na nke ga-arụ ọrụ maka ọtụtụ mmadụ bi na Legosi.'

english: Bola Tinubu, National Leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), was the most notable name in attendance as Babajide Sanwo-Olu, the Lagos State Governor-Elect, and his running mate Obafemi Hamzat received their certificates of return from the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) at a ceremony held at the commission's office in Yaba, Lagos Mainland, on Friday.
igbo: Bola Tinubu, onye ndu nke 'All Progressives Congress (APC)' ala anyị bụ aha a ma ama nọ ebe ahụ dị ka Babajide Sanwo-Olu, Gọvanọ Legosi Steeti a họpụtara ọhụrụ, na onye òtù ya Obafemi Hamzat naara asambodo nhọpụta n' aka 'Independent National Electoral Commission (INC) n' emume were ọnọdụ n' ụlọ ọrụ Komishọn na Yaba, Lagos Mainland, n' ụbọchị Fraịdee.

english: Clad in Agbada with caps to match, the Governor-elect and his deputy were accompanied to the carnival-like event by their wives, associates, family members and APC leaders, including the party chairman in Lagos, Hon. Tunde Balogun; party leader, Prince Tajudeen Olusi; and former Minister of State for Defence, Senator Musiliu Obanikoro, among others.
igbo: O yi agbada na okpu ha abụọ bụ otu, Gọvanọ a họpụtara ọhụrụ na Osote ya ka e sonyere na mmemme dịka ngagharị ngosi bụ ndị nwunye ha, ndị òtù ha, ndị ezinaụlọ na ndị ndu APC, tinyere onyeisi oche pati na Legosi, Hon Tunde Balogun; onye ndu pati, Prince Tajudeen Olusi; na onye jibu ọkwa Minista nke Steeti maka Nchekwa, Sinetọ Musiliu Obanikoro, n' ime ndị ọzọ.

english: At exactly 11:30am, INEC National Commissioner in charge of Lagos, Ondo and Ogun states, Dr. Adekunle Ogunmola, presented the certificate to Sanwo-Olu, charging the Governor-Elect to be magnanimous in victory.
igbo: N' elekere 11:30 nke ụtụtụ kpọmkwem, 'INEC National Commissioner' na-ahụta maka Legosi, Ondo na Ogun Steeti, Dr. Adekunle Ogunmọla, nyere Sanwo-Olu asambodo, na-agwa Gọvanọ a a họpụtara ọhụrụ ka o gosi umeala na mmeri.

english: Sanwo-Olu received the certificate in company of his wife, Ibijoke.
igbo: Sanwo-Olu naara asambodo a na nsonyere nwunye ya, Ibijoke.

english: Ogunmola charged Sanwo-Olu and Hamzat to pursue reconciliation and close ranks with their opponents, reminding them that tolerance of opposition remains a key foundation of constitutional democracy.
igbo: Ogunmola gwara Sanwo-Olu na Hamzat ka ha gbaso ndozi ma mee ka ha ndị ncha zọrọ ọchịchị dị n' otu, na-echetara ha na ịnabata Mbuso agha bụ otu ihe dị na ntọala iwu ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya.

english: The state's Resident Electoral Commissioner (REC), Sam Olumekun, described Sanwo-Olu's victory as rancour-free, noting that international observers adjudged the Lagos governorship election to be free, fair and credible.
igbo: 'Resident Electoral Commissioner' nke Legosi Steeti, Sam Olumekun, kọwara mmeri Sanwo-Olu dị ka ihe enweghi ọgba aghara ọbụla n' ime ya, na-ekwu na ndị nleta Ozuruuwa kwuputara na ntụli aka gọvanọ nke Legosi Steeti gosiri enweghi ụta, ịdị mma na ikwesi ntụkwasị obi.

english: Pointing out that 45 political parties fielded governorship candidates in the election, Olumekun, however, lamented apathy among voters in some constituencies.
igbo: O kwuru na òtù ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị 45 wepụtara ndị zọrọ ọkwa gọvanọ na ntụli aka ahụ, Olumekun, ka ọ sila dị, kwara arịrị banyere enweghi mmasị n' etiti ndị na-atụ votu na mpaghara ụfọdụ.

english: He particularly made a reference to Eti-Osa Constituency 1, which recorded a four per cent voter turnout — a development he described as unprecedented.
igbo: Ọ rụtụrụ mpaghara Eti-Osa 1 aka karịsịa, nke nwere ntụgharịpụta pesent anọ ndị na-atụ votu---- mpụtara nke ọ kọwara dị ka ihe enwebeghi ụdị.

english: In his six-minute acceptance speech, Sanwo-Olu promised to lead 'an all-inclusive government', while extending a hand of fellowship to his opponents in the governorship race.
igbo: N' nnabata ya o kwuru na nkeji isi, Sanwo-Olu kwere nkwa iduzi 'gọọmenti onye ọbụla ga-esonye', ebe ya ga-agbasa aka mkpakọrịta nye ndị ha na ya zọrọ ọkwa gọvanọ.

english: He expressed joy that his victory was not tainted by violence and bloodshed.
igbo: O gosiri obi añụrị na mmeri ya abụghị nke e merụrụ site ọgba aghara na ịkwafu ọbara.

english: He specially paid tribute to President Muhammadu Buhari and Tinubu for displaying 'responsible leadership', which 'led to victory of APC in Lagos and the centre'.
igbo: O bunyere Onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari na Tinubu ụkpa ekele n' ụzọ pụrụ iche maka igosi 'ọchịchị kwesiri ntụkwasị obi', nke 'mere APC ji nwee mmeri na Legosi nakwa n' etiti.'

english: He said: 'Our resolve to lead the state as Governor and Deputy Governor is not about our personal welfare and that of our families, but a determination to build a state that all of us will be proud of.
igbo: Ọ kwuru: 'Mkpebi anyị idu steeti a dị ka Gọvanọ na Osote Gọvanọ abụghị maka ọdịmma nke onwe anyị na nke ndị ezinaụlọ anyị, kama ọ bụ mkpebi siri ike iguzobe steeti anyị niile ga-enwe afọ ojuju na ya.

english: We will not disappoint Lagosians for the confidence reposed in us to lead on their behalf.
igbo: Anyị agaghị emechu ndị Legosi ihu na ntụkwasị obi ha nwere n' anyị ịchị n' ihi ha.

english: We promise to lead a government that will be responsible and that will work for the greater majority of residents.
igbo: Anyị na-ekwe nkwa idu gọọmenti ga-ama ọrụ dịịrị ya na nke ga-arụ ọrụ maka ọtụtụ mmadụ bi na Legosi.'

english: 'Whatever happened during the campaign period belongs to the past.
igbo: 'Ihe ọbụla mere n' oge ịchụ nta votu bụ ihe gara aga.

english: It's time for reconciliation and the state must move forward.
igbo: Ugbua bụ oge ndozi makana steeti a ga-agarịrị n' ihu.

english: Therefore, we will not engage anyone or group based on their political affiliation, ethnic nationality or whether they voted for us or not, we are all Lagosians and we will run a government that will work for all.'
igbo: Ya mere, anyị agaghị emeso onye ma ọ bụ òtù ọbụla omume banyere òtù ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị ọ dabeere na ya, agbụrụ o si pụta ma ọ bụ ma ọ tụnyere anyị ma ọ tunyeghiri anyị, anyị niile bụ ndị Legosi nke mere na anyị ga-agbaso amụma gọọmenti ga-arụ ọrụ maka onye ọ bụla.'

english: Tiwa Savage Celebrates 'Appearance' On Times Square Big Screen
igbo: Tiwa Savage na-eri oriri maka ịpụta na 'Times Big Screen.'

english: Capturing the video on her page, she said, 'New York Times Square, we did say worldwide release.'
igbo: N' iseta ihe onyonyo a na peeji ya, o kwuru, 'New York Times Square, anyị

english: Tiwa Savage, Nigerian music star, was ecstatic seeing herself on a billboard at the New York Times Square.
igbo: kwuru mweputa ụwa niile.'

english: The visibly joyous singer who posted a short video on her Instagrampage was seen screaming, 'Oh my God!' while she kept looking at thebillboard.
igbo: Tiwa Savage, ọgwụ egwu onye Naijiria a ma ama, jupụtara n' ọñụ maka ịhụ onwe ya na bọọdụ mkpọsa na 'New York Times Square.'

english: Capturing the video on her page, she said, 'New York Times Square, wedid say worldwide release.
igbo: Ọgụ egwu a añurị juru obi n' ụdị a na-ahụ anya onye tinyere obere ihe onyonyo n' 'Instagram' peeji ya ka a hụrụ ka ọ na-eti, 'Oh Chi m' ka ọ nọ na-ene anya na bọọdụ mkpọsa.

english: 'Tiwa's recently-released music video, 49-99, was played and advertisedon the big Times Square screen.
igbo: N' iseta onyonyo a na peeji ya, ọ kwuru, 'New York Times Square, anyị kwuru mweputa ụwa niile.

english: The mother of one was in the news recently for standing against Xenophobia.
igbo: Onyonyo egwu Tiwa wepụtara ọhụrụ na nso nso a, 49-99, ka a kpọrọ ma gbasa ozi ahịa ya na nnukwu ihuenyo' Times Square.' Onye a mụrụ bụ nne so otu nwa gbara n' akụkọ na nso a maka ikwugide ịtụ onye ọbịa ụjọ.

english: She had cancelled her planned appearance in South Africa following therecent xenophobic attacks in the country.
igbo: Ọ kagbuola ịkụ egwu ọ kwadoro na Saụt Afrịka maka mwakpo ndị ọbịa enwere n' obodo ahụ na nso a.

english: Trader Sues Saraki, Atiku For Portraying Her In Campaign Poster
igbo: Ọzụ ahịa gbara Saraki, Atiku akwụkwọ maka igosi ya na posta achụmnta votu.

english: She said her picture was taken without her consent and put to pubic use where she was portrayed like she was deprived and less privileged.
igbo: O kwuru na foto ya ka e were n' agwaghị ya agwa ma tinye n' ọha ebe e gosiri ya ka onye anaghara ihe na onye ụwa na-atụ n' ọnụ.

english: Amuda Adeleke, a trader in Victoria Island, Lagos, has sued Bukola Saraki, a former Senate President, who was also Director-General of the Atiku Abubakar Campaign Organisation for the 2019 general election, for portraying her in a poster as poor.
igbo: Amuda Adeleke, ọzụ ahịa na 'Victoria Island', Legosi, agbaala Bukola Saraki, onye bụbu onyeisi Sineti, bụrụkwa ọga kpata kpata nke nzukọ achụmnta votu Atiku Abubakar na ntụli aka ọha nke 2019 akwụkwọ, maka igosi ya ka ogbenye na posta.

english: Adeleke also joined in the suit Abukabar, his running mate, Peter Obi and the Peoples Democratic Party.
igbo: Adeleke tinyekwara onye ya na Abubakar soro zọọ ọkwa, Peter Obi, na ndị ' Peoples Democratic Party' n' akwụkwọ ọ gbara.

english: She said her picture was taken without her consent and put to pubic use where she was portrayed like she was deprived and less privileged.
igbo: O kwuru na foto ya ka e were n' agwaghị ya agwa ma tinye n' ọha ebe e gosiri ya ka onye anaghara ihe na onye ụwa na-atụ n' ọnụ.

english: The suit, which was filed before the Federal High Court in Ikoyi, Lagos, is praying the court to award N45m damages to the plaintiff for the unauthorised and unlawful use of her photographs.
igbo: Akwụkwọ a, nke a gbara na 'Federal High Court na Ikoyi' , Legosi, na-arịọ ụlọ ikpe ka e nye onye gbara akwụkwọ nde N45 maka anataghị ikike na iji foto ya mee ihe n' ụzọ iwu n' akwadoghi.

english: She explained through the court papers that Saraki and his campaign crew had come to Victoria Island during the election to canvass for votes, adding that she was not aware that the photographs taken would become a part of PDP's campaign souvenir
igbo: Ọ kọwara site n' akwụkwọ ụlọ ikpe na Saraki na ndị òtù achụmnta votu ya abịala 'Victoria Island' n' oge ntụli aka ịchụ nta votu, ọ gbakwunyere na ya amaghị na foto e sere ga-eso n' ihe ncheta achụmnta votu PDP.

english: She said she was shocked when she started receiving phone calls from relatives and friends, who had seen the campaign billboards on which her photo was displayed.
igbo: O kwuru na akpata oyi nwụrụ ya ka ndị ikwu na ibe na ndị enyi ya, ndị hụrụla bọọdụ mkpọsa achụmnta votu nke e gosiri foto ya na ya, bidoro kpọwa ya n' ekwe nti.

english: However, Saraki and the other respondent denied that they had any contact with the woman.
igbo: Ka o sina dị, Saraki na ndị ọzọ na-azara ọnụ ha gọrọ na ha amaghị nwaanyị a.

english: The respondents argued that their campaign materials were managed by a third party, and that the company sought her consent and interviewed her before using her pictures.
igbo: Ndị nzara ọnụ rụrụ ụka na ọ bụ onye ọzọ hụtara maka ngwongwo achụmnta votu ha, na ụlọ ọrụ a rịọrọ nkwenye ya ma gbakwa ya ajụjụ ọnụ tupu ha ewere foto ya mee ihe.

english: The respondents said she had given her name as Tope Olukolu.
igbo: Ndị nzara ọnụ ha kwuru na ọ nyere aha ya dị ka Tope Olukolu.

english: They also claimed she was paid before her photographs were used.
igbo: Ha kwukwara na a kwụrụ ya ụgwọ tupu e were foto ya mee ihe.

english: The court has now adjourned the case to January 2020 for the continuation of hearing.
igbo: Ụlọ ikpe yighariri Jenụwarị 2020 maka nsochi ịnụ ikpe a.

english: Train Crushes Two Lying On Rail Track To Death In Kano
igbo: Ụgbọ okporoìgwè kwọriri mmadụ abụọ dina n' okporoìgwè na Kano

english: A statement by the Kano state Police Command Spokesman, DSP, Abdullahi Haruna said: 'Tuesday at about 8:00hrs, report received by the Police, that two yet to be identified persons, who were lying on the rail track, were crushed by a moving train behind Kano club.
igbo: Okwu nke ọnụ na-ekwuru Ụlọ ọrụ ndị uweojii na Kano steeti, DSP Abdullahi Haruna kwuru: 'Ụbọchị Tuzdee n' ihe dịka awa 8:00, ndị uwe ojii nwetara akụkọ, na mmadụ abụọ a mabeghi ndị ha bụ, ndị dina n' okporoìgwè, ka ụgbọ okporoìgwè na-aga aga kwọriri n' azụ Kano 'club.'

english: A moving train has crushed two persons to death in Kano.
igbo: Ụgbọ okporoìgwè na-aga aga kwọriri mmadụ abụọ na Kano.

english: According to a witness, the tragic incident occurred very early on Tuesday along a rail line behind Kano Club in Nasarawa Local Government area of the city.
igbo: Dị ka onye akaebe kwuru, ọdachi a dapụtara n' ụzọ ụtụtụ n' ogologo okporoìgwè n' azụ Kano 'club' nke dị n' okpuru ọchịchị Nasarawa nke obodo ahụ.

english: The witness also said the victims of the accident were lying down on the rail trail and oblivious of the approaching train until it crushed them.
igbo: Onye akaebe kwukwara na ndị ihe mberede a dakwasara dina n' okporoìgwè n' amaghị n' ụgbọ okporoìgwè na-abịa ganye mgbe ọ kwọriri ha.

english: A statement by the Kano state Police Command Spokesman, DSP, Abdullahi Haruna said: 'Tuesday at about 8:00hrs, report received by the Police, that two yet to be identified persons, who were lying on the rail track, were crushed by a moving train behind Kano club.
igbo: 'Okwu nke ọnụ na-ekwuru Ụlọ ọrụ ndị uweojii na Kano steeti, DSP Abdullahi Haruna kwuru: 'Ụbọchị Tuzdee n' ihe dịka awa 8:00, ndị uwe ojii nwetara akụkọ, na mmadụ abụọ a mabeghi ndị ha bụ, ndị dina n' okporoìgwè, ka ụgbọ okporoìgwè na-aga aga kwọriri n' azụ Kano 'club.'

english: 'The Police's visit showed that one of the victims was cut into two parts. The bodies have been evacuated to the hospital.'
igbo: 'Nleta ndị uwe ojii gosiri na e kere otu n' ime ndị ihe a metụtara ụzọ abụọ. E bugaala ozu ha n' ụlọ ọgwụ.'

english: Trump's Trial Or Triumph? By Hannatu Musawa
igbo: Nke Trump ọ bụ ikpe ka ọ bụ mmeri? Nke si n' aka Hannatu Musawa.

english: The latest Ukraine scandal was triggered by President Trump's alleged efforts to coerce Ukraine and other countries to provide damaging information about the 2020 Democratic Party candidate Joe Biden.
igbo: Nkwụtọ Ukraine nke ikpeazụ a ka e kwuru na ọ bụ mgbali nke onyeisi ala Trump ịmanye Ukraine na mba ndị ọzọ iweta ọmụma jọgburu onwe ya banyere onye ji 'Democratic Party' azọ ọkwa na 2020, Joe Biden kpalitere ya.

english: President Trump was said to have pressured his personal lawyer, Rudy Giuliani, Attorney General, Bill Barr and other parties outside his administration to influence politics in Washington. The 2016 Presidential election scandal also has not disappeared.
igbo: Onyeisi ala Trump ka e kwuru na ọ manyela ọkaiwu nke aka ya, Rudy Giuliani, Ọkaiwu izugbe, Bill Barr, and ndị ọzọ n' anọghị n' ọchịchị ya ka ha nwe mmetụta nye ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị na Washington. Nkwụtọ ntụli aka onyeisi ala nke 2016 apụbeghi.

english: Hannatu Musawa
igbo: Hannatu Musawa

english: A near impossible and rare feat is to impeach a United States' president.
igbo: Ihe dị ka ihe ekweghị omume na ihe dị ụkọ bụ ịchụtu onyeisi ala mba Amerịka.

english: The president must have committed, either bribery, treason or other serious crimes or misdemeanors.
igbo: Onyeisi ala a narịrị ngarị ma ọ bụ, gbaa mgba okpuru ma ọbụ mpụ ndị ọzọ siri ike ma ọ bụ na ọ dara iwu.

english: Even at that, in the present clime, it is almost impossible to believe that the Republican members of Congress in the Senate would pass such a bill if presented with one by the lower House of Representatives.
igbo: Ọ bụrụgodu otu a, ka ihu igwe dị ugbua, ọ dị ka ihe ekweghi omume ikweta na ndị òtù 'Republican' nọ na 'Congress' na sineti ga-ekwe ka a nabata ụdị iwu a ma ọ bụrụ na ụlọ nnọchiteanya nke nta wetara ha ya.

english: After the American civil war and President Abraham Lincoln's death, his Vice President, Andrew Johnson became the 17th president of the US, Johnson, had radical ideas and constantly was at loggerheads with the Congress by vetoing certain bills.
igbo: Ka a lụsịrị agha ndị nkịtị n' Amerịka na ọnwụ Onyeisi ala Abraham Lincoln, osote ya, Andrew Johnson bụrụ onyeisi ala nke 17 nke US, Johnson nwere echiche nnupụisi ma na-enweta ọgba aghara n' aka ndị 'congress' kwa mgbe maka ịkwado ụfọdụ iwu.

english: In 1867 when he replaced the Secretary of War, Edwin Stanton, a man appointed by Lincoln who supported the Radical Republicans, a breakaway group of the party who believed in the civil rights of freed African Americans, Congress pushed hard and presented eleven articles of impeachment alleging that President Johnson had violated what is known as the 'Tenure of Office Act', that is, a law meant to limit presidential power to remove federal appointees from office without consulting the Senate.
igbo: N' 1867 mgbe o dochiri ode akwụkwọ nke agha, Edwin Stanton, nwoke Lincoln wepụtara onye kwadoro nnupụisi ndị 'Republican', otu ndị si ná pati gbọwara ndị kwenyere n' ikike dịrị onye ndị Afrika-Amerika nwerela onwe ha, 'congress' gbalịsiri ike ma weta isiokwu iri na otu nke nchụtụ n' ọkwa na-ekwu na Johnson e metọọla ihe a mara dị ka 'Tenure of office act', nke pụtara iwu e mere maka ibelata ikike onyeisi ala nwere iwepu ndị gọọmenti etiti họpụtara n' ụlọ ọrụ n' emeghị ka sineti mara.

english: Eventually, in 1868, President Johnson was successfully impeached by a two- thirds majority of the House. This act was deemed unconstitutional years later by the Supreme Court.
igbo: N' ikpeazụ, n' afọ 1968, a chụturu onyeisi ala Johnson n' ọchịchị site ọnụ Ọgụgụ ka ụba nke abụọ n' ụzọ atọ. Ka ọtụtụ afọ gasịrị ụlọ ikpe ukwu hụtara omume a dị ka ihe usoro iwu ọchịchị obodo akwadoghi.

english: President Johnson was not removed from office because a single vote from seven Republicans who voted with the Democrats saved his position.
igbo: E wepughi Onyeisi ala Johnson n' ọchịchị makana nanị otu votu nke si n' aka ndị 'Republican' asaa nke so ndị Democrat tụnyere ya zọpụtara ọnọdụ ya.

english: A Historian, Hans L. Trefousse wrote, 'The weakness of the case convinced many that the charges were largely political and that the violation of the Tenure of Office Act constituted neither a crime nor a violation of the Constitution but merely a pretext for Johnson's opponents.'
igbo: Otu onye akụkọ ihe mere eme, Hans L. Trefousse dere, 'Adịghị ike okwu a doro ọtụtụ mmadụ anya na ebubo n' ụzọ dị ukwuu bụ maka ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị nakwa na nnupụisi na' Tenure of office act ' esoghị n' ime mpụ nke ọ n' abụ ịnụpụ isi n' usoro iwu ọchịchị obodo kama nanị ngosiputa ndị ihu ha na Johnson echeghi.'

english: Interestingly, this historic case set the tone in Washington for future Presidential impeachments to follow, namely that no President should ever be impeached for political reasons but should be impeached for 'treason, bribery or other high crimes and misdemeanors' as clearly stated by the U.S. Constitution.
igbo: N' ịkpali mmasị, akụkọ ihe mere eme a tọrọ ụkpụrụ ịchụtu onyeisi ala na Washington n' ọdịnihu ga-ana eso, ya bụ na onweghi onyeisi ala a ga-achụtu n' ihi ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị kama maka ihi 'ịgba mgba okpuru, iri ngarị ma ọ bụ mpụ dị elu ndị ọzọ na ịda iwu' dị ka usoro iwu ọchịchị U. S. kwuru n' doro anya.

english: Using the same paintbrush of which hunting for political reasons, the White House has repeatedly dismissed claims by the Democrats that top government officials had pressured leaders of other nations, namely Ukraine, to investigate the former U.S. Vice President and 2020 Democratic Presidential Candidate Joe Biden and his son, Hunter Biden, in the personal and political interest of President Trump.
igbo: N' iji otu iko nke nchụgharị n' ihi ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị wee ma, 'White House' enepula anya ugboro ugboro n' ebubo ndị 'Democrat' na ndị isi ọchịchị amanyela ndị ndu nke mba ndị ọzọ, n' ịkpọ aha Ukraine, inyocha osote onyeisi ala U. S. mbụ na onye ga-azọrọ ndị 'Democrat' ọkwa onyeisi ala n' afọ 2020, Joe Biden, na nwa ya nwoke, Hunter Biden, na mmasị nke onwe nakwa nke ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị nke onyeisi ala Trump.

english: President Trump has been quoted publicly as bragging that the Democrats have 'no grounds to impeach.'
igbo: E kwuola ihe onyeisi ala Trump kwuru n' ihu ọha dị ka itu ọnụ na ndị 'Democrat' 'enweghị ebe mgbakwasị ụkwụ iji chụtu ya.'

english: He claims he has done 'nothing wrong or illegal' in light of the formal impeachment proceedings against him recently.
igbo: 'Ọ na-ekwu na onweghi ihe ọjọọ ma ọ bụ ihe iwu n' akwadoghi ya mere' banyere okwu iwu nchụtụ a na-ekwu megide ya na nso a.

english: In 1972, when the Watergate scandal broke, the 37th president of the US, Richard, Nixon struggled to cover up his direct involvement in the burgling and trespassing of the Democratic National Committee (DNC) headquarters at the Watergate office complex in Washington.
igbo: N' afọ 1972, mgbe nkwụtọ Watergate pụtara ìhè, onyeisi ala US nke 37, Richard Nixon, gbalịrị ikpuchi ka aka ya si dị kpọmkwem n' mgbaka na njehie isi ụlọ ọrụ 'National Democratic Committee' dị na ụlọ ọrụ Watergate na Washington.

english: The scandal was intertwined with multiple cases of abuse of power of officials of the Nixon administration, which culminated in the commencement of an impeachment process against him.
igbo: Nkwụtọ a na ọtụtụ mmetọ ike ọchịchị nke ndị ji ọkwa ọchịchị n' ọchịchị Nixon nwere njikọ chiri anya, nke digidere ruo n' ibido usoro nchụtu megide ya.

english: Apart from the overwhelming evidence of cash found on the five burglars of the DNC headquarters leading back to Nixon's Staff, the investigation revealed that President Nixon had a tape recording system in his offices where private conversations were recorded.
