english: Analysis by The Guardian of the document titled: 'Trend Analysis on Complaint Received from January to October 2019 in Consumer Affairs Bureau, 'showed that for the period under review, 18, 717 complaints were received via the 622 channel; 764 through the consumer portal; 315 via social media and 181 written words.
igbo: Nnyocha nke ndị Guardian nke akwụkwọ akpọrọ: Nnyocha na mkpesa enwetara site na Jenụwarị ruo Ọktọba 2019 na ụlọ Ọrụ Ahịa, ' gosipụtara maka oge a na-enyocha, 18, 717 natara mkpesa site na ọwa 622; 764 site na ụzọ ahia; 315 site na mgbasa ozi mmekọrịta na 181 okwu edere.

english: Of the 19,977 complaints, NCC was able to resolve 13, 282 while others are pending.
igbo: N'ime mkpesa 19,977, NCC nwere ike idozi 13, 282 ebe ndị ọzọ na-eche .

english: Compared to 2018, there was a major leap in complaint resolution this year.
igbo: Tụnyere 2018, enwere nnukwu nkwupụta maka mkpesa afọ a .

english: The Guardian checks showed that across the channels in 2018, about 40, 380 complaints were received, while 24,281 got resolved.
igbo: Akwụkwọ nyocha nke Guardian gosipụtara na n'ime ọwa niile na 2018, anabatara mkpesa 40, 380, ebe ekpebiri 24,281 .

english: The regulator claimed an average of 96.66 percent complaint resolution rate as against 57.65 percent in 2018 just as the contact center confirmed a 39.01 percent improvement.
igbo: Onye na-ahụ maka njikwa kwuru na ọnụego mkpesa dị 96.66 megidepasent 57.65 na 2018 dị ka etiti kọntaktị ahụ gosipụtara nkwalite pasent 39.01.

english: For complaints from the consumer portal, there was also a leap from the 65.5 percent record of 2018 to 88.07 per cent in 2019, representing a 22.57 per cent progress.
igbo: Maka mkpesa sitere na ọnụ ụzọ ahịa, enwere ngagharị site na ndekọ pasent 65.5 nke 2018 ruo pasent 88.07 na 2019, na-anọchite anya ọganihu pasent 22.57.

english: Progressively, the social media platforms advanced from 50.56 per cent in 2018 to 74.93 per cent this year with complaint resolution posting a 24.37 per cent improvement.
igbo: Na-aga n'ihu, nyiwe mgbasa ozi na-elekọta mmadụ toro site na pasent 50.56 na 2018 ruo pasent 74.93 afọ a na mkpebi mkpesa mmelite pasent 24.37.

english: However, for petitions, the scorecard fell with the commission acknowledging 53.22 percent as against the 86.47 percent tally of 2018, indicating a 33.25 percent decline.
igbo: Agbanyeghị arịrịọ, akara dara na kọmiti ahụ na-ekwenye pasent 53.22 dị ka nke megidere pasent 86.47 nke 2018, na-egosi ọdịda 33.25 dara ada.

english: Speaking on the document, the NCC Executive Vice Chairman, Prof. Umar Danbatta, explained that the exercise was geared towards harnessing extant policies, regulations and guidelines for the protection, information, education and empowerment of telecommunications consumers in Nigeria.
igbo: Mgbe ọ na-ekwu na akwụkwọ a, onye isi NCC Onye isi oche, ọkammụta Umar Danbatta kọwara na mmega ahụ bụ nke a na-eche ihu iji jigharịrị usoro iwu, ụkpụrụ maka nchedo, ozi, agụmakwụkwọ na ike nke ndị na-ere ọkụ na Naịjirịa.

english: Dr Okpala noted that adequate measure was in place to check participants in the ongoing police Games in the state.
igbo: Dọkịnta Okpala kwuru na ọnọdụ zuru oke iji wee nyochaa ndị sonyere na egwuregwu ndị uwe ojii na-aga n'ihu na steeti ahụ.

english: According to him, anyone who comes in from China should stay indoors for two weeks; if he has fever should report immediately to any health facility across the state.
igbo: Dịka o siri kwuo, onye ọ bụla nke si China bata n'ime ụlọ nọrọ izu abụọ; ma ọ bụrụ na ọnya ahụ ga-aga ụlọ ọgwụ ike n'ofe steeti ahụ ozugbo.

english: The commissioner said that it was because of high surveillance that made it possible to detect a victim of the virus in Lagos.
igbo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwuru na ọ bụ n'ihi nyocha dị elu mere ka ọ nwee ike ịchọpụta onye butere nje ahụ na Legos.

english: There are processes and structures that have been installed to fish out anyone who is infected with the virus.
igbo: E nwere usoro na arụnyere iji chọpụta onye ọ bụla bu nje.

english: Wash your hands regularly with soap, use hand sanitizers, keep a safe distance from anyone coughing or sneezing, avoid crowds and maintain good respiratory hygiene.
igbo: Jiri ncha na-akwọ aka gị mgbe niile, na-eji ihe ga-eme ka aka gị dị ọcha, na-anọ ebe dị anya nye ​​onye ọ bụla na-ata ụta ma ọ bụ na-amị amị, zere ìgwè mmadụ ma na-adị ọcha nke iku ume.

english: Cover your mouth and nose with your elbow when coughing or sneezing, stay indoors, if you feel unhealthy with symptoms such as fever, cough and difficulty in breathing,' he urged.
igbo: ' Jiri mkpuchi gị kpuchie ọnụ gị na imi gị mgbe ị na-arịa ụkwara ma ọ bụ mgbe ọsụsọ, nọrọ n'ụlọ, ọ bụrụ na enwee ahụike adịghị ọcha, dị ka ahụ ọnya, ọnya na nsogbu iku ume, ' ka ọ gbara ume.

english: Anambra 2020 Budget: Accelerating infrastructure development, youth entrepreneurship - a clarion call to support Gov. Obiano
igbo: mmefu ego ANAMBRA 2020: ịkwado uto oganihu, azụmahịa ndị ntorobia - oku ana-akpụ iji kwadoo gọvanọ Obiano.

english: In many societies, especially the under-developed, the bane of underdevelopment is usually poor human resource capacity, poor policy initiative and inadequate infrastructure to support and facilitate growth and development.
igbo: N'ọtụtụ obodo, ọkachasị ndị mepụtara emepe, nsogbu nke enweghi ike na-abakarị ike mmadụ inweta ọrụ, amụma adịghị mma yana akụrụngwa ezughi oke iji kwado ma kwalite mmepe.

english: Inadequate infrastructure is also a result of poor policy formulation, faulty implementation of programmes as well as poor execution of projects.
igbo: Akụrụngwa na-ezughi oke bụ nsonazụ usoro iwu na-ezighi ezi, mmejuputa iwu na-ezighi ezi yana mmebi nke ọrụ adịghị mma.

english: At the mention of infrastructure development, the human mind readily goes to provision of access and motorable roads, regular electricity supply; provision of portable water.
igbo: N'ikwu banyere mmepe akụrụngwa, uche mmadụ na-agara ngwa ngwa ụzọ nnweta na okporo ụzọ, ọkụ eletrik mgbe niile; inye obere mmiri.

english: Indeed, infrastructure means the basic facilities: services and installations needed for the effective and efficient functioning of a community, state or country. Consequently, the need for basic infrastructure cuts across all areas of human endeavour.
igbo: N'ezie, akụrụngwa pụtara ụlọ ọrụ bụ isi: ọrụ na nrụnye achọrọ maka arụmọrụ bara ụba nke ọma n'otu obodo, steeti ma ọ bụ obodo. N'ihi nke a, mkpa akụrụngwa na-ebepu akụkụ niile mmadụ na-agba.

english: In Government, Budget is a statement or itemised summary of intended expenditures, usually coupled with expected revenue. The Budget is a social contract between the Government and the people. The budget, also spells out Government proposed recurrent and capital expenditures for a given period, usually a year.
igbo: Na gọọmentị, Mmefu ego bụ nkwupụta ma ọ bụ nchịkọta nke mmefu ezubere, yana agakọ ego a na-atụ anya ya. Mmefu ego bụ nkwekọrịta ọhaneze n'etiti gọọmentị na ndị mmadụ. Mmefu ego a, na-ekpughere mmefu nke gọọmentị chọrọ maka nlọghachị na mmefu ego maka oge ụfọdụ, ọ na-abụkarị otu afọ.

english: The performance and success of a budget depends on the realisation of the projected revenue targets and their efficient and effective implementation.
igbo: Mmezu na mmefu nke mmefu ego na-adabere na mmezu nke ebumnuche ego a na-atụ anya inweta na mmejuputa ha nke ọma.

english: Central Bank of Nigeria's (CBN) governor Godwin EmefieleA: Accidentally, the United States Central Bank – The Federal Reserve – stumbled on a powerful monetary policy tool in the 1920s.
igbo: Gọọmentị isi ala ụlọ akụ nke Naịjirịa (CBN) Godwin EmefieleAgba na mberede, ụlọ akụ etiti United States - Fedra Resav - sụrụ ngọngọ na ngwá ọrụ nchịkwa ego dị egwu na 1920s.

english: After the First World War, the new regional Federal Reserve banks found they had almost no financial relationship with the banks they were supervising in their regions.
igbo: Mgbe Agha Mbụ gasịrị, ndị ụlọ ọrụ Federa Resav mpaghara ọhụrụ chọpụtara na ha enweghị ego na ụlọ akụ ha na-elekọta na mpaghara ha.

english: The implication of this was that these Federal Reserve banks could not generate any revenues to carry out their most basic obligations.
igbo: Ihe pụtara na nke a bụ na ụlọ akụ Federa resav a enweghị ike iwepụta ego ọ bụla iji wee rụọ nnukwu ọrụ ha.

english: Central Bank of Nigeria's (CBN) governor Godwin Emefiele.
igbo: Gọọmentị isi ala ụlọ akụ nke naịjirịa (CBN) Godwin Emefiele.

english: In a bid to find other ways of earning money, early in 1992, the Federal Reserve banks started buying government bonds from banks so they could at least earn some interest.
igbo: N'ịchọ ụzọ ndị ọzọ ha ga-esi nweta ego, na mbido 1992, ụlọ akụ Federa resav malitere ịzụ nkekọ gọọmentị site na ụlọ akụ ka ha wee nwee ike inweta ma ọ dịkarịa ala.

english: It soon discovered something interesting – as it bought the government securities from the banks, the banks reserves were boosted.
igbo: N'oge na-adịghị anya, ọ chọpụtara ihe na-atọ ụtọ - ebe ọ na-azụta nchekwa nke gọọmentị n'aka ụlọ akụ, na-eme ka nkwalite nke ndị nwe ụlọ akụ kwalite.

english: The second order effect of this was that interest rates started to come down as the banks all had more money to deploy.
igbo: ụzọ nke abụọ si mee nke a bụ na ọnụego ọmụrụ nwa bidoro gbadata ka ụlọ akụ niile nwekwuru ego iwebata.

english: Thus the Federal Reserve figured out that when credit was scarce and interest rates were high, it could buy up government securities from the banks to boost liquidity and lower those rates.
igbo: Federa resav si kọwaa na mgbe akwụmụgwọ dị ụkọ na ọmụrụ nwa dị elu, ọ nwere ike zụta nchekwa gọọmentị site na ụlọ akụ iji bulie oke mmiri na belata ọnụego ndị ahụ.

english: By extension the reverse was also true – when there was too much money in circulation and interest rates were too low, it could sell government securities to banks.
igbo: Site na ndọtị, mgbanwe a bụkwa eziokwu - mgbe enwere nnukwu ego na mgbasa ma na ọmụrụ nwa dị ntakịrị, ọ nwere ike renye nchedo gọọmentị n'ụlọ akụ.

english: By May 1922, the Federal Reserve decided to formalize this process and create what was called the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) to coordinate how this new powerful tool was to be used and when.
igbo: Tupu Mee 1922, Federa resav kpebiri imepụta usoro a wee mepụta ihe akpọrọ Kọmitii ahịa mepere nke isi ala (FOMC) iji hazie otu a ga-esi rụọ ngwá ọrụ ọhụrụ a dị egwu na mgbe.

english: These days Open Market Operations (OMO) is nothing new of course but in 1922 one can only imagine how innovative they were.
igbo: mmepe ahịa nke ụbọchị ndị a (OMO) na-arụ ọrụ n'ahịa ọhụrụ (OMO) abụghị ihe ọhụụ mana ọ bụ na 1922 mmadụ nwere ike iche n'echiche etu ha si arụ ọrụ.

english: All of a sudden there was a market tool which could be used as a lever to control interest rates without having to use any other crude methods.
igbo: Na mberede, enwere ngwa ahịa nke enwere ike iji dị ka onye na-achịkwa iji belata ọnụego ọmụrụ nwa na-ejighị ụzọ ọjọọ ndị ọzọ.

english: Over the last 100 years since the invention of this tool, Central Banks across the world have borrowed and deployed it in their own countries to achieve the same goal of managing the supply of credit in the economy and interest rates in general.
igbo: N'ime otu narị afọ gara aga kemgbe mmalite nke ngwa a, ụlọ akụ ala n'ofe ụwa agbaziri ma bufee ya na mba nke ha iji nweta otu ebumnuche nke ijikwa kredit nke akụ na ụba na ọmụrụ nwa n'ozuzu ya.

english: Until the coming of the Great Godwin Emefiele, Nigeria's Central Bank governor, that is.
igbo: Ruo mgbe ọbịbịa onye dị ike Godwin Emefiele, gọvanọ ụlọ akụ nke ala Naịjirịa, bụ ya.

english: In the last 2 or so years in Nigeria, the meaning of OMO has been completely redefined.
igbo: N'ime afọ abụọ gara aga ma ọ bụ karịa na Naịjirịa, a kọwapụtara nkọwa nke OMO kpamkpam.

english: The name remains the same and in the Central Bank's annual activity report, it still says that the purpose of its OMO activity is 'to moderate the excess banking system liquidity'.
igbo: Aha a ka bụ otu ihe si kwa na akụkọ nke ụlọ akụ isi ala kwa ụbọchị, o ka na ekwu na ebumnuche nke ọrụ OMO bụ 'ime ka usoro ụlọ akụ dị nma'.

english: On the face of it, that sounds like the same thing the US Fed discovered almost 100 years ago.
igbo: N'akụkụ ya, nke ahụ na-ada ka otu ihe ahụ US Fed chọpụtara n'ihe dị ka otu narị afọ gara aga.

english: But when you dig deeper into what is going on in Nigeria, you see something totally different.
igbo: Mana mgbe imubanye n'ime ihe ndị na-eme na Naịjirịa, ị na-ahụ ihe dị iche.

english: The first thing is to ask a simple question – how come CBN's OMO involves foreign investors? Much of the securities being sold by the CBN to 'mop up' excess liquidity in the banking system is being bought by foreign investors.
igbo: Ihe mbu bu iju ajuju - kedu ihe CBN si OMO si tinye ndị nnochita ala ozo? Ọtụtụ ndị nchekwa nke ndị CBN na-ere iji 'dozie oke mmiri dị na usoro nchekwa ụlọ akụ na-azụta n'aka ndị si mba ofesi.

english: Has the CBN finished mopping up the liquidity in Nigeria that it is now mopping up foreign liquidity as well? As anyone who has been following events knows, what happens is that the CBN sells securities to foreign investors at 'mouthwatering rates' that they cannot obtain elsewhere.
igbo: Ndi CBN emechaala mmiri dị na ala Naịjirịa na - emeziwanye mmiri si mba ọzọ? Dị ka onye ọ bụla nke na-eme ihe omume maara, ihe na-eme bụ na CBN na-eresị ndị nchekwa ala ọzọ nchekwa ego na 'ọnụ ọnụ' ha enweghị ike inweta ebe ọzọ.

english: Since these foreign investors only have dollars and the CBN's securities are denominated in naira, the CBN takes their dollars and exchanges it to naira for them.
igbo: Ebe ọ bụ na ndị ọchụnta ego ndị a si mba ọzọ nwere naanị dollar na ego mkpuchi nke CBN na naira, CBN na-ewere dollar ha ma gbanwere ya nye naira maka ha.

english: At the same time, it gives them a cast iron guarantee that when they need their dollars back in 1 years' time, it will sell it to them at an agreed rate no matter what the actual rate at that time is.
igbo: N'otu oge ahụ, ọ na-ekwe ha nkwa nke ihe nkedo na mgbe ha chọrọ dọla ha n'ime afọ 1, ọ ga-erere ha ya na ọnụego ekwenyere na agbanyeghị etu ọnụego ahụ n'oge ahụ dị.

english: These investors then take their naira and buy securities from the CBN and count their interest for one year.
igbo: Ndị a na - etinye ego na - ewere naira ha ma zụta nchekwa site na CBN ma gụpụta mmasị ha otu afọ.

english: In 2018 alone, CBN sold a total of N22.4trn ($62bn) worth of OMO securities ostensibly to 'mop up' excess liquidity.
igbo: Na 2018 naanị, CBN rere ọnụego N22.4trn ($ 62bn) nke nchekwa ego OMO ka ọ ga - eme ka ọ 'wụfuo mmiri.

english: Anambra State before the advent of All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA) was marred by chaos, armed robbery attacks, kidnapping, threat to life and, property as well as looting of public funds.
igbo: Steeti Anambra tupu mmalite nke All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA) bịara nwee ọgba aghara site na, mwakpo ndị oji egbe, nwantakịrị, egwu na ndụ, akụ na ịwe ụba nke ọha.

english: Was there really that much money sloshing around the Nigerian banking system that needed mopping up? At any rate, there was hardly any movement in interest rates during the year since the CBN itself needed to keep them high to keep attracting foreign investors to buy the securities.
igbo: Enwere nnukwu nsogbu ego na usoro ụlọ akụ na Naịjirịa chọrọ ịkwado? Ka o sina dị, enwebeghị mmegharị ọ bụla na ọnụego ọmụrụ nwa n'afọ ahụ n'ihi na CBN n'onwe ya kwesịrị idebe ha ka ọ dị elu iji nọgide na-adọta ndị na-etinye ego si mba ọzọ ịzụta nchekwa.

english: Herein is the final evidence that if the inventors of OMO were to reincarnate in Nigeria today, they would not recognise their own creation.
igbo: Nke a bụ akaebe ikpeazụ na-egosi na ọ bụrụ na ndị chepụtara OMO ga-alọ ụwa na Naịjirịa taa, ha agaghị anabata okike nke ha.

english: Nigeria's OMO does not mop up excess liquidity and does not have any effect on interest rates.
igbo: OMO nke Naịjirịa anaghị achịkwa oke mmiri ma ọ nweghị mmetụta ọ bụla na ọnụego ọmụrụ nwa.

english: So what is the best thing to call this redefined OMO? Nigeria owes the foreign investors who buy the OMO securities and it owes them in dollars.
igbo: Yabụ kedu ihe kacha mma ịkpọ OMO a akọwapụtara? Naijirịa ji ndị mbịarambịa si mba ọzọ ụgwọ zụrụ nchekwa OMO ma ji ya na dọla.

english: The CBN has merely found a way to increase Nigeria's external debt using what Diezani Alison-Madueke famously called 'non transparent opacity'.
igbo: CBN achọtala ụzọ iji bulie ụgwọ mpụga nke Naịjirịa site na iji Diezani Alison-Madueke a ma ama akpọrọ 'non transperent opesity'.

english: When you go to the Debt Management Office (DMO) website, what you see on the front page is FG's share of Nigeria's foreign debt that currently stands at $21bn.
igbo: Mgbe ị gara na webụsaịtị ụlọ ọrụ nhazi ụgwọ (DMO), ihe ị na-ahụ na peeji ihu bụ òkè FG nke ụgwọ mba ofesi na Naịjirịa nke dị ugbu a na $ 21bn.

english: As the CBN's OMO is mostly short term for 1 year, it is hard to tell how much the outstanding balance is.
igbo: Dịka OMO nke CBN na-abụkarị obere oge maka afọ 1, ọ bụ ihe siri ike ịkọ ego ole pụtara ìhè.

english: But whenever the CBN decides to make this figure public, we should be honest enough to treat it as what it really is by adding it to the figure of Nigeria's external debt.
igbo: Mana mgbe ọ bụla CBN kpebiri ime ka ọnụ ọgụgụ a pụta n'ihu ọha, anyị kwesịrị ịkwụwa aka ọtọ iji were ya dị ka ọ bụ n'ezie site na itinye ya na ọnụ ọgụgụ nke mpụga ụgwọ nke Naịjirịa.

english: The Administration 1999-2003 was handcuffed, emasculated and strangulated to make way for celebrated looting of the Treasury, through the instrumentality of Irrevocable Payment Standing Order'.
igbo: Edebere gọọmentị 1999-2003 n'aka, ikeọbụ, mmechi iji mee emume ịkwakọrọ Akụ nke Ego, site na ngwa nke 'Irrevocable Payment Standing Order'.

english: Mr. Michael Akinwale is the General Manager of Rally Trade, an international online broker.
igbo: Maazị Michael Akinwale bụ onye njikwa ọhụụ na Rally Trade, onye na-ere ahịa ntanetị mba ofesi.

english: This paved the way for Government activities to be hijacked, and the state legislature attacked on the orders of Political Godfathers'. Salaries could not be paid. Ecological funds were not left out by the ravaging Political Godfathers.
igbo: Nke a meghere ụzọ maka izochi ihe ndị gọọmentị na-eme, ndị omeiwu steeti wakporo iwu nke ' Ndokwa Ọchịchị ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị '. A gaghị akwụ ụgwọ ọnwa. Ndị nna nna ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị na-emebi ihe ahapụghị ego ebe obibi.

english: In this interview with BENJAMIN ALADE, he speaks on opportunities in brokerage business, the need for Nigerians to have multiple streams of income and a regulatory environment for online brokers.
igbo: N'ajụjụ ọnụ ha na BENJAMINE ALADE, ọ na-ekwu okwu banyere ohere dị na azụmaahịa, mkpa ọ dị maka ndị Naịjirịa inwe ọtụtụ iyi ego ha na-enweta na usoro nchịkwa maka ndị na-ere ahịa n'ịntanetị.

english: What is Rally Trade all about?.
igbo: Kedu ihe ahịa Rally pụtara?

english: Rally Trade is a financial service brokerage company.
igbo: Rally Trade bụ ụlọ ọrụ na-akpata mmefu ego.

english: We have a platform where people can trade in global financial markets.
igbo: Anyị nwere usoro ebe ndị mmadụ nwere ike ịre ahịa n'ahịa ego ụwa.

english: It means looking at the global stock market- New York Stock Exchange, London Stock Exchange, French exchange, German exchange and other platforms where you can trade directly from Nigeria.
igbo: Ọ pụtara ire ahịa ụwa ọnụ- mgbanwe ahịa New York , mgbanwe ahịa London, mgbanwe French, mgbanwe Germany na usoro ndị ọzọ ebe ị nwere ike zụọ ahịa na Naịjirịa.

english: You can trade currencies, euro, pounds, and dollar.
igbo: Nwere ike gbanwere ego, uro, pawnd na dọla.

english: We all know that prices from each country are always fluctuating, which means you can trade them against themselves to make money.
igbo: Anyị niile maara na ọnụahịa nke mba ọ bụla na-agbanwe mgbe niile, nke pụtara na ị nwere ike zụọ ha megide onwe ha iji nweta ego.

english: Lastly, commodities- gold, cocoa, aluminium, rubber, not in their physical form, but virtual form, are all on the market platform.
igbo: Nke ikpe azu, ahia- gold, koko, alumini, roba, ọbụghị n'udi aru ha, kama udiri ihe, ha nile di n'elu ahia.

english: What do you see in Nigeria's economy at the moment?.
igbo: Kedu ihe ị hụrụ na akụnụba Naịjiria ugbu a ?.

english: Well, based on our own business, it is a good time to be in Nigeria and the reason is that we are going through a transition period.
igbo: Ọ dị mma, dabere na azụmahịa anyị, ọ bụ oge dị mma ịnọ na Naịjirịa na ihe kpatara ya bụ na anyị na-agafe oge mgbanwe.

english: We are in a serious problem now.
igbo: Anyị nọ n'oké nsogbu ugbu a.

english: First, people that have one job will find that the job alone can't help them again.
igbo: Na mbu, ndị nwere otu ọrụ ga-achọpụta na naanị ọrụ ahụ agaghị enyere ha aka ọzọ.

english: Secondly, there's no job, even for young and old alike.
igbo: Nke abuo, odighi oru, ọbụna dị ma ndị ntorobia ma ndị okenye.

english: We are in a time where we should be creating opportunities to solve the problems.
igbo: Anyị nọ n'oge anyị kwesịrị iwepụta ohere iji dozie nsogbu ndị ahụ.

english: This will mean creating several other sources of income that people never know about.
igbo: Nke a ga - apụta ịmepụta ụzọ ọzọ esi enweta ihe mmadụ na - amaghị.

english: It is a good time to be in business because we are now helping people now to start making money from a source they never thought existed.
igbo: Ọ bụ oge dị mma iji nọrọ n'azụmahịa n'ihi na anyị na-enyere ndị mmadụ aka ugbu a ịmalite ịkpata ego n'ebe ha na-echeghị na ọ dị.

english: While I was in school, I didn't know anything called trading, though it was existing, but because at that time, there was no technology to bring it here.
igbo: Mgbe m nọ n'ụlọ akwụkwọ, amaghị m ihe ọ bụla akpọrọ azụmaahịa, n'agbanyeghị na ọ dị adị, mana n'ihi na n'oge ahụ, enweghị teknọlọji wetara ya ebe a.

english: There was no Internet and mobile phone, so the trading could not come to Nigeria.
igbo: Enweghị intanetị na ekwentị mkpanaka, ya mere azụmaahịa ahụ abịaghị na Naịjirịa.

english: But now that the technology is here and everyone has a mobile phone, it's a good time to be in the business.
igbo: Mana ugbu a teknọlọji dị ebe a ma onye ọ bụla nwere ekwentị, ọ bụ oge dị mma ịnọ na azụmahịa ahụ.

english: Is the business related to foreign exchange trading?.
igbo: Azụmaahịa metụtara azụmahịa mgbanwe mba ọzọ?

english: That word foreign exchange (forex) is just one part of the market.
igbo: Mkpụrụ ego mba ọzọ gbanwere (forex) bụ naanị otu akụkụ nke ahịa ahụ.

english: If I say currency, I mean forex.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na m kwuo mkpụrụ ego, m na-ekwu Forex.

english: But somebody can be trading indices, that is not trading financial currency.
igbo: Mana mmadụ nwere ike na-azụ ahịa ihe, nke ahụ abụghị azụmaahịa ego.

english: So, foreign currency is just a part of the market and the business we do, not the whole market.
igbo: Yabụ, ego mba ofesi bụ naanị otu akụkụ nke ahịa na azụmaahịa anyị na-eme, ọ bụghị n'ahịa niile.

english: What opportunities for this business exist in Nigeria?.
igbo: Kedu ohere ndị dị na azụmahịa a na Naịjirịa?

english: There is great potential.
igbo: Enwere ikike dị ukwuu.

english: For any young person, I see the business as a career.
igbo: Maka ndị na-eto eto ọ bụla, m na-ahụ azụmaahịa dịka ọrụ.

english: There's something about making money, but the other side is the career, something that you can be proud of and would want others to be part of.
igbo: Onwere ihe gbasara inweta ego, mana akụkụ ọzọ bụ ọrụ aka, ihe inwere ike inya isi na ichoro ka ndị ọzọ soro na ya.

english: What is the role of technology in business operations?.
igbo: Kedu ọrụ teknọlọji dị na arụmọrụ azụmahịa ?.

english: Without mincing words, technology now is the bedrock of businesses.
igbo: Na-enweghị okwu ntinye, teknọlọji bụzi nnukwu azụmahịa.

english: Any company that is not technology-driven is headed for disaster.
igbo: ụlọ ọrụ ọ bụla na-ejighị nkà na ụzụ na-aga na-ebute mbibi.

english: Whenever we do our seminars, we always show people the fact that in the last 10 years, companies like Exxon Mobil, Shell, China Petroleum, were the biggest in the world then.
igbo: Mgbe ọ bụla anyị na-eme nzukọ ọmụmụ ihe anyị, anyị na-egosi ndị mmadụ eziokwu mgbe niile na afọ iri gara aga, ụlọ ọrụ dịka Exxon Mobil, Shell, China Petroleum, bụ ndị kasị ibu n'ụwa mgbe ahụ.

english: The biggest companies in the world now are Google, Microsoft, Apple.
igbo: ụlọ ọrụ kachasị ukwuu n'ụwa ugbu a bụ Google, Microsoft, na Apple.

english: Former classmates of President Muhammadu Buhari visited him in Daura, on Friday.
igbo: Onye ya na onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari gụkọrọ akwụkwọ bịara leta ya na Daura ụbọchị fraịde.

english: President Muhammadu Buhari played host to various groups, while in his hometown, Daura, in Katsina State, on Friday.
igbo: Onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari kpụrụ ndị ọbịa otu dị iche iche n'obodo ya na Daura, Kastina steeti ụbọchị fraịde

english: The President was in his hometown during the week for the Sallah celebration.
igbo: Onye isi ala nọ n'obodo ya n'izu ahụ maka emume ekpere alakụba.

english: Among those who visited him were his former classmates; Chief Felix Idiga, Chairman of Good Governance Ambassadors of Nigeria (GOGAN); Chairmen of Association for Local Governments in Nigeria (ALGON), Katsina State; Members of the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN), Katsina State chapter; representatives of the Kano Traders Association, and representatives of five local governments in Daura Emirate.
igbo: Ndị so bịa nleta gunyere ndị ya na ha gụkọrọ akwụkwọ Felix Idiga, onye isi oche maka ọchịchị ọma ndị n'anọchị obodo Naijiria n'mba ọzọ. ndị isi oche otu jikọrọ ndị ime obodo dị na Nijiria, Katsina Steeti; ndị otu jikọrọ ndị otu Kraist na Naijiria (CAN), nke Katsina Steeti; ndị nnọchị anya ndị na-azu ahịa nke Kano na ndị nnọchị anya ime obodo ise dị na Daura.

english: Photographs of the visit were tweeted by Garba Shehu, the President's Senior Special Adviser on Media and Publicity. President Buhari received different Groups in Daura Katsina State earlier today, 24th Aug 2018*President Buhari with Former Classmates — Garba Shehu (@GarShehu) August 24, 2018
igbo: Garba Shehu bụ onye ndụmọdụ onye isi ala maka mgbasa ozi na mgbasa ozi twita gosiri foto nlete a. Onye isi ala Buhari nabatara ndị otu dị iche iche na Daura Katsina Steeti na mbido taa, 24 Ọgọst, 2018. Onye isi ala bụ Buhari na ndị ya na ha so gaa akwụkwọ.

english: President Buhari received different Groups in Daura Katsina State earlier today, 24th Aug 2018*President Buhari with Former Classmates
igbo: Onye isi ala Buhari nabatara ndị otu dị iche iche na Daura Katsina steeti na mbido taa, 24 Ọgọst,2018. Onye isi ala na ndị ya na ha gụkọrọ akwụkwọ

english: He left Daura for Abuja on Saturday morning.
igbo: Ọ hapụrụ Daura gawa Abuja n'ututu Satọde

english: Buhari Not Bothered About Criticisms By US, UK -Femi Adesina
igbo: Buhari enweghi nkụja gbasara nkatọ ndị US, UK -Femi Adesina

english: He also said the Nigerian Government would pay no concern to the ultimatum issued by a group of civil societies.
igbo: O kwukwara na gọọmentị Naịjirịa agaghị ege ntị na iwu nke ndị otu nkịtị nyere

english: Femi Adesina, Special Adviser to President Muhamadu Buhari on Media and Publicity, has said the Nigerian Government was not bothered by criticisms from the United States, United Kingdom and European Union over human rights violations in Nigeria.
igbo: Femi Adesina onye ndụmọdụ pụrụ iche nye onye isi ala Muhamadu Buhari na mgbasa ozi, ekwuola na gọọmentị Naịjirịa atụghị ụjọ banyere nkatọ ndị mba Unaited steeti, Unaited Kindom na Uropian Uniọn gbasara mmegide iwu banyere mmadụ na Naịjirịa.

english: Speaking on Channels Television, Adesina said, 'We are not answerable to the US, UK or EU.
igbo: N'ikwu okwu na onyonyo nke Chanel, Adesina kwuru 'Anyị anaghị aza ajụjụ US, UK ma ọ bụ EU'.

english: We are Nigeria, a sovereign country.
igbo: Anyị bụ ndị obodo Naịjirịa, mba kwụrụ onwe ya.

english: Those countries and entities have issues of their own.
igbo: Obodo na otu ndị ahụ nwere nsogbu nke ha.

english: Let them deal with their issues.
igbo: Ka ha mezie nsogbu nke ha

english: Let Nigeria also deal with her internal issues.
igbo: Ka mba Naịjirịa meziekwa nke ha.

english: We are not answerable to them.
igbo: Anyị agaghị aza ha ajụjụ.

english: He also said the Nigerian Government would pay no concern to the ultimatum issued by a group of civil societies.
igbo: O kwukwara na gọọmentị Naịjirịa agaghị ege ntị na iwu ndị otu nkịtị nyere.

english: He said that genuine issues will be looked into.
igbo: O kwuru na a ga-eleba anya na nsogbu ndị dị mkpa.

english: We have had instances in which the government had to reverse itself because there were concerns raised.
igbo: Anyi enwego oge gọọmentị gbanwere mkpebi ya makana enwere nsogbu.

english: It shows that the government is responsive but you cannot listen to a babble .
igbo: O gosiri na gọọmentị na-azahachi ngwangwa mana ịgaghị ege ntị na ihe na-enweghị isi.

english: It will distract you from what you are doing .
igbo: Ọ ga emegharị gị anya n'ihe ị na-eme.

english: Adesina also said that Prof Wole Soyinka, who had been a vocal critic of the lawlessness of the administration, was entitled to his opinion.
igbo: Adesina kwukwara na Ọka mmụta Wole Soyinka, onye bụbu onye na-ekwusi ike na mmebi iwu nke ọchịchị ahụ nwere ike ịnwe uche nke ya.

english: He added, We respect Prof Soyinka .
igbo: Ọ gbakwunyere, 'anyị na-asọpụrụ ọka mmụta Soyinka.

english: You don't have too many of them in the country or even on the continent.
igbo: E nweghị ọtụtụ n'ime ha n'obodo ma ọ bụ na kọnịnentị.

english: He is an avatar and he is well respected but his opinion will remains his opinion.
igbo: Ọ bụ odogwu na onye a na-akwanyere ugwu nke ukwuu ma uche ya ga abụgide uche ya.

english: It will be considered and if there are things to act on, we will act on them .
igbo: A ga-atụle ya ma ọ bụrụ na enwere ihe anyị ga-eme, anyị ga-eme ya.

english: Buhari sets aside Nigeria's problems, celebrates 30 years of marriage with wife, Aisha .
igbo: Buhari wezugara nsogbu Naịjirịa wee mee emume afọ 30 nke alụmdi na nwunye ya bụ Aisha.

english: On Monday, President Muhammadu Buhari 'temporarily set aside' Nigeria's many problems to celebrate 30 years of marriage with his wife, Aisha .
igbo: N'ụbọchị Mọnde, onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari wezugara nsogbu Naịjirịa wee mee emume afọ 30 alụmdi ya na nwunye ya bụ Aisha.

english: In a tweet on the President's verified Twitter handle, Buhari posted a photograph of himself and the First Lady of Nigeria during their younger days together .
igbo: Na akara twita nke onye isi ala, Buhari gosiri foto ya na nwunye onye isi ala Aisha mgbe ha bidoro dịka okoro na agbọghọ

english: In reference to the photo in the tweet, Buhari said, 'Today, on our 30th wedding anniversary, I pray for Allah's continued peace and blessings in our home and family.' Today, on our 30th Wedding Anniversary, I pray for Allah's continued peace and blessings in our home and family. — Muhammadu Buhari (@MBuhari) December 2, 2019
igbo: N'ihe banyere foto ahụ na twit, Buhari kwuru 'Taa, alụmdi na nwunye anyị gbara afọ 30, a na m ekpe ka udo na ngọzi nke Chukwu ga n'ihu na ezinụlọ anyị .'

english: Today, on our 30th Wedding Anniversary, I pray for Allahâs continued peace and blessings in our home and family.
igbo: Taa, alụmdi na nwunye anyị gbara afọ 30, a na m ekpe ka udo na ngọzi nke Chukwu ga n'ihu na ezinụlọ anyị .

english: Aisha, who has sometimes criticised her husband's government, also pushed those hard feelings aside to celebrate the milestone on her Twitter handle by posting a short video captioned '30 years of togetherness .
igbo: Aisha onye na-akatọ gọọmentị di ya mgbe ụfọdụ kwapụrụ obi ụfụ ndị ahụ iji mee emume ije a na akara twita ya site n'itinye ihe nkiri dị mkpirimkpi isi okwu ya bụ 'Njịkọ ọnụ 30'.

english: Buhari Slowing Down Nigeria's Progress – Ondo Cleric
igbo: Buhari n'egbochi agamn'ihu Naijiria - Ụkọchukwu Ondo

english: Speaking at a programme on Thursday in Akure, Giwa said the ruling All Progressives Congress government led by Buhari had made Nigerians regret voting them into power in 2015 due to its unfriendly polices.
igbo: Mgbe ọ na-ekwu okwu na mmemme ụbọchị Tọzdee na Akure, Giwa kwuru na mkpebi ndị gọọmentị All Progressive Congress n'okwu bekee nke Buhari na-edu mere ka ndị Naịjirịa kwaa ụta maka ịtụnyere ha vootu n'ọchịchị na 2015 n'ihi ụkpụrụ adighị mma.

english: Senior Pastor of Awaiting The Second Coming Of Jesus Christ, a church based in Akure, Ondo State, Adewale Giwa, has said President Muhammadu Buhari was slowing down Nigeria's wheel of progress of Nigeria following his continued silence on human rights abuses and violation of court orders under his watch.
igbo: Onye isi nchụ-aja nke ndị na-eche ọbịbịa nke abụọ nke Jizọs Kraịst, otu ụka dị na Akure. O kwuru na ya na-agbagha usoro ọganihu nke Naijiria na-esochi ịgbachi nkịtị banyere mpụ ndị ruuru mmadụ na imebi iwu ụlọikpe n'okpuru nche ya .

english: Speaking at a programme on Thursday in Akure, Giwa said the ruling All Progressives Congress government led by Buhari had made Nigerians regret voting them into power in 2015 due to its unfriendly polices.
igbo: Mgbe ọ na-ekwu okwu na mmemme ụbọchị Tọzdee na Akure, Giwa kwuru na mkpebi ndị gọọmentị All Progressive Congress n'okwu bekee nke Buhari na-edu mere ka ndị Naịjirịa kwaa ụta maka ịtụnyere ha vootu n'ọchịchị na 2015 n'ihi ụkpụrụ adighị mma.

english: He said, Nigeria is a blessed country but the leaders have failed to walk on God's paths.
igbo: O kwuru na 'Naịjirịa bụ obodo agọziri agọzi mana ndị ndu ajụ iso ụzọ nke Chukwu.

english: If you are not a wicked leader, you would not have been watching your tribe killing another tribe without bringing them to justice.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na ị bụghị ajọ onye ndu, ịgaghị na-eleli ebo gị n'emeghị ka ikpe ruo ha

english: If you are a good leader, you would not have jailed innocent people and allowed killers to move freely in the country .
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na ị bụ ezigbo onye ndu, ịgahị atụ ndị aka ha dị ọcha nga na-ekwu ka ndị na-egbu mmadụ na-aga n'enweghi mgbochi obula n'obodo .

english: If you are a God-fearing man, you would have fulfilled all the promises you made during the electioneering campaigns .
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na ị bụ nwoke na-atụ egwu Chukwu, ị ga-emezu nkwa niile I kwere n'oge mgbasa ozi nhọpụta gị .

english: This style of leadership is slowing down Nigeria's progress .
igbo: Udi ọchịchị a n' egbochi agamnihu Naijiria .

english: Buhari's Fight Against Corruption Profoundly Disappointing - Ex-Presidential Adviser
igbo: Agha Buhari na-ebu megide mpụ bụ nke na emechu iru - Onye bụbu Onye ndụmọdụ Onye-Isi Ala

english: A former political adviser in the Presidency, Dr Usman Bugaje, has described President Muhammadu Buhari's fight against corruption as one that is profoundly disappointing.
igbo: Onye bụbu onye ndụmọdụ ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị na Onye isi ala, Dr Usman Bugaje akọwaala ọgụ Onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari megide mpụ bụ nke na-emechu iru nke ukwu .

english: Bugaje said this while speaking at the 25th anniversary of the Serikin Fulani of Lagos State, Dr Mohammad Bambado II.
igbo: Bugaje kwuru nke a mgbe ọ na-ekwu okwu na ncheta afọ iri abụọ na ise nke Serikin Fulani nke Lagos State, Dr Mohammad Bambado II .

english: Bugaje also condemned the incessant attacks by Boko Haram sect in the country, incompetent politicians whose only way of winning is through manipulation of religion and ethnicity .
igbo: Bugaje katọrọ mwakpo ọjọọ nke ndị otu Boko Haram na-eme na mba ahụ, ndị ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị na-enweghị isi nke otu ụzọ ha ga-esi merie bụ site na iji nkewa nke okpukpe na agbụrụ.

english: He said every Nigerian must be worried that the fight against corruption was being lost .
igbo: O kwuru na onye Naijiria ọ bụla ga-enwe mgbaka arụ na ọgụ a na-alụ megide mpụ bụ na-efu.

english: He stated, The fight against corruption is, to say the least profoundly disappointing .
igbo: O kwuru, ọgụ a na-alụ megide mpụ, n' ikwu ya n' obere, na emechu ihu .

english: He urged the government to find a lasting solution to rising unemployment in the country, saying if not arrested, it poses a big threat to the country, Daily Trust reports.
igbo: Ọ gbara gọọmentị ume ka ọ chọta ihe usoro ga-adịgide maka enweghị ọrụ na-arịwanye elu na mba ahụ, na-ekwu na ọ bụrụ na ejideghị ya, ọ bụ nnukwu ihe iyi egwu na mba ahụ, Daily Trust na-akọ.

english: Buhari's Secret Emissaries To Sowore Proved Mission Impossible By Bayo Oluwasanmi
igbo: Ndị ozi-nzuzo nke Buhari zigaara Sowore gosịrị na ọ bụ ozi agaghị aga - site n'aka Bayo Oluwasanmi

english: President Buhari's emissaries to Sowore proved mission impossible because the history of tyranny is also the history of its eventual defeat.
igbo: Ndị ozi President Buhari na Sowore gosipụtara na ọ gaghị ekwe omume n'ihi na akụkọ ntanetị nke ọchịchị aka ike bụkwa akụkọ banyere mmeri ya mechara mezuo .

english: The Great King of Persia was checked at Marathon and Salamis.
igbo: Egochiri Eze Ukwu Pesia na Marathon na Salamis .

english: Napoleon was checked at Waterloo.
igbo: Egbochinwuru Napoleon na Waterloo .

english: Hitler was checked on D-Day.
igbo: Egbochiri Hitler na D-Day .

english: The Soviet Empire collapsed .
igbo: Ọchịchị Soviet dara .

english: The tyrant dies and his rule is over, the martyr dies and his rule begins . - Soren Kierkegaard
igbo: Onye ọchịchị aka ike nwụrụ, ọchịchị ya adaa, onye nwụrụ n'ihi okwukwe ya nwụrụ, ọchịchị ya amalite - Asiren Kierkegaard

english: Last week, Premium Times reported that President Muhammadu Buhari on two separate occasions sent secret emissaries to Omoyele Sowore in the Department of State Services ' gulag 'to extract a commitment from him to back down on the 'revolution now' protest as a precondition for his release ' .
igbo: Na ngwụcha izu, Premium Times kọrọ na Onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari zigaara ndị ozi-nzuzo na Ọrụ 'gulag' iji wepụta nkwa sitere n'aka ya ịkwado ngagharị iwe 'ugbu a' dịka ihe mgbochi maka ya hapụ ' .

english: Similarly, those who engage in the sale of these items are also warned to desist from such business as buyers, users and sellers are culpable under the law.
igbo: N' otu aka ahụ a na-adọ ndị na-etinye aka na ire ihe ndị a aka na ntị ka ha zere azụmaahịa dịka ndị na-azụ ahịa, ndị na-eji ya eme ihe, ndị na-ere ahịa dị n'okpuru iwu.

english: He added that the police was ready to secure the lives and properties of citizens and residents of the state during Yuletide.
igbo: Ọ gbakwụnyere na ndị uwe ojii adịla njikere maka nchekwa ndụ na ihe onwunwe nke ụmụ amaala na ndị bi n'steeti n'oge ekeresimesi.

english: Climate Change: Ministry Of Environment, Eko Carbon Exchange Partner To Reduce Emission In Nigeria
igbo: Mgbanwe ihu igwe: ulo oru na ahu makagburugburu ebe obibi, onye otu ga agbanwe ikuku kabọ belata na Naịjirịa

english: The initiative, which was announced during the 2019 United Nations Climate Change Conference of Parties in Madrid, Spain, also aims to achieve net-zero emissions by 2030.
igbo: Ebumnuche nke ekwuputara n'afọ 2019, oge ogbako mgbanwe ihu igwe nke otu mba ụwa na ndị òtù na Madrid, Spain, na-ezube iji nweta nhichapụ ikuku site na 2030.

english: In a bid to reduce the effects of climate change in Nigeria and indeed the entire African continent, the Federal Ministry of Environment and other government agencies have partnered with Eko Carbon Exchange to achieve the target.
igbo: Na nkwenye iji belata nsonaazụ mgbanwe ihu igwe na Naịjirịa na mba Afrika dum, ụlọ ọrụ gọọmentị etiti na-ahu maka gburugburu ebe obibi na ụlọ ọrụ gọọmentị ndị ọzọ na mgba Eko kabon jikoro iji mezuo ebumnuche.

english: The initiative, which was announced during the 2019 United Nations Climate Change Conference of Parties in Madrid, Spain, also aims to achieve net-zero emissions by 2030.
igbo: Ebumnuche nke ekwuputara n'afọ 2019, oge ogbako mgbanwe ihu igwe nke otu mba ụwa na ndị òtù na Madrid, Spain, na-ezube iji nweta nhichapụ ikuku site na 2030.

english: The UN Conference in Spain attracted African and international experts and sustainability actors including from Nigeria, who all discussed how to protect the continent from the harsh effects of climate change.
igbo: Mgbakọ otu mba ụwa na Spain dọtara ndị ọkachamara n' Afrika na mba ụwa na ndị na-eme ihe nkwado gụnyere ndị si Naijirịa tụlere otu esi echekwa kọntinent na mmetụta ọjọọ nke mgbanwe ihu igwe.

english: Managing Director of Eko Carbon Exchange, Mr Innocent Azih, disclosed that the initiative, being the first in West Africa, was mobilising to harness the opportunities in low-carbon development across all economic sectors in Nigeria, starting with solid waste and transport sectors.
igbo: Onye na-ahụ maka nhazi mgbanwe kabon Eko, mazị Innocent Azih kpughere na atụmatụ a bụ nke mbụ na ọdịda Afrika , na-achịkọta onwe ya iji jigide ohere dị na mmepe nke obere kabon gafere mpaghara akụ na ụba na Naijiria, na-amalite site na mkpofu siri ike na mpaghara njem.

english: He said this will also serve as a regional vehicle for mobilising finance for low-carbon economic development for West African economies through the Clean Development Mechanism.
igbo: O kwuru na nke a ga-adịkwa ka ụgbọ mpaghara a maka ịkpọkọta ego maka nkwalite ego obere-kabon maka ọdịda anyanwu site na nkwalite usoro ịdị ọcha.

english: Azih stated, 'The objective is to mobilise the necessary resource pool and low-carbon finance required for greening all economic sectors.'
igbo: Azih kwupụtara 'ebumnuche bụ ịchịkọta akụ dị mkpa yana ego obere kabon a chọrọ iji dozie ngalaba akụ niile.

english: Head of Climate Change Mitigation in the Ministry of Environment, Hajia Aisha Jibril, revealed the readiness of the ministry to work with the Exchange to enable Nigeria achieve the nationally determined contributions through projects implementation that are fully mainstreamed.
igbo: Onye isi nke mbelata onodu mgbanwe ihu igwe n'ụlọ ọrụ na-ahụ maka gburugburu ebe obibi oriaku Aisha Jibril, kpughere njikere nke ngalaba ahụ iji rụọ ọrụ iji mee ka Naijiria nweta mmezu ụtụ obodo dị iche iche na-atụ site na mmejuputa ọrụ e ji n'aka.

english: She described efforts made by the ministry to include policy incentives, education and awareness of actors through climate change desks at state levels, to development of the Nigerian carbon emission registry.
igbo: Ọ kọwara mbọ niile ụlọ ọrụ ahụ gbara iji tinye akwụkwọ amụma, mmụta na ịmara ndị na-eme ihe site na okpokoro mgbanwe ihu igwe na ọkwa steeti, na mmepe ndekọ kabon nke Naijiria.

english: She urged stakeholders to follow Eko Carbon Exchange's lead and partner with the ministry to ensure early realisation of the registry.
igbo: Ọ gbara ndị isi obodo ume ka ha gbasoo ụzọ ntụgharị kabon Eko ma soro ụlọ ọrụ ha jịkọọ aka iji hụ na oge ndekọ malitere n'oge.

english: Also speaking at the UN meeting, Chief Executive Officer of Natural Eco Capital, Dr Eugene Itua, in his submission noted that tremendous emission reduction programmes have been on in Lagos State through the replacement of outdated mass transport vehicles with more modern and energy-efficient buses.
igbo: N'ikwu okwu na nzukọ UN, onye isi ndị isi ala obodo Eko, Dkt. Eugene Itua, na ntinye ya kwuru na mmemme mbelata dị rii na Legos steeti site n'iji ụgbọ ọhụrụ dochie ụgbọ njem ndị ochie

english: Stakeholders noted that finance remained a major challenge to scaling green investments but suggested that the best approach was non-monetary strategy in which financing packages for low-carbon consumption comes with credit and insurance.
igbo: Ndị new obodo kwuru na ego kabụ nnukwu nsogbu iji bido ọrụ mana ha tụrụ alo na ụzọ kacha mma bụ atụmatụ enweghị ego eji etinye maka oriri kabon na-abịa na ịzụ n'aka na mkpuchi

english: Closure Of Border Cannot End Smuggling, ECOWAS Tells Nigeria
igbo: Mmechi oke ala agaghị akwụsi ịzụbata ihe ECOWAS na-agwa Naịjirịa.

english: Disagreeing with President Buhari, ECOWAS stated that the border closure would also affect the implementation of the Africa Continental Free Trade Area Act signed by the country.
igbo: N'ekweteghi na onye isi ala Buhari, ECOWAS kwupụtara na mmechi oke a ga-emetụta iwu mmejupụta azụmahịa anaghị ego nke kọntịnentị Afrika nke obodo ahụ binyere aka.

english: Nigeria Cameroon border
igbo: Oke Naijiria na Kemeron

english: The Economic Community Of West African States has told the Nigerian Government that closing its border with other neighbouring countries cannot prevent the smuggling of goods and products into Nigeria.
igbo: Otu jịkọrọ akụ mba ọwụwa anyanwụ nke Afrika agwala gọọmentị Naịjirịa na Mmechi oke ala agaghị akwụsi ịzụbata ihe na Naịjirịa.

english: President Muhammadu Buhari had announced the closure of the border, saying that it would prevent bringing products into the country illegally and also help boost the patronage of locally made products.
igbo: Onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari ekwupụtala mmechi okeala na-ekwu na ọ ga-egbochi ibubata ngwaahịa na obodo na-ezighi ezi ma nyekwa aka ịkwalite ngwaahịa nke obodo.

english: Disagreeing with President Buhari, ECOWAS stated that the border closure would also affect the implementation of the Africa Continental Free Trade Area Act signed by the country.
igbo: N'ekweteghi na onye isi ala Buhari, ECOWAS kwupụtara na mmechi oke a ga-emetụta iwu mmejupụta azụmahịa anaghị ego nke kọntịnentị Afrika nke obodo ahụ binyere aka.

english: In a statement on Tuesday, the bloc said,'The ECOWAS Parliament calls for compliance with community provisions and the reopening of borders and a coordinated fight against smuggling in the region.
igbo: Na nkwupụta na Tuzdee, òtù a kwuru na 'ọgbakọ omebe iwu ECOWAS kpọrọ oku ka ekwenye na usoro obodo yana imepe okeala na njikwa ọgụ megide ndị na-ezubata ihe na mpaghara obodo.

english: The root causes of this recurrent situation must be studied with a view to finding a permanent solution.
igbo: A ga-amụrịrị ihe na-akpata onodu a mgbe niile iji chọpụta ndozi ga adigide.

english: Comparing Omoyele Sowore's #RevolutionNow To Boko Haram Insurgency, A Needless Escalation By Kayode Ogundamisi
igbo: Itule 'mgbanwe ugbua Omoyele Sowore na nsogbu ndị Boko Haram, mkparịta na-enweghị isi - site na Kayode Ogundamisi

english: Now is the time for the government to stop the disobedience of court orders, no one is above the law including activists and people in government .
igbo: Ugbua bụ oge gọọmentị ga akwụsị ịnụpụrụ iwu ụlọ ikpe isi, enweghi onye ka iwu nkea gunyere ndị na-akwado ọrụ na ndị nọ na gọọmentị.

english: if you must prosecute Sowore and others then let it be open, free and transparent.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na a ga akpọgide Sowore na ndị ọzọ, aga eme ya n' ụzọ ghee anya oghe ma kwurukwa ọtọ, ma ziekwa ezie

english: Otherwise, thus far the state has made a mess of the case, this is looking more like persecution than prosecution.
igbo: Ewezuga nke a, ruo ugbua, steeti emebiela okwu a, nke a dizi ka mkpagbụ karịa ịnwụcha.

english: If the government has a thinking cap on, it will #FreeSoworeNow or at the least let the case in court continue without infractions .
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na gọọmentị nwere ikike iche echiche, ọ ga # atọpụ Sowore ugbu a ma ọ bụ opeka mpe hapụ ụlọ ikpe ka ha gaa n'ihu n'enweghi mmebi iwu obula .

english: I read the statement by the Presidency on the Sowore-Bakare treason trial.
igbo: A gụrụ m nkwupụta onye isi ala gbasara ikpe Sowore-Bakare .

english: This statement is a needless escalation, particularly the comparison with Boko Haram insurgency.
igbo: Okwu a bụ mmụba na-enweghị isi, ọkachasị ma e jiri ya tụnyere nsogbu ndị Boko Haram.

english: If the allegations are completely true, why is the Department of State Services disobeying court orders?
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na ebubo ahụ bụ eziokwu, gịnị kpatara na ngalaba nke ọrụ gọọmentị ji enupụrụ iwu ụlọ ikpe isi?

english: One would think the state will be eager to bring its evidence to the open.
igbo: Mmadụ ga-eche na steeti ga-achọsi ike iweta ihe akaebe ya niile.

english: If the Presidency and the DSS are confident of Omoyele Sowore's ability and capabilities to 'violently overthrow the government', why can't the state simply let the judicial process proceed without interference as seen in the agency's disobedience of two court orders and the recent show of force by carrying out an arrest when you could have easily invited Sowore or picked him up at his residence in Abuja with a court warrant?
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na onyeisi ala na ndị DSS kwenyesiri ike na Omoyele Sowore nwere ike 'ịchụda gọọmentị steeti n'ike', gịnị mere na steeti enweghị ike ikwe ka usoro ikpe gaa n'ihu n'enweghị nsogbu ọ bụla dịka egosiri na nnupu isi nke otu a nke iwu ụlọ ikpe abụọ na ihe ike egosiri site na ijide ya mgbe ị nwere ike ịkpọ Sowore oku ma ọ bụ bulie ya n'ụlọ ya na Abuja site na ikike ụlọ ikpe.

english: The President Muhammadu Buhari government is making a grave mistake, attracting negative local and international commentaries, a distraction the government does not need at any time, particularly now.
igbo: Ọchịchị onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari na emehie nke ukwuu, na-adọta ndị na-ekwu okwu na adighị mma na mpaghara na mba ọzọ, ihe ndọpụ uche gọọmentị adighị mkpa n'oge maka gọọmentị ịkwụsị ige ntị n'olu ọgbahara ma malite igere olu amamihe ntị.

english: Now is the time for the government to stop listening to the The Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami (SAN), should review the Sowore and Bakare's case file and do the needful (drop the treason charges) and if the state is confident of its case, then let the case proceed in a transparent and open manner.
igbo: Onye isi ndị ọka ikpe na mịnịsta nke ikpe ziri ezi Abubakar Malami kwesịrị ịtule okwu ikpe nke Sowore na Bakare ma mee ihe ekwesiri ime (tụfụọ ebubo aghụghọ) ma ọ bụrụ na steeti kwenyesiri ike na okwu ya, ya hapụzie okwu ikpe ahụ gaa n'ụzọ doro anya

english: When Sowore committed what was an obvious infraction such as defacing a public property in Lagos, an offence that could get an easy conviction in a Lagos environmental court, the government looked the other way
igbo: Mgbe Sowore mehiere bụ mgbe o mebiri ihe oha na Legọs, mmejọ nke nwere ike inweta nkwupụta dị mfe n'ụlọ ikpe n'ahụ maka gburugburu Legọs, gọọmentị lere anya n'ụzọ nke ọzọ.

english: A sign the state isn't interested in enforcing our laws but to bring up charges with stringent conditions that can drag on for long and keep alleged offenders in jail awaiting trial for a long period.
igbo: Ihe ngosi na steeti enweghị mmasị na ịmanye iwu anyị kama iji bulie ebubo na ọnọdụ siri ike nke nwere ịdọrọ ogologo oge ma debe ndị a na-ebo ebubo na mkpesa n'ụlọ mkọrọ na-eche oge ikpe.

english: The treason charges the state is now relying on is unlikely to stand in an open trial, thus the request for a secret trial and anonymous witnesses.
igbo: Eleghi anya, ebubo nke steeti na-adabere na agaghị eguzonwu ikpe, yabụ arịrịọ maka ikpe nzuzo na onye akaebe na-enweghi aha

english: Sowore's followership on social media run into millions of people who find it easy to 'comment' 'like' 'follow' his broadcasts, but no evidence the millions have translated into a mass movement.
igbo: Ndị na-eso Sowore na igwe mgbasa ozi na-agbaba nde mmadụ ndị ọ dịrị mfe ịtụnye okwu, ihu na anya na iso mgbasa ozi ya, mana enweghi akaebe na nde mmadụ ahụ tụgharịrị bụrụ otu nghagharị

english: Nigerians are disappointed, angry and have always wanted a change but not reckless enough to follow an unplanned idealistic 'revolution' with no road map, even the DSS should have known this.
igbo: Ndị Naịjirịa na-enwe nkụda mmụọ, na-ewe iwe ma na-achọ mgbanwe mgbe niile mana ha adịghị nzuzu nke isoro mgbanwe ebummuche na-enweghị atụmatụ na ụzọ ọbụna ndị DSS kwesiri ịma nke a.

english: The danger to Nigeria isn't the Sowore and his group, the government should review how the intelligent agencies arrive at largely fictitious 'security reports'.
igbo: Ihe egwu dị na Naịjirịa abụghị Sowore na ndị otu ya, gọọmentị kwesiri ịtụle ka ụlọ ndị ọgụgụ isi si erute na akụkọ nchebe zuru oke.

english: Now it is the Nigerian Government and the DSS that are promoting #RevolutionNow by aiming to kill a fly with a nuclear bomb with attendant negative impact. It is the government now ascribing some imaginary powers to Omoyele Sowore and his armless group, a sign of insecurity on the part of the government.
igbo: Ugbu a, ọ bụ gọọmentị Naịjirịa na ndị DSS na-akwalite mgbanwe ugbu a site na ịchọ iji ogbunigwe gbuo ijiji. ọ bụ gọọmentị na-ebuputa ike ụfọdụ n'echiche nye Sowore na ndị otu ya, ihe na-egosi enweghị ntụkwasị obi nke gọọmentị.

english: Each infraction by the government will attract more sympathy.
igbo: Mmebi ọ bụla nke gọọmentị ga-eme ka e nwekuo ọmịiko.

english: It is the case of David against Goliath.
igbo: Ọ bụ ikpe Devid na Goloyat.

english: Give this group a designated space to protest and a platform to vent and you will see not all Nigerians agree with some of the solutions being proffered by the group.
igbo: Nye ndị otu a ohere iji mee ngagharị iwe na oghere ịkpọ okwu aha, ị ga-ahụ na ọ bụghị ndị Naịjirịa niile kwenyere na ụzọ ụfọdụ ndị otu ahụ kwenyere.

english: Omoyele Sowore and his group are being lionised by the state.
igbo: Steeti na-esogbu Omoyele Sowore na ndị out ya.

english: Nigeria's elite security is now acting like a gangster enforcer.
igbo: Nchebe oke nke Naịjirịa na-eme ugbu a dịka nke ndị moekome.

english: The government should review its so-called counter-insurgency strategy and stop applying failed tactics.
igbo: Gọọmentị kwesịrị ịtụle atụmatụ a sị na ọ bụ oke ọgụ ma kwụsị itinye atụmatụ ndị dara ada.

english: The irony is that the government already had half of what it wants legally by securing one of the harshest bail conditions against a suspect.
igbo: Ihe nzuzu bụ na gọọmentị enwegolarị ọkara nke ihe ọ chọrọ n'ụzọ iwu site na ichebe otu n'ime ọnọdụ mgbapụta kachasị sie ike megide onye na-enyo enyo.

english: The judge had in a ruling on October 4 granted Sowore bail in the sum of N100m and two sureties in the same amount and barred him from travelling out of Abuja.
igbo: Onye ọka ikpe ahụ kpebiri na Ọktoba 4, nyere Sowore ịgbazinye ego puku nde naira na ndị ga ekwechitere ya nkwa abụọ kwụọkwa ụgwọ a wee gbochie ya ịpụ Abuja.

english: Why rearrest Sowore when he's already restricted to Abuja ?
igbo: Gịnị mere a ga-eji tuarịa Sowore nga ebe egbochiela ya ịpụ Abuja ?

english: Is the DSS saying it does not have the capability to mount surveillance on one man in Abuja ?
igbo: Ndị DSS ha na-akọwa na ha enweghị ike ilegide otu onye nọ n'Abuja anya .

english: For the record, I am no supporter of #RevolutionNow.
igbo: Maka ndekọ, abụghị m onye na-akwado #RevolutionNow .

english: I have seen how recklessness can destabilise fragile states but evidence of alleged infractions is better presented in court without the state acting as if it is insecure and desperate to keep a
igbo: Ahụtalam etu enweghị uche si emebi steeti ndị na-adighị ike mana igosi nke ọma ebubo mpụ n'ụlọ ikpe karịa steeti ịdị na-eme ka egwu ọnatụ ya bia na-emekwa ihe niile nke gunyere igbanya iwu iji tụọ olu obula kwuliterenu nga .

english: Now is the time for the government to stop the disobedience of court orders, no one is above the law including activists and people in government.
igbo: Ugbua bụ oge gọọmentị ga eji kwụsị ịnụpụrụ iwu ụlọ ikpe isi, enweghi onye ka iwu, nkea gunyere ndị na-akwado ọrụ na ndị nọ na gọọmentị

english: But if you must prosecute Sowore and others then let it be open, free and transparent. Otherwise, thus far the state has made a mess of the case, this is looking more like persecution than prosecution.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na a ga akpọgide Sowore na ndị ọzọ. Hapụzie ya ka omepee ma zie ezie, ruo ugbua, steeti emebiela okwu a, nke a dizi ka mkpagbụ karịa ịnwụchite akwụkwọ.

english: If the government has a thinking cap on, it will #FreeSoworeNow or at the least let the case in court continue without infractions.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na gọọmetị nwere ike iche echiche, ọ ga ahapụ Sowore ka onwere onwe ya ma ọ bụ opekata mpe kwe ka ụlọ ikpe gaa n'ihu n'enweghi mmebi ọbụla.

english: Dammy Krane Granted N50,000 Bail By Court
igbo: Ụlọ ikpe enyela Dammy Krane ikike mgbapụta naira 50,000 .

english: He was arraigned at the Igbosere Magistrate Court in Lagos over a three-count allegation bothering on breach of public peace .
igbo: Akpọrọ ya n'ụlọ ikpe ọkaikpe Igbosere dị na Legọs maka ebubo atọ nke bụ imebi udo nke oha.

english: Hip-hop artiste, Johnson Oyindamola widely known as Dammy Krane, has been granted bail in the sum of N50,000 with one surety in like sum.
igbo: Onye na-akpọ egwu mkpọlị elu bụ Johnson Onyindamola amara ka Dammy Krane, enwetela ohere mgbapụta site n'ịkwụ puku iri ise ma onye n'akwado ya.

english: He was arraigned at the Igbosere Magistrate Court in Lagos over a three-count allegation bothering on breach of public peace.
igbo: Akpọrọ ya n'ụlọ ikpe ọkaikpe Igbosere dị na Legọs maka ebubo atọ nke bụ imebi udo nke oha.

english: The musician was accused of making statements capable of breaching public peace and threatening the lives of staff of Merrybet Gold Limited on July 25.
igbo: Eboro onye na-agụ egwu ahụ maka ikwu okwu nwere ike imebi udo oha nakwa ịyị ndụ ndị ọrụ Merrybet Gold limited egwu na 25 Julai.

english: According to the prosecutor, the offence contravened sections 301, 412 and 168 of the Criminal Law of Lagos State of Nigeria, 2015.
igbo: Dika onye ọka ikpe siri kwuo, mmehe ahụ megidere akụkụ 301, 412 na 168 nke iwu mpụ nke Steeti Legos nke Naịjirịa, afọ 2015.

english: He pleaded not guilty to the charges preferred against him by the police.
igbo: O kwereghị na ebubo ndị uwe ojii boro ya.

english: His lawyer, Adebayo Oniyelu, while applying for his bail, said the defendant was 'a well-known musician who had not been convicted of any crime in the past'.
igbo: Onye ọka ikpe ya bụ Adebayo Oniyelu mgbe ọ na-achọ ịgbapụta ya kwuru na onye ọ na-agbachịtere bụ ' onye egwu a ma ama nke na-enwebeghi ikpe ọbụla maka mpụ akpọrọ ya n'oge gara aga'.

english: He also said that the defendant would not interfere with the prosecution of the matter if granted bail, noting that Dami Krane had been in prison custody since Friday.
igbo: ọ sịkwara na onye o na-agbachịtere agaghị egbochi ndị ka iwu ikpe okwu a ma ọ bụrụ na enye ya ohere mgbapụta, na-ekwupụta na Dami Krane anọrọla n'ụlọ mkpọrọ kemgbe Fraịde.

english: Opposing the application for bail, prosecuting counsel J. I Enang, said he ordinarily would not have objected to the application for bail if it were not a national issue.
igbo: N'imegide akwụkwọ mgbapụta ya, kansul na-ekpechite ọnụ bụ J. I. Enang kwuru na ọ karaghị imegide mgbapụta ya ma ọ bụrụ na ọ bụghị okwu obodo.

english: But when asked how the case was a national issue, Enang said it would be revealed at the right time.
igbo: Mana mgbe a juru ya out o si bụrụ okwu obodo, Enang siri na aga-ekughe ya mgbe oge ruru.

english: He said, 'Your Honour, while coming to court today, I already heard it on the radio that a musician was to be arraigned today, it is even an international issue.'
igbo: O kwuru 'Nsọpụrụ gị, mgbe m na-abịa ụlọ ikpe taa, anụburum ya na redio na aga-awuchị onye na-agụ egwu taa, ọ bụ okwu mba ụwa'.

english: Interjecting, Oniyelu informed the court that the case was one of breach of contract.
igbo: N'isukwunye okwu, Oniyelu gwara ụlọ ikpe na ikpe ahụ bụ okwu imebi nkwekọrịta.

english: 'The musician performed for the complainant and they are owing to him N1m.
igbo: Onye na-akpọ egwu ahụ kpọrọ ndị kpọpụrụ ya ikpe egwu, ha ji ya otu nde naira.

english: 'He reached out to them to request for his money but they refused to listen to him, forcing him to go on air to say that they were owing to him. The next thing that happened was his arrest.'
igbo: ' ọ gakwuru ha ịrịọ maka ego ya mana ha juru ige ya nti, nke manyere ya ịga n'ikuku kwuo na ha ji ya ụgwọ. Ihe mere ọzọ bụ nwuchi ya.

english: The magistrate, A. F. O Botoku, adjourned the matter until October 11 for the commencement of trial .
igbo: Onye ọka ikpe bụ A. F. O. Botoku yigharịrị okwu ahụ ruo Oktoba 11, maka ịmalite ikpe.

english: 'Danfo Driver's Star, 'Mad Melon' Dies
igbo: Onye tiri egwu 'Danfo Driver, 'Mad Melon' anwụọla

english: According to the management of the group in a statement, the artiste died on Wednesday night after a brief illness.
igbo: Dịka ndị njikwa otu ahụ si kwupụta, onye oku egwu ahụ nwụrụ abali Wenezde mgbe ọrịachara obere ọrịa.

english: A member of one of Nigeria's legendary music groups, Danfo Drivers – Oghenemaro Emeofa popularly known as 'Mad Melon', has died.
igbo: Onye otu ndị na-akụ egwu nke Naịjirịa, Danfo Drivers – Oghenemaro Emeofa a ma dịka 'mad melon' nwụrụ.

english: According to the management of the group in a statement, the artiste died on Wednesday night after a brief illness.
igbo: Dịka ndị njikwa otu ahụ si kwupụta, onye oku egwu ahụ nwụrụ abali Wenezde mgbe ọrịachara obere ọrịa.

english: The statement said, 'The management of Mad Melon and Mountain Black aka Danfo Drivers, wishes to announce to the general public the passing of Oghenemaro Emeofa aka Mad Melon.
igbo: Nkwupụta ahụ kwuru na 'ndị njikwa Mad Melon na Mountain Black ama dịka Danfo Drivers, chọrọ ịkọsara ọha na eze banyere ọnwụ Oghenemaro Emeofa ama dịka Mad Melon'.

english: 'A true legend has fallen. May God grant his family, group mate (Mountain Black), well-wishers and friends the fortitude to bear the loss.'
igbo: oke osisi adawo, ka Chukwu nye ezinụlọ ya, onye otu ya (Mountain Black), ndị na-echere ya echiche ọma, ndị enyi ya ndidi iji die ihe mgberede a.

english: Dangote Flour Mill Shares Suspended On Floor Of Stock Exchange Ahead Of Takeover
igbo: òkè igwe ntụ ọka Dangote kwụsịrị n'ala mgbanwe odin'ihu nwachi

english: This will be the second time the company will get sold in the last seven years after it was bought by South Africa-based Tiger Foods in 2012 and returned three years later.
igbo: Nke a ga-abụ oge nke abụọ erere ụlọ ọrụ a n'afọ asaa gara aga ka Tiger Foods nke mba Saut-Afrika zụrụ ya na 2012 wee lọghachi mgbe afọ atọ gachara.

english: The Nigeria Stock Exchange on Tuesday effected a full suspension on the trading of shares of Dangote Flour Mills as a precursor to its delisting and takeover by Crown Flour Mills.
igbo: Mgbasa azụmahịa nke Naịjirịa na ụbọchị Tuzde nwetara nkwusi azụmahịa niile nke òkè ntụ ọka Dangote dịka ihe ga-ebute ọdịmma ya na nwachi igwe ntụ ọka Crown.

english: This will be the second time the company will get sold in the last seven years after it was bought by South Africa-based Tiger Foods in 2012 and returned three years later.
igbo: Nke a ga-abụ oge nke abụọ erere ụlọ ọrụ a n'afọ asaa gara aga ka Tiger Foods nke mba Saut-Afrika zụrụ ya na 2012 wee lọghachi mgbe afọ atọ gachara.

english: The suspension is imperative to prevent trading in the shares of the company beyond the effective date of the scheme of arrangement for Crown Flour Mills Limited to acquire the entire issued and fully paid ordinary shares of 50 kobo each in DFM held by scheme shareholders, subsequent to which the company would be delisted from the main board of the NSE
igbo: Nkwụsị ahụ dị oke mkpa iji gbochie azụmaahịa oke nke ụlọ ọrụ ahụ karịa ụbọchị dị mma maka atụmatụ maka nhazi nke ụlọ ọrụ ntụ ọka Crown iji nwete ego niile enyere na ịkwụ ụgwọ òkè zuru ezu nke kobo iri ise ọ bụla na DFM ndị haziri ya bụ ndị nwere òkè, nke ga-esote ya bụ ikewapụ ụlọ ọrụ ahụ na ndị isi nke NSE .

english: The board of directors of the company had in April received an offer from Olam – the parent company of Crown Flour Mill for the sale of the company.
igbo: Ndị isi ụlọ ọrụ ahụ n'onwa Eprel, natara ozi si na Olam- ụlọ ọrụ mutara ụlọ ọrụ igwe ntụ ọka Crown maka ire ụlọ ọrụ ahụ.

english: The firm and the board agreed to pay N130bn for five billion worth of ordinary shares listed by DFM.
igbo: ụlọ ọrụ ahụ na ndị isi ya kwekotara ịkwụ 130bn maka òkè nkiti ego ya ruru ijeri ise ndị DFM depụtara

english: The board proposed to make the offer to its shareholders on August 5 through a high court ordered meeting that was scheduled to hold on October 14.
igbo: Ndị isi ahụ tụrụ atụmatụ ike mpaghara ha n'ọnwa ọgọst 5 site na nzukọ ụlọ ikpe nyere iwu ka ewee bido n'ọktoba 14.

english: Tiger Foods sold DFM back to Dangote in 2015 for a single dollar after it had acquired the company for $200m.
igbo: ụlọ ọrụ nri Tiger reghariri DFM nye Dangote n'afọ 2015 site n'ịkwụ out dọla mgbe o ji dọla 200m nweta ụlọ ọrụ ahụ.

english: The company had made losses in the years it was owned by the South African firm.
igbo: ụlọ ọrụ ahụ nwetere njọ ahịa afọ ndị nwe ya bụ ndị ụlọ ọrụ dị na Sawt Afrika.

english: DFM again announced that it made a loss of N1.16bn just before it agreed to sell the firm to Olam.
igbo: DFM ọzọ mara ọkwa na ọ nwere njọ ahịa N1.16bn tụpụ o kwere resi ụlọ ọrụ Olam

english: Experts say Olam's acquisition of the staggering firm is an attempt to expand its influence in the country's confectionery space through Crown, which it purchased in 2010.
igbo: Ndị ọkachamara na-ekwu na nweta Olam nwetara ụlọ ọrụ ahụ na-agbagha agbagha bụ mgbalị iji gbasaa mmetụta ya na oghere nchịkwa obodo site na Crown. Nke a zuru n'afọ 2010.

english: Dangote Flour Records Negatives In Q3 Result
igbo: Edekọọ ntụ ọka Dangote n'aka ọjọọ na nsonaazụ Q3.

english: Highlights of the group's third quarter result indicates that the company lost N6.84bn.
igbo: Ihe ngosiputa atọ n'ime ihe anọ nke ọgbakọ ahụ gosiri na ụlọ ọrụ ahụ gbajọrọ ego ruru 6.8bn.

english: Dangote Flour, which is soon to be sold to Crown Flour – a subsidiary of Olam, is piling up losses for its coming investors.
igbo: Ntụ ọka Dangote, nke a ga-eresi ntụ ọka Crown- mpaghara Olam, na-akwakọrọ ndị na-etinye ego na ya ihe efu.

english: Highlights of the group's third quarter result indicates that the company lost N6.84bn.
igbo: Ihe ngosiputa atọ n'ime ihe anọ nke ọgbakọ ahụ gosiri na ụlọ ọrụ ahụ gbajọrọ ego ruru 6.8bn.

english: The wheat milling firm earned N76.75bn in the quarter ending September 30.
igbo: ụlọ ọrụ ọka wit nwetara 76.75bn na nkeji ikpeazụ nke ọnwa Septemba 30.

english: It had previously netted in revenues worth N83.29bn in the period ending June 30.
igbo: ọ dababuola na nha ego ruru 83.29bn na ngwụcha Jun 30.

english: This is a loss of 7.85 per cent.
igbo: Nke a bụ mfu nke pasent 7.85

english: Proshare reports that the firm's loss before tax increased by 316.75 per cent to N9.64bn.
igbo: Proshia na-akọ na mfu ụlọ ọrụ ahụ tupu ụtụ isi mụbara site na pasent 316.75 ruo 9.64bn.

english: Its loss after tax soared by 309.69 per cent to N6.84bn.
igbo: Mfu ahụ mgbe anachara ụtụ isi mụbara site na pacent 309.69 ruo 6.84bn

english: The firm's net asset also decline by 28.97 per cent to N39.
igbo: Ihe onwunwe ụlọ ọrụ ahụ ritukwara site na pacent 28.97 ruo N39.

english: It's before tax losses was occasioned by increased cost of sales, distribution and administration.
igbo: ọ bụ tupu mfu ụtụ isi bidoro site na mmụba nke ire ihe, nkesa na nchịkwa

english: In April, the board of directors of Dangote Flour approved a 100 per cent take over from Olam.
igbo: N'ọnwa Eprel, ndị isi ntụ ọka Dangote kwadoro nnwachi Olam nke pacent 100.

english: Dangote sold over 60 per cent of the company's stake to South Africa-based Tiger Foods in 2012.
igbo: Dangote resiri mpaghara ụlọ ọrụ ha kariri pacent 60 nye ndị ụlọ ọrụ ihe nri Tiger dị na Sawt Afrika na afọ

english: That relationship lasted for three years.
igbo: Ime enyi ha nọrọ naanị afọ atọ 2012.

english: It climaxed in Africa's richest man repossessing his firm for just a dollar.
igbo: O jedebere na nwoke kasị baa ọgaranya nke Afrika ji naani otu dọla ịnweghachi ụlọ ọrụ ya

english: In 2013 and 2014, Dangote Flour was on the loss trail.
igbo: N'afọ 2013 na 2014, ụlọ ọrụ ntụ ọka Dangote nọ n'okporo mfu

english: Its scorecard in 2018 amounted to a deficit of N1.16bn.
igbo: Akara ya n'afọ 2018 ji 1.16bn daa

english: Experts have said the firm is not strategic to the Dangote Group, hence its laggard performances and double change of ownership in six years.
igbo: Ndị ọkachamara ekwuola na ụlọ ọrụ ahụ abụghị nke dị mkpa maka out Dangote, ya kpatara adịghị ike ha n'ọrụ na mgbanwe nke abụọ n'afọ isii.

english: Davido Arrests Girls Who Accused Him of Impregnating Them
igbo: Davido akpọchịela ụmụ nwanyị ndị boro ya ebubo na ọ tụwara ha ime.

english: The two ladies had last week taken to social media to call out the singer for impregnating one of them and refusing to accept responsibility.
igbo: izu gara aga, ụmụ nwanyị abụọ ndị ahụ ji akara mgbasa ozi kpọọ onye ahụ na-akpọ egwu maka ịkwakpo otu n'ime ha ime ma jụ ịnara ibu ọrụ ya.

english: Nigerian musician, David Adeleke better known as Davido, has arrested the two ladies, who wrongfully accused him of impregnating them.
igbo: Onye Naịjirịa na-akpọ egwu bụ David Adeleke a maara ka Davido awụchịela ụmụ nwanyị abụọ ndị boro ya ebubo asi na ọ kwakporo ha

english: The two ladies had last week taken to social media to call out the singer for impregnating one of them and refusing to accept responsibility.
igbo: Izu gara aga, ụmụ nwanyị abụọ ndị ahụ ji akara mgbasa ozi kpọọ onye ahụ na-akpọ egwu maka ịkwakpo otu n'ime ha ime ma jụ ịnara ibu ọrụ ya

english: The artiste denied this accusation vehemently and placed a N1m bounty on anyone with information that could lead to the arrest of the girls.
igbo: Onye a na-eti egwu gonariri ebubo a wee kwe nkwa inye N1m nye onye ọ bụla nwere ike iwetara ya ozi gbasara ụzọ a ga-esi nwuchienwuo ụmụ nwanyị ndị a

english: He also promised to sue them for N30bn in damages.
igbo: O kwerekwara nkwa ịkpọpụ ha ụlọ ikpe ka ha kwụọ ijeri naira iri atọ maka ihe mmebi

english: The two girls, who have done several posts on social media to say that they were only pranking the singer, were however, on Tuesday arrested at their apartment.
igbo: Ụmụ nwanyị abụọ ndị ahụ, bụ ndị merela ọtụtụ ihe nkiri na mgbasa ozi iji kwuo na ha ne-egwusa onye ahụ na-akụ egwu egwuregwu, n'agbanyeghi na awụchịe la ha n'ụlọ ha n'ụbọchị Tuzde

english: Acknowledging the arrest, Davido posted a picture of the girls on his Instagram page with the caption: 'First to do no day pain.'
igbo: N' ịkwado nwuchi ahụ, Davido tinyere foto ụmụ agbọghọ na akara ya n'Instagram nke isi okwu ya bụ 'onye mbu ime anaghị afụ ụfụ'.

english: Davido, Chioma Welcome Baby Boy
igbo: Davido, Chioma na-anabata nwa nwoke .

english: The baby was born on Sunday in the United Kingdom
igbo: Amuru nwa ahụ ubọchị ụka na mba United Kingdom.

english: Nigerian Hip hop artiste, Davido, has announced the birth of his son with fiancee, Chioma.
igbo: Onye Naịjirịa na-akpọ egwu bụ Davido, ekwuputala ọmụmụ nwa nwoke ya na Chioma, onye ọchọrọ ịlụ mụrụ.

english: The musician made the announcement through his verified Instagram page.
igbo: Onye ahụ na-akụ egwu kwupụtara nke a site n'akara Instagram ya.

english: Sharing a photo of him holding his newborn, Davido wrote, 'Omoba ti de!! David Adedeji Ifeanyi Adeleke Jr .
igbo: O gosiri foto ebe o ku nwa ya a mụrụ ọhụrụ Davido dere, 'Omoba ti de!! David Adedeji Ifeanyi Adeleke Jr.'

english: Davido, Wizkid, Others Shower Burna Boy With Praises After Grammy Awards Nomination
igbo: Davido, Wizkid na ndị ọzọ toro Burna Boy mgbe ahọpụtara ya maka awod Grammy.

english: In the list released on Wednesday, Burna's 'African Giant' album was nominated in the 'Best World Music category.'
igbo: N'ime ndepụta ewepụtara na Wenezde, a họpụtara egwu Burna Boy a kpọrọ 'African Giant' na ngalaba egwu ụwa kachasị mma.

english: Leading Nigerian musicians have continued to shower praises on Hip-hop artiste – Damini Ogulu popularly known as Burna Boy – after he was nominated for the 2020 Grammy Awards.
igbo: Ndị Naịjirịa na-akụ egwu a maara ama agala n'ihu ito onye na-akụ egwu mkpọli elu – Damini Ogulu a maara dịka Burna Boy – mgbe a họpụtara ya maka Grammy awod nke afọ 2020.

english: In the list released on Wednesday, Burna's 'African Giant' album was nominated in the 'Best World Music category.'
igbo: N'ime ndepụta ewepụtara na Wenezde, a họpụtara egwu Burna Boy a kpọrọ 'African Giant' na ngalaba egwu ụwa kachasị mma.

english: The nomination is for albums containing at least 51 per cent playing time of new vocal or instrumental world music recordings.
igbo: Nhọpụta a b maka ọba ndị nwere opekata mpe pacent 51 oge eji kpọọ egwu ohuru ma ọ bụ ihe eji akpọ egwu mba ụwa

english: Celebrating with the artiste over the feat, Banky W in a tweet said, 'Our African giant has been nominated for a Grammy!
igbo: N'iso onye ahụ na-akụ egwu ñurịa, Banky W dere n'akara twita ya si ' a họpụtala African Giant anyị maka Grammy.

english: Congratulations to @burnaboy, his mom and the entire team .
igbo: Ekele diri @Burnaboy, nne ya na ndị otu ya niile.

english: Amazing and well deserved.
igbo: Nnukwu ịtụnanya na ihe tozuru etozu.

english: Anything is possible with a little bit of faith and a lot of hard work. So happy for him.'
igbo: E nwere ike ime ihe ọ bụla site n'obere okwukwe na ọtụtụ ndogbu. Obi dim ụtọ nkw ukwuu ebe ọ nọ.

english: Also reacting to the announcement, ace music producer, Don Jazzy, said, 'Congrats to the African giant @burnaboy on the Grammy nomination.
igbo: N'ịzakwa ọkwa ahụ, onye na-emepụta egwu bụ Don Jazzy kwuru ' ekele diri African Giant @Burna Boy na nhọpụta nke Grammy.

english: Congrats on having the most amazing couple of years.
igbo: Ekele n'inwe ọmalịcha afọ ọma .

english: The Grammy is actually just the icing on the already juicy cake.'
igbo: Grammy a ka bụ mbido ihe ọma ndị ọzọ n'abịa

english: Nathalie Joachim With Spektral Quartet (Fanm D'Ayiti) and Angelique Kidjo (Celia).
igbo: Nathalie Joachim na Spektral Quartet (Fanm D'Ayiti) na Angelique Kidjo (Celia).

english: Death Of A Nation: Biafra and the Nigerian question By Chido Onumah
igbo: Ọnwụ nke mba: Biafra na ajụjụ ndị Naịjirịa.

english: There are two basic questions that must be answered by all Nigerians.
igbo: E nwere ajụjụ abụọ dị mkpa ụmụ Naịjirịa niile ga-aza.

english: One, do we want to remain as one country ?
igbo: Otu, anyị chọrọ ịnọgide na-abụ otu mba ?

english: Two, if the answer is yes, under what conditions ? – Chief Bola Ige
igbo: Abụọ, ọ bụrụ na azịza ya bụ ee, n'ọnọdụ gịnị ?' – Chief Bola Ige

english: To paraphrase the historian, mathematician, journalist, Marxist, and progressive thinker, Edwin Madunagu, every political history has its significant dates, landmarks or turning points.
igbo: Iji kọwaa onye ọkọ akụkọ ihe mere eme, onye na-ahụ maka mgbakọ na mwepụ, odeakụkọ, Marxist na onye na-eche echiche ngamnihu, Edwin Madunagu, akụkọ ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị ọ bụla nwere ụbọchị ndị dị ịrịba ama, akara ala ma ọ bụ ntụgharị.

english: In Nigeria's political history, for instance, landmarks would include:
igbo: N'akụkọ ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị nke Naịjirịa, dịka ọmụmaatụ, akara ala ga-agụnye:

english: October 1, 1960 - The day Nigeria gained independence from Britain
igbo: Oktoba 1, 1960 - Ụbọchị Naịjirịa nwetere nwere onwe ha n'aka Britain

english: January 15, 1966 - When the first of what would become a tradition of military coups occurred
igbo: Jenuwarị 15, 1966 - Mbido nnara ọchịchị ndị agha

english: July 6, 1967 - The official start of the 30-month Nigeria-Biafra war .
igbo: Julaị 6, 1967, - Mgbe agha ọnwa iri atọ Nigeria-Biafra bidoro

english: January 15, 1970 - The official end of the civil war .
igbo: Jenuwarị 15, 1970, - Mgbe agha obodo kwusiri .

english: On May 27, 50 years ago, Yakubu Gowon, who served as head of state of Nigeria from 1966 to 1975, perhaps in anticipation of the audacious move by the Military Governor of the Eastern Region of Nigeria, Lt. Col. Emeka Ojukwu, announced the division of Nigeria into 12 states from four regions.
igbo: Na Mee 27, afọ iri ise gara aga, Yakubu Gowon, onye chịrị dịka onye isi ala Naịjirịa site n'afọ 1966 ruo 1975, ikekwa n'atụ anya mmegharị ahu nke gọvanọ ndị agha mpaghara ọwụwa anyanwu nke Naịjirịa, Lt. Col. Emeka Ojukwu, kwuputara nkewa Naịjirịa n'ime steeti iri na abụọ na mpaghara anọ.

english: The division of Nigeria into 12 states and Ojukwu's declaration of Biafra were decisions that would change the country forever.
igbo: Nkewa Naịjirịa n'ime steeti iri na abụọ na nkwupụta Ojukwu maka Biafra bụ mkpebi ga-agbanwe mba ahụ ruo mgbe ebighi ebi.

english: Gowon's action did not only alter the structure of Nigeria, it led to the reconstruction of the nascent nation through the lenses of the so-called Nigerian military; a military that was provincial in outlook as it was ill-equipped for leadership.
igbo: Omume Gowon agbanweghị naani ọdịdị Naịjirịa, ọ dabere na nruzigharị nke ala ahụ site na oghere ndị a kpọrọ ndị agha Naịjirịa, ndị agha bụ ndị lepuru anya mgbe ndị Naịjirịa enweghi ike idu onwe ha.

english: The military centralized economic and political power and moved Nigeria from a federal republic to a unitary state.
igbo: Ndị agha jịkọrọ ikike akụ na ụba na nke ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị ma mee ka Naịjirịa si na Federal Repọblik gaa na nchịkọ steeti ala.

english: In many ways, we can conveniently say May 27, 1967, was the day Nigeria began to unravel and any attempt to understand the current crises and our inability to make progress as a nation must necessarily return to the action of the military junta on May 27, 1967.
igbo: N'ọtụtụ ụzọ, anyị nwere ike ịsị na Mee 27, 1967 bụ ụbọchị Naịjirịa malitere ịkpughe onwe ya na mbọ ọ bụla iji ghọta nsogbu ndị dị oge ugbua na adịghị ike anyị inweta agamnihu dịka mba dị oke mkpa ilaghachị omume ndị ọchịagha na Mee 27, 1967.

english: Three days later, May 30, 1967, Lt. Col Ojukwu, a Nigerian soldier of Igbo extraction declared an 'independent sovereign state of the name and title of the Republic of Biafra .
igbo: Mgbe ụbọchị atọ gachara, May 30, 1967 Lt. Col. Ojukwu, onye agha Naịjirịa nke mpaghara ndị Igbo kwupụtara 'Nnwere onwe mba kwuru onwe ya akpọrọ Repọblik nke Biafra.

english: Officially excising the Eastern Region from Nigeria .
igbo: Ọ bụrụla ihe amaama na ekewapụtala mpaghara ọwụwa anyanwu na Naịjirịa.

english: Ojukwu based his action on the resolution, four days earlier, on May 26, 1967, of a joint conference of the Eastern consultative assembly and leaders of thought that asked him to declare the Eastern region as a separate republic at an 'early practicable date .
igbo: Ojukwu dabere ihe o mere na mkpebi, abali anọ gara aga na Mee 26, 1967 nke ọgbakọ nzukọ ndị isi mpaghara ọwụwa anyanwu na ndị isi nke gwara ya ka ọ kpọọ mpaghara ọwụwa anyanwu dịka mba ọzọ na mbido ụbọchị.

english: The declaration of Biafra was the culmination of a series of tragic events .
igbo: Nkwupụta nke Biafra bụ ngwụcha nke ọtụtụ ọdachi.

english: First was the bloodletting that started with the January 15, 1966, military coup .
igbo: Nke mbụ bụ nkwafu ọbara nke bidoro na Jenụwarị 15, 1966, mgbagha ndị agha

english: That coup led to the assassination of Alhaji Abubakar Tafawa Belewa, the country's first and only prime minister and Sir Ahmadu Bello, the Premier of the Northern Region, among other high-profile casualties .
igbo: Ya bu mgbagha butere ogbugbu nke Alhaji Abubakar, Tafawa Belewa, onye isi ala mbụ na naanị Prime Minister enwere na Mazi Ahmadu Bello, onye isi mpaghara ugwu, n'etiti ndị ọzọ nwere nnukwu nwakpo.

english: Some recollections by Edwin Madunagu in 'Settling account with Biafra (The Guardian, May 4, 2000) are apposite here:
igbo: Ncheta ụfọdụ nke Edwin Madunagu na 'imezi akaụntụ nke Biafra' ( Guardian Mee 4, 2000) tughariri nke a :
