igbo: Ndị otu mba ụwa na-arụ ọrụ megide nruruaka enyela Russia afọ anọ ha agaghị esonye na ihe omume egwuregwu niile.

english: It means the Russia will not be allowed at events such as the Tokyo 2020 Olympics and Paralympics and the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar, the BBC reports.
igbo: Ọ pụtara na a gaghị anabata Russia na ihe omume dịka Tokyo 2020 Olympic na Paralympics na asọmpi iko mba ụwa FIFA nke 2022 na Qatar, BBC na-akọ.

english: But athletes, who can prove they are untainted by the doping scandal, will be able to compete under a neutral flag.
igbo: Ma ndị na-eme egwuregwu, ndị nwere ike igosipụta na he esonyeghị n'asịrị ahụ, ga-enwe ike ịsọ mpi n'okpuru ọkọlọtọ nọpụrụ iche.

english: WADA's executive committee made the unanimous decision in a meeting in Lausanne, Switzerland.
igbo: Kọmitii na-ahụ maka WADA mere mkpebi a n'otu nzukọ na Lausanne, Switzerland.

english: It comes after Russia's Anti-Doping Agency was declared non-compliant for manipulating laboratory data handed over to investigators in January 2019.
igbo: Ọ abịara mgbe ekwuputara na ndị na-arụ ọrụ megide nruruaka nke Russia na-enweghị mmezi maka ịmegharị ọrụ nyocha n'ụlọ nyocha ha enyefere ndị ọrụ nyocha na Jenụwarị 2019.

english: It had to hand over data to WADA as condition of its controversial reinstatement in 2018 after a three-year suspension for its vast state-sponsored doping scandal.
igbo: O kwesiri inyefe WADA ihe eji arụ ọrụ dị ka ọnọdụ nke iweghachite arụmụka ya na 2018 mgbe a chụpụrụ ya afọ atọ maka asambodo nruruaka steeti ya buru ibu.

english: WADA president, Sir Craig Reedie, said the decision showed its 'determination to act resolutely in the face of the Russian doping crisis'.
igbo: Onye isi WADA, Mazịr Craig Reedie, kwuru na mkpebi a gosipụtara 'mkpebi ya ime mkpebi siri ike n'agbanyeghị nsogbu nruruaka nke Russia'.

english: He added, 'For too long, Russian doping has detracted from clean sport.
igbo: Ọ gbakwụnyere, 'Ruo ogologo oge, ọgwụ ndị Russia emerụsịrị emerụ site na egwuregwu dị ọcha .

english: The blatant breach by the Russian authorities of Rusada's reinstatement conditions demanded a robust response.
igbo: Mkpesa siri ike nke ndị ọchịchị Russia nke ọnọdụ iweghachi Rusada chọrọ nzaghachi siri ike.

english: That is exactly what has been delivered.
igbo: Nke ahụ bụ kpọmkwem ihe ewepụtara.

english: Russia was afforded every opportunity to get its house in order and re-join the global anti-doping community for the good of its athletes and of the integrity of sport but it chose instead to continue in its stance of deception and denial.
igbo: Enyere Russia ohere ọ iji jịkọta ụlọ ya n'usoro ma soro ndị obodo na-egbochi mkpokọ ụwa maka ọdịmma ndị egwuregwu ya na eziokwu nke egwuregwu kama ọ họọrọ ịga n'ihu na ọnọdụ ya nke aghụghọ na ngọnarị .

english: Sack DSS DG, Yusuf Bichi, Premium Times Tells Buhari In New Editorial
igbo: Chụọ DSS DG, Yusuf Bichi, Premium Times na-agwa Buhari na Nchịkọ Ọhụrụ

english: Evidently, Mr Bichi's DSS has become a major threat to the norms and values of a democratic system.
igbo: 'Ihe atụ gosiri na, Mz Bichi's onye isi ndị DSS abụrụla ihe iyi egwu nye ụkpụrụ usoro ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya.

english: Premium Times, an independent news platform in Nigeria, has called on President Muhammadu Buhari to immediately fire Yusuf Bichi, head of the Department of State Services, over his role in his men's Invasion of the Federal High Court in Abuja last Friday to rearrest Omoyele Sowore.
igbo: Premium Times, ụlọ ọrụ akụkọ nọrọ onwe ya na Naịjirịa akpọọla Onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari ka ọ chụọ Yusuf Bichi, onye isi Ngalaba nke Ọrụ ọrụ, maka ọrụ ya na mwakpo nke ndị agha ya na mwakpo ụlọ ikpe gọọmentị etiti na Abuja na Fraịde gara aga iji nwuchie Omoyele Sowore .

english: DSS Spokesperson, Peter Afunanya, had initially denied the invasion despite evidence.
igbo: Onye na-ekwuchitere DSS, Peter Afunanya, agọnarị ụzọ mwakpo ahụ n'agbanyeghị ihe akaebe.

english: The service later backtracked when Bichi sent a delegation to apologise to the Chief Judge of the Federal High Court over the incident.
igbo: Ọrụ ahụ mechara kụọ azụ mgbe Bichi zigara ndị nnọchi anya ịrịọ Onye isi ọka ikpe nke ụlọ ikpe dị elu nke etiti ala ịrịọ maka ihe ahụ merenụ.

english: In an editorial on Friday, Premium Times said, The frightening scale of impunity and arbitrary conduct under the presidency of General Muhammadu Buhari plumbed new depths on Friday, December 6 when armed operatives of the State Security Service (often called the Department of State Services – DSS), invaded Federal High Court No.
igbo: N'ime nchịkọta akụkọ na Fraịde, Premium Times kwuru, ọnụ ọgụgụ dị egwu nke enweghị ntaramahụhụ na akparamaagwa n'okpuru ọchịchị Onye isi ala bụ Muhammadu Buhari dakwasịrị omimi ọhụụ na Fraịde, Disemba 6 mgbe ndị ọrụ agha nke Ndị Ọrụ Nchebe Obodo (nke a na-akpọkarị Ngalaba Ọrụ - DSS), wakporo ụlọ ikpe ukwu nke etiti ala No .

english: 7 in Abuja, the Federal Capital Territory.
igbo: 7 na Abuja, isi ngalaba obodo .

english: We are now at that point where it is being argued that never in the history of Nigeria, including during the colonial period and the dark days of military rule, has such brazen act of disrespect for the sanctity of our law courts and independence of the judiciary been perpetrated.
igbo: Anyị nọzi n'oge ahụ ebe a na-arụ ụka na ọ dịghị mgbe ọ bụla n'akụkọ ihe mere eme nke Nigeria, gụnyere n'oge ọchịchị ndị ọcha na oge ọchịchịrị nke ọchịchị ndị agha, nwere omume enweghị nsọpụrụ dị otú ahụ maka ịdị nsọ nke ụlọ ikpe iwu na nnwere onwe nke ikpe.

english: We are greatly concerned that the DSS under the leadership of Yusuf Bichi has repeatedly acted as if it is above the laws of the land.
igbo: Anyị nwere nchegbu dị ukwuu na ndị DSS n'okpuru Yusuf Bichi emeela ihe ugboro ugboro ka a ga-asị na ọ karịrị iwu nke ala .

english: The serial violations of the fundamental human rights of the citizens by the security outfit since Mr Bichi assumed the reins of leadership and the disdain with which it has been treating the judicial arm of government through flagrant disobedience of court orders that seek to put a stop to such violations, have indeed become routine.
igbo: Mmebi ahụ mebiri ikike ụmụ amaala mmadụ nke site na nchekwa ebe ọ bụ na Mz Bichi chere na ikike nke onye isi na nlelị nke o jirila na-emeso ikpe nke gọọmentị site na nnupụisi dị egwu nke iwu ụlọikpe na-achọ ịkwụsị nkwụsi ike ụdị mmebi a, abụrụla ihe a na-eme kwa ụbọchị .

english: Dr Okpala said that the disease symptoms include fever, headaches, sore throat, general body weakness, coughing, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, muscle and chest pains.
igbo: Dọkịta Okpala kwuru na ihe e ji ama oria a gụnyere ahụ ọkụ, isi ọwụwa, ọnya akpịrị, adịghị ike anụ ahụ, ụkwara, ọgbụgbọ, afọ ọsịsa, akwara na obi mgbu.

english: He explained that in severe cases, unexplainable bleeding from ears, eyes, nostrils, mouths and other body openings were observed.
igbo: Ọ kọwara na n'ọnọdụ dị oke njọ, a na-ahụ ọbara ọgbụgba na-enweghị atụ site na ntị, anya, imi, ọnụ na oghere ndị ọzọ.

english: Commissioner said the time between the infection and appearance of symptoms of the disease ranges from 3 to 21 days.
igbo: Kọmịshọna kwuru na oge mbute ọrịa ahụ na ọdịdị mgbaàmà ya bụ site n'ụbọchị atọ ruo ụbọchị iri abụọ na otu.

english: He emphasised that early treatment and diagnosis increase the chances of survival.
igbo: O kwusiri ike na ọgwụgwọ na nchọpụta ọrịa n'oge na-amụba oghere nke ịdị ndụ.

english: Dr Okpala explained that people of all age groups, who come in contact with urine, faeces, saliva, and blood of rats, stand higher risk of contracting the disease.
igbo: Dọkịta Okpala kọwara na ndị nọ n'afọ niile, bụ ndị mamịrị, nsị, asọmmiri na ọbara oke metụtara nwere oke ihe egwu ibute ọrịa a.

english: People living in rat-infested environment also have increased chances of coming in contact with rats.
igbo: Ndi mmadụ bi na gburugburu ebe e nwere oke bu ọrịa a nwekwara oghere ibute ya.

english: People who consume potentially contaminated food stuff especially those left open overnight or dried outside in the open.
igbo: Ndị na-eri nri nwere nje ahụ ọkachasị nri ndị gho oghe n'abali maọbụ ndị a gbara n'anwụ n'èzí.

english: People who handle or process rodents for consumption and those who do not perform hand hygiene when appropriate.
igbo: 'Ndị na-ejikwa maọbụ hazie òké maka oriri na ndị anaghị akwọ aka mgbe o kwesiri.

english: Relatives who care for sick persons with unexplained illnesses at home, doctors, nurses and other health workers providing direct patient care in the absence of standard precautions.
igbo: 'Ndị ikwu ndị na-elekọta ndị ọrịa nwere ọrịa ndị agaghị akọwa n'ụlọ, ndị dọkịta, ndị nọọsụ na ndị ọrụ ahụike ndị ọzọ na-enye ndị ọrịa nlekọta ebe enweghi ozigbo.

english: Hospital staff that clean, disinfect contaminated surfaces, materials and supplies without adequate protective gear.
igbo: 'Ndị ụlọ ọgwụ na-ehicha, na-ehicha ihe ndị butere ọrịa a, ihe na akụrụngwa na-enweghị ngwa nchebe zuru oke.

english: He adds: Laboratory staff who handle blood samples of suspected Lassa fever patients, without appropriate precautions, medical or support staff that prepare or handle dead bodies without appropriate precautions can contract the disease'.
igbo: Ọ gbakwụnyere: 'Ndị ọrụ ụlọ nyocha na-eme nlele ọbara nke ndị a na-enyo enyo na ha bu ọrịa Lassa fever, na-enweghị nlezianya kwesiri ekwesi, ụlọ ọgwụ maọbụ ndị ọrụ nkwado na-akwadebe maọbụ na-edozi ozu ndị enweghi nlezianya kwesiri ekwesi nwere ike ibute ọrịa ahụ.'

english: To reduce the risk of Lassa fever, he gave the following advice:.
igbo: Iji belata ihe egwu nke ọrịa Lassa fever, o nyere ndụmọdụ ndị a:.

english: Ensure proper environmental sanitation, i.e.
igbo: ' Gbaa mbọ hụ na a na-edebe gburugburu ebe obibi ọcha, i.e.

english: The ministry is also working toward facilitating the Diaspora Estate and portal, where Ndi Anambra in The Diaspora can register online to ascertain their numeric strength.
igbo: Ụlọ ọrụ mịnịstrị ahụ na-agbakwa mbọ ime ka ndị 'Diaspora Estate and Portal', ebe ndị Anambra bi na 'Diaspora' nwere ike ịdebanye aha n'ịntanetị iji chọpụta ike ha.

english: keep your environment clean at all times, and block all holes in your houses to prevent rats from entering.
igbo: Debe gburugburu gị ọcha mgbe niile, ma gbochie oghere niile dị n’ụlọ gị iji gbochie oke ịbanye.

english: Cover your dustbins and dispose refuse properly.
igbo: Kpuchie ebe ị na-awụkọ ahịhịa gị ma tụfuo ya nke ọma.

english: Communities should set up dump sites very far from their homes to reduce the chances of having rodents within homes.
igbo: Ọha obodo kwesiri itinye ebe ikpofu ahịhịa ka ọ ghara ịdị nso n'ụlọ ebe obibi ha iji belata ohere inwe oke n’ime ulo.

english: Store food stuff like rice, garri, beans, corn/maize and the likes in air tight containers.
igbo: Chekwaa nri dịka osikapa, garri, agwa, ọka na ihe ndị ọzọ n'ihe ikuku agaghị aba.

english: Avoid drying food stuff outside on the floor and on roadside where it will be exposed to contamination.
igbo: Zeere ịgba ihe oriri n'anwụ na mbara na n'okporo ụzọ ebe ọ ga-ebute nje ahụ.

english: Youths of Anambra will undergo training on Project Smart Job' that will make booking of hotel, transportation and other online services, easy and accessible.
igbo: 'Ndị ntorobịa nke Anambra ga-anata ọzụzụ na 'Project Smart Job ' nke ga-eme ka ntinye akwụkwọ n'ụlọ nkwari akụ, njem na ọrụ ịntanetị ndị ọzọ, dị mfe ma kwe nnweta.

english: He advised Ndi Anambra to avoid bush fires which could lead to displacement of rats from bushes to human dwellings and eliminate rats in homes and communities by setting rat traps.
igbo: Ọ dụrụ ndị Ndị Anambra ọdụ ka ha zeere ịgba ọhịa ọkụ nke nwere ike ime ka oke site n'ọhịa baa n'ụlọ obibi mmadụ ma kpochapụ oke n'ụlọ na obodo site n'ikwere ha ọnya.

english: He enjoined healthcare workers to practice standard precautions at all times, that is, wearing gloves when handling patients or providing care to an ill patient/relative.
igbo: Ọ gwara ndị ọrụ ahụike ka ha na-akpachapụ anya ha mgbe niile, ya bụ, iyi uwe aka (gloves) mgbe ha na-elekọta ndị ọrịa.

english: Healthcare workers should maintain a high index of suspicion for Lassa fever, be vigilant and look out for symptoms of Lassa fever.
igbo: 'Ndị ọrụ ahụike kwesiri ịdị na-enyocha nke ukwuu maka ọrịa Lassa, kee nkwụcha ma lelee ihe mgbaàmà nke ọrịa Lassa fever.

english: Dr Okpala advised that any febrile illness that has not responded to 48 hours use of anti-malaria or antibiotics should raise an index of suspicion for Lassa fever.
igbo: dr Okpala dụrụ ọdụ na ọrịa ọbụla ejighi ọgwụ ịba maọbụ ọgwụ nje gbochie awa iri anọ na asatọ kwesiri ka e enyoo ya dịka ọrịa Lassa fever.

english: He also called on the healthcare workers to report any suspected case of Lassa fever to their local government disease surveillance and notification officer to access care.
igbo: ọ kpọkuzikwara ndị ọrụ ahụike ka ha kọọrọ ndị ọrụ gọọmentị obodo na-enyocha ọrịa a maka onye ọbụla ha chere bu ọrịa Lassa fever iji nweta nlekọta.

english: The commissioner said that Anambra State Ministry of Health was on the alert and fully prepared to respond to any outbreak of Lassa fever in the state.
igbo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwuru na Mịnịsta Ahụike steeti Anambra nọ na nche ma jikere nke ọma maka ọria Lassa fever na steeti ahụ.

english: GOVERNMENT ASSURES OF READINESS TO COMPLETE OKPUNOEZE /UMEOJILIGWE NNEWI ROADS By Mercy Akaolisa/Theresa Muowe :
igbo: GỌỌMENTỊ KWERE NKWA ỊRỤSỊ OKPOROỤZỌ OKPUNOEZE/UMEOJILIGWE NNEWI site n'aka Mercy/Akaolisa/Theresa Muowe:

english: Anambra State Government has assured the leadership of Uruagu Nnewi Community of its readiness to complete Okpunoeze/Umeojiligwe Uruagu Nnewi roads.
igbo: Gọọmentị Anambra emela ka obi sie ndị isi Uruagu Nnewi ike na ọ ga-adị njikere ịrụsị okporoụzọ Okpunoeze/Umeojiligwe Uruagu Nnewi.

english: Special Adviser (SA) to the Governor on Budget Monitoring and Efficiency, Mr Melie Onyejepu said this while addressing the group after an inspection tour on ongoing reconstruction of drainage channel of the roads.
igbo: Onye ndụmọdụ pụrụ iche (SA) nye Gọvanọ na Nnyocha Mmezi a kpọrọ Budget Monitoring and Efficiency, Maazị Melie Onyejepu kwuru nke a mgbe ọ na-agwa ndị otu ahụ okwu mgbe ọ gasịrị njem nlegharị anya na mwugharị okporo ụzọ mmiri.

english: Mr Onyejepu expressed the determination of the Gov. Obiano-led administration to ensure that the roads were in good shape, noting that the contractor had since been mobilised back to the site.
igbo: Maazị Onyejepu kwupụtara mkpebi nke gọọmentị Gọvanọ Obiano iji hụ na okporoụzọ ndị ahụ dị mma, na-arịba ama na kemgbe ka onye ọrụ ngo ahụ nọ na saịtị ahụ.

english: The economy of Anambra State is doing well because Gov. Willie Obiano has invested a lot on security, education, good roads, and in other vital areas.
igbo: Akụnaụba nke steeti Anambra na-eme nke ọma n’ihi na Gov. Willie Obiano etinyela ọtụtụ ego na nchekwa, mmụta, ezi ụzọ, na mpaghara ndị ọzọ dị mkpa.

english: According to him, the roads were delayed because of the prolonged rains, the redesigning of the drainage channel as well as increase in the bearing strength on the pavement.
igbo: Dịka o si kwuo, ụzọ ndị ahụ gburu oge n'ihi oke mmiri ozuzo, nrụgharị nke ọwa mmiri yana mmụba ike nke 'pavement'.

english: The SA re-assured them that Government was committed to completing the roads before the next raining season.
igbo: SA ahụ kwere ha nkwa na Gọọmentị na-agba mbọ ịrụcha ụzọ ndị ahụ tupu oge udu mmiri.

english: The President General, Uruagu Community, Mr Charles Nwoye praised the giant strides of Gov. Obiano.
igbo: Onyeisi obodo Uruagu, Maazị Charles Nwoye toro Gov. Obiano.

english: She said that Anambra was the safest state in Nigeria with accessible good road network.
igbo: O kwuru na Anambra bụ steeti kasị nwe nchebe na Naịjiria nke nwere ezigbo okporo ụzọ.

english: The PG said that although the community was grateful for the intervention by the state government, but stressed the need to ensure completion of the roads before the rainy season.
igbo: PG kwuru na n'agbanyeghị na ndị obodo na-ekele ekele maka ntinye aka nke gọọmentị steeti ahụ, mana o kwusiri ike mkpa ọ dị iji hụ na arụchara okporoụzọ tupu oge udummiri.

english: A stakeholder in Uruagu Nnewi, Mr Ben Aghazu pledged that the community would offer the construction company the needed support to complete the project.
igbo: Onye nwere ego n'Uruagu Nnewi, Maazị Ben Aghazu kwere nkwa na obodo ahụ ga-enye ụlọ ọrụ ahụ ihe enyemaka ha chọrọ iji rụchaa ọrụ ahụ.

english: In my personal capacity, I have provided a place of residence for the workers to ensure their availability in the site.
igbo: N'ikike m, enyela m ebe obibi maka ndị ọrụ iji hụ na ha nọ na saịtị ahụ.

english: Aghazu commended Onyejepu efforts in ensuring that the state government intervened in 100-Foot Road, Nnewi.
igbo: Aghazu toro mbọ Onyejepu gbara iji hụ na gọọmentị etiti tinyere aka n'okporo ụzọ dị '100Foot', na Nnewi.

english: Another stakeholder of the community, Mr Agu Okonkwo praised the Onyejepu for ensuring that the roads continued to command government's attention.
igbo: Onye ọzọ nwere ego n'obodo ahụ, Maazị Agu Okonkwo toro Onyejepu maka ịgba mbọ hụ na okporoụzọ ndị ahụ gara n'ihu na-adọta ndị gọọmentị.

english: He also said that the community was worried because the sand earlier coated on the roads was posing health challenges to residents of the community.
igbo: O kwukwara na obodo ahụ na-echegbu onwe ha n'ihi na ájá ahụ a wụrụ n'okporo ụzọ ndị ahụ na-ewetara ndị bi n'obodo ahụ nsogbu ahụike.

english: ADB TO BANKROLL CONSTRUCTION OF RURAL/FARM ROADS IN ANAMBRA AT PROJECT COST OF 50 MILLION DOLLARS
igbo: ADB ỊKWADO ỌRỤ OKPOROỤZỌ IME OBODO/UGBO NA ANAMBRA NKE GA-EWE NDE DỌLA IRI ISE.

english: The African Development Bank (ADB) is to bankroll the construction of rural/farm roads in 14 Local Government Areas of Anambra state at the cost of 50 million dollars, a top aid of the Anambra state Government says.
igbo: Ụlọakụ 'The African Development Bank (ADB) ga-eji ego ruru nde dọla iri ise kwado ịrụ okporoụzọ ime obodo/ugbo na mpaghara okpuru ọchịchị iri na anọ nke steeti Anambra, otu enyemaka dị elu nke gọọmentị steeti Anambra kwuru.

english: The Project Coordinator of Anambra Rural Access and Agricultural Marketing Project (RAAMP), Mr Joe Onyejekwe, an engineer said the project would be sited in some select food producing corridors of the state.
igbo: Onye nchịkọta ọchịchị nke Anambra Rural Access and Agricultural Marketing Project (RAAMP), Maazị Joe Onyejekwe, onye injinia kwuru na a ga-arụ ọrụ ahụ n'ụfọdụ obodo na-akọpụta nri na steeti ahụ.

english: According to him diligent decisions were reached to site the projects within these food producing belts of the state -- Ayamelum, Anambra East, Anambra West, Oyi, Dunukofia, Awka North, Awka, South, Orumba North, Orumba South, Aguata, Ihiala, Ogbaru, Idemili South and Anaocha.
igbo: Dịka o siri kwuo, mkpebi siri ike ka e wepụtara iji rụ ọrụ ndị a n'ime obodo ndị na-emepụta nri na steeti - Ayamelum, Anambra East, Anambra West, Oyi, Dunukofia, Awka North, Awka South, Orumba North, Orumba South, Aguata, Ihiala, Ogbaru, Idemili South na Anaocha.

english: He said the projects were originally conceived by the Federal Government, when it was established that the country was steadily losing 9.8 Billion dollars annually in post harvest losses.
igbo: Ọ sịrị na gọọmentị etiti bụ ndị mbụ chepụtara ọrụ ndị ahụ, mgbe mba ahụ na-emefu ihe ruru ijeri dọla 9.8 kwa afọ.

english: The commissioner said this when the Association of Ndi Anambra residing in Madrid, Spain paid her courtesy visit in her office at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.
igbo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwuru nke a mgbe ndị otu Ndị Anambra bi na Madrid, Spain bịara nleta dị mma n'ọfịs ya na Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.

english: This stemmed from the inability of the food producing areas to readily access the markets to evacuate their harvests.
igbo: Nke a sitere na enweghi ike mpaghara na-emepụta nri iji ruo ahịa ngwa ngwa na repụ ihe ubi ha.

english: He said that the FG, then, opened up discussions with two major funding agencies -- the World Bank and the African Development based in Abidjan.
igbo: O kwuru na FG, mgbe ahụ, mepere mkparịta ụka ya na nnukwu ụlọ ọrụ nkwado abụọ- World Bank na African Development dị n'Abidjan.

english: Onyejekwe, a Senior Special Assistant (SSA) to the Governor on Works, noted that it was the bid to overcome this anomaly that the FG then, projected to execute the jobs in 18 states.
igbo: Onyejekwe, onye nnukwu enyemaka pụrụiche (SSA) nye Gọvanọ n'Ọrụ, kwuru na ọ bụ iji merie ọgbaghara a ka FG mgbe ahụ, chọrọ ịrụ ọrụ ahụ na steeti iri na asatọ.

english: He said that it was resolved that five states -- Anambra, Borno, Benue, Taraba and Cross River States would be financed by African Development Bank and the rest to be financed by the World Bank.
igbo: O kwuru na e kpebiri na steeti ise- Anambra, Borno, Benue, Taraba na Cross River Steeti ga-enweta nkwado site n'aka African Development Bank ebe ndị ọzọ ga-enweta ego site n'aka Ụlọakụ Mba Ụwa.

english: The ADB has since accepted to bankroll the projects, promising each of the five states 50 million dollars.
igbo: Ndị ADB anabatara ịkwado ọrụ ndị a, na-ekwe nkwa na steeti ise ga-enweta nde dọla iri ise n'otu n'otu.

english: Their officials have made two major visits to Anambra State, during which they have interacted with people from the concerned communities.
igbo: Ndị isi ha emeela njem nleta abụọ n'Anambra Steeti, oge ha na ndị mmadụ sitere na mpaghara ndị ahụ kpakọrịtara.

english: They have all mutually agreed to work together toward successful realisation of the projects.
igbo: 'Ha niile ekwekọrịtala ịrụkọ ọrụ ọnụ iji rụpụta ihe ọma n'ọrụ a.

english: Onyejekwe, said that project, which aims primarily at building all-season farm roads would have complementing infrastructure and facilities like building of markets, Veterinary clinics, cottage industries, Road Safety Service centres, Storage facilities.
igbo: Onyejekwe kwuru na ọrụ ngo ndị a bụ iji rụọ ụzọ gara ugbo nke ga-enwe akụrụngwa dịka ụlọ ebe a na-ere ahịa, ụlọ ebe a na-ere ọgwụ anụmanụ, ebe ọrụ nchekwa okporo ụzọ na ihe e ji echekwa ihe.

english: The benefitting communities benefiting communities would be trained on road maintenance and partnership with the private sector for provision of transport for evacuation of farm produce.
igbo: A ga-azụta obodo ndị ahụ na-erite uru na njikwa okporo ụzọ na mmekorita ya na otu mmadụ nwe maka inye aka ụgbọ njem maka ibupụ ihe ubi.

english: The job would also entail resettlement of people, who might be displaced in the process for project delivery.
igbo: Ọrụ ahụ ga-edubatakwa ndozi ndị mmadụ, ndị nwere ike ịbụ ndị a chụpụrụ n'usoro maka ịnye ọrụ.

english: He confirmed that Anambra State Government had demonstrated commitment by striving to meet all the local requirements to access the funding for the project.
igbo: O kwenyere na Gọọmentị Anambra gosipụtara nkwenye site n'ịgbalịsi ike imezu ihe niile dị na mpaghara iji nweta ego maka ọrụ ahụ.

english: Since conditions require that all participating states will provide 8 per cent of the counterpart funding, the state has since committed to this.
igbo: Ebe ọnọdụ chọrọ ka steeti niile sonyere ga-eweta pasenti 8 nke ego mbụbata, steeti enyefeelarịị nke a.

english: Indeed, the funding that has so far been utilised by Anambra to carry out its impact assessment studies and other relevant exercises considered important to assessing the project have come from the state Government.
igbo: 'N’ezie, ego ndị Anambra tinyere n'ọrụ iji wee mụọ ọmụmụ ntule na ihe omume ndị ọzọ e chere na ha dị mkpa maka ịtụle ọrụ a sitere n’aka gọọmentị steeti.

english: Onyejekwe said that Anambra State Government had so far spent N80 million, all still within the 8 per cent of Anambra State share of the counterpart funding.
igbo: Onyejekwe kwuru na gọọmentị Anambra Steeti emefuola nde naịra iri asatọ, ihe niile ka dị na pasenti asatọ nke steeti Anambra ketara.

english: We expect another tranche of payment from Government to undertake another critical aspect of the job; this is the design and then full implementation of the project, when the funding must been assessed for full execution of the various jobs.
igbo: 'Anyị na-atụ anya na ịkwụ ụgwọ ọzọ sitere n'aka gọọmentị ga-arụ ọrụ ọzọ dị oke mkpa; nke a bụ atụmatụ ahụ na mmejupụta ọrụ ahụ n'ụzọ zuru ezu, mgbe a na-enyocha ego ahụ maka mmezu nke ọrụ dị iche iche.

english: I am confident that the project will soon get off to a start with all the enormous engineering works in full steam.
igbo: 'Obi siri m ike na ọrụ ngo a ga-amalite n'oge adịghị anya, ebe a ga-arụ ọtụtụ ọrụ injinia niile.

english: The job execution would guarantee jobs at all levels – the Bank and communities will be happy at the jobs.
igbo: Ndị na-enye ọrụ ga-enye ọrụ n'ọnọdụ ọbụla- ụlọakụ ahụ na ndị obodo ga-enwe obi ụtọ n'ọrụ ndị ahụ.

english: Its going to be a win on win situation for all'.
igbo: 'Ọ ga-abụ ọnọdụ mmeri maka mmadụ niile'.

english: DOZZY FOUNDATION ENROLLS 1,500 PERSONS INTO ANAMBRA HEALTH INSURANCE SCHEME
igbo: DOZZY FOUNDATION EDEBANYELA MMADỤ OTU PUKU NA NARỊ ISE N'ANAMBRA HEALTH INSURANCE SCHEME

english: Dozzy Foundation, a subsidiary of Dozzy Group Nig. Ltd. , has enrolled no fewer than 1,500 Okija indigenes into Anambra State Health Insurance Scheme (ASHIA).
igbo: Dozzy Foundation, onye enyemaka nke Dozzy Group Nig. Ltd., edebanyela aha ụmụ amaala Okija opekata mpe mmadụ otu puku na narị ise n'Anambra State Health Insurance Scheme (ASHIA).

english: , has enrolled no fewer than 1,500 Okija indigenes into Anambra State Health Insurance Scheme (ASHIA).
igbo: Edebanyela aha ụmụ amaala Okija opekata mpe mmadụ otu puku na narị ise n'ime ngalaba Anambra State Health Insurance Scheme (ASHIA).

english: The enrollment took place at Okija General Hospital, where some top government officials, business moguls, traditional rulers, clergies and witnessed the event.
igbo: Ndenye aha a bụ nke e mere n'ụlọọgwụ Okija, ebe ụfọdụ ndị isi gọọmentị, ndị isi ahịa, ndị igwe, ndị ụkọchukwu bịara emume ahụ.

english: Gov. Willie Obiano of Anambra, who flagged off the exercise, was represented by his Deputy, Dr Nkem Okeke.
igbo: Gov. Willie Obiano nke Anambra, onye kwụpụrụ nke ahụ bụ osote ya, Dr Nkem Okeke nọchitere anya ya.

english: The governor said that the health insurance scheme was introduced to offer medical succour to the low income earners as well as those living in the rural areas of the state.
igbo: Gọvanọ ahụ kwuru na e webatara atụmatụ ahụike ahụ iji nyere ndị na-akpata obere ego yana ndị bi n'ime ime obodo nke steeti ahụ aka.

english: Obiano commended the Foundation for making free medical care available, noting that the scheme would enable the indigenes especially the elderly ones among them to visit the hospitals regularly.
igbo: Obiano toro ntọala/Foundation ahụ maka inye nlekọta ahụike n'efu, na-ekwupụta na atụmatụ a ga-enyere ụmụ amaala ahụ aka ọkachasị ndị agadi nọ n'etiti ha ije nleta n'ụlọọgwụ oge niile.

english: He said that the enrollees would pay little or no amount in medical bills as the exercise would help to eliminate the spread and use of fake drugs in the communities.
igbo: O kwuru na ndị debanyere aha ga-akwụ obere ụgwọ maọbụ ha agaghị akwụ ụgwọ n'ụgwọ ahụike dịka ihe ọmụmụ ahụ ga-enyere aka wepụ mgbasa na ịṅụ ọgwụ adịgboroja n'obodo.

english: We are here to extend the scheme to Okija through Dozzy Foundation,' he said.
igbo: O kwuru na 'Anyị nọ ebe a iji bulite atụmatụ a n'Okija site na Dozzy Foundation.'

english: The governor also inaugurated the upgraded Okija General Hospital by Dozzy Foundation.
igbo: Gọvanọ mepekwara ụlọọgwụ Okija nke Dozzy Foundation wulitere.

english: He thanked the Executive Chairman Dozzy Group, Dr Daniel Chukwudozie for the kind gesture.
igbo: O kelere onyeisi oche Dozzy Group, Dr Daniel Chukwudozie maka ezi ihe ahụ.

english: The governor, then, urged other well-to-do Ndi Anambra to emulate the group in bringing development to the state.
igbo: Gọvanọ ahụ rịọkwara ndị Anambra ọzọ ji ego ka ha ṅomie ndị otu ahụ n'iweta mmepe na steeti ahụ.

english: Executive Secretary ASHIA, Dr Simeon Onyemaechi, said Dozzy Foundation had taken the bull by the horn' in engaging 1,500 persons into the scheme.
igbo: Onye odeakwụkwọ ASHIA, Dọkịta Simeon Onyemaechi kwuru na Dozzy Foundation akpaala ike n'itinye mmadụ otu puku na narị ise n'atụmatụ ahụ.

english: We wish to commend them for understanding the need for functional health system,' Onyemaechi said.
igbo: 'Anyị chọrọ ịja ha mma maka ịghọta mkpa ụlọọrụ ahụike na-arụsi ọrụ ike dị,' Onyemaechi kwuru.

english: The ASHIA boss urged beneficiaries to ensure proper use of the opportunity.
igbo: Onyeisi ASHIA ahụ gbara ndị na-erite uru ume ka ha hụ na ha jiri ohere ahụ kpọrọ ihe.

english: Days of visiting quacks are over and the people of Okija can now access quality healthcare using their ASHIA cards,' Onyemaechi said.
igbo: 'Oge nleta adịgboroja a gaala aga, ndị Okija nwekwaa ike inweta ahụike dị mma n'iji kaadị ASHIA ha,' Onyemaechi kwuru.

english: He said that the foundation had taken care of financial aspect of the enrollees as N12, 000 annual fees per person had been paid for all 1,500 individuals.
igbo: O kwuru na ntọala ahụ elekọtara ihe banyere ego nke ndị debanyere aha ha dịka puku naịra iri na abụọ bụ ụgwọ onye ọbụla ga-akwụ n'afọ ụgwọ nke ọ kwụrụ maka mmadụ otu puku na narị ise niile.

english: Dr Onyemaechi also thanked Dozzy Foundation for spending millions of naira in renovating the Okija General Hospital, describing the act as philanthropy at its best'.
igbo: Dr Onyemaechi kelekwara Dozzy Foundation maka imefu nde kwuru nde naịra n'ịhazigharị ụlọọgwụ Okija, na-akọwa ihe ahụ dịka 'ọrụ ebube kacha mma'.

english: Anambra State Government is quite appreciative of the support from Dozzy group through its various interventions in Okija and environs,' he said.
igbo: O kwuru, 'Gọọmentị steeti Anambra na-ekele nkwado nke ndị otu Dozzy site n'enyemaka ya dị iche iche n'Okija na gburugburu ya,'

english: In an address, Executive Chairman Dozzy group, Dr Chukwudozie said the foundation had over the years embarked on programmes aimed at empowering the less privileged.
igbo: N’okwu a, onyeisi oche otu Dozzy, Dr Chukwudozie kwuru na ntọala ahụ amalitela kemgbe n'ihe omume a iji nyere ndị o nweghi ka ọ ha aka.

english: These includes, offering scholarship to indigent students and putting smiles on faces of the widows.
igbo: Ndị a gụnyere, inye ụmakwụkwọ enweghi ego agụmakwụkwọ n'efu na ime ka ihu ọchị waa ụmụnwaanyị ajadu.

english: He said that the Foundation had recognised inability of many people to pay their hospital bills.
igbo: O kwuru na ntọala ahụ amatala na ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ enweghi ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ụlọọgwụ.

english: This he said compel them to patronise quacks, thereby increasing the mortality rate of people living in most rural communities.
igbo: Nke a ka o kwuru ịmanye ha ịtụnyere ndị adịgboroja, wee na-abawanye ọnụọgụgụ ndị mmadụ na-anwụ bụ ndị bi n'ọtụtụ ime obodo.

english: Dr Chukwudozie noted that the inauguration of the scheme in Okija in collaboration with ASHIA was in line with Social Corporate Responsibility of the Dozzy.
igbo: Dr Chukwudozie kwuru na mwepụta nke atụmatụ a n'Okija na njikọta ya na ASHIA bụ n'usoro Social Corporate Responsibility nke Dozzy.

english: He solicited state government assistance in providing medical personnel, as well as equipping Okija General Hospital with necessary basic amenities.
igbo: Ọ rịọrọ maka enyemaka gọọmentị steeti iweta ndị ọrụ ahụike, yana ịkwadebe ma tinye ihe ndị dị mkpa n'ụlọọgwụ Okija.

english: Some of the enrollees expressed their joy, describing the programme as a good development that would help prolong their lives.
igbo: Ụfọdụ ndị ahụ nwetara ọzụzụ gosipụtara obi ụtọ ha, na-akọwa mmemme ahụ dịka ezigbo mmepe nke ga-enyere aka gbatịkwuo ndụ ha.

english: CRIMINALISE BUSH FIRES NOW -- LIVESTOCK FARMER
igbo: MEBIE IWU ỊGBA ỌHỊA ỌKỤ UGBU A - NDỊ ỌRỤ UGBO

english: Dr Ugochukwu Okpalaeke, Managing Director (MD) Eagle Food Processing Industry Ltd., has called on government at all levels to criminalise bush fires to save forest reserves in the state.
igbo: Dọkịta Ugochukwu Okpalaeke, onye nlekọta 'Managing Director' (MD) Eagle Food Processing Industry Ltd., akpọkuola gọọmentị n'ogo niile imebie ịgba ọhịa ọkụ iji chekwaa ọhịa na steeti ahụ.

english: Those who can afford it should pay without delay for their indigent relatives, friends and community members the way philanthropists like Dr Chukwudozie of Dozzy Foundation have done for their people.
igbo: Ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ kwesiri ịkwụrụ ndị ikwu ha dara ogbenye, ndị enyi na ndị obodo ụgwọ n'egbughi oge dịka ndị ọrụ enyemaka dịka Dr Chukwudozie nke Dozzy Foundation meere ndị ha.

english: Okpalaeke made the call while interacting with information officers, in his office at Ozalla Akokwa Umuchu, on Jan.
igbo: Okpalaeke kpọrọ oku ahụ mgbe ya na ndị ọrụ ozi na-akparịta ụka, n'ọfịs ya n'Ozalla Akokwa Umuchu, na Jan.

english: Dr Okpalaeke said that bush fires constituted sabotage against governments at all levels.
igbo: Dr Okpalaeke kwuru na ọhịa ịgba ọkụ bụ mmebi iwu megide gọọmentị n'ọkwa niile.

english: This is a matter that should be treated with dispatch.
igbo: Nke a bụ okwu e kwesiri itinye ọnụ na ya ozigbo.

english: He explained that that certain people he classed as lazy hunters' were those in the habit of setting fires in a bid to hunt for bush meat' –rabbits, antelopes.
igbo: Ọ kọwara na ụfọdụ ndị ọ kpọrọ dịka 'ndị dinta dị umengwụ' bụ ndị na-amụnye ọkụ iji chụọ 'anụ ọhịa' - oke oyibo, ele.

english: According to him in the process they only succeed in destroying forest reserves and their habitats.
igbo: Dịka o kwuru, ha na-aga n'ihu ibibi oke ọhịa na ebe obibi ha.

english: When fires destroy bush, the nutrients in the land, animals, birds and insects that cross fertilize plants are also destroyed in the process; this also results into poor harvests of crops, high mortality rate among animals, with hunger as another direct consequence.
igbo: 'Mgbe ọhịa gbara ọkụ, ọ na-emebi ihe ndị na-enye nri dị n’ime ala, ụmụanụmanụ, ụmụ nnụnụ na ụmụahụhụ nke na-enyere ahịhịa/osisi aka ito; nke a na-ebute owuwe ihe ubi adịghị mma, ọnụọgụgụ ọnwụ dị elu nke ụmụanụmanụ, na agụụ.

english: So, government has no option than to deal decisively with bush fire perpetrators, so as to stem negative consequences,' he said.
igbo: 'N'ihi ya, gọọmentị enweghị nhọrọ karịa imeso ndị mpụ na-agba ọhịa ọkụ, iji kpata rezọọtụ adịghị mma,' ka o kwuru.

english: According to him, it is an ill wind that blows no one any good, calling on the media especially radio and television to develop jingles to sensitise the general public on dangers of bush fires.
igbo: Dịka o si kwuo, ọ bụ ihe dị njọ na-emetụta onye ọbụla, na-akpọ oku na mgbasa ozi ọkachasị redio na televishọn ka ha gbasaa ozi iji mee ka ọha na eze mara ihe egwu dị n'ịgba ọhịa ọkụ.

english: He urged Churches, Primary/Secondary Schools, market leaders, Igwes, president's generals and village heads to launch crusade against fire menace.
igbo: Ọ gbara ụka, ụlọ akwụkwọ praịmarị na nke sekọndrị, ndị isi ahịa, ndị igwe na ndị isi obodo ume ka ha bido ịlụ ọgụ megide ihe egwu dị n'ịgba ọhịa ọkụ.

english: The MD said that since December 2019 to date, he lost nine native cows (Efi Igbo) as a result of bush fires that cleared all vegetations around his ranch.
igbo: Nke MD kwuru na kemgbe ọnwa Disemba afọ 2019 ruo taa, na ehi Igbo itoolu funahụrụ ya n'ihi ọkụ ọgbụgba nke kpochapụrụ ahịhịa niile dị na gburugburu ya.

english: The Efi Hausa is survives it because they eat prepared animal feeds while Efi Igbo finds it difficult to survive as feed mainly on green leaves,' he said.
igbo: 'Ehi Hausa dị ndụ n'ihi na ha na-eri nri a kwadebere maka anụmanụ ebe ọ na-esiri Ehi Igbo ike ịdị ndụ ka ha na-eri akwụkwọ ndụ akwụkwọ ndụ,' o kwuru.

english: Okpalaeke used the opportunity to congratulate Gov. Willie Obiano on his recent award as Knight Commander of the Pontifical Order of St. Gregory the Great.
igbo: Okpalaeke jiri ohere ahụ kelee Gov. Willie Obiano na nzere o nwetara nso nso a dịka onye Knight Commander nke Pontifical Order of St Gregory the Great.

english: There can hardly be a better demonstration of solidarity with the human family than participation in initiatives like the Anambra State Health Insurance Scheme.
igbo: O nwere ike isi ike inwe ngosipụta dị mma na mmekọrịta mmadụ na ibe ya karịa ikere òkè na atụmatụ dịka atụmatụ Anambra State Health Insurance Scheme.

english: Anambra State Commissioner for Diaspora Affairs, Indigenous Artworks, Culture and Tourism, Mrs Sally Mbanefo has appealed Anambra State Association (ASA), Madrid, Spain to strive invest in the state.
igbo: Kọmịshọna steetị Anambra Steeti maka Diaspora Affairs, Indigenous Artworks, Culture and Tourism, Oriakụ Sally Mbanefo arịọla otu Anambra State Association (ASA), Madrid, Spain ka ha gbaa mbọ tinye ego na steeti ahụ.

english: This is an honour well deserved and a reward for hard work.
igbo: 'Nke a bụ nsọpụrụ kwesiri ekwesi na ụgwọ ọrụ maka ịrụsi ọrụ ike.

english: Obiano has achieved excellence at every life endeavour, from his school days to his days in the banking industry/personal businesses.
igbo: 'Obiano enwetazuola ihe dị mma na ndụ ọbụla, site n'ụbọchị agụmakwụkwọ ya rue ụlọọrụ ụlọakụ/ahịa nke onwe.

english: He called on Anambra youths to emulate Obiano, emphasising that award did not come through shortcuts, but rather from hard work.
igbo: Ọ kpọkuru ndị ntorobịa Anambra ka ha ṅomie Obiano, na-ekwusi ike na nzere abụghị site n'ụzọ dị mkpirisi, kama ọ bụ site n'ịrụsi ọrụ ike.

english: If anybody wanted an award of excellence, he should discharge his duties creditably wherever they found themselves.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na onye ọbụla chọrọ ka e nye ya onyinye/nzere kachasị mma, o kwesịrị ịrụ ọrụ ya nke ọma ebe ọbụla ha hụrụ onwe ha.

english: I have not less 40 awards as a farmer.
igbo: 'Enwere m opekata mpe onyinye iri anọ dịka onye ọrụ ubi.

english: So, awards are available in every discipline; it is only hard work and sincerity of purpose that are rewarded,' he said.
igbo: Ya mere, nzere dị n'ọzụzụ ọbụla; ọ bụ naanị ịrụsi ọrụ ike na ezi obi nke nzube ka a ga-akwụ ụgwọ,' o kwuru.

english: The MD emphasised that it was better to rear animals in ranches than rearing them wandering about.
igbo: MD ahụ mere ka ọ pụta ìhè na ọ ka mma idobe ụmụanụmanụ n'ebe a na-azụ ụmụ anụmanụ karịa ime ka ha na-awagharị n'ọhịa.

english: This he said had enabled them to grow faster, bigger and produce more.
igbo: O kwuru na nke a na-enyere ha aka ito ngwa ngwa, buo ibu ma mepụta ihe karịa.

english: Those that purchase cows from us testify to generating more meat as they slaughter them,' Okpalaeke said.
igbo: 'Ndị zụrụ ehi n'aka anyị na-agba akaebe na ha-enweta ọtụtụ anụ ma ha gbue ha,' Okpalaeke kwuru.

english: We maintain good relationship with crop farmers because we buy their products such as cassava peels, leaves, to feed our animals.
igbo: 'Anyị na ndị ọrụ ugbo na-enwe ezi mmekọrịta n'ihi na anyị na-azụ ihe ubi ha dịka azụ akpụ, akwụkwọ nri, iji zụ ụmụanụmanụ anyị.

english: They also buy animal faeces as manure to grow crops.
igbo: 'Ha na-azụkwa nsị anụmanụ dịka ahịhịa nri (manure) iji mee ka ihe ubi too.

english: Okpalaeke said that they also undertake palm kernel processing for animal feeds, buying as much as anybody could bring to them at attractive prices.
igbo: Okpalaeke kwuru na ha na-arụkwa nhazi mkpụrụ akị maka nri anụmanụ, na-azụta ihe onye ọbụla ga-ewetara ha ọnụ ahịa mara mma.

english: A staff member of Eagle Food Processing Industry Nigeria Ltd.
igbo: Onye ọrụ nke Eagle Food Processing Industry Nigeria Ltd.

english: , Mr Samuel Ezennia said that their MD was a good employer.
igbo: Maazị Samuel Ezennia kwuru na MD ha bụ ezigbo onye na-ewe ọrụ.

english: He pays salaries promptly; maintains good relationship with workers who are known to be hard working.
igbo: Ọ na-akwụ ụgwọ ọrụ n’oge; na-enwe mmekọrịta dị mma n'etiti ndị ọrụ a maara na ha na-arụsi ọrụ ike.

english: He punishes lazy ones.
igbo: Ọ tara ndị umengwụ ahụhụ.

english: CONDUCT INTEGRITY TESTS BEFORE REBUILDING -- AGUPUGO URGES VICTIMS OF MARKET FIRE DISASTERS
igbo: MEE NNWALE IGUZOSI IKE N’EZI IHE TUPU ỊMALITE IWUGHACHI- AGUPUGO NA-AGBA NDỊ ỌDACHI ỌKỤ ỌGBỤGBA NKE AHỊA METỤTARA UME

english: Executive Director, Anambra State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA), Mr CY Agupugo has directed shop owners affected by Mgbuka Obosi Market fire disasters to conduct integrity tests before rebuilding their burnt shops.
igbo: Onyeisi nchịkwa, nke Anambra State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA), Mazị CY Agupugo agwala ndị nwere ụlọ ahịa nke ọdachi ọkụ nke ahịa Mgbuka Obosi metụtara ka ha nwalee iguzosi ike n'ezi ihe ha tupu ha ewughachi ụlọ ahịa ha ọkụ gbara.

english: Agupugo gave the directive when the panel set up on recent Mgbuka Obosi Market fires conducted assessment visits to affected parts of the market.
igbo: Agupugo nyere ntuzi aka ahụ mgbe ndị otu e guzobere n'ọkụ gbara n'ahịa Mgbuka Obosi na nso nso a mere nleta n'akụkụ ahịa ahụ ọkụ gbara.

english: The executive director, who doubled as secretary of the panel noted that it was wrong to start rebuilding shops and malls without integrity tests by the State Physical Planning Board and other relevant bodies.
igbo: Onyeisi ụlọ ọrụ ahụ, bụ onye jikwa ọrụ dịka odeakwụkwọ nke otu ahụ chọpụtara na ọ bụ ihe ọjọọ ịmalite ịrụ ụlọ ahịa na nnukwu ụlọ ahịa na-enweghị ule iguzosi ike n'ezi ihe nke ga-esite n'aka Physical Planning Board nke steeti ahụ na ndị ọzọ dị mkpa o metụtara.

english: We all have to take proper measures before we commence rebuilding of shops.
igbo: Anyị niile kwesiri ime ihe kwesiri ekwesi tupu anyị ebido iwugharị ụlọ ahịa.

english: I know that we are in a hurry to rebuild, so as to get back to our businesses, but we have to do the right thing first,' he said.
igbo: Amaara m na anyị na-eme ngwa ngwa ịrụghachi, ka anyị wee nwee ike ịlaghachi n'azụmaahịa anyị, mana anyị ga-ebu ụzọ mee ihe ziri ezi,' o kwuru.

english: Managing Director Anambra State Fire Service, Mr Ben Chiobi noted that the market was of great relevance to Ndi Anambra, as investors from different parts of the world come there to do business.
igbo: Onyeisi nchịkwa ụlọ lọrụ Anambra State Fire Service, Maazị Ben Chiobi kwuru na ahịa ahụ dị ndị Anambra ezigbo mkpa, ebe ndị ntinye ego sitere n'akụkụ ụwa dị iche iche na-abịa ebe ahụ ịzụ ahịa.

english: According to him, it was of importance that challenges faced by the market be addressed immediately and accordingly.
igbo: Dịka o si kwuo, ọ dị mkpa na a ga-elebara ihe ịma aka ndị dị n'ahịa anya ozigbo.

english: Chiobi also condemned indiscriminate dumping of waste engine oil and other combustible materials in and around the market.
igbo: Chiobi katọrọ ikpofu mmanụ ụgbọala mebiri emebi na ihe ndị ọzọ adịghị mma n'ime na n'akụkụ ahịa ahụ.

english: He said that state government through agencies like fire service, SEMA and related bodies would aid the market leaders to see that state laws would be enforce.
igbo: O kwuru na gọọmentị steeti site n'ụlọ ọrụ dịka ụlọọrụ ọkụ, SEMA na ndị metụtara ya ga-enyere ndị isi ahịa aka ịhụ na a ga-etinye iwu steeti ahụ.

english: It is in the interest of government to see that whatever challenges they face are solved as the state government will always come to your aid.
igbo: Ọ bụ mmasị nke gọọmentị ịhụ na e gboro nsogbu ọbụla chere ha ihu dịka gọọmentị steeti ga-enyere gị aka.

english: In order to avoid future occurrence of disasters in the state, there is a process for erecting buildings and that process requires that you must get government approval,' Chiobi noted.
igbo: 'Iji zeere ihe ga-eme n'ọdịnihu na steeti ahụ, e nwere usoro maka iwu ụlọ ma usoro ahụ chọrọ ka i nweta nnabata gọọmentị,' Chiobi kwuru.

english: Chairman of Mgbuka Obosi who is also a member of the panel, Mr Samuel Okey Ezeobodo, while sympathising with the fire victims, commended the state government for showing concerns toward them.
igbo: Onyeisi oche Mgbuka Obosi, onye bụkwa onye otu a, Maazị Samuel Okey Ezeobodo, mgbe ọ na-enwere ndị ọkụ dakwasịrị ọmịiko, kelere gọọmentị steeti maka igosipụta nchegbu ha.

english: He urged market leadership to ensure that the people put up better structures that would benefit the traders and government.
igbo: Ọ gbara ndị isi ahịa ume ka ha gbaa mbọ hụ na ndị mmadụ hiwere ezigbo ụlọ nke ga-abara ndị ahịa na gọọmentị uru.

english: MGBACHU NKPOR ELECTS NEW EXECUTIVE By Uzo Ugwunze
igbo: MGBACHU NKPOR HỌPỤTARA NDỊ NDU ỌHỤRỤ site n’aka Uzo Ugwunze

english: A New Executive has been elected to pilot affairs of Mgbachu Village, Nkpor, Idemili North Local Government Area, Anambra State, for the next four years.
igbo: A họpụtala ndị isi ọhụụ ga-arụ maka ọdịmma ógbè Mgbachu Nkpor, Idemili North Local Government Area, Anambra Steeti, afọ anọ na-abịa.

english: Heir apparent to Odu position in the village, Mr Godwin Onwukwe after dissolving the former village leaderships that were running parallel government, noted the need to operate in with the village Constitution.
igbo: Onye nketa ọkwa Odu n'ime obodo, Mr Godwin Onwukwe, mgbe o kposasịrị ndị isi mbụ obodo ahụ na-arụ ọrụ yiri ọchịchị gọọmentị, kwuru na ọ dị mkpa iji iwu obodo rụọ ọrụ.

english: We want to follow our Constitution and bring about lasting peace to the leadership and promote progress in Mgbachu.
igbo: 'Anyị chọrọ iso iwu anyị ma weta udo na-adịgide n'ọchịchị ma kwalite ọganiihu na Mgbachu.

english: I hereby dissolve the former executives on both sides,' Onwukwe said.
igbo: 'M wee si otu a kpochapu ndị bụbu ndị isi na mpaghara abụọ,” Onwukwe kwuru.

english: He commended Chairman of Mgbachu Elders Forum, Mr Oboli Joseph Okolo, the Nkpor Development Union (NDU) team, Chairman Nkpor Taskforce, Mr Augustine Udoh and Nkpor Central Vigilance Security, DSS and Police.
igbo: O toro onyeisi ndị otu okenye Mgbachu, Maazị Oboli Joseph Okolo, ndị otu Nkpor Development Union (NDU), onyeisi Nkpor Taskforce, Mr Augustine Udoh na ndị ọrụ nche Nkpor Central, DSS na ndị uwe ojii.

english: The former village Chairman, Mr Sunday Udoh pleaded with NDU to postpone the election to give him more time to prepare for re-election but he was told that his appeal was belated.
igbo: Onye bụbu onyeisi oche obodo, Maazị Sunday Udoh rịọrịrị ka NDU yigharịe nhọpụta ahụ iji nyekwuo ya oghere iji kwado maka ntuli aka mana a gwara ya na arịrịọ ya abịaghị n'oge.

english: The election was conducted through option A4 – the open ballot system.
igbo: A na-eme ntuli aka site na nhọrọ A4- usoro vootu gho oghe.

english: Arinze Idemili polled 66 votes to defeat his opponent, Sunday Muoghalu who polled 23 votes.
igbo: Arinze Idemili nwetara vootu iri isii na isii iji merie Sunday Muoghalu onye nwetara vootu iri abụọ na atọ.

english: The executive comprises Mr Arinze Idemili, Chairman; Mr Sunday Muoghalu Vice Chairman; Mr Felix Adibe, Secretary; Mr Ikechukwu Ejikeme, Assist Secretary; Mr Nzube Anikpe, Fin Sec; and Mr Chukwuka Obidigbo,Treasurer.
igbo: Ndị isi ahụ gụnyere Maazị Arinze Idemili, onyeisi oche; Maazị Sunday Muoghalu osote onyeisi oche; Mazị Felix Adibe, odeakwụkwọ; Maazị Ikechukwu Ejikeme, inyeaka odeakwụkwọ; Maazị Nzube Anikpe, odeakwụkwọ ego; na Maazị Chukwuka Obidigbo, oji ego.

english: Others are Nnanna Nwosu, Pub Sec; Ekene Ezeabata, Provost; Mr Nwachukwu Okolo Assist Provost and Amaechi Onwukwe as Auditor.
igbo: Ndị ọzọ bụ Nnanna Nwosu, odeakwụkwọ mgbasa ozi; Ekene Ezeabata, Provost; Maazị Nwachukwu Okolo Assist Provost na Amaechi Onwukwe dịka onye nyocha.

english: In his acceptance speech, Arinze Idemili thanked everyone for giving him the opportunity to serve his people and promised to attract developmental projects to Mgbachu village.
igbo: N'okwu nkwenye ya, Arinze Idemili kelere onye ọbụla maka inye ya ohere ijere ndị ya ozi ma kwe nkwa na ọ ga-adọta mmepe n'obodo Mgbachu.

english: The new executive was inaugurated by Mr Onwukwe in the presence of NDU Team, and the returning electoral officers, Mr Innocent Ilechukwu and Mr Chinedu Obidigbo (MOI).
igbo: Ndị isi ọchịchị ahụ bụ nke Maazị Onwukwe guzobere n'ihu ndị otu NDU na ndị ọrụ ntuli aka, Maazị Innocent Ilechukwu na Maazị Chinedu Obidigbo (MOI).

english: HEALTH MINISTRY TO COLLABORATE WITH NDLEA TO FIGHT DRUG TRAFFICKING, ABUSES TOO
igbo: MỊNỊSTRỊ AHỤIKE NA NDLEA JIKỌRỌ ỌNỤ IBU AGHA MEGIDE ỊTỤ MGBERE ỌGWỤ ỌJỌỌ NA MMEBI IWU

english: Anambra State Commissioner for Health, Dr Vincent Okpala says his ministry will collaborate with National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) to fight drug trafficking and abuse in the state.
igbo: Kọmịshọna steetị Anambra na-ahụ maka ahụike, Dr Vincent Okpala kwuru na ministị ya na National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) ga-ejikọ aka ibuso mgbere ọgwụ na mkparị steeti ahụ.

english: Dr Okpala said this during a courtesy visit by newly appointed NDLEA Commander Anambra State Command, Mr Misbahu M Idris in his office at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.
igbo: Dr Okpala kwuru nke a n'oge nleta sitere n'aka onyeisi ọhụrụ nke NDLEA Anambra steeti, Maazị Misbahu M Idris n'ụlọ ọrụ ya na Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.

english: He said that the state drug control committee constituted by Gov. Willie Obiano would work closely with the agency to eliminate drug trafficking and abuses across the state.
igbo: O kwuru na kọmitii na-achịkwa ọgwụ nke Gov. Willie Obiano chịkọtara na ụlọọrụ ahụ ga-arụkọ ọrụ ọnụ iji kpochapụ ndị ahịa ọgwụ ọjọọ na mmebi iwu n'ofe steeti ahụ.

english: God bless Anambra State, the Light of the Nation! (MOI)
igbo: Chukwu gọzie Anambra Steeti, Ìhè nke ala! (MOI)

english: The commissioner noted that the purpose of drug control committee was to ensure that all parties involved, would work together to achieve the goals.
igbo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwuru na ebumnuche kọmitii na-achịkwa ọgwụ bụ iji hụ na ndị niile o metụtara, ga-arụkọ ọrụ iji mezuo ebumnuche ha.

english: Health is diverse both in mental and physical health, we know that the agency is not relenting in this regard, which will make our job easier.
igbo: 'Ahụike dị iche ma ahụike uche na nke anụ ahụ, anyị maara na ndị otu ahu anaghị atụgharị na nke a, nke ga-eme ka ọrụ anyị dị mfe.

english: Mental health is where we must pay urgent attention with your agency.
igbo: 'Ahụike nke uche bụ ebe anyị na ndị ọrụ gị kwesiri ilebara anya.

english: I have seen that you (NDLEA) are very proactive because in less than two months, you have already effected 50 arrests and four convictions.
igbo: 'Ahụla m na ị (NDLEA) na-eme ihe ike nke ọma n’ihi na ihe na-erughi ọnwa abuo, i jidela mmadụ iri ise ma nwee ikpe anọ.

english: Dr Okpala commended him for the visit, assuring him of continued collaboration and support from the ministry as well as the government.
igbo: Dr Okpala jara ya mma maka nleta ahụ, na-emesi ya obi ike na mịnịstrị ahụ na gọọmentị ga-agbakọ aka ma kwado ya.

english: Earlier, Mr Idris said his visit was to seek for collaboration with the ministry of health in order to fight against drug trafficking and abuses.
igbo: Na mbụ, Maazị Idris kwuru na nleta ya bụ ịchọ maka nkwado na ngalaba mịnịstrị ahụike iji lụọ ọgụ megide ndị mgbere ọgwụ ọjọọ na mmebi iwu.

english: He noted that ministry of health was one of their major stakeholders, believing they would help them in the fight against drug abuses and trafficking in the state.
igbo: O kwuru na mịnịstrị ahụike bụ otu n'ime ndị nkenye ha, kwenye na ha ga-enyere ha aka n'ọgụ megide ọgwụ ọjọọ na ịtụ mgbere ya na steeti.

english: NDLEA cannot do it alone; the reason we have come to seek collaboration and cooperation for our ideas to be fully achieved and implemented.
igbo: NDLEA apụghị ime ya naanị; ihe kpatara anyị ji bịa ịchọ mmekọta na ime ka e mezuo ma mepụta echiche anyị.

english: We arrested 249 suspects, seized 426.5988kg of hard drugs and secured 37 convictions in 2019,' the commander said.
igbo: 'Anyị jidere mmadụ narị abụọ na iri anọ na itoolu ndị a na-enyo enyo, jidere ọgwụ ike dị kg 426.5988 ma nweta ikpe iri atọ na asaa na 2019,' ọchịagha ahụ kwuru.

english: Adinuba is Commissioner for Information & Public Enlightenment, Anambra State
igbo: Adinuba bụ kọmịshọna na-ahụ maka ozi a kpọrọ Information and Public Enlightenment, nke steeti Anambra

english: He applauded the state Government's support in the fight against insecurity, drug trafficking as well as the leadership style of the commissioner, urging him to remain committed.
igbo: o toro nkwado nke gọọmentị steeti ahụ n'ọgụ megide enweghi nchekwa, ịtụ mgbere ọgwụ ọjọọ yana ụdị ọchịchị kọmishọna ahụ, na-agba ya ume ịnọgide na-agba mbọ.

english: Bringing your health experience is something that is commendable and we are enjoying that your experience already,' he noted.
igbo: 'Iwetara ahụmịhe ahụike gị bụ ihe kwesiri ịja mma na anyị na-ekpori ndụ n' ahụmịhe gị ugbua,' o kwuru.

english: TAKE ADVANTAGE OF CURRENT DRY SEASON TO EXECUTE ROAD PROJECTS – GOVERNMENT URGES CONTRACTORS
igbo: JIRI ỌKỌCHỊ NA-AKPỌ UGBU A RỤỌ ỌRỤ OKPOROỤZỌ- GỌỌMENTỊ NA-AGWA NDỊ ỌRỤ NGO

english: Willie Obiano of Anambra has urged contractors handling different road projects in the state to take advantage of ongoing dry season to hasten road construction works.
igbo: Willie Obiano nke Anambra agwala ndị ọrụ ngo na-arụ ọrụ dị iche iche n'okporo ụzọ dị na steeti ahụ ka ha were oge ọkọchị na-aga n'ihu rụọ okporo ụzọ ngwa ngwa.

english: My administration is determined to complete every road awarded during the last raining season before the next season,' the governor said.
igbo: Gọvanọ ahụ kwuru, 'Ọchịchị m ekpebiela ịrụzu okporo ụzọ niile enyerela n'oge udu mmiri tupu udummiri ọzọ abịa.'

english: He said this while inspecting ongoing construction work at the 4.95km Ezinnaja-Oraukwu-Nimo roads.
igbo: O kwuru nke a mgbe ọ na-enyocha ọrụ na-aga n'ihu n'okporo ụzọ 4.95km Ezinnaja-Oraukwu-Nimo.

english: The roads, which were on contract finance basis, were being handled by a prominent individual, Mr Daniel Nkwonta in Oraukwu.
igbo: Okporoụzọ ndị ahụ, nke e kwekọrịtara n'ego, bụ nke otu onye a ma ama n'Oraukwu, Maazị Daniel Nkwonta, na-edozi.

english: Gov. Obiano, who commended efforts of Mr Nkwonta, noted that the state government would refund the cost of the jobs on any certificate raised on the roads.
igbo: Gov. Obiano, onye toro mbọ nke Maazị Nkwonta, kwuru na gọọmentị steeti ahụ ga-eweghachite ụgwọ ọbụla a kwụrụ maka okporo ụzọ.

english: He highlighted the importance of the roads, saying the construction would promote agriculture and help the evacuation of farm produce to other towns and states.
igbo: Ọ kọwapụtara mkpa okporo ụzọ ndị ahụ dị, na-ekwu na ọrụ ahụ ga-akwalite ọrụ ugbo ma nyere aka ibupụ ihe ubi n’obodo na steeti ndị ọzọ.

english: Oraukwu is known for agriculture, it is an agrarian community.
igbo: 'A maara Oraukwu maka ọrụ ugbo, ọ bụ obodo ọrụugbo.

english: About 80 per cent of vegetables we export are from Oraukwu.
igbo: Ihe dịka pacenti akwụkwọ nri iri asatọ ka e si Oraukwu ebupụ.

english: This road is important to us.
igbo: 'Okporoụzọ a dị anyi mkpa.

english: Market women and farmers will be transporting their goods to markets easily.
igbo: Ụmụnwaanyị ndị ahịa na ndị ọrụ ugbo ga na-eburu ngwaahịa ha gaa n'ahịa n'ụzọ dị mfe.

english: In addition to that, it will also decongest heavy traffic into Agulu and other neighbouring communities during festive seasons.
igbo: 'Na mgbakwụnye nke a, ọ ga-akụda mkpọchi ụgbọala n'okporo ụzọ dị n'Agulu na obodo ndị ọzọ gbara ya gburugburu n'oge mmemme.

english: INVEST AT HOME COMMISSIONER MBANEFO ENJOINS NDI ANAMBRA IN DIASPORA
igbo: TINYE EGO N'ỤLỌ, KỌMỊSHỌNA MBANEFO GWARA NDỊ ANAMBRA BI NA MBA ỌZỌ

english: The Governor called on Anambra citizens in The Diaspora to heed the 'Aku-luo-uno' policy and partner the state in any capacity.
igbo: Gọvanọ kpọrọ oku ka ụmụ amaala Anambra bi n'ofesi ka ha ṅaa ntị n'amụma 'Aku-luo-uno' ma ha na steeti ejikọọ n'ike ọbụla.

english: Commissioner for Works, Mr Marcel Ifejiofor said 70 per cent of works had been achieved at the site including sand filling and other major works.
igbo: Kọmịshọna na-ahụ maka ọrụ, Maazị Marcel Ifejiofor kwuru na arụpụtala ọrụ dị pasenti iri asaa na saịtị ahụ gụnyere ịgba aja na ọrụ ndị ọzọ dị mkpa.

english: Coordinating Contractor handling the project, Mr Morgan Ofodum noted they had done major works, such as diversion of water channels responsible for deep erosion during raining seasons and control of swampy areas in addition to construction of double culverts.
igbo: Onye na-ahazi ọrụ ngo ahụ, Maazị Morgan Ofodum kwuru na ha arụọla nnukwu ọrụ, dịka ntopute nke ọwa mmiri nke na-ebute oke mbize n’oge udummiri ma na-ejikwa ebe apịtị mmiri na-aga.

english: He promised to complete the project within 72 weeks, as contained in the agreement.
igbo: O kwere nkwa ịrụcha ọrụ ahụ n’ime izuụka iri asaa na abụọ, dịka nkwekọrịta ahụ si dị.

english: BE CONSCIOUS OF SENSITIVE ISSUES WHILE REPORTING, HOS URGES MEDIA PRACTITIONERS
igbo: KPACHARA ANYA BANYERE OKWU NDỊ DỊ AṄAA MGBE Ị NA-AKỌ AKỤKỌ, HOS NA-AGBA NDỊ NA-AGBASA OZI UME

english: Anambra State Head of Service (HOS), Barr. Harry Udu has urged media practitioners to always remain conscious of sensitivity over issues they report on.
igbo: Onyeisi ọrụ a kpọrọ 'Head of Service' (HOS) na Steeti Anambra, Barr. Harry Udu gbara ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi ume ka ha mụrụ anya ma na-eche nche gbasara okwu ha na-akọ.

english: Udu gave the advice, when Anambra State Chapter of Nigeria Union of Journalists (NUJ) paid him courtesy visit in his office at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka on Jan.
igbo: Udu nyere ndụmọdụ ahụ, mgbe ngalaba ntaakụkọ n'Anambra State a kpọrọ Nigeria Union of Journalists (NUJ) gara leta ya n'ọfịs ya na Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka na Jan.

english: HOS commended their efforts, reminding them that they were first, government employees as well as members of the NUJ and as such ought to remain agents of good governance.
igbo: HOS toro mbọ ha, na-echetara ha na ha bụ ndị mbụ, ndị ọrụ gọọmentị yana ndị otu NUJ ma ha kwesiri ịnọgide bụrụ ndị nnọchi anya nke ezigbo ọchịchị.

english: Udu assured them that Anambra State Government would continue to support the development of the media in the state including welfare of its members.
igbo: Udu mere ka obi sie ha ike na Gọọmentị Anambra ga-aga n’ihu ịkwado mmepe mgbasa ozi na steeti ahụ gụnyere ọdịmma nke ndị otu ya.

english: The civil service boss said that Anambra State Broadcasting Service (ABS) had been digitised by Gov.
igbo: Onyeisi ndị ọrụ kwuru na Gov. agbanweela Anambra State Broadcasting Service (ABS).

english: Udu stressed that Anambra State Government had offset pension and gratuities of NUJ members, which he described as a demonstration of support.
igbo: Udu kwusiri ike na Gọọmentị Anambra akwụọla ụgwọ ezumike nka nke ndị otu NUJ, nke ọ kọwara dịka ngosipụta nke nkwado.

english: The state government from inception has demonstrated strong support for the media and welfare of media workers by offsetting salary and pension arrears,' HOS said.
igbo: 'Gọọmentị steeti na mbido egosipụtala nkwado siri ike maka ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi na ọdịmma nke ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi site n'ịkwụ ụgwọ ọnwa na ụgwọ ezumike nka,' HOS kwuru.

english: He called on them to remain agents of development and eschew reporting issues when the details were hazy as this could be detrimental to sensibilities of the masses.
igbo: Ọ kpọrọ oku ka ha ka bụrụ ndị nnọchi anya mmepe ma gbanarị ikwupụta nsogbu mgbe nkọwa ndị ahụ edoghi anya n'ihi na nke a nwere ike ibute ọha mmadụ nsogbu.

english: HOS, then, assured them of government's continued support, promising them synergised relationship and transformations with the state's print media; National Light Newspaper.
igbo: Ya mere, HOS mere ka obi ha sie ike na gọọmenti ga na-akwado, na-ekwe ha nkwa na mmekọrịta na mgbanwe site n'ụlọ ọrụ mgbasa ozi nke steeti ga-emegharị; akwụkwọ akụkọ National Light.

english: Earlier, Chairman NUJ, Anambra State chapter, Mr Emmanuel Ifesinachi commended Gov. Willie Obiano for supporting the group.
igbo: Na mbụ, Onyeisi oche NUJ, ngalaba nke steeti Anambra, Maazị Emmanuel Ifesinachi jara Gov. Willie Obiano mma maka ịkwado ndị otu a.

english: Ifesinachi described Gov. Obiano as the most media friendly governor in the country considering his immense effort at transforming the state media.
igbo: Ifesinachi kọwara Gov. Obiano dịka gọvanọ ya na ndị mgbasa ozi kachasị emekọrịta na mba ahụ na-atụle nnukwu mbọ ọ na-agba n'ịgbanwe mgbasa ozi steeti.

english: The chairman recounted payment of media workers salaries and pensioners' arrears offset by the current administration.
igbo: Onyeisi oche ahụ kwupụtara ụgwọ ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi na ndị nọ ezumike nka nke ndị ọrụ gọọmentị na-akwụ ugbu a.

english: Ifesinachi, while assuring government of their continued loyalty, pleaded that digitisation of operations of the ABS be replicated at the National Light.
igbo: Ifesinachi, mgbe ọ na-ekwe gọọmentị nkwa na ha ga-erubere ya isi, rịọrọ ka e mepụtaghachi iji kọmputa arụ arụmọrụ nke ABS na National Light.

english: Chairman, Correspondent's Chapel of the NUJ, Mr Emmanuel Ndukuba thanked HOS for granting them audience.
igbo: Onyeisi oche, Correspondent's Chapel nke NUJ, Maazị Emmanuel Ndukuba kelere HOS maka ige ha ntị.

english: He pledging continued support, appealing to government to grant them more opportunities to participate in government activities. (MOI)
igbo: O kwere nkwa na ha ga-aga n’ihu, na-arịọ gọọmentị ka o nyekwuo ha ohere isonye n’ihe omume gọọmentị. (MOI)

english: GOVERNOR INSPECTS ANAMBRA AIRPORT DUAL-CARRIAGE WAY, PROMISES SPEEDY COMPLETION OF PROJECT By John Ndu :
igbo: GỌVANỌ NYOCHAA ỤZỌ ỌDỤ ỤGBỌELU ANAMBRA, NA-EKWE NKWA ỊRỤCHA YA NGWA NGWA Site n'aka John Ndu:

english: Awkuzu-Umunya (Oyi LGA), Jan. 24, 2020 (MOI) Gov. Willie Obiano has embarked on inspection tour of the ongoing construction of International Airport dual-carriage way.
igbo: Awkuzu-Umunya (Oyi LGA), Jenụwarị 24, 2020 (MOI) Gov. Willie Obiano ebidola njem nlegharị n'ihe owuwu nke ọdụ ụgbọelu nke na-aga n'ihu.

english: The 4.8 Km dual carriage is between Awkuzu and Umunya axis of the Enugu-Onitsha Expressway.
igbo: Ụzọ dị Km 4.8 dị n'agbata Awkuzu na Umunya nke dị n'okporo ụzọ Enugu-Onitsha.

english: Gov. Obiano assured that the road, which was being handled by a competent contractor, would be completed with the State-of-the-Art infrastructures.
igbo: Gov. Obiano kwere na ụzọ a, nke onye ọrụ ngo ya maara ihe ekwe na-akụ, bụ nke a ga-eji akụrụngwa 'State-of-the-Art' were rụcha.

english: According to him, we have three roads leading into the airport -- Nsugbe-Umueri axis, when coming from Onitsha and another from Nteje-Umueri axis for those within Nteje, Umueri and Aguleri axis.
igbo: Dịka o si kwuo, anyị nwere okporo ụzọ atọ na-eduga na ọdụ ụgbọelu- okporo ụzọ Nsugbe-Umueri, mgbe esi Onitsha abịa na ụzọ ọzọ si Nteje-Umueri maka ndị nọ na Nteje, ụzọ Umueri na Aguleri.

english: We have Awkuzu-Umunya axis, which was supposed to be the major highway into the Airport.
igbo: Anyị nwere ụzọ Awkuzu-Umunya, nke kwesiri ịbụ oke okporo ụzọ banyere n’ọdụ ụgbọ elu.

english: We are committed to ensuring that all these roads are completed with the best road infrastructures; we will finish it by the grace of God.
igbo: 'Anyị kpebisiri ike ịhụ na e ji akụrụngwa kachasị mma rụchaa ụzọ niile; anyị ga-arụcha ya site n’amara nke Chineke.

english: All these are geared toward ensuring that we do not have traffic congestion on the Airport Road, also to make it easily accessible to Ndi Anambra and Nigerians in general,' Obiano pointed out.
igbo: 'Ihe ndị a niile bụ ịgba mbọ hụ na anyị enweghi nkwokọ ụgbọala n' okporoụzọ ọdụ ụgbọelu, iji mee ka ọ dịrị ndị Anambra na ndị Naịjiria niile mfe.' Obiano rụtụrụ aka

english: The Governor also promised to deploy more sophisticated road facilities on major roads in the state.
igbo: Gọvanọ ahụ kwekwara nkwa iwebata ihe ndị bụ ọkaibe e ji arụ okporoụzọ n'isi okporo ụzọ na steeti ahụ.

english: Commissioner for Works, Mr Marcel Ifejiofor, commended the construction company handling the project for their efforts at achieving great physical structures within the short time the award was contracted.
igbo: Kọmịshọna na-ahụ maka ọrụ, Maazị Marcel Ifejiofor, toro ụlọọrụ na-ahụ maka iwu ihe owuwu ahụ jikwa ọrụ ahụ maka mbọ ha na-agba iji rụpụta ihe a na-ahụ anya n'ime obere oge e nwere nkwekọrịta ahụ.

english: Works Commissioner observed that of the 4.8Km, 2.5Km had been cleared and asphalted.
igbo: Kọmịshọna ọrụ ahụ chọpụtara na n'ime Km 4.8, e kpochapụla Km 2.5.

english: The coordinating contractor handling the project, Mr Jonny Nasa assured that the work would be delivered under 10 months once they were mobilised. (MOI)
igbo: Onye na-ahụ maka ọrụ ahụ, Maazị Jonny Nasa kwere nkwa na a ga-arụcha ọrụ ahụ n'ime ọnwa iri ozigbo a chịkọtara ha. (MOI)

english: SECCIMA HOLDS INVESTITURE/INSTALLATION OF SOUTH EASTERN GOVERNORS AS GRAND PATRONS
igbo: SECCIMA NA-AMALITE/ARỤNYE NDỊ GỌVANỌ ỌWỤWA ANYANWỤ DỊKA NDỊ AKA OCHIE

english: South East Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines and Agriculture (SECCIMA) plans inauguration/ installation of South East Governors as Grand Patrons of the Chamber.
igbo: Ndị South East Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines and Agriculture (SECCIMA) na-ezube ịmalite/nrụnye nke ndị gọvanọ ọwụwa anyanwụ dịka ndị aka ochie 'Grand Patrons' nke ụlọ ọrụ ahụ.

english: Some selected distinguished indigenous entrepreneurs will also be honoured as patrons.
igbo: Ụfọdụ ndị nta ego a ma ama a họpụtara ka a ga-akwanyekwara ugwu dịka ndị isi.

english: The event would be held on Feb. 19, at Anedo Hall, Nnewi, Anambra State under the Chairmanship of Dr Cletus M Ibeto (CON).
igbo: A ga-eme emume ahụ na Febrụwarị 19, n'Anedo Họọlụ, Nnewi, Anambra Steeti ebe Dr Cletus M Ibeto (CON) ga-abụ onyeisi oche.

english: The event would also feature inaugural economic lecture with theme: Sustainable Steps Towards The Economic Development of The South East Region'.
igbo: Ihe omume a ga-egosipụta okwu nkuzi akụnaụba nke isiokwu ya bụ: 'Nzọụkwụ Ga-adịgide Maka Mmepe Akụnaụba na Mpaghara Ọwụwa Anyanwụ.'

english: The Chamber, then, called for goodwill messages/adverts insertions for publication in the event's brochure.
igbo: Mgbe ahụ, chamber ahụ kpọrọ òkù maka ozi ekele/mgbasa ozi a ga-ebipụta n'ime akwụkwọ 'Brochure' emume ahụ

english: This it said could be sent as soft copies to the chambers' e-mail: seccima247@gmail.com or whatsApp: 08036758278.
igbo: Nke a ka e nwere ike izipụrụ na email nke ụlọọrụ ahụ: seccima247@gmail.com ma ọ bụ whatsApp: 08036758278.

english: All payment would be expected to be made in favour of SECCIMA: A/C No. 3906894017 (FCMB). (MOI)
igbo: A ga-atụ anya na ịkwụ ụgwọ niile ga-akwado SECCIMA: A/C No. 3906894017 (FCMB). (MOI)

english: ANAMBRA TO COMMENCE NEW MINIMUM WAGE IMPLEMENTATION THIS MONTH END By John Ndu
igbo: ANAMBRA GA-EBIDO MMEJUPỤTA ỤGWỌ ỌNWA OPEKEMPE NA NGWỤCHA ỌNWA A Site n'aka John Ndu.

english: Umunnachi (Dunukofia LGA), Jan. 24, 2020 (MOI) Anambra State Government has announced its readiness to commence payment of the new minimum wage, starting from Jan. 26.
igbo: Umunnachi (Dunukofia LGA), Jenụwarị 24, 2020 (MOI) Gọọmentị steeti Anambra ekwupụtala na ọ dị njikere ịmalite ịkwụ ụgwọ opekata mpe ọhụrụ, malite na Jenụwarị 26.

english: According to him, the new minimum wage implementation will improve socio-economic status of the state and boost the state's Internally Generated Revenue (IGR).
igbo: Dịka o si kwuo, mmejupụta ụgwọ ọnwa opekata mpe ga-emeziwanye ọnọdụ akụnaụba na steeti ahụ ma bulite 'Internally Generated Revenue' (IGR) nke steeti ahụ.

english: He stressed the economic importance of the implementation of the new minimum wage, pointing out that improved welfare of workers was top priority of his administration.
igbo: Ọ kwusiri ike mkpa akụnaụba nke mmejupụta ụgwọ opekempe ọhụụ dị, na-akọwapụta na ọdịmma ndị ọrụ bụ ihe kachasị mkpa na ọchịchị ya.

english: Gov. Obiano while inspecting the Eziowelle-Umunnachi-Afor Igwe roads, currently under construction, observed that some structures would be affected during the job execution.
igbo: Gov. Obiano mgbe ọ na-enyocha ụzọ Eziowelle-Umunnachi-Afor Igwe, nke a na-arụ ugbu a, chọpụtara na ụfọdụ ihe owuwu bụ nke a ga-emetụta n'oge a na-arụ ọrụ.

english: Gov. Obiano made the declaration while inspecting the 5.3Km Eziowelle-Umunnachi-Afor Igwe roads.
igbo: Gov. Obiano mere nkwupụta a mgbe ọ na-enyocha okporoụzọ Eziowelle-Umunnachi-Afor Igwe dị 5.3km.

english: He noted that traffic congestion on the old road would be reduced, especially during festive periods, when the construction of the road would have been completed.
igbo: Ọ chọpụtara na mkpọchi okporo ụzọ ochie ga-ebelata, ọkachasị n'oge mmemme, mgbe a ga-arụcha okporo ụzọ ahụ.

english: The Governor emphasised his administration's commitment to continue to link up communities through building of roads; urging the people of the area to support the contractors.
igbo: Gọvanọ ahụ kwenyesiri ike na ọchịchị ya ga-anọgide na-ejikọta obodo site n'ịrụ okporo ụzọ; na-agba ndị bi n'ógbè ahụ ume ka ha kwado ndị ọrụ ngo ahụ.

english: The contractor handling the project, Mr Daniel Ekene, said the project was awarded last year.
igbo: Onye na-ahụ maka ọrụ ngo ahụ, Maazị Daniel Ekene kwuru na e nyere ọrụ ahụ n'afọ gara aga.

english: Mr Ekene explained that they commenced with demolition of the existing drainage system, which usually caused flooding in the area, adding that they had done 1.5Km of drainage.
igbo: Maazị Ekene kọwara na ha ebidola ịkwatu usoro ọwa mmiri dịbu mbụ, bụ nke na-ebute ide mmiri na mpaghara ahụ, na-agbakwụnye na ha arụọla ọwa mmiri dị Km 1.5.

english: He assured the people that the project would be completed by May. (MOI)
igbo: O mere ka ndị mmadụ kwenyesie ike na a ga-arụsị ọrụ ahụ ruo n'ọnwa Mee. (MOI)

english: He explained that Lassa fever was an acute viral hemorrhagic fever (VHF) caused by Lassa virus.
igbo: Ọ kọwara na ọrịa Lassa bụ nnukwu ọrịa Viral Hemorrhagic Fever (VHF) nke nje Lassa kpatara.

english: The natural reservoir for the virus is the Mastomys natalensis rodent commonly known as the multimammate rat. Other rodents have also been identified to carry the virus,' he said.
igbo: 'Ebe nje oke ahụ si bụ 'Mastomys natalensis' nke a na-akpọkarị oke 'multimammate'. Achọpụtakwala na òké ndị ọzọ bu nje ahụ,' o kwuru.

english: The commissioner maintained that Lassa fever remained a major public health challenge in West Africa with Nigeria bearing the highest burden.
igbo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwusiri ike na ọrịa Lassa fever ka bụ nnukwu nsogbu ahụike n'Ọdịda Anyanwụ Africa ebe Naịjiria nwere ọnụọgụgụ kachasị elu.

english: Lassa fever occurs throughout the year but more cases are recorded during dry season from Nov. to May, with 81 cases reported from six states,' Okpala said.
igbo: Ọrịa Lassa na-apụta n'afọ niile mana ọtụtụ okwu ka e depụtara n'oge ọkọchị site na Nọvemba ruo Mee, yana okwu iri asatọ na otu sitere na steeti isii,' Okpala kwuru.

english: Lassa fever is spread through direct contact with urine, faeces, saliva or blood of infected rats.
igbo: 'Ọrịa Lassa fever na-agbasa site na imetụta mamịrị, nsị, ọnụ mmiri maọbụ ọbara oke bu ya.

english: Contact with objects, household items and surfaces or eating food contaminated with urine, faeces, saliva or blood of infected rats.
igbo: 'Imetụ ihe, ihe di n’ime ụlọ maọbụ iri nri metụrụ mamịrị, nsị, ọnụ mmiri maọbụ ọbara oke bu ọrịa ahụ.

english: Awka, Jan. 28, 2020 (MOI) Anambra Commissioner for Health, Dr Vincent Okpala, has urged the people to maintain proper sanitary conditions in their environment to prevent the spread of Lassa fever.
igbo: Awka, Jenụwarị 28, 2020 (MOI) Kọmịshọna Ahụike nke Anambra, Dr Vincent Okpala, agbaala ndị ahụ ume ka ha debe ọnọdụ ịdị ọcha kwesịrị ekwesị na gburugburu ebe obibi ha iji gbochie mgbasa nke ọrịa Lassa.

english: The commissioner said this while addressing the newsmen in his office at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.
igbo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwuru nke a mgbe ọ na-agwa ndị nta akụkọ okwu n'ọfịs ya na Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.

english: Dr Okpala said that there was no incidence of Lassa fever in the state and briefed the people on dangers of the disease in our society.
igbo: Dọkịta Okpala kwuru na enweghi ọrịa Lassa fever na steeti ahụ wee mee ka ndị mmadụ mara banyere ihe egwu dị n'ọrịa ahụ n'obodo anyị.

english: HEALTH COMMISSIONER ADVOCATES PROPER PERSONAL, ENVIRONMENTAL HYGIENE
igbo: KỌMỊSHỌNA AHỤIKE NA-AKWADO MAKA ỊDỊ ỌCHA DỊ MMA NKE ONWE, GBURUGBURU EBE OBIBI

english: The commissioner urged them to impact positively on the state's economy by investing at home.'
igbo: Kọmịshọna ahụ gbara ha ume ka ha na-emetụta akụnaụba steeti site n'itinye ego na steeti ha.

english: Chairman ASA Madrid, Mr Kenneth Nwose thanked the commissioner for her hospitality and efforts in promoting Igbo culture and values.
igbo: Onyeisi oche ASA Madrid, Maazị Kenneth Nwose kelere kọmishọna ahụ maka ile ọbịa ya na mbọ ya n'ịkwalite ọdịnaala na ụkpụrụ ndị Igbo.

english: He said that they would like to have a portion of land at the Diaspora estate when activated.
igbo: O kwuru na ha ga-achọ inweta ala na mpaghara ndị ọbịa mgbe enyere ha.

english: Mr Nwose commended the state governor for his good works in the state and pointed out that parents should be educated against child abuse.
igbo: Maazị Nwose toro gọvanọ steeti ahụ maka ọrụ ọma ọ na-arụ na steeti ahụ wee rụtụ aka na o kwesịrị ka a kụziere ndị nne na nna maka mmeso ọjọọ a na-emeso ụmụaka.

english: The chairman also urged government to look into and improve electricity power supply in the state. (MOI)
igbo: Onyeisi oche ahụ rịọkwara gọọmentị ka ha leba anya ma kwalite ọkụ eletrik na steeti ahụ. (Moi)

english: Hotels will be registered and a programme called 'Suwa kwa Igbo', will be initiated.
igbo: A ga-edebanye aha ụlọ ọrụ nkwariakụ 'hotel' ma tinye mmemme a kpọrọ 'Suwa kwa Igbo'.

english: The wife of the governor, through her pet project, Caring Family Initiative (CAFE)' has impacted positively on the lives of widows, children and the physically challenged in the state,' she said.
igbo: 'Nwunye gọvanọ ahụ, site n' ọrụ ya, 'Caring Family Initiative (CAFE)' emetụtala ndụ ụmụnwaanyị ajadu, ụmụaka na ndị ọrụsị na steeti ahụ,' ka o kwuru.

english: Fredrick Nwabufo
igbo: Fredrick Nwabufo

english: On June 12, 2018, Joshua Dariye, former Plateau State governor and senator, huddled in the dock awaiting the verdict of fate for pilfering N1.6bn public funds at a high court of the Federal Capital Territory.
igbo: Na June 12, 2018, Joshua Dariye, onye bụbu gọvanọ Plateau steeti na onye nnọchite anya na Sineti, gbakwụnyere n'ọdụ ụgbọ mmiri na-eche mkpebi nke akara aka maka ịkwụ ego N1.6bn ọha na eze n'ụlọ ikpe ukwu nke Federal Capital Territory.

english: Dariye was lachrymal, wiping hot tears from his eyes.
igbo: Dariye bu anyammiri, were na-ehichasị anyammiri ya n'anya.

english: Before the senator was handed a 14-year jail sentence by Adebukola Banjoko, the presiding judge, he begged for mercy – a luxury he did not accord to the people of Plateau who endured his troubled administration.
igbo: Tupu e nyefee Sịnetị ahụ akwụkwọ mkpọrọ afọ iri na anọ, Adebukola Banjoko, onye ọkaikpe n'ụlọ mkpọrọ, rịọrọ ka e meere ya ebere - okomoko o nyeghị ndị bi na Plateau onye nagidere nsogbu ọchịchị ya.

english: He was found guilty of 14 counts out of the 23 preferred against him by the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission.
igbo: A mara ya ikpe ugboro iri na anọ n'ime iri abụọ na atọ ahụ Kọmitii na-ahụ maka ego na mmefu ego (EFCC) kpebiiri ya.

english: Before the judge passed her judgment, Paul Eroko, counsel to Dariye, pleaded for a light sentence.
igbo: Tupu onye ọkaikpe ahụ kpebie ikpe ya, Paul Eroko, onye ndụmọdụ Dariye, rịọrọ ka a maa ya ikpe dị mfe.

english: 'Appeals to your judgement do not succeed; we will fall on your mercy. The prisons are congested,' Eroko said.
igbo: “Arịrịọ a na-arịọ ka ikpe gị ghara ịga nke ọma; anyị ga-emere gị ebere. Ụlọ mkpọrọ ahụ ejula.' Eroko kwuru.

english: 'They misled the governor, it is the bank; they said he didn't have to present anything.'
igbo: “Ha duhiere gọvanọ, ọ bụ ndị ụlọakụ; ha kwuru na ọ dịghị mkpa iwepụta ihe ọbụla.”

english: But Rotimi Jacobs, counsel to the EFCC, said Dariye did not deserve a light sentence because he 'did not show remorse'.
igbo: Mana Rotimi Jacobs, onye ndụmọdụ na EFCC, kwuru na Dariye ekwesighi inweta amamikpe dị mfe n'ihi na “o gosighi mmụọ nchegharị”.

english: At this point, weeping Dariye said he wanted to speak.
igbo: N'oge a, Dariye onye nke na-ébé ákwa kwuru na ya chọrọ ikwu okwu.

english: 'Have mercy, you are a Christian, your name is Jacob,' he said.
igbo: “Mee ebere, ị bụ onye ụka, aha gị bụ Jekọb,” o kwuru.

english: On Thursday, Orji Uzor Kalu, another former governor and senator, received the retribution of kismet.
igbo: Na Tọzdee, Orji Uzor Kalu, onye bụbu gọvanọ na sinetọ, natara nkwụghachi nke kismet.

english: Reality jarred Kalu out of the fantasy that he was going home to his bed after his conviction for money laundering by a federal high court in Lagos.
igbo: Eziokwu gbochiri Kalu n'echiche efu na ọ na-ala n'ụlọ ya mgbe o kwenyesịrị ikpe maka ego zuuru n' ụlọ ikpe dị elu na Lagos.

english: After Mohammad Idris, the presiding judge, pronounced a 12-year jail sentence and warders moved towards him with handcuffs, the Senate Chief Whip resorted to diplomacy.
igbo: Dịka Mohammad Idris mesịrị, ọkaikpe ahụ kpọpụtara, afọ iri na abụọ nke ịtụ mkpọrọ ma ndị nche mkpọrọ ahụ lutere ya na tụọ ya ịga n'aka, onyeisi Sịnetị maliteghachiri diplọma.

english: 'Where are you taking us to now? Please don't handcuff me. I will follow you,' he said.
igbo: “Ebee ka ị na-akpọga anyị ugbu a? Biko atụkwala m ịga n'aka. Aga m eso gị,” o kwuru.

english: Kalu's fall is louder than the crash of Jericho – being a trenchant mouthpiece of President Muhammadu Buhari in the South-East.
igbo: Ọdịda Kalu dara karịrị ọdịda mgbidi nke Jeriko - dịka onye bụ nkwupụta okwu nzuzo nke onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari na South-East.

english: But is his conviction a 'pass mark' for Buhari's much vaunted war against corruption? I do not think so.
igbo: Mana nkwenye ya, o ruru 'akara' maka agha dị oke egwu Buhari megide mpụ? Echeghị m otu ahụ.

english: First, the case is 12 years old. It was not actuated by this administration. And investigations were already concluded before this regime.
igbo: Nke mbu, ikpe ahụ gbara afọ iri na abụọ. Ndi ọchịchị a emeghi ya. E mechaala nyochaa ya tupu ọchịchị a.

english: Second, corruption cases recently initiated against certain individuals have not received oomph owing to the fact that they are in the 'Buhari fraternity'.
igbo: Nke abụọ, ikpe nrụrụ aka ebidola megide ụfọdụ mmadụ anabataghị 'oomph' n'ihi na ha nọ n' ọchịchị 'Buhari.'

english: For example, the case of Babachir Lawal, former Secretary to the Government of the Federation, is sputtering in court this despite his indictment by the government he served.
igbo: Ịmaatụ, okwu gbasara Babachir Lawal, onye bụbu onye ode akwụkwọ gọọmentị etiti, na-asọgharị n'ụlọ ikpe n'agbanyeghị ịma ikpe nke gọọmentị mere.

english: Also, there is a petition against Bola Tinubu, National Leader of the APC, for alleged money laundering at the EFCC. Tinubu admitted transporting cash in bullion vans on the eve of the 2019 election to his house. But the anti-graft agency has not moved a muscle to investigate the allegation.
