igbo: Ọzọkwa, e nwere akwụkwọ mkpesa megide Bola Tinubu, Onye ndú nke APC maka ịdọrọ ego na EFCC. Tinubu kwenyere na o ji ụgbọala na-ebuga ego na mgbede ntuli aka nke 2019 n'ụlọ ya. Mana ụlọ ọrụ na-ahụ maka nke a amalitebeghi inyocha ebubo a.

english: When Ibrahim Magu, acting EFCC chairman, was asked about the petition against Jagaban by a journalist, he snubbed the inquiry, and said 'next question, please?'
igbo: mgbe a jụrụ onye na-elekọta otu EFCC bụ Ibrahim Magu ajụjụ maka arịrịọ onye ntaakụkọ rịọchitere Jagaban, ọ gbara ha nkịtị ma jụọ ha 'ajụjụ ọzọ, biko? '

english: As a matter of fact, there are other members of the APC and those in the Buhari fraternity who have corruption allegations hanging on their necks, but the EFCC is yet to crack up a case against them.
igbo: N'ezie, e nwere ndị otu APC na ndị na-enye Buhari nkwado bụ ndị aka ha dị n'aghụghọ, mana ndị EFCC ebidobeghi ime nnyocha ha.

english: I will not mention more names.
igbo: Agaghị m ekwu áhà ọzọ.

english: So, on what grounds should Buhari's anti-corruption war be toasted? If the regime is applauded for the jailing of Dariye and Orji Kalu, how about other cases it has failed to take up or conclude?
igbo: Yabụ, kedu ihe kpatara e kwesịrị ịtụkwasị agha Buhari na-ebu maka nrụrụaka obi? Ọ bụrụ na a na-eto gọọmentị maka mkpọrọ ọ tụrụ Dariye na Orji Kalu, kedu maka ikpe ndị ọzọ ọ dara mba ikwulite maọbụ kwubie?

english: The fact is, Buhari's anti-corruption war is still selective. And as Abubakar Tsav, former Lagos police commissioner, said, 'It has no impact on Nigerians.'
igbo: Eziokwu bụ, agha Buhari megidere nrụrụaka ka na-ahọta. Dịkwa ka Abubakar Tsav, onye bụbu onyeisi ndị uwe ojii (kọmịshọna) na Lagos kwuru, “Ọ nweghị ihe mmetụta ọbụla n'ebe ndị Naịjirịa nọ.”

english: However, I will commend the judiciary for not bending despite influences to have some cases of corruption compromised. The termination of Kalu's 12-year-old bout at the trial court is a big point for the institution. The hero here is this arm of government.
igbo: Otu o sila dị, a ga m aja ndị ụlọ ikpe ike maka na ha alaghachighị azụ n'okwu ha n’agbanyeghi ikike imegharị nrụrụaka ahụ. Nkagbu afọ iri na abụọ a kagbuuru Kalu n'ụlọ ikpe bụ nnukwu ihe maka ụlọ ọrụ ahụ. N'ébé a, dike bụ ogwe gọọmentị a.

english: But beyond this feat, we must look into another tragic offence against Nigerians. Why is a senator convicted of fraud still receiving allowances and salaries as a member of the Senate?
igbo: E mesịa, anyị ga-elebanye anya na iwu ọzọ jọgburu onwe ya megide ndị Naijirịa. Gịnị kpatara na onye omeiwu amara ikpe ígwù wàyó ka na-anata ụgwọ ọrụ na ụgwọ ọnwa dịka onye otu omeiwu?

english: As of December 2018, Dariye was paid N85.5m in prison, and as of May 2019 his allowances had risen to N171m. Obviously, the same immoral privilege will be accorded to Orji Kalu. Is this not troubling?
igbo: N'ọnwa Disemba 2018, a kwụrụ Dariye ụgwọ N85.5m n'ụlọ mkpọrọ, wee rue na May 2019, ụgwọ mmachi akpa ya agbagola N171m. N'ụzọ doro anya, a ga-enye Orji Kalu otu ikike a rụrụ arụ. Nke a ọ bụghị nsogbu?

english: What it means is that tax-payers will continue to fund the lifestyles of individuals who have been convicted of stealing from them.
igbo: Ihe ọ pụtara bụ na ndị na-atụ ụtụ isi ga-aga n'ihu na-akwado ndị ahụ a mara ikpe na ha zuru ọha na eze ohi.

english: Justice is not final when people, who have been declared vandals of the public purse, are still maintained by public money.
igbo: Ikpe ziri ezi abụghị ikpe mgbe ndị mmadụ, bụ ndị e kwupụtara na ha zuru ohi dị iche iche n’ihu ọha, ka na-ejide ego ọha na eze.

english: Fredrick Nwabufo is a writer and journalist… @FredrickNwabufo
igbo: Fredrick Nwabufo bụ odeakwụkwọ na onye ntaakụkọ… @FredrickNwabufo

english: Arsenal Sacks Emery Over Poor Performance
igbo: Arsenal chụrụ Emery maka arụmọrụ adịghị mma

english: During his time at the club, he oversaw a disastrous run of form that saw his side go seven games without a win for the first time since 1992.
igbo: N'oge ọ nọ na klọb ahụ, ọ lekọtara usoro dị egwu nke mere ka otu ya gaa egwuregwu asaa na-enweghị mmeri ọbụla na nke mbụ kemgbe 1992.

english: Unai Emery, has been sacked as manager of Arsenal.
igbo: A chụpụla Unai Emery, dịka onye njikwa nke Arsenal.

english: During his time at the club, he oversaw a disastrous run of form that saw his side go seven games without a win for the first time since 1992.
igbo: N'oge ọ nọ na klọb ahụ, ọ gara egwuregwu asaa na-enwetaghị mmeri kemgbe 1992.

english: Hailed in the past as saviour of the team, Emery, 48, was appointed in the summer of 2018 following the departure of Arsene Wenger.
igbo: Oge e were dịka onye nzọpụta nke otu ahụ, Emery, 48, bụ onye a họpụtara n'oge ọkọchị n'afọ 2018 tinyere ọpụpụ Arsene Wenger.

english: He guided the Gunners to fifth in his debut campaign, one point adrift of Spurs, before losing 4-1 to Chelsea in the Europa League final.
igbo: O duziri ndị Gunners ka ha banye n'ọgba nke ise, otu isi na-esote Spurs, tupu Chelsea e jiri ọkpụ anọ a sara naanị otu (4-1) merie ha na Europa League ikpeazụ.

english: His side also went 22 games unbeaten combined with a run of 11 straight defeats.
igbo: Ndị otu ya gbara egwuregwu iri abụọ na abụọ were turu ugo na ha tinyere egwuregwu iri na otu e meriri ha.

english: The final straw was the Europa League defeat at home to Frankfurt on Thursday.
igbo: Ihe ikpeazụ bụ mmeri ndị Frankfurt meriri ha na European League na Tọọzụde.

english: The club have asked Freddie Ljungberg to take responsibility for the first team as interim head coach.
igbo: Ndị klọb ahụ rịọrọ Freddie Ljungberg ka ọ rụọ ọrụ n'otu egwuregwu mbụ dịka onye isi ha.

english: ASUU Calls For Boycott As Varsites Begin IPPIS Today
igbo: ASUU kpọrọ oku maka ịkwụsị ọrụ dị ka ndị Varsites bidoro IPPIS Taa

english: The union said the Federal Government needs to test its own model of ensuring financial transparency rather than forcing its members captured on the Integrated Personnel Payroll and Information System, which opened on Monday.
igbo: Njikọ ahụ kwuru na Gọọmentị etiti kwesịrị ịnwale iji hụ na ego ahụ doro anya kama ịmanye ndị otu ya ihu ha dị na Integrated Personnel Payroll na Ụlọọrụ na-ahụ maka mgbasa ozi 'Information System', nke mepere na Mọnde.

english: The leadership of the Academic Staff Union of Universities has directed its members nationwide to disregard a circular from the Office of the Accountant-General of the Federation to enrol academic staff on the Integrated Payment and Personnel Information System from Monday.
igbo: Ndị ọchịchị na-ahụ maka ndị nkuzi mahadum a kpọrọ 'Academic Staff Union of Universities' agwala ndị otu ha nọ na mba niile ka ha leghara akwụkwọ sitere n'ụlọ ọrụ na-ahụ maka ego n'ala anyị anya iji debanye aha ndị ọrụ n'ime 'Integrated Payment and Personnel Information System' site n'ụbọchị Monday.

english: ASUU on Sunday stated that the same Accountant-General of the Federation had challenged the union to develop a template that accommodates the peculiarities of academic staff and present same to him.
igbo: N'ụbọchị Sunday, ndị otu ASUU kwuru na onyeisi ndị na-ahụ maka ego mara ndị otu ahụ aka ịmepụta ndebiri nke ga-anabata ndị ọrụ ma gosi ya.

english: The union said the Federal Government needs to test its own model of ensuring financial transparency rather than forcing its members captured on the Integrated Personnel Payroll and Information System, which opened on Monday, a report by PUNCH said.
igbo: Ndị otu ahụ kwuru na gọọmentị etiti kwesịrị ịnwale n'ụdị nke ya kama ịmanye ndị otu ya na ndị a ga-etinye na 'Integrated Personnel Payroll and Information System', nke mepere na Mọnde, nkwupụta nke Punch mere.

english: Prof Biodun Ogunyemi, ASUU National President, added that the enrollment of lecturers was like taking universities back to core civil service.
igbo: Prof Biodun Ogunyemi, onyeisi ndị ASUU, gbakwụnyere na idebanye aha ndị nkuzi dị ka iweghachi mahadum azụ dịka ọrụ ndị nkịtị.

english: Ogunyemi insisted that its members will not take part in the registration for the IPPIS, adding that such steps by the Federal Government would undermine the autonomy of Nigerian universities.
igbo: Ogunyemi siri ọnwụ na ndị otu ya agaghị etinye aka ná ndebanye aha maka IPPIS, na-agbakwụnye na usoro dị otu a ndị gọọmentị etiti chọrọ ime ga-emebi ọchịchị nke mahadum Naịjiria.

english: He said, 'We have proposed to the government that we have an alternative that will address all issues that the government had raised about universities.
igbo: O kwuru, 'Anyị gwara gọọmenti na anyị nwere nhọrọ ọzọ nke ga-edozi nsogbu niile gọọmenti welitere banyere mahadum'.

english: The government needs to test our own model rather than buying into a model that will take universities back to the core civil service.
igbo: Gọọmenti kwesịrị ịnwale ụdị nke anyị kama iweta ụdị ga-eweghachi mahadum azụ dịka ọrụ ndị nkịtị'.

english: With IPPIS, before a Vice Chancellor can employ an academic worker, the VC will have to get permission from the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation.
igbo: Site na IPPIS, tupu onyeisi mahadum ga-enwe onye ọrụ agụmakwụkwọ, onyeisi ahụ (VC) ga-enweta ikikere n'aka onyeisi ndị ọrụ n'ala anyị.

english: 'Universities cannot be run within the framework of civil service bureaucracy.
igbo: E nweghị ike ime e mahadum n'ime usoro ọrụ gọọmenti'.

english: 'Universities are universal cities of knowledge creation and they can perform best when they are allowed to operate their system based on the laws establishing them.
igbo: Mahadum bụ ebe ihe ọmụma ma ha nwere ike ime nke ọma mgbe e nyere ha oghere ịrụ n'usoro dị n'iwu ha'.

english: 'We signed a memorandum of action with government earlier this year and they promised that they will start visitation by March this year.
igbo: Anyị na gọọmentị debanyere akara ngosi ma ha kwere nkwa na ha ga-amalite nleta n'ọnwa Maachị afọ a.

english: Government didn't do anything.
igbo: Gọọmenti emeghị ihe ọbụla.

english: This is November.
igbo: Nke a bụ ọnwa Nọvemba.

english: When people say ASUU is encouraging corruption, it is cheap blackmail.
igbo: Mgbe ndị mmadụ na-ekwu na ASUU na-akwado nrụrụ aka, ọ bụ mmebi aha.

english: 'We will destroy Nigerian universities with IPPIS if government should go ahead and force people to enroll.
igbo: Anyị na IPPIS ga-emebi mahadum Naịjirịa ma ọ bụrụ na ndị a ga-aga n'ihu manye ndị mmadụ idebanye aha ha'.

english: 'You can't bring lecturers from all over the world and ask them to go and register in Abuja in the ministry.
igbo: Ị gaghị enwe ike ịkpọta ndị nkuzi n'akụkụ ụwa niile gwa ha ka ha debanye aha n'Abuja n'ozi ahụ.

english: It is ridiculous.
igbo: Ọ bụ ihe ọchị.

english: We have gone beyond that.
igbo: Anyị agafeela nke ahụ.

english: They are taking us many decades back.
igbo: Ha na-akpọghachi anyị azụ.

english: It is sad.'
igbo: Ọ bụ ihe mwute.

english: Banking Sector's Loss Is Entertainment Industry's Gain
igbo: Ọghọm ndị ụlọakụ bụ uru ndị ụlọ ntụrụndụ

english: The entertainment industry is emerging as the market that will absorbmuch of the loans the central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) is forcingcommercial banks to give.
igbo: Ụlọ ọrụ na-ahụ maka mmemme na-apụta dịka ahịa nke ga-anara mgbazinye ego nke Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) na-amanye ndị ụlọ akụ inye.

english: A report by Proshare indicates that banks are positioning themselves to attract clients from small and medium scale enterprises in themusic and movie space.
igbo: Akụkọ sitere n'aka Proshare na-egosi na ụlọ akụ na-etinye onwe ha n'ọrụ na-adọta ndị ahịa site n'obere ụlọ ọrụ.

english: However, analysts Sahara Reporters have spoken to and reports published by financial research firms, conclude that the increasedpressure on banks to lend much of their deposit, is negative for thefinance industry at this point.
igbo: N'agbanyeghị, ndị nnyocha Sahara Report agwala ma kọsaa akwụkwọ sitere n'ụlọ ọrụ nnyocha ego 'Financial Research Firm', kwubie na mmụba nke ụlọ akụ dị iche iche iji gbazinye ego, bụ ihe adịghị mma nye ụlọ ọrụ ego a n'oge a.

english: We believe this development — the 65 percent loan to deposit ratio islargely negative for the banking sector, which has only just recoveredfrom the weak asset quality issues prevalent since 2016,'Cardinalstone research said in a report.
igbo: Anyị kwenyere na nke a-ịgbazinye ego dị pacenti iri isii na ise bụ ihe adịghị mma maka ndị ụlọ akụ, nke nwetagoro nke ọma site na nsogbu nke jupụtara kemgbe afọ 2016, ndị nnyocha Cardinals Tone kwuru.

english: We also believe that the macro-environment is still too fragile tosupport strong growth in lending,' it added.
igbo: Anyị kwenyekwara na gburugburu ebe obibi esighi ike ịkwalite ùtó n'igbazinye ihe', ọ gbakwụnyere.

english: Adedayo Bakare, an analyst with Afrinvest gave Sahara Reporters a similar outlook.
igbo: Adedayo Bakare, onye nnyocha na Afrinvest nyere ndị Sahara Report echiche yiri nke ha.

english: True to Bakare's observation, two of the three-tier 1 lenders, Zenith and Guarantee Trust, are among the 12 lenders fined a combined total of over N499bn by the CBN for their inability to meet with the September 2019 target of borrowing 60 percent of their deposits to thereal sector.
igbo: N'ikwe n'ihe Bakare hụrụ, abụọ n'ime atọ ndị na-agba inye ego, Zenith na Guarantee Trust, so ná ndị mgbazinye ego iri na abụọ CBN dara nha karịrị #499bn maka enweghị ike izute ebumnuche maka ịgbazite ego dị pasenti iri isii nke Septemba 2019.

english: The third lender – Access bank, survived thanks to thehuge loan portfolio it inherited from Tier 2 Diamond bank.
igbo: Ndị mgbazinye nke atọ - ụlọ akụ Access, na-enye ego nke ha nwetara site n'ụlọ akụ Diamond.

english: Proshare is of the opinion that these lenders have looked to thesafety of the celebrity industry, to reduce the risk of borrowingfunds to the everyday farmer and small-time shoemaker.
igbo: Proshare kwuru na ndị a na-agbazi ego lebara anya n'ụlọ ọrụ a ma ama, iji belata nsogbu ibinye ndị ọrụ ugbo ego.

english: In a report published Thursday, it listed a series of creative packages Deposit Money Banks are adapting to build quality assets in the creative space.
igbo: N'ime akwụkwọ e bipụtara ụbọchị Tọzdee, o depụtara usoro nkepụta ego ndị Deposit Money Banks na-arụ iji wee rụpụta akụ dị mma.

english: The most audacious plan is Access bank's Creative Arts village in Ogun State.
igbo: Atụmatụ kachasị mma bụ nke ndị ụlọ akụ Access mere n'Ogun steeti.

english: Proshare notes that the village will help to 'address issueslike the location for movie production, capacity building forpractitioners, and deepening the ecosystem of the Arts and Entertainment industry in Nigeria.
igbo: Proshare kwuru na obodo ahụ ga-enye aka kọwaa nsogbu a na-enwe n' ebe a na-emepụta ihe nkiri, ikike maka ndị na-eme ihe na ịbawanye gburugburu ụlọ ọrụ ndị 'Arts na Entertainment' na Naịjiria.

english: Herbert Wigwe, the managing director of Access Bank, expects thevillage to create 2 to 3m jobs annually.
igbo: Herbert Wigwe, onyeisi njikwa nke ụlọ akụ Access, na-atụ anya n'aka ndị obodo ịmepụta ọrụ dị nde abụọ maọbụ atọ kwa afọ.

english: The size of Access bank's investment in Ogun State is indicative of the feeling in the industry.
igbo: Òtù ihe nnweta akụ ha n'Ogun steeti na-egosi mmetụta a na-enwe n'ụlọ akụ ahụ.

english: One of such strategies is the United Bank of Africa (UBA's) decision to make Wizkid its ambassador.
igbo: Otú n'ime ụdịrị ihe ndị a bụ mkpebi ụlọ akụ United Bank of Africa (UBA) mere Wizkid dịka onye nnọchite anya ya.

english: It had also hosted a discourse 'Stars and Suits: Afropop meets HighFinance,' that conference gave UBA the opportunity to build acollaboration between music stars and finance institutions.
igbo: Aghakwara okwu 'Stars na Suits' : Afropop zutere 'High Finance', ọgbakọ ahụ nyere ndị UBA ohere iwu mmekọrịta dị n'etiti ụlọ egwu na ụlọ ọrụ ego.

english: Zenith, ECOBank and GT are other banks that have and are building more partnerships with clientele in the creative industry.
igbo: Zenith, Eco na GTB bụ ụlọ akụ ndị ọzọ nwere ma na-ewu lite mmekọrịta ha na ndị ọkachamara n'ime ụlọ ọrụ ahụ.

english: Banky W Attacks Buhari's Government For Arresting Sowore
igbo: Banky W wakporo Gọọmentị Buhari maka ijide Sowore

english: Who go represent you?
igbo: Onye ga-anọchite anya gị?

english: When they enter office, they will get what they paid for.
igbo: Mgbe ha bara n’ọfịs, ha ga-enweta ego ha kwụrụ.

english: Na double wahala for everybody.'
igbo: Nnukwu nsogbu ga-adịrị onye ọbụla.

english: Musician, Bankole Wellington better known as Banky W, has condemned the Nigerian Government for its gross human rights violation against citizens.
igbo: Onye na-eti egwu, Bankole Wellington a maara nke ọma dịka Banky W, akọtọọla gọọmentị Naịjirịa maka nnukwute oke iwu ndị nke megidere ụmụ amaala.

english: He also accused Nigerians of being too complacent in moments when they should act.
igbo: Ọ boro ndị Naijiria ebubo na ha na-eme na ihe zuuru ha n' ọnọdụ ọbụla mgbe ha kwesiri ime ihe.

english: Banky W made his position known in a music video posted on his Instagram page with hashtag #BetterChallenge.
igbo: Banky W mere ka a mara nke a na vidiyo egwu o gosipụtara n' Ịnstagramụ nke ọ kpọrọ #BetterChallenge.

english: He said, 'You see the story is the same old one, you want change but you won't vote?
igbo: Ọ sịrị, 'Unu hụrụ na akụkọ a na akụkọ ochie ahụ bụ otu ihe, unu chọrọ mgbanwe mana unu agaghị eme ntuliaka.

english: Then complaining is a not the thing.
igbo: Yabụ, mkpesa abaghị uru.

english: The video went on to show CCTV footage of Sowore's arrest by operatives of the Department of State Services in Lagos on August 3.
igbo: Ihe nkiri ahụ/vidiyo gara n'ihu gosipụta vidiyo CCTV ebe ndị ọrụ nke Ngalaba Ọchịchị (DSS) dị na Legoosụ jidere Sowore n'Ọgọstụ (August) 3.

english: He added, 'They arrest protestor and protect dishonourable senators.
igbo: Ọ gbakwụnyere, 'Ha jidere onye omeiwu na-eme ngagharị iwe ahụ.

english: Who be the meat, who be the hunter?
igbo: Onye bụ anụ ahụ, olee onye bụ dinta?

english: Too many days for the thief, one day for the owner.
igbo: Ọtụtụ ụbọchị bụ maka onye ohi, mana otu ụbọchị bụ maka onye nwe ihe.

english: They arrest the Protestor, and protect dishonourable Senators.
igbo: Ha jidere onye na-eme ngagharị iwe, ma na azọkwa onye Sinetọ ahụ enweghị ihere.

english: Here's my #BetterChallenge - please watch and share if you feel compelled — Banky Wellington (@BankyW) September 14, 2019
igbo: Nke a bụ #Betterchallenge - biko, lelee ma kesaa ma ọ bụrụ na ọ na-adị gị mma - Banky Wellington (@ BankyW) Septemba 14, 2019

english: BBNaija: Khafi Threatens To Sue The Sun Over 'Damaging' Publication
igbo: BBNaija: Khafi na-eyi ndị Sun egwu (na-àmájà ha) ịgba ha akwụkwọ maka 'Mmebi Mbipụta'

english: The Sun had on Tuesday reported that Khafi, who is a PC with the Metropolitan Police, had been denied permission by the organisation to participate in the reality show.
igbo: Na Tuesday, Sun kọrọ na Khafi, onye bụ PC ndị uweojii Obodo, bụ onye amachibidoro ikike isonye n'ihe ngosi ahụ.

english: The management of Khafi Kareem, a Big Brother Naija constant, has threatened to sue The Sun, a British tabloid, over what it considers 'repulsive and damaging publication' about her.
igbo: Ndị nlekọta Khafi Kareem, BBN amanyela ndị na-arụ maka akwụkwọ akụkọ Sun nke Briten egwu ịgba ha akwụkwọ, maka 'akụkọ na-asọ oyi na mmebi mbipụta' gbasara ya.

english: This was contained in a statement released via Khafi's Instagram page.
igbo: Nke a dị na nkwupụta e wepụtara site na ihu akwụkwọ (peeji) Instagram nke Khafi.

english: Khafi, currently in the Big Brother reality TV show, became popular with viewers for her relationship and sexual activities with another housemate, Gedoni.
igbo: Khafi, onye nọ ugbu n'ihe nkiri igwe onyonyo nke BBN, ghọọrọ onye ama ama n'ihi mmekọrịta dị n'etiti ya na onye ọzọ bikwa n'otu ụlọ bụ Gedoni.

english: The Sun had on Tuesday reported that Khafi, who is a PC with the Metropolitan Police, had been denied permission by the organisation to participate in the reality show.
igbo: Na Tuesday, Sun kọrọ na Khafi, onye bụ PC ndị uweojii Obodo, bụ onye amachibidoro ikike isonye n'ihe ngosi ahụ.

english: However, reacting to the report, Khafi's management said it is considering a legal option against the British tabloid except it publicly apologises and retract the now-viral report.
igbo: Agbanyeghị, n'ịza mkpesa ahụ, ndị nlekọta Khafi kwuru na ha na-atụle nhọrọ iwu megide 'tabloid' nke Britain beelụsọ na ọ na-arịọ mgbaghara n'ihu ọha na eze ma na-agbagha akụkọ ahụ ugbu a.

english: The statement read: 'The attention of Khafi's management has been drawn to a publication by The Sun UK on Tuesday, August 13, 2019, titled 'LOIN OF DUTY Met Police poster girl faces sack for 'having sex' on Nigerian Big Brother after being told not to take part'.
igbo: Nkwupụta ahụ gụrụ: “Mbipụta maka ndị nlekọta nke Khafi nke si n'aka ndị Sun nke UK na Tuesday, August 13, 2019, a kpọrọ 'LOIN OF DUTY Met Police Nwata nwaanyị na-etinye ihe nkiri chere ọ̀chụ́chụ́ n'ihi' inwe mmekọrịta na BBN mgbe a gwara ya ka ọ ghara iso .

english: The brazen sensational and defamatory outburst by The Sun UK is written in poor taste without considering the ethics of journalism which seeks balance and objectivity.
igbo: Nkọwasị nke SUN UK bụ nke e deghị nke ọma ma ghara itule ụkpụrụ ide akụkọ nke chọrọ ntule.

english: At no time did The Sun UK send a mail of inquiry to Khafi's official email which is blasted across her social media platforms under active management to confirm or refute the claims in the publication.
igbo: N'oge adịghị anya, SUN UK zigaara Khafi ozi n'imeelụ ya nke gbásàrà na soshal midia iji kenye maọbụ gbaghaa nkwupụta dị na mbipụta ahụ.

english: Khafi's side of the story is deliberately and conveniently omitted to sell a pre-conceived narrative while responses from 'outraged colleagues' and 'other papers' riddle the publication.
igbo: N'akụkụ Khafi, akụkọ ahụ bụ nke a ma ụma kọọ ma hapụ ịkọ ebe nzaghachi sitere na 'ndị ọrụ oke iwe na-ewe' na 'akwụkwọ ndị ọzọ' na-ekwupụta mbipụta ahụ.

english: This comes from a repressive culture of shaming and characterising women for their sexual decisions and life choices.
igbo: Nke a sitere n'agwa na-eme ihere na ihe e ji mara ụmụnwaanyị dịka mkpebi mmekọahụ na nhọrọ ndụ ha.'

english: We find The Sun UK's publication repulsive and damaging to the image and livelihood of our client.
igbo: Anyị na-ahụ akwụkwọ akụkọ mbipụta nke Sun UK ka ihe na-asọ oyi ma na-emebi ndụ onye ahịa anyị.

english: We demand an immediate retraction of the publication by The Sun UK and a public apology to our client Khafilat Kareem within the next 48 hours.
igbo: Anyị na-achọ ka eweghachi akwụkwọ ahụ nke Sun bipụtara ya na ịrịọ mgbaghara n'ihu ọha nye onye ahịa anyị Khafilat Kareem n'ime awa iri anọ na asatọ na-abịa.

english: Legal options are also being considered at this time.
igbo: A na-atụlekwa nhọrọ iwu n'oge a.

english: BBNaija Is Satanic, Says Muslim Group, Urges Christians To Join In Condemning Reality Show
igbo: BBNaija bụ ihe ekwensu, onye alakụba na-ekwu, ma na-agba ndị ụka ume isonye na nkatọ a na-akatọ ihe ngosi.

english: The Muslim Rights Concern (MURIC) has urged the federal government to immediately place a ban on the Big Brother Naija show.
igbo: Ndị otu Muslim Rights Concern (MURIC) agwala gọọmentị etiti ka etinye iwu machibido ihe ngosi Big Brother Naija.

english: MURIC posited that the reality show promotes immorality in the country branding it as 'immoral, dangerous and Bohemian'.
igbo: MURIC kwuru na ihe ngosi a na-akwalite omume rụrụ arụ n' obodo nke a na-akpọ 'ihe rụrụ arụ, ihe dị óké egwu na Bohemian'.

english: Professor Ishaq Akintola, Director of MURIC also said the promoter of the show must be held accountable for promoting immorality in the country
igbo: Ọkammụta Ishaq Akintola, onye nlekọta nke MURIC kwukwara na a ga-ejide onye na-akwado ihe ngosi ahụ maka ịkwalite omume rụrụ arụ na mba ahụ.

english: 'We are being forcibly dragged to a world of nudity, shamelessness and open promiscuity.
igbo: A na-adọbanye anyị n'ụwa ịgba ọtọ, mmechuihu na inwe mmekọ aghara aghara.

english: Inmates of BBNaija kiss, romance and engage in sex openly.
igbo: Ndị obibi nke BBNaija susuru ọnụ, na-enwe mmekọahụ n'ihu ọha.

english: BBNaija is Bohemian, anti-social, crude and immoral.
igbo: BBNaija bụ ihe na-emegide ọha, ọ bụ ihe nzuzu na nke rụrụ arụ.

english: It constitutes a potent danger to every home.
igbo: Ọ bụ ihe jupụtara na nnukwu ihe egwu nyere ezinaụlọ niile.

english: BBNaija is Satanic.
igbo: BBNaija bụ ihe si n'aka ekwensu.

english: It is unacceptable.
igbo: Ọ bụ ihe anabataghị.

english: 'Where are our norms and values?
igbo: “Olee ebe iwu na ụkpụrụ anyị dị?

english: Is it part of African culture to engage in sex in the open?
igbo: Inwe mmekọ nwoke na nwaanyị, o so na omenaala Afrika?

english: Where are the authorities?
igbo: Ebee ka ndị ọchịchị nọ?

english: Is the Ministry of Information and Culture sleeping?
igbo: Ndị Minista na-ahụ maka Ozi na Omenaala, a na-ehi ụra?

english: Is the National Orientation Agency on sabbatical?
igbo: Ngalaba ọrụ na-ahụ maka nhazi obodo, a nọ ezumike?

english: Who will protect our children from this despicable onslaught?
igbo: Onye ga-echebe ụmụ anyị n'ihe mbibi a na-asọ oyi?

english: Who did this to Nigeria?
igbo: Onye mere Naịjirịa ihe a?

english: This reality show is dragging our children into a life of moral debauchery.
igbo: Ihe ngosi a na-adọkpụrụ ụmụ anyị baa n'ibi ndụ rụrụ arụ.

english: It is robbing them of the last vestiges of honour.
igbo: Ọ na-anapụ ha nsọpụrụ.

english: It is deleting the word 'shame' from their vocabulary.
igbo: Ọ na-ehichapụ okwu ahụ bụ 'ihere' n'okwu ha.

english: BBNaija has alienated our youth from the elders.
igbo: BBNaija kewapụrụ ndị ntorobịa anyị n'ebe ndị okenye nọ.

english: A yawning lacuna now exists between the young and the old.
igbo: Ugbu a, óghére ka dị n'etiti ndị na-eto eto na ndị agadi.

english: Irreversible social crisis looms.
igbo: Nsogbu nke ọha na eze agaghị ebelata.

english: We must see those who woo our young ones with humongous amounts of money, big cars, and palatial buildings as those bent on destroying industry, diligence, and integrity, particularly among the youth.
igbo: Anyị ga-ahụrịrị ndị ji ego buru ibu, nnukwu ụgbọala, na nnukwu ụlọ achụ ụmụ anyị dịka ndị kpebiri ibibi ụlọ ọrụ, ịdị uchu, nakwa ibibi iguzosi ike n'ezi ihe, karịsịa n'etiti ndị ntorobịa.

english: Nothing destroys a nation faster than materialism.
igbo: Ọ dịghị ihe na-emebi mba ngwa ngwa karịa ịhụ ihe onwunwe n'anya.

english: The daughters of Jezebel are here already.
igbo: Ụmụnwaanyị Jezebel nọ ya ugbu a.

english: Unless the authorities move with the speed of lightning, human dignity in Nigeria is going, going, going!
igbo: Ọ gwụla ma ndị ọchịchị e jiri ọsọ dịka àmụ̀mà, ugwu mmadụ na Naịjiria ga-ala!

english: Or do we not realize that for every single BBNaija inmate who wins a big amount of money and a car, more than 50 million young people are misled?
igbo: Ka ọ bụ na anyị amataghị na onye obibi BBNaija ọbụla meriri ma nwetakwa nnukwu ego na ụgbọala, ihe karịrị nde ndị ntorobịa iri ise ka a na-eduhie?

english: Qur'an 30:41 says, 'Evil has appeared on both land and sea as a result of the handiworks of men'
igbo: Kor'an 30:41 kwuru sị, 'Ihe ọjọọ apụtala ma n' ala ma n'óké osimiri n'ihi akaọrụ nke mmadụ'

english: The Bible in Ephesians 4:19 was also describing these people when it says, 'Having lost all sensitivity, they have given themselves over to sensuality so as to indulge in every kind of impurity, with a continual lust for more'.
igbo: Akwụkwọ Nsọ na Ndị Efesọs 4:19 na-akọwa ndị a mgbe ọ na-ekwu, 'Dịka ha tụfuru ọgụgụ isi niile, ha enyefeela onwe ha ime ihe anụ ahụ́ bụ ihe rụrụ arụ, ya bụ agụụ ime ihe rụrụ arụ na-aga n'ihu mgbe niile.'

english: MURIC calls for unity among the Christians and Muslims in the country to jointly condemn and force the government to place a ban on the reality show.
igbo: MURIC na-akpọ maka ịdịnotu n'etiti ndị otu Ụka na ndị ụka Alakụba na mba ahụ iji jikọta aka ọnụ ma manye gọọmentị itinye mmachi n'ihe nkiri a.

english: MURIC Gives Falz Seven Days To Withdraw 'This Is Nigeria'
igbo: MURIC na-enye Falz mkpụrụ ụbọchị asaa ka ọ wepụ 'Nke a bụ Naịjirịa'

english: We can put an end to this anomaly called BBNaija if Christians and Muslims bury the hatchet and come together to fight evil.
igbo: Anyị nwere ike ịkwụsị BBNaija ma ọ bụrụ na ndị otu Ụka na ndị Alakụba zukọta ịlụso ihe ọjọọ ọgụ.

english: Home is home.
igbo: Ụlọ bụ ụlọ.

english: Moral debauchery knows no religion.
igbo: Omume rụrụ arụ amaghị okpukpe ọbụla.

english: The destructive influence of television shows like BBNaija penetrates both Christian and Muslim homes.
igbo: Ihe rụrụ arụ a na-egosi n'igweonyonyo dịka BBNaija na-abanye ma n'ụlọ ndị Ụka na ndị Alakụba.

english: Ditto for the custodians of our culture and tradition.
igbo: Out aka ahụ maka ndị ọdịbendị nke omenaala na ọdịnaala anyị.

english: Our traditional rulers ignore a program like this, which has all the potentials to diminish the dignity of our culture.
igbo: Ndị igwe anyị na-eleghara mmemme dịka nke a anya, bụ nke nwere ikike niile iji belata ùgwù omenaala anyị.

english: They are fighting over who should be chairman of the council of traditional rulers.
igbo: Ha na-alụ ọgụ maka onye kwesịrị ịbụ onyeisi oche nke kansụl nke ndị isi ọdịnala.

english: They want to be the king of kings and rivals of the supreme creator.
igbo: Ha chọrọ ịbụ eze ndị eze na ndị mgbagha nke onye okike kachasị elu.

english: Who placed a curse on Nigeria?
igbo: Onye bụrụ Naịjiria ọnụ a?

english: Homo sapiens may not respect a single snake when they see one.
igbo: Mmadụ nwere ike ghara ịkwanyere otu onye ùgwù n'ihi na ọ bụ naanị ya.

english: But can anyone wait to see what follows if the cobra leads and it is faithfully followed by the python, the black mamba, rattlesnake, garter snake, and the anaconda?
igbo: Mana ọ gaghị adị otu a ma ha dị n'igwe.

english: So what do you think will happen if our traditional rulers from the East, West and North march on Aso Rock to demand the immediate halt of this horrible show?
igbo: Kedụ ihe ị chere ga-eme ma ọ bụrụ na ndị igwe anyị si mpaghara ọwụwa anyanwụ, ọdịda anyanwụ na ugwu gaa n'Aso Rock ịchọ ka a kwụsị ihe nkiri a jọgburu onwe ya ozigbo?

english: MURIC charged the Ministry of Information and Culture to move swiftly against BBNaija before moral debauchery becomes Nigeria's middle name.
igbo: MURIC boro ndị Minista Ozi na Omenala ebubo ime ngwangwa megide BB Naija tupu omume rụrụ arụ a a bụrụ ihe e ji mara ndị Naịjirịa.

english: Big Brother Naija: Nigerian-born British Policewoman, Khafi Kareem, Faces Being Sacked After 'Sex Romp' With Another Contestant
igbo: Big Brother Naija: Nwaanyị Britain a mụrụ na Naịjiria, Khafi Kareem, na-eche ọchụchụ n'ihi mmekọ a kpọrọ 'Sex Romp' ya na onye ọzọ na-azọkwa ọkwa mere.

english: The officer was used as a 'poster girl' for the Met, posing alongside Met Commissioner Cressida Dick to encourage black and female recruitment and celebrate 100 years of women in the force.
igbo: E ji onye uweojii ahụ dịka nwata nwaanyị na-etinyere ndị Met ihe nkiri, nke guzo n'akụkụ kọmịshọna ndị Met Cressida Dick iji gbaa ndị isi ojii na ndị nwanyị ume ma mee emume afọ otu narị ụmụnwaanyị n'ọchịchị.

english: A British policewoman faces the sack for defying her bosses to appear a reality television programme - before appearing to sleep with a man on the show.
igbo: Otu nwaanyị uweojii nke Britain na-eche nchụpụ ya maka ịlenị ndị isi ya iji pụta n'ihe nkiri igweonyonyo- tupu ọ gbaa ka ya na nwoke dinara n'ihe nkiri.

english: PC Khafi Kareem, 29, from the Metropolitan Police, was warned not to take part in Nigerian Big Brother this year.
igbo: PC Khafi Kareem, 29, onye uwe ojii bụ onye a dọrọ aka na ntị ka ọ ghara itinye aka na BBN afọ a.

english: But she was granted unpaid leave and entered the show, in which she has formed a relationship with fellow contestant Ekpata Gedoni, 31, the Sun reported.
igbo: Mana e nyere ya ikike ezumike akwụghị ụgwọ o wee baa n'ihe ngosi ahụ, nke o jiri nwee mmekọrịta n'etiti ya na Ekpata Gedoni onye dị afọ iri atọ na otu, Sun kwuru.

english: Audiences in Nigeria have been caught up in their liaisons, of which there has been three, but she will now be the subject of an investigation by the Met's Directorate of Professional Standards.
igbo: Ndi na-ege ntị na Nigeria abanyela na njikọta nke ha, nke e nwere mmadụ atọ, mana ọ ga-abụzi isiokwu nke nyocha nke ndị Ọrụ Met a kpọrọ 'Directorate of Professional Standards' n'olu bekee.

english: And her colleagues have expressed their dismay at her 'tarnishing' the force's reputation with her antics.
igbo: Ndị ọrụ ibe ya ekwupụtala iwe ha maka iji aghụghọ ya mee ihe ga-emebi aha ya.

english: The officer was used as a 'poster girl' for the Met, posing alongside Met Commissioner Cressida Dick to encourage black and female recruitment and celebrate 100 years of women in the force.
igbo: E ji onye uweojii ahụ dịka nwata nwaanyị na-etinyere ndị Met ihe nkiri, nke guzo n'akụkụ kọmịshọna ndị Met Cressida Dick iji gbaa ndị isi ojii na ndị nwanyị ume ma mee emume afọ otu narị ụmụnwaanyị n'ọchịchị.

english: One colleague told the Sun: 'She's a serving British police officer - it's outrageous.
igbo: Otu onye ọrụ ibe ya gwara Sun: 'Ọ bụ onye uwe ojii Britain ka na-eje ozi- ọ jọgburu onwe ya.

english: She asked permission to go on the show but, when her request was refused, she went anyway.
igbo: Ọ rịọrọ ikike ka ọ gaa ihe nkiri mana, mgbe a jụrụ ịnabata arịrịọ ya, ọ pụrụ.

english: Her out-of-office email reply blatantly says that she is away from work, yet no one does anything.
igbo: Ozi ịntanetị na-egosi ọpụpụ gosiri na ọ nọghị n’ọrụ, ma ọ dịghị onye mere ihe ọbụla.

english: Other officers working with her are furious that she can just disobey orders then swan off Africa and tarnish the reputation of the force.
igbo: Ndị ọrụ ọzọ ha na ya na-arụkọ na-enwe nnwute na ọ gaghị ada iwu ma gaa n'Afrịka inwe aṅụrị ebe ọ gara kpụọ ndị ọchịchị uweojii afọ n'ala

english: Ms. Kareem began as a PC at Lambeth station in 2015 after four years spent as a part-time special constable.
igbo: Nwaada Kareem bidoro dịka PC n'ọdụ Lambeth na 2015 mgbe afọ anọ gachara dịka onye ọrụ nchekwa pụrụ iche.

english: The officer, who has spoken against stop-and-search, joined up after a 16-year-old friend was stabbed to death, UK Daily Mail reports.
igbo: Onye uwe ojii ahụ, onye kwuru okwu banyere nkwụsị na ịchọ ihe, sonyeere mgbe a sụgburu enyi ya dị afọ iri na isii, UK Daily Mail na-akọ.

english: The PC worked as a spotter at airports, looking for possible victims of female genital mutilation (FGM).
igbo: PC ahụ rụrụ ọrụ dịka onye na-ahụ anya n'ọdụ ụgbọelu, na-achọ ndị nwere ihe nbute mmekpa ahụ nwaanyị a kpọrọ 'Female Genital Mutilation' (FGM).

english: She also acted as a translator as she speaks French, Italian and her native Yoruba.
igbo: Ọ rụkwara dịka onye ntụgharị okwu dịka ọ na-asụ asụsụ French, Italian na asụsụ ala nna ya bụ Yoruba.

english: However, she wasmoved from the FGM team after she argued with colleagues.
igbo: Agbanyeghị, e wepụrụ ya site n'otu FGM mgbe ya na ndị ọrụ ibe ya rụchara ụka.

english: Publicity material for the programme showed Miss Kareem in her uniform, branding her a talented singer and dancer.
igbo: Ngwa ihe ngosi maka mmemme ahụ gosipụtara Nwaada Kareem n'uwe ya, ma gosipụta ya dịka ọ̀gụ́ egwu na ọ̀gbá egwu.

english: The material says of Miss Kareem: 'Police officer Khafi Kareem believes that you can have it all if you believe in yourself.
igbo: Akwụkwọ ahụ kwuru banyere Nwaada Kareem: 'Onye uwe ojii Khafi Kareem kwenyere na ị ga-enweta ihe niile ma ọ bụrụ na ikwere n'onwe gị.

english: She is not only hoping to win the prize money but she wants the exposure that being in Big Brother Naija House brings so that she can do societal good.'
igbo: Ọ bụghị naanị na ọ na-ele anya inweta ego mmeri ahụ mana ọ chọrọ ikpughe ịnọ na Big Brother Naija na-eweta ka o wee mee nke ọma.

english: Her romance with Mr. Gedoni has been gripping viewers of the show, which began on June 30.
igbo: Ịhụnanya ya na Mr. Gedoni nọ na-adọrọ mmasị ndị na-ekiri ihe nkiri ahụ, nke malitere na June 30.

english: Nigerian news websites published footage of the couple appearing to be in an act of congress beneath the sheets.
igbo: Isi ụlọọrụ mgbasa ozi ikuku nke ala Naịjiria gosipụtara di na nwunye a na-egosi ịbụ ndị na-eme nnọkọ n'okpuru àkwà.

english: One article said: 'There are now fears that Khafi may leave Big Brother Naija House pregnant as she and lovebird Gedoni continued their sizzling romance.
igbo: Otu edemede kwuru: 'Ugbu a, egwu dị na Khafi nwere ike ibu afọ ime hapụ ụlọ Big Brother Naija dịka ya na Gedoni na-aga n'ihi enwe mmekọ nwoke na nwaanyị.

english: The cameras caught them for the third time overnight as other housemates were dead asleep.
igbo: Igwefoto ahụ jidere ha nke ugboro atọ n'abali ka ndị ọzọ na-ehi ụra.

english: The footage, now trending, showed the lovebirds moving their bodies in ecstasy under the sheets. Gedoni and Khafi first romped in the house on Saturday, July 20 and then again on Tuesday, July 23.'
igbo: Gedoni na Khafi buuru ụzọ banye n'ụlọ na Satọde, Julaị 20 na n'ụbọchị Tuesday, Julaị 23

english: Her participation has left her fellow officers unimpressed.
igbo: Ntinye aka ya emeela ka ndị ọrụ ibe ya dị nnwute.

english: Another Met source told the Sun: 'There should be no way back for her from this and her superiors will have to act.
igbo: Ozi ọzọ si na Met gwara ndị Sun: 'A gaghị enwe ike ịlọghachite azụ ọbụla na nke a na ndị isi ya ga-eme ihe.'

english: She fitted the mould perfectly for how the modern force wants to portray itself but seems to have got a bit too big for her boots.
igbo: Ọ dabara n'ụkpụrụ ahụ nke ọma dịka otu ọchịchị ọgbara ọhụụ chọrọ igosipụta onwe ya.

english: It's hard to see how can she argue that she hasn't brought the force into disrepute.
igbo: O siri ike ịhụ ka ọ ga-esi rụọ ụka na o wetaghị onwe ya mmechu ihu n' ele ndị uweojii nọ. Onye na-ekwuchitere ndị Met ọnụ kwuru n'abalị ụnyaahụ a: Ndị Met akwadoghi ọdịdị onye uweojii ahụ nke o ji anọchite anya Met mgbe ọ na-apụta n'ihe ngosi ahụ.

english: A Met spokesman said last night: The Met does not support the officer's appearance nor does she represent the Met whilst appearing on the show.
igbo: Ndị uwe ojii niile kwesịrị inwe agwa ndị ọkachamara na anaghị emechu ndị uweojii ihu n'ihu maọbụ n'azụ ọrụ.

english: All officers have a duty to behave with professionalism and in a manner that does not bring the Met into disrepute whether on or off duty. Those who do not behave professionally risk breaching police standards of professional behaviour, and may be dealt with by way of misconduct proceedings.'
igbo: Ndị anaghị akpa agwa ndị ọkachamara na-emebi ụkpụrụ ndị uweojii nke e nwere ike imeso site n'usoro omume ọjọọ. '

english: Big Brother Naija: Sex Content On Reality Show Contemptible, Says Women Council
igbo: Big Brother Naija: Inwe mmekọrịta dị n'ihe nkiri ahụ, ọgbakọ ụmụnwaanyị kwuru

english: A new Big Brother Naija is on its way coming and we are working with Startimes. We are doing BBN that will reflect the true Nigerian culture.
igbo: Big Brother Naịja ọhụrụ a na-apụta, nke anyị na-esi na Startimes na-arụ ọrụ. Anyị na-eme BBN nke ga-egosipụta ezi omenaala ndị Naijiria.

english: The National Council of Women Societies (NCWS) and the Nigerian government have condemned the sexual content on Big Brother Naija (BBN), a reality TV show, stating that it is not a Nigerian culture.
igbo: Otu na-ahụ maka ụmụnwaanyị a kpọrọ National Council of Women Societies (NCWS) na gọọmentị Naijiria katọrọ ihe mmekọ nwoke na nwaanyị dị na Big Nwan Naija (BBN), ihe ngosi tiivii, na-ekwupụta na ọ bụghị omenaala ndị Naijiria.

english: Segun Runsewe, Director-General of the National Council for Arts and Culture (NCAC), said this while receiving Gloria Shoda, President of the National Council of Women Societies (NCWS).
igbo: Segun Runsewe, onye mgbazi na kansụl omenaala a kpọrọ National Council for Arts and Culture (NCAC), kwuru nke a mgbe ọ na-anabata Gloria Shoda, onyeisi oche nke National Council of Women Societies (NCWS).

english: The NCAC boss also revealed that the government was in talks with Startimes to start a state-owned BBN that will truly reflect Nigerian content.
igbo: Onyeisi NCAC kpughere na gọọmentị na ndị Startimes nwere mkparịta ụka maka ibido BBN nke steeti nwe nke ga-egosipụta ihe ndị Naijirịa nwere.

english: He also warned that the agency would present a nudity bill to punish sexual acts as displayed on BBN.
igbo: Ọ dọkwara aka na ntị na ụlọ ọrụ ahụ ga-eweta akwụkwọ ịgba ụgwọ iji nye mmebi iwu mmekọahụ dịka e gosiri na BBN.

english: He said: 'We are going to re-present that bill.
igbo: Ọ sịrị: “Anyị ga-eweghachi akwụkwọ ụgwọ ahụ.

english: You can't fight a battle without a legal framework; we are definitely going to be conscious of that.
igbo: Ị gaghị ike ịlụ ọgụ na enweghị usoro iwu; anyị ga-ama nke a.

english: I will take up the issue of Big Brother Naija.
igbo: “M ga-ebulite okwu nke Big Nwanna Naija.

english: I have spoken with officials of the National Broadcasting Commission because what is going on now is terrible.
igbo: Agwala m ndị isi nke ụlọ ọrụ Mgbasa Ozi Mba n'ihi na ihe na-eme ugbu a dị egwu.

english: Having love affairs on the screen is not part of our own culture at all.
igbo: Inwe mmekọ nwoke na nwaanyị n' igweonyonyo abụghị omenaala anyị ma ọlị.

english: Let me use this forum to tell Nigerians that a new Big Brother Naija is on its way coming and we are working with Startimes.
igbo: Ka m jiri nnọkọ a gwa ndị Big Brother Naịja ọhụrụ na-abịa, anyị na ndị Startimes na-emekọ.

english: We are doing BBN that will reflect the true Nigerian culture.
igbo: Anyị na-eme BBN nke ga-egosipụta ezi omenaala ndị Naijiria.

english: We are already working on it, all that will be eaten there will be Nigerian food, the dresses will be Nigerian dresses.'
igbo: Anyị na-arụ ọrụ na ya, ihe niile a ga-eri ebe ahụ ga-abụ nri ndị Naịjirịa, akwa a ga-eyi ga-abụ akwa ndị Naịjirịa.

english: The NCWS president said she was not against the BBN reality show but the sex content was disgusting.
igbo: Onyeisi NCWS kwuru na ya emegideghị ihe ngosi BBN mana nke gbasara mmekọahụ na-asọ oyi.

english: Shoda said, 'Having live sex on stage is the thing affecting my sensibility and it is impacting negatively on the young children coming up.
igbo: Shoda kwurusị, 'Inwe mmekọ nwoke na nwaanyị n'ọgbọ bụ ihe na-emetụta echiche m, ọ na-emetụta ụmụaka na-eto eto n'ụzọ adịghị mma.

english: Does it mean that they can't abstain from sex for three months?
igbo: Ọ pụtara na ha agaghị enwe ike ịhapụ ịkwa iko ọnwa atọ?

english: I'm condemning the sex content on BBN.'
igbo: Ana m akatọ ịkwa iko dị na BBN.

english: Big Brother Naija Star, Khaffy, Facing UK Met Police Internal Inquiry For Joining Show Without Permission
igbo: Big Brother Naija Star, Khaffy, nọ n'ihu ndị uweojii UK maka isonye na ngosi ahụ na enweghị ikike

english: She's a serving British police officer — it's outrageous.
igbo: Ọ bụ onye uwe ojii Britain ka na-eje ozi- ọ jọgburu onwe ya.

english: She asked permission to go on the show but, when her request was refused, she went anyway.'
igbo: Ọ rịọrọ ikike ka ọ gaa ihe nkiri mana, mgbe a jụrụ ịnabata arịrịọ ya, ọ pụrụ.

english: A Metropolitan Police officer, Khafi Kareem, is appearing on the Nigerian version of Big Brother despite being refused permission by her bosses and could face disciplinary action.
igbo: Onye uweojii Metropolitan bụ Khafi Kareem na-apụta na Big Brother nke Naịjirịa n'agbanyeghị na ndị isi ya enyeghi ya ikike.

english: Ms. Kareem, 29, who was pictured alongside Commissioner Cressida Dick as the Met celebrated 100 years of women in the force last November, is one of the stars of the African reality TV show.
igbo: Nwaada Kareem dị afọ iri abụọ na itoolu, onye e sere ya na kọmịshọna Cressida Dick foto ka ndị Met na-eme ncheta ụmụnwaanyị nke afọ otu narị n'ọnwa Nọvemba gara aga, bụ otu onye a ma ama nke ihe nkiri Africa tiivii gosipụtara.

english: Scotland Yard said it had not granted Ms. Kareem's request to appear on the programme and that an internal investigation would be carried out, reports UK Press Association.
igbo: Scotland Yard kwuru na enyebeghị Nwaada Kareem ikike n'arịrịọ iji pụta na mmemme ahụ nakwa na a ga-eme nyocha nke ime ụlọ, ka UK Press Association na-akọ.

english: The UK Metropolitan Police said Ms. Kareem was granted unpaid leave for an 'unrelated reason' ahead of appearing on the show but her request to take part in the programme was denied.
igbo: Onye uweojii nke UK Metropolitan kwuru na e nyere Nwaada Kareem ezumike agaghị akwụ ụgwọ maka tupu ọ pụta n'ihe nkiri ahụ mana a jụrụ ịnabata arịrịọ ya maka itinye aka na mmemme ahụ.

english: A spokesman said: 'A Pc, attached to the Met's transformation command, requested permission to take part in a reality television entertainment show in Nigeria.
igbo: Onye nkwuchite ọnụ kwuru, sị: Pc Met rịọrọ ikike isonye na ihe ngosi egwuregwu telivishọn na Nigeria.

english: Permission was not given.
igbo: Enyeghị ya ikike ahụ.

english: The Met is aware that the officer has since appeared on the show without authority.
igbo: Ndị ụlọọrụ Met ahụ maara na onye uweojii ahụ pụtara n'ihe nkiri ahụ n'enweghị ikike.

english: The Directorate of Professional Standards has been informed and will be carrying out an investigation into the circumstances.
igbo: A gwala ndị 'Directorate nke Professional Standards' na a ga-eme nchọpụta banyere ọnọdụ ahụ.

english: 'The Met does not support the officer's appearance nor does she represent the Met whilst appearing on the show.'
igbo: Met akwadoghi ejiji onye uweojii ahụ nke nwaanyị ahụ ji anọchite anya Met n'ihe ngosi ahụ.

english: The force added that any officer found to have breached police standards of professional behaviour could face misconduct proceedings.
igbo: Ndị agha ahụ gbakwụnyere na onye uweojii ọbụla a hụrụ na-emebi ụkpụrụ ndị uweojii n'akparamàgwà ọkachamara nwere ike ịnwe ikpe na-adịghị mma.

english: According to The Sun, Ms. Kareem joined the force as a Pc based at Lambeth station in 2015, having worked part-time as a special constable for four years.
igbo: Dịka ndị Sun kwuru, Nwaada Kareem sonyere ndị agha ahụ dịka onye PC n'ọdụ Lambeth na 2015, ma rụọ ọrụ nwa oge ihe dịka afọ anọ.

english: An unnamed colleague told the newspaper: 'She's a serving British police officer — it's outrageous.
igbo: Otu onye ọrụ ya akpọghị aha ya gwara ndị akwụkwọ akụkọ: 'Ọ bụ onye uwe ojii Britain ka na-eje ozi- ọ jọgburu onwe ya.

english: She asked permission to go on the show but, when her request was refused, she went anyway.'
igbo: Ọ rịọrọ ikike ka ọ gaa ihe nkiri mana, mgbe a jụrụ ịnabata arịrịọ ya, ọ pụrụ.'

english: A post on the website of Africa Magic, the television channel which broadcasts Big Brother Naija, says Ms. Kareem joined the show 'so that she can do societal good'.
igbo: Ihe ngosi dị na webụsaịtị Africa Magic, nke telivishọn na-agbasa Big Brother Naija, kwuru na Nwaada Kareem sonyere n'ihe ngosi a 'ka o were mee ọhaneze mma'.

english: It read: 'Police officer Khafi Kareem believes that you can have it all if you believe in yourself.
igbo: Ọ na-agụ: 'Onye uweojii Khafi Kareem kwenyere na ị ga-enweta ihe niile ma ọ bụrụ na ikwere n'onwe gị.

english: 'She is not only hoping to win the prize money but she wants the exposure that being in Big Brother Naija House brings so that she can do societal good.
igbo: Ọ bụghị naanị na ọ na-ele anya inweta ego mmeri ahụ mana ọ chọrọ ikpughe ịnọ na Big Brother Naija na-eweta ka o wee mee nke ọma.

english: 'What people don't know about her is that she is secretly talented in spoken word, singing, and dancing.
igbo: Ihe ndị mmadụ amaghị banyere ya bụ na o nwere ikike ikwu okwu, ịgụ egwu na ịgba egwu.

english: She is an Ekiti native who resides in London.'
igbo: Ọ bụ nwa afọ Ekiti onye bi na Lọndọn.

english: The post also reveals Ms. Kareem would spend the prize money, reportedly worth N30 million (£68,000), on hosting a travel show in Nigeria, as well as investing in charitable causes.
igbo: Ihe ngosi ahụ kpughere Nwaada Kareem ga-emefu ego nrite ahụ, nke a na-ekwu na ọ dị nde N30 ($68,000), na nnabata ihe ngosi njem na Nigeria, ya na itinye ego n'ihe ọrụ ebere.

english: Bigamy: ASD Daughter's Marriage, Mulan and Abubakar Musa Abubakar By Dr Muhammad Bashir Maru
igbo: Bigamy: Alụmdi na nwunye nwa nwanyị ASD, Mulan na Abubakar Musa Abubakar nke Dr Muhammad Bashir Maru

english: We must not forget the reverberating cry of Ernesto Che Guevera to with 'If you tremble with indignation at every injustice then you are a comrade of mine' it is this that spur true patriots on an eternal vigil as the vanguards for justice and equity for all.
igbo: Anyị agaghị echezọ mkpu ákwá Ernesto Che Guevera na ' Ọ bụrụ na ị wee iwe n'ihi ikpe na-ezighị ezi ọbụla, ị bụ onye otu m'. Ọ bụ nke a na-akwalite ezi ịhụ mba n'anya n'ụzọ na-enweghị atụ dịka ihe na-egbochi ikpe ziri ezi na ịha nhatanha n'ihi ihe niile.

english: Justice will not be served until those who are unaffected are as outraged as those who are.' – Benjamin Franklin
igbo: A gaghị ekpe ikpe ziri ezi ruo mgbe ndị o metụtaghị ga-ewe iwe dịka ndị o metụtara - Benjamin Franklin

english: From the very origins and cradle of humanity, injustice has always reared its ugly head to crush and oppress those perceived to be of less social standing and thus the fight for justice has raged on through the ages.
igbo: Site na nzụlite na nkata nke mmadụ, ikpe e zighi ezi bụ ihe na-emegbu ndị e lere anya dịka ndị ọnụ erughi n'okwu ma mgba a na-agbara ikpe ziri ezi malitere kemgbe ụwa.

english: Little wonder the immortal words of Benjamin Franklin remain as empirically practicable today as it was decades ago when he muttered them and even before the words found life from his oscillating tongue centuries back.
igbo: Ka a sịkwa ihe mere na okwu Benjamin Franklin adịghị anwụ anwu dịka ọ mere ọtụtụ iri afọ gara aga mgbe ọ kwupụtara ha.

english: These pricking words are the prods that guide us today as we cry out for impartial justice for Abubakar Musa Abubakar who is being persecuted consistently by Alhaji Sani Dauda (ASD), former Chairman of Peugeot Automobile Nigeria Limited.
igbo: Okwu ndị a bụ ihe na-eduzi anyị taa dịka anyị tiri mkpu maka ikpe Abubakar Musa Abubakar, bụ onye Alhaji Sani Dauda (ASD), onyeisi oche 'Peugeot Automobile Nigeria Limited' na-akpagbu mgbe niile.

english: In the Nigeria of yesteryears opulent individual like ASD lorded over others like a czar of a medieval fiefdom; having their wishes, whims and caprices foisted on the generality of the people.
igbo: Na Naịjiria n'oge ochie, ndị ji ego dịka ASD na-eme ihe ike karịa ndị ọzọ dịka inweta ihe ha chọrọ, izugbe ndị mmadụ ime ihe.

english: This was indeed a dark and gloomy period when he and his ilk had their words as laws and any attempt to challenge or oppose their ambition would be seen as a sacrilege with a resultant mobilization of their foot soldiers to bully, coarse, harass, intimidate and humiliate those who dared to oppose them.
igbo: Nke a bụ mgbe ya na ụdị ya mere okwu ya dịka iwu, na mbọ ọbụla a gbara iji megide ebumnuche ha ka a ga-ahụ ihe dị nsọ ma kwanye ndị agha iji megbuo, yie egwu, menye ụjọ ma mee ndị na-emegide ha ihe ihere.

english: In these repugnant dark days, it was believed that some rogue law enforcement agents, compromised media influencers and corrupt judges were whispered to be on his payroll and always willing to do his bidding.
igbo: N'ụbọchị ọjọọ ndị a, e kwenyere na ụfọdụ ndị ọrụ mmanye iwu, ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi na ndị ọ̀kà ikpe arụrụ ala bụ ndị ọ na-akwụ ụgwọ ma na-adị njikere ime ihe ọ chọrọ.

english: It can thus be inferred that was the very reason his types got away with so much impunity.
igbo: Ọ nwere ike bụrụ ihe kpatara ụdị ya ji pụọ n'enweghị ntaramahụhụ.

english: Though the businessman still wallows in the euphoria of the past, but what he has failed to realize is that the ground has shifted beneath him, and that in the New Nigeria of today no one is above the law.
igbo: N'agbanyeghị na onye ọchụnta ego ka na-awagharị n'obi ọjọọ nke oge gara aga, mana ihe ọ ghọtaghị bụ na ihe agbanweela, na Naịjiria nke taa ọ dịghị onye karịrị iwu.

english: In the lines of the ancient adage, 'A leopard never changes its spots' and so true for ASD's apparent impunity which has remerged in this recent episode hence the resort to contempt of Court and judicial abuse all in a bid to placate his daughter Nasiba Sani Dauda, shield his Son Shehu Sani Dauda, a sharia court Judge Alkali Murtala Nasir Al-Misiry and one Abdullahi Kaloma.
igbo: N'ahịrị nke usoro okwu mgbe ochie, 'Agụ owuru anaghị agbanwe agwa ya', ọ bụ eziokwu maka nnabata pụtara ìhè nke ASD nke jupụtara n'ihe e mere n'oge gara aga, n'ihi nke a, na-eleda ụlọ ikpe anya, ikpe ikpe iji chụọ nwa ya nwaanyị bụ Nasiba Sani Dauda, kpuchie nwa ya nwoke bụ Shehu Sani Dauda, onye ọkaikpe Sharia Alkali Murtala Nasir Al-Misiry na otu onye, Abdullahi Kaloma.

english: Together, they jointly committed criminal conspiracy, abetment of an offence, criminal assault, wrongful confinement and restraint, false imprisonment, voluntary causing of harm, enticement of a married woman, bigamy, re-marriage with concealment of former marriage in defiance of an existing judgment of the Kawo Upper Sharia Court, Kaduna in a case between Abubakar Musa Abubakar Vs. Nasiba Sani Dauda contrary to sections 45, 46, 58, 217, 229, 230, 239, 365, 366 and 369 respectively of the panel code law of Kaduna State, Nigeria.
igbo: Ha jikọrọ ọnụ mee mpụ, mwepụ nke imebi iwu, njide ezighi ezi, mkpọrọ ụgha, ịkpata mmerụ ahụ, ịlụgharị di na nwunye na nkwụsị ikpe dị adị n'ụlọ ikpe ukwuu nke Kawo Sharia, Kaduna n'ikpe dị n'etiti Abubakar Musa Abubakar na Nasiba Sani Dauda nke megidere ngalaba 45, 46, 58, 217, 229, 230, 239, 365, 366 na 369 n'usoro iwu nke Kaduna steeti, Naịjiria.

english: As one would expect that his recent entanglement with Abubakar Musa Abubakar a supposed son-in-law is nothing new and certainly he is not likely going to be the last person to undergo such a harrowing experience from irresponsible prying except the businessman is stopped in his tracks by the grilling mechanism of justice.
igbo: Dịka mmadụ ga-atụ anya na mmekọ ya na Abubakar Musa Abubakar onye nwere ike ịbụ ọgọ ya nwoke abụghị ihe ọhụụ ma ọ gaghị abụ onye ikpeazụ ga-anagide n'ihe ọjọọ dị otu a site na enweghi amamihe beelụsọ ma a ga-akwụsị onye ọchụnta ego ime ihe n'usoro nkwụmọtọ.

english: Now, the same scenario is being re-enacted with Abubakar Musa Abubakar, who married Nasiba Sani Dauda on the 24th December, 2016.
igbo: Ugbu a, a na-enyochaghachi ọnọdụ ahụ ya na Abubakar Musa Abubakar, onye lụrụ Nasiba Sani Dauda n'àbàlị̀ iri abụọ na anọ nke ọnwa Disemba, 2016.

english: It will be recalled that the marriage started on the foundation of love, peace and harmony until few months into the marriage when the father of Nasiba - Alhaji Sani Dauda - began undue interference in the family affairs of the couple on a daily basis and subsequently instructed his daughter against her will to abscond from the marriage for reasons not yet clear to discerning minds.
igbo: A ga-echeta na alụmdi a bidoro na ntọala nke ịhụnanya, udo na nkwekọrịta ruo ọnwa ole na ole a banyere na alụmdi mgbe nna Nasiba - Alhaji Sani Dauda - malitere itinye anya n'okwu ezinụlọ ahụ kwa ụbọchị ma mesịa gwa nwa ya nwaanyị ka ọ ghara ịlụ di ahụ n'ihi ebumnuche na-edobeghị anya.

english: All entreaties to ASD to return Nasiba to her matrimonial home fell on deaf ears, but he instead forced Nasiba to institute a case of Khul' (request for divorce) before Grade 1 Sharia Court, Tudun Wada, Kaduna where a controversial judgment was obtained and a dissolution of the marriage was pronounced without recourse to principles of nemo iudex in causa sua and audi alteram partem to the concerned parties.
igbo: Arịrịọ a rịọrọ ASD ka ọ laghachi Nasiba n'alụmdi na nwunye ya kpụrụ afọ n'ala, mana ọ manyere Nasiba ka o guzobe okwu nke Khul (arịrịọ maka ịgba alụkwaghịm) n'ihu ụlọ ikpe Sharia mbụ, Tudun Wada, Kaduna ebe e nwetara ikpe na-ese okwu ma kwupụta alụkwaghịm n'etiti di na nwunye ahụ na-enweghị mgbakwunye na ụkpụrụ nke 'nemo iudex in causa sua' na 'audi alteram pertem' nke metụtara ndị ahụ.

english: However, Abubakar Musa Abubakar not satisfied with the judgment of the lower court obtained a stay of execution order from the Upper Sharia Court, Kawo, Kaduna which was served on the respondent and subsequently appealed the travesty of justice of the lower court at the Upper Sharia Court which gave judgment in favour Abubakar Musa Abubakar by quashing and setting aside the judgment of the lower court for lacks of jurisdiction.
igbo: Agbanyeghị, Abubakar Musa Abubakar enweghị afọ ojuju na ikpe ahụ ụlọ ikpe dị ala wetara nke igbu ọchụ sitere n'ụlọ ikpe nke Sharia, Kawo, Kaduna nke e nyere onye na-azaghachi ma mechaa rịọ maka ikpe ziri ezi nke ụlọ ikpe dị ala n'ụlọ ikpe dị elu nke Sharia ebe e nyere Abubakar Musa Abubakar ikpe ahụ site n'ịsụgharị na ịwezụga ikpe nke ụlọ ikpe dị ala maka enweghị ikike.

english: Both the stay of execution order notice and the substantive judgment of the Upper Sharia Court were properly served on the respondent (Nasiba). It is the only prevailing judgment that exists till this day.
igbo: Ma nnọchite anya akwụkwọ e nyere maka igbu egbu na mkpebi ụlọikpe nke Sharia ukwu ka e nyere onye nzara ọnụ (Nasiba). Ọ bụ naanị ikpe a na-agbasokarị nke dị ruo taa.

english: The arrest and detention of Alhaji Sani Dauda and others for abetment of an offence, remarriage with marriage concealment, criminal assault among other charges goes further to show that President Muhammadu Buhari's next level agenda will not tolerate lawlessness from any quarters and that justice is truly blind but fair and balanced to all manner of people.
igbo: Njide na nnwụchi nke Alhaji Sani Dauda na ndị ọzọ maka ịda iwu, ịlụgharị di na nwunye na nzuzo, mpụ na ebubo ndị ọzọ na-aga n'ihu na-egosi na ọkwa onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari ọzọ agaghị agbachi mmebi iwu site n'akụkụ ọbụla.

english: The action of ASD is capable of triggering series of unpleasant events such breach to peace, chaos, turmoil etc.
igbo: Omume nke ASD nwere ike ibute usoro ihe ọjọọ jupụtara na mmebi udo, ọgba aghara, wdg.

english: Above all it is an affront to the judiciary, rule of law and attempt to denigrate sharia law.
igbo: N'ihe niile, ọ bụ mkparị na ngalaba ikpe, ịkwado iwu na ịnwa imebi iwu Sharia.

english: How can anyone who called himself Muslim marry off another man's wife?
igbo: Kedụ ka onye kpọrọ onwe ya onye Alakụba si lụta nwunye onye ọzọ?

english: In condemning the injustice and high handedness being propelled by ASD, let this turn of justice signal a warning knell to all that;
igbo: N'ịkatọ ikpe ezighi ezi na aka dị elu nke ASD na-akpali, ka ikpe a gosipụta ịdọ aka ná ntị na-emetụta ihe ndị ahụ;

english: Gone are the days when individuals because of their economic powers can do as they wish by pocketing law enforcement officers and conniving with rogues members of the judiciary to do as they please.
igbo: Oge agafeela mgbe ndị nwere akụ na ụba na-eme ihe ha chọrọ site na inye ndị ọrụ iwu aka azụ na isonye ndị otu ụlọ ikpe na-eme ihe masịrị ha.

english: His arrest and detention has sent an unmistakable warning to unrepentant law breakers that there is now a new Sherriff in town and that their excesses will no longer be tolerated.
igbo: Njide ya ezigara ndị na-emebi iwu na-enweghị nchegharị ịdọ aka ná ntị e nwere Sherriff ọhụrụ n'obodo ugbu a nakwa na a gaghịzi anabata ihe ha na-eme.

english: All eyes are now on the judiciary on whether they will look the other way while the temple of justice is being desecrated through repeated abuse of judicial processes and contempt of Court proceedings.
igbo: Anya niile dị na ngalaba ikpe ma ha ga-ele anya ebe ọzọ ebe ebibiworo ụlọ ikpe site mkparị usoro ikpe ikpe na nlelị maka usoro ikpe.

english: Since the outbreak of this imbroglio and its escalation in the public domain, ASD albeit clandestinely has been sponsoring groups and individuals as face-saving measures to sell false narratives through media propaganda that portray him and his darling daughter as the victims rather than the perpetrators of this heinous crime against God and humanity.
igbo: Kemgbe ntiwapụ nke 'imbroglio' na-arị elu, ASD n'amaghị ama na-akwado ndị otu na mmadụ dị iche iche ire akụkọ ụgha site na mgbasa ozi na-egosi na ya na nwa ya nwaanyị dị ka ndị a tara ahụhụ kama ndị na-arụ arụrụala megide Chineke na ndị mmadụ.

english: One of such groups is Muslim Lawyers Association of Nigeria, Kaduna State Chapter, an organisation that should be neutral in a matter that involves two contending parties both of who are Muslims or at best side with the truth but instead they came out disgracefully to pitch tent with the culprits (ASD and Others) who intentionally and knowingly desecrate Islamic Sharia laid down tenets of marriage by abetting bigamy.
igbo: Otu n'ime ndị otu a bụ 'Muslim Lawyers Association of Nigeria' nke steeti Kaduna, otu kwesịrị ịnọpụ iche n'okwu metụtara ndị abụọ na-asọrịta mpi bụ ndị Alakụba maọbụ kwụrụ n'eziokwu kama ha pụtara na mmechu ihu kwụ nyere ndị mere mpụ (ASD na ndị ọzọ) bụ ndị kpachaara anya mebie ụkpụrụ nke alụmdi na nwunye nke Alakụba site n'ịlụ nnukwu nwaanyị.

english: By this act, MULAN Kaduna State chapter has shown that their conscience is available for auction to the highest bidder
igbo: Site n'omume a, ndị MULAN nke steeti Kaduna e gosipụtara na ha nwere akọ na uche.

english: How low can an organization sink that prides itself as noble?
igbo: Kedu ka nzukọ ga-esi wedaa onwe ya dịka onye dị oke mma?

english: Abubakar Musa Abubakar should be applauded by all and sundry for towing the path of honour in seeking redress and restraining his relations, associates and thousands of followers from taking laws into their hand and for his abiding faith in our country's judicial system.
igbo: Onye ọbụla kwesịrị ịja Abubakar Musa Abubakar mma n'ịga n'ụzọ nke nsọpụrụ na igbochi mmekọrịta nke ndị be ya, ndị otu ya na puku ọtụtụ ndị na-eso ụzọ ya iwere iwu n'aka ha yana maka okwukwe na-adịgide n'usoro ikpe ala anyị.

english: Abubakar has never been accused of any wrong doing and he is well known as an honest, hardworking and unassuming gentleman who cannot even hurt a fly.
igbo: Eboghi Abubakar ebubo ime ihe ọjọọ ọbụla mana a maara ya dịka onye na-akwụba aka ọtọ, onye na-arụsi ọrụ ike na enweghị obi ọjọọ.

english: In the face of provocation, intimidation, emotional hurt, blackmail, unwarranted media attack, defamation, criminal assault to relatives and threat to life among others, Abubakar Musa Abubakar has remained unmoved and consistently determined to get justice via the constitutionally guaranteed means.
igbo: N'agbanyeghị mkpasu iwe, obi mgbawa, mmaja, imebi aha, mwakpo na enweghị nchekwa, nkatọ, mpụ na iyi ndụ egwu na ndị ọzọ, Abubakar Musa Abubakar kwụ chịm ma kpebisie ike inweta ikpe ziri ezi site n'ụzọ iwu kwadoro.

english: Let's hope that at the end of it all, justice will be served impartially, because anything other than that will be equal to encouraging self-help, stamping of lawlessness and an unequivocal invitation to disorderliness.
igbo: Ka anyị nwee olile anya na na njedebe ya niile, a ga-ekpe ikpe ziri ezi n'eleghị mmadụ anya n'ihu, n'ihi na ihe ọzọ ga-abụ ịgba ume nke inyere onwe aka, mmebi iwu na ịkpọ oku aghara aghara.

english: A society that gives justice to only selected few is a fertile ground for anarchy.
igbo: Ọha obodo nke na-enye mmadụ ole na ole ahọpụtara ikpe ziri ezi bụ ala na-eme nri maka ọgba aghara.

english: Let those who have ears take a heed.
igbo: Ka ndị nwere ntị gee ntị.

english: We must not forget the reverberating cry of Ernesto Che Guevera to wit 'If you tremble with indignation at every injustice then you are a comrade of mine'
igbo: Anyị agaghị echezọ mkpu ákwá Ernesto Che Guevera na 'Ọ bụrụ na ị wee iwe n'ihi ikpe na-ezighị ezi ọbụla, ị bụ onye otu m'.

english: It is this that spur true patriots on an eternal vigil as the vanguards for justice and equity for all.
igbo: Ọ bụ nke a na-akwalite ezi ịhụ mba n'anya n'ụzọ na-enweghị atụ dịka ihe na-egbochi ikpe ziri ezi na ịha nhatanha n'ihi ihe niile.

english: Bill To Give More Money To Lawmakers Passes Second Reading
igbo: Bill iji nyekwuo ndị omebeiwu ego gafere ọgụgụ nke abụọ.

english: The zonal intervention funds used in executing constituency projects by the lawmakers has been marred with cases of corruption.
igbo: Ego ndị omebe iwu na-eji arụ ọrụ mpaghara jupụtara maka nrụrụ aka.

english: Many of the projects are shoddily executed or abandoned.
igbo: Ọtụtụ ọrụ ahụ bụ ndị e ji nwayọọ arụ maọbụ ndị agbahapụrụ.

english: In some cases, lawmakers use the items to boost their campaigns.
igbo: N'ọnọdụ ụfọdụ, ndị omebe iwu na-eji ihe ndị ahụ akwalite kampeenụ ha.

english: Nigerian lawmakers are in the process of passing a bill that will allocate more money to them for constituency projects.
igbo: Ndị omebe iwu ala Naịjirịa na-aga n’ihu iwepụ iwu ga-ekenyekwu ha ego maka ọrụ mpaghara.

english: The zonal intervention funds used in executing constituency projects by the lawmakers has been marred with cases of corruption.
igbo: Ego ndị omebe iwu na-eji arụ ọrụ mpaghara jupụtara maka nrụrụ aka.

english: Many of the projects are shoddily executed or abandoned.
igbo: Ọtụtụ ọrụ ahụ bụ ndị e ji nwayọọ arụ maọbụ ndị agbahapụrụ.

english: In some cases, lawmakers use the items to boost their campaigns.
igbo: N'ọnọdụ ụfọdụ, ndị omebe iwu na-eji ihe ndị ahụ akwalite kampeenụ ha.

english: However, at the plenary on Tuesday, lawmakers passed a bill seeking to allocate 20 per cent of the national budget for constituency projects.
igbo: Otu o sila dị, na nnọkọ e mere na Tuesday, ndị omebe iwu tiri iwu nke chọrọ ikenye pasent iri abụọ nke mmefu ego mba maka ọrụ mpaghara.

english: According to Premium Times, the bill was sponsored by Stella Odua, lawmaker representing Anambra North.
igbo: Dịka Premium Times kwuru, Stella Odua, onye omebe iwu na-anọchi anya Anambra Nọọtụ kwadoro iwu ahụ.

english: This bill comes on the heels of the outcry over non-existent and incomplete constituency projects proposed by lawmakers.
igbo: Mkpesa ego a bụ banyere ọrụ ndị na-adịghị adị nakwa ndị ezughi ezu na mpaghara dị iche iche nke ndị omebe iwu chọrọ.

english: Nigerian lawmakers have been accused of using constituency projects as a means of embezzling public funds.
igbo: E boro ndị omebe iwu nke Naịjirịa ebubo na ha na-eji ọrụ dị na mpaghara dịka ụzọ ha si eri ego ọha.

english: Only recently, President Muhammadu Buhari said billions of naira allocated to constituency projects had not been properly utilised – an allegation that the Senate Minority Leader dismissed as erroneous.
igbo: N’oge adịbeghị anya, onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari kwuru na etinyere ọtụtụ ijeri naịra maka ọrụ mpaghara nke arụghị n'ụzọ ziri ezi-ebubo onyeisi ndị omeiwu nta a kpọrọ 'Minority Leader' jụrụ na ọ bụ ihe ezighi ezi.

english: According to the bill, projects under the Act when passed shall be community-based in order to ensure that the prospective benefits are available to a wide cross-section of the inhabitants of a particular area.
igbo: Dịka ego ahụ siri dị, ọrụ dị n'okpuru Iwu (Act) ahụ, mgbe ọ gafere ga-abụ nke obodo iji hụ na uru dị nke ga-enweta ọtụtụ akụkụ nke ndị bi n'otu mpaghara.

english: It also states that any funding under the Act shall be for a completed project or a defined phase of a project and may include the acquisition of land and buildings.
igbo: O kwukwara na ego ọbụla nọ n’okpuru Iwu ahụ ga-abụ maka ọrụ a rụchara arụcha maọbụ nke kọwapụtara nke ọma ma nwee ike ịgụnye nweta ala na ụlọ.

english: 'All projects shall be projects as defined under this Act when passed and may include costs related to feasibility studies, planning and design or other technical input for the project but shall not include recurrent costs of a facility.
igbo: “Ọrụ ngo niile ga-abụ ọrụ dịka akọwara n’okpuru iwu a, mgbe ha gafere ya nwere ike ịgụnye ọnụ ego ndị ọzọ nke metụtara ihe ọmụmụ, atụmatụ na imewe maọbụ ihe ọmụma ndị ọzọ maka ọrụ a mana ọ gaghị agụnye ego ọrụ a.

english: 'Projects may include the acquisition of vehicles, machinery and other equipment for the constituency,' are some provisions of the bill.
igbo: 'Ọrụ ahụ nwere ike ịgụnye nnweta ụgbọala, ígwè na ngwa ndị ọzọ maka mpaghara,' bụ ụfọdụ ihe dị n'ego ahụ.

english: Leading the debate, Oduah said constituency projects is one of the unique features of Nigeria's democratic journey so far.
igbo: N'idu na mkparịta ụka a, Oduah sịrị na ọrụ dị na mpaghara bụ otu n’ime ihe pụrụ iche banyere njem ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya nke Naịjirịa.

english: She said the bill is intended to correct the top-bottom approach of governance and replace it with the bottom-top approach.
igbo: O kwuru na ego ahụ e zubere bụ iji dozie usoro elu-ala 'top-bottom' nke ọchịchị ma were usoro dị ala 'bottom-top' dochie ya.

english: If not for the projects, the majority of federal constituencies would not have a single federal project due to the lopsided nature of project allocation in the budget, she said.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na ọ bụghị maka ọrụ ndị ahụ, ọtụtụ mpaghara nke gọọmentị etiti agaghị enwe otu ọrụ gọọmentị etiti n'ihi ọdịdị òkè nke ọrụ ngo, o kwuru.

english: In his contribution, Deputy Chief Whip, Sabi Abdullahi, said there are lots of misinterpretations and misinformation on constituency projects hence the need to act in a manner that gives every constituency a sense of belonging and a national feeling.
igbo: Na ntinye ya, osote onyeisi Whip, Sabi Abdullahi, kwuru na e nwere ọtụtụ nghọtahie na nduhie n'ihe gbasara ọrụ mpaghara ya mere na ọ dị mkpa ime ihe n'ụzọ ga-eme ka mpaghara niile nwee echiche onwe na mmetụta nke mba.

english: He said, 'I think it is only very fair to ensure that every part of this country has that sense of belonging, those little interventions as democratic dividends.'
igbo: O kwuru, 'Echere m na ọ bụ nnọọ ihe ziri ezi na akụkụ/mpaghara ọbụla nke mba a nwere echiche ịbụ, obere ihe mgbochi ndị ahụ dịka ndị ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya.'

english: Bobrisky Is Risky, Buhari Regime Warns Travellers, Tourists
igbo: Bobrisky bụ ihe egwu, Buhari adọọla ndị njem aka na ntị.

english: The health hazard Bobrisky has is worse than Ebola Virus Disease; travellers and tourists should be careful wherever they notice the presence of Bobrisky, mostly as it affects sharing of public facilities.
igbo: Ahụike Bobrisky jọrọ njọ karịa Ọrịa Ebola; Ndị njem kwesịrị ịkpachara anya ebe ọbụla ha hụrụ Bobrisky, ọkachasị ebe metụtara ịkekọrịta ụlọ ọrụ ọha.

english: The President Muhammadu regime has warned tourists and travellers to be wary of Nigerian crossdresser, Okuneye Idris Olarenwaju, aka Bobrisky.
igbo: Ọchịchị onyeisi ala Muhammadu adọọla ndị njem aka na ntị ka ha kpachara anya ha maka Okuneye Idris Olarenwaju, onye Naịjirịa a na-akpọ Bobrisky.

english: Reacting to a complaint that Bobrisky used a female restroom at the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja, Nigeria's Director-General of National Centre for Arts and Culture, Segun Runsewe, told Punch, 'Bobrisky is a serious health hazard for Nigeria and Nigerians. The health hazard Bobrisky has is worse than Ebola Virus Disease; travellers and tourists should be careful wherever they notice the presence of Bobrisky, mostly as it affects sharing of public facilities.
igbo: Mgbe a na-eme mkpesa na Bobrisky jere n'ụlọ mposi ụmụnwaanyị n'ọdụ ụgbọelu Nnamdi Azikiwe dị n'Abuja, onyeisi nlekọta nke 'National Centre for Arts and Culture', Segun Runsewe gwara Punch, 'Bobrisky bụ nnukwu ọghọm ahụike nyere Naịjirịa na ndị Naịjirịa.' Ahụike Bobrisky jọrọ njọ karịa Ọrịa Ebola; Ndị njem kwesịrị ịkpachara anya ebe ọbụla ha hụrụ Bobrisky, ọkachasị ebe metụtara ịkekọrịta ụlọ ọrụ ọha.

english: 'Women are prone to get various types of disease from the toilet than sexual intercourse. Now, Bobrisky will enter the same toilet with a woman and at the end the woman will contract some kind of diseases.
igbo: “Ụmụnwaanyị na-ebute ọrịa dị iche iche n'ụlọ mposi karịa inwe mmekọahụ. Ugbu a, Bobrisky na nwaanyị ga-abanye n'otu ụlọ mposi ahụ, n'ikpeazụ, nwaanyị ahụ ga-ebute ụfọdụ ọrịa.

english: 'When she gets home and sleeps with her husband and the husband discovers he has been infected, the next thing is to seek for divorce without knowing the actual cause of how the wife was infected.'
igbo: Mgbe ọ lọtara, ya na di ya dinaa ma di ya chọpụta na o bu oria, ihe ọzọ bụ ịgba alụkwaghịm n'amaghị ihe kpatara nwunye ya ji bute ọrịa ahụ. '

english: Speaking further, he said, 'In the first place, Bobrisky's passport shows that he is a man. Why should he turn himself to a woman and use women's toilets? At the end of the day, innocent Nigerian women who go to same toilet will now be infected with what they did not bargain for.
igbo: N'ịga n'ihu, ọ sịrị, 'Na mbu, paspọtụ Bobrisky gosiri na ọ bụ nwoke. Kedu ihe kpatara na ọ ga-atụgharị onwe ya ka nwaanyị ma jiri ụlọ mposi nke ụmụnwaanyị? Na ngwụsị nke ụbọchị, ụmụnwaanyị Naịjirịa aka ha dị ọcha ndị ga-aga ụlọ mposi ga-arịazi ihe ha amaghị maka ya.

english: 'If Bobrisky is even using men's toilet, we can understand. As I speak, we got a report of how a woman was very upset with the Federal Airports Authority of Nigeria because on this day she saw Bobrisky using female toilet in Abuja airport.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na Bobrisky na-eji ụlọ mposi ụmụnwoke, anyị nwere ike ịghọta. Dịka m na-ekwu, anyị nwetara akụkọ banyere otu nwaanyị were iwe n'ọdụ ụgbọelu nke Nigeria n'ihi na n'ụbọchị a ọ hụrụ Bobrisky ka ọ na-eji ụlọ mposi ụmụnwaanyị n'ọdụ ụgbọelu Abuja.

english: 'Well, for me, we have done our little bit; we have left everything for the medical practitioners.'
igbo: Nye m, anyị emeela ntakịrị ihe anyị nwere ike ime; anyị ahapụla ihe niile n'aka ndị dọkịta.

english: Bobrisky: 'He', 'She', Nigerians Confused About Pronoun To Use For Idris Okuneye
igbo: Bobrisky: 'Nwoke', 'Nwaanyị', ndị Naịjirịa gbagwojuru anya banyere nnọchiaha a ga-akpọ Idris Okuneye

english: Bobrisky's birthday venue was sealed off on Saturday when policemen laid siege to it.
igbo: E mechiri ebe ncheta ọmụmụ bobrisky na Satọde mgbe ndị uwe ojii nọchibidoro ya.

english: Nigerians seem confused about the appropriate pronoun to use for Idris Okuneye, a popular cross-dresser and self-acclaimed transgender.
igbo: Ndị Naịjirịa dịka ndị ọ gbagwojuru anya banyere nnọchiaha kwesịrị ka e tinyere Idris Okuneye, onye gbanworo ụdị ya.

english: Bobrisky's birthday venue was sealed off on Saturday when policemen laid siege to it.
igbo: Mmemme ncheta ọmụmụ Bobrisky bụ nke e mere ụbọchị Satọdee mgbe ndị uwe ojii gbara ebe ahụ gburugburu.

english: SaharaReporters reports that Nigerians on social media were divided onthe legality of the police's action.
igbo: Ndị 'Sahara Report' na-akọ na ndị Naịjiria na mgbasa ozi nke soshal midia kewara n'usoro iwu nke ndị uwe ojii

english: While some criticized the police for violating Bobrisky's right to assemble, others thought Okuneye's action was immoral.
igbo: Ebe ụfọdụ katọrọ ndị uwe ojii maka imebi ikike Bobrisky nwere, ndị ọzọ chere na omume Okuneye bụ omume rụrụ arụ.

english: But, the pronoun to use in describing Bobrisky's gender generated adebate online.
igbo: Mana, nnọchiaha a ga-eji kọwaa okike/jenda Bobrisky bụ nke rụpụtara n'arụmụka na ịntanetị.

english: Bisi Alimi, a gay man and advocate for the LGBTQ rights cautioned that the right pronoun for Bobrisky is 'she' and 'her'.
igbo: Bisi Alimi, nwoke nwere mmasị n'ụmụnwoke ibe ya na onye nkwado ikike LGBTQ dọrọ aka na ntị na nnọchiaha kwesịrị ka e ji kọwaa Bobrisky bụ 'ọ/she' na 'ya/her'.

english: Using this will help reduce stigma and show that you really care.
igbo: Iji nke a ga-enyere aka belata ihere ma gosipụta ma ị hụrụ n'anya n'ezie.

english: Similarly, Sarah Ogunmiyiwa with the Twitter handle, @sara_ogun, corrected another Twitter user, Olusegun Iselaiye @10tama22, for using'his' to describe Bobrisky.
igbo: N'otu aka ahụ, Sarah Ogunmiyiwa jiri akara 'twitter', @sara_ogun, meziri onye ọrụ 'Twitter' ọzọ, Olusegun Iselaiye @10tama22, maka iji 'ya/his' kọwaa Bobrisky.

english: Bobrisky on the run as Police Storms.
igbo: Bobrisky na-agba ọsọ dịka ndị uweojii wakporo ya

english: Shutdown venue if his 27th birthday celebration in Lekki, chase away everyone,'
igbo: Mechie ebe ọ na-eme mmemme ncheta ọmụmụ afọ iri abụọ na asaa na Lekki, chụpụ mmadụ niile'.

english: Iselaiye tweeted to which Ogunmuyiwa replied, 'HER!!! Her pronouns are she/her!!!
igbo: Iselaiye dere nke Ogunmiyiwa zara, 'Ọ/her!!!' Nnọchiaha ya bụ ọ(she) /ya(her).

english: In one viral video, Bobrisky asked, 'Who is you bro?'
igbo: N' otu vidiyo, Bobrisky jụrụ,' Onye ka ọ bụ Bro?'

english: In an attempt to get Nigerians to see her as a woman.
igbo: Iji mee ka ndị Naịjiria mata ya dịka nwaanyị

english: Border Closure: Nigeria's Inflation Dropped Despite Measure, Says National Bureau Of Statistics
igbo: Mmechi ókè: Ọnụ oriri Naịjịrịa na-agbada n'ike, ụlọ ọrụ a kpọrọ 'National Bureau of Statistics' na-ekwu

english: According to the bureau, the rise in the food index was caused by increases in prices of oils and fats, meat, bread and cereals, potatoes, yam, and other tubers and fish.
igbo: Dịka ụlọ ọrụ ahụ si kwuo, ịrị elu nri rịrị bụ mmụba/mbawanye nke ọnụahịa mmanụ na abụba, anụ, achịcha na ọka, nduku, ji, azụ na ihe ndị ọzọ kpatara ya.

english: Nigeria Cameroon border
igbo: Ókè-ala Naịjiria/Cameroon

english: Nigeria's inflation rate has dropped by 0.06 in the last month, the National Bureau of Statistics said on Tuesday.
igbo: Ọnụego mmachi nke Nigeria adaala 0.06 n'ọnwa gara aga, National Bureau of Statistics kwuru na Tuesday.

english: According to the Consumer Price Index, the inflation rate dropped from 11.08 percent in July to 11.02 percent in August.
igbo: Dịka ndị 'Consumer Price Index' si kwuo, ọnụahịa gbadara site na pasenti 11.08 na July ruo pasenti 11.02 n'Ọgọstụ.

english: The NBS said that the drop in inflation rate continued in August despite several pronouncements regarding restrictions on the import of some food items, minimum wage, and the recent border closures.
igbo: NBS kwuru na mgbalata nke ọnụahịa gara n'ihu n'Ọgọstụ n'agbanyeghị ọtụtụ nkwupụta gbasara mmachi a machiri ibubata ụfọdụ ihe nri, ụgwọ opekata mpe, na mmechi ókèala nso nso a.

english: Similarly, food inflation dropped to 13.17% from 13.39%, while core inflation dropped to 8.68% from 8.80% recorded in the previous month.
igbo: Otu aka ahụ, ọnụahịa nri gbadara rue 13.17% site na 13.39%, ebe isi ọnụahịa sitere na 8.80% gbadaa na 8.68%, e dere n'ọnwa gara aga.

english: With respect to the impact of border closure on consumer prices, the bureau stated that the country may not see the significant effect on inflation now as the closure was only captured for 11 days during the 31 days reference period in August.
igbo: Banyere mmetụta mmechi ókèala n'ọnụahịa ndị ahịa, ụlọ ọrụ 'Bureau' kwuru na obodo ahụ nwere ike ọ gaghị ahụ mmetụta dị mma n'ọnụahịa ugbu a n'ihi na mmechi ahụ bụ naanị mkpụrụ ụbọchị iri na otu n'ime mkpụrụ ụbọchị iri na atọ dị n' Ọgọọstụ.

english: According to the bureau, the rise in the food index was caused by increases in prices of oils and fats, meat, bread and cereals, potatoes, yam, and other tubers and fish.
igbo: Dịka ụlọ ọrụ ahụ si kwuo, ịrị elu nri rịrị bụ mmụba/mbawanye nke ọnụahịa mmanụ na abụba, anụ, achịcha na ọka, nduku, ji, azụ na ihe ndị ọzọ kpatara ya.
