english: On a month-on-month basis, the food sub-index increased by 1.22% in August 2019, down by 0.04% points from 1.26% recorded in July 2019.
igbo: Site n'ọnwa-ọnwa, ihe-oriri na-abawanye site na 1.22% na Ọgọstụ 2019, gbadata 0.04% m, akara 1.26% e dere na July 2019.

english: Boris Johnson Wins Parliamentary Majority
igbo: Boris Johnson meriri na ndọrọndọrọ omeiwu

english: The exit poll spells disaster for the main opposition Labour Party, which was projected to win just 191 seats – its worst result since 1935.
igbo: Ntuli aka ọpụpụ na-ekpughe ọdachi maka ndị isi na-emegide Labour Party, nke a na-atụ anya nwere naanị oche 191 -rezọọtụ ya kacha njọ kemgbe 1935.

english: British Prime Minister, Boris Johnson, has won a parliamentary majority following an election to determine the next phase of Brexit.
igbo: Prime Minista British, Boris Johnson, emerila na ntuli aka omeiwu e mere iji kpebie usoro nke Brexit nke ọzọ.

english: According to Sky News and BBC on Friday, the results show that the Tories won 326 of the 650 seats in the lower House of Commons, meaning they could not be beaten.
igbo: Dịka Sky News na BBC si kwuo na Fraịde, rezọọtụ gosiri na Tories ji 326 merie n'ime oche 650 na 'Lower House of Commons', nke pụtara na a gaghị emeri ha.

english: Exit polls from Thursday's vote indicated they could win 368 seats.
igbo: Ntuli aka ọpụpụ si na vootu a tụrụ na Thursday gosipụtara na ha nwere ike merie oche 368.

english: If confirmed, this would be the party's biggest majority in three decades.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na ekwenyela, nke a ga-abụ ihe kachasị ukwuu na pati ahụ n'ime iri afọ atọ.

english: By contrast, the exit poll spells disaster for the main opposition Labour Party, which was projected to win just 191 seats – its worst result since 1935.
igbo: Site na ndị iche, ntuli aka ọpụpụ na-ekpughe ọdachi maka ndị isi na-emegide Labour Party, nke a na-atụ anya nwere naanị oche 191 -rezọọtụ ya kacha njọ kemgbe 1935.

english: On Friday, European leaders are expected to charge EU negotiator, Michel Barnier, with negotiating a close trade deal with Britain.
igbo: Na Fraịde, a na-atụ anya na ndị isi Europe ga-ebo onye mkparita ụka EU, Michel Barnier ebubo, isoro nkwekọrịta azụmahịa na Britain.

english: The News Agency of Nigeria explained that with a large majority of MPs, Johnson will be able to get the divorce deal he struck with Brussels through parliament in time to meet the next Brexit deadline of January 31.
igbo: Ndị mgbasa ozi 'News Agency of Nigeria' kọwara na e nwee ọtụtụ MP, Johnson ga-enwe ike ịnweta nkwekọrịta ịgba alụkwaghịm ya na Brussels site na nzuko omeiwu n'oge iji mezuo usoro njedebe nke Brexit na-abịa na Jenụwarị 31.

english: Borno Governor, Zulum, Assents To Bill To Regulate NGOs Activities In State
igbo: Gọvanọ ndị Bornu, Zulum, nyere ego iji mezie mmemme ndị NGO na steeti

english: Zulum said that the bill will empower the agency in the coordination of humanitarian agencies and development partners in the state.
igbo: Zulum kwuru na ego ahụ ga-eme ka ụlọ ọrụ ahụ nwee ike hazie ndị ọrụ enyemaka na ndị ọrụ mmepe steeti.

english: Borno State governor, Prof Babagana Zulum, has passed the state's Agency for Coordination of Development and Humanitarian Response bill into law to regulate the activities of Non-Governmental Organisations as well as development partners in the state.
igbo: Gọvanọ borno steeti, Prọfesọ Babagana Zulum, enyefeela iwu maka nchịkọba nke mmepe a kpọrọ 'Coordination of Development and Humanitarian Response bill' n'iwu iji mezie ihe ndị otu abụghị nke gọọmentị (NGOs) yana ndị mmepe na steeti ahụ.

english: Zulum said that the bill will empower the agency in the coordination of humanitarian agencies and development partners in the state.
igbo: Zulum kwuru na ego ahụ ga-eme ka ụlọ ọrụ ahụ nwee ike hazie ndị ọrụ enyemaka na ndị ọrụ mmepe steeti.

english: He said, 'We will review and approve a work plan of all humanitarian and development partners in the state.
igbo: O kwuru, 'Anyị ga-enyocha ma kwado atụmatụ ọrụ nke ndị ọrụ mmekọrịta niile na ndị ọrụ mmepe na steeti.

english: 'This will be in line with state government's stabilisation and recovery objectives across the 27 local government areas of the state.'
igbo: Nke a ga-aga n'usoro mmechi gọọmentị na ebumnuche mgbake gafee mpaghara ọchịchị iri abụọ na asaa nke steeti ahụ.

english: Earlier in his remarks, Speaker of Borno State House of Assembly, Abdulkarim Lawan, said that the bill will go a long way in assisting displaced persons through the coordination of humanitarian and developmental activities in the state.
igbo: N’okwu ya na mbụ, onyeisi oche nke Omeiwu nke steeti Borno, Abdulkarim Lawan, kwuru na 'bill' ahụ ga-aba nnukwu uru n’inyere ndị gbara ọsọ ndụ aka site na nhazi nke ọrụ mmadụ na mmepe na steeti ahụ.

english: Brazen Invasion Of Court By DSS And Lagos State Task Force: Suggestions For The Bar By Ebun-Olu Adegboruwa
igbo: Mwakpo ụlọikpe sitere na DSS na ndị 'Task Force' nke Lagos State: Aro maka ụlọ ikpe site n'aka Ebun-Olu Adegboruwa

english: Unless we act swiftly and urgently now, there seems to be more ahead in the coming days.
igbo: Beelụsọ ma anyị na-eme ngwa ngwa ugbu a, ọ dị ka a ga-enwe ọtụtụ ihe n'ọdịnihu.

english: I commend the leadership of the Nigerian Bar Association for its prompt response to the court invasion by the DSS.
igbo: Ana m aja ndị isi 'Nigerian Bar Association' mma maka ịzaghachi ngwa ngwa na mwakpo ndị DSS wakporo ụlọikpe.

english: The statement issued is very encouraging and timely indeed.
igbo: Nkwupụta e nyere na-agba ume ma na-abịa n'oge.

english: That is what is expected, given that the main objective of the NBA is to promote the rule of law.
igbo: Nke ahụ bụ ihe a na-atụ anya ya, n'ihi na ebumnuche 'NBA' bụ ịkwalite usoro iwu.

english: I suggest the following further steps:
igbo: M na-atụ aro n'usoro ndị ọzọ:

english: 1. A meeting with the CJN and AGF to consult on possible steps to be taken to protect judges and the courts from further invasion.
igbo: 1. CJN na AGF ga-ezukọ iji kpaa maka ụzọ a ga-eji chebe ndị ikpe na ụlọ ikpe pụọ na mwakpo ọzọ.

english: As it was happening in Abuja, so also was it happening in the Federal High Court in Lagos where it was reported that members of the Lagos State Environmental Task Force stormed the court and even stabbed an officer of the court.
igbo: Dịka ọ na-eme na Abuja, ọ bụkwa ihe na-eme n' ụlọ ikpe etiti dị elu 'Federal High Court' na Legoosụ ebe a na-akọ na ndị ọrụ na-ahụ maka Gburugburu ebe obibi na Lagos wakporo ụlọ ikpe ahụ ma sụọ onye ọrụ ikpe mma.

english: The purpose of this meeting is to secure the courts with a functional police post as is done in the National Assembly and even houses of assembly of the states.
igbo: Ebumnuche nke nzukọ a bụ iji mee ka e chekwaa ndị ụlọikpe na ụlọ ọrụ ndị uweojii dịka a na-eme n'ụlọ omebeiwu nke Naịjirịa (National Assembly) na nke steeti (State House of Assembly).

english: 2. To ensure that the DSS is made to account for the events of December 6, 2019.
igbo: 2. Iji hụ na ndị DSS nyere nkọwa ihe ndị mere na Disemba 6, 2019.

english: 3. To also meet with the leadership of the National Assembly, the committees on judiciary and human rights and law enforcement with a view to getting the DSS to be brought to book.
igbo: 3. Iji mee ka ndị ndu ndị omebe, ndị kọmitii na-ekpe ikpe na ụlọọrụ na-ahụ maka ikike mmadụ na mmanye iwu zukọọ iji mee ka e webata DSS n'akwụkwọ.

english: 4. To demand the immediate disengagement of the present leadership of the DSS and all its officers involved in the invasion.
igbo: 4. Ịchọ ka e wepụ ndị ndú ọrụ DSS ugbu a na ndị ọrụ ya niile tinye aka na mwakpo ahụ ozigbo.

english: 5. To meet with the AG of Lagos State to unravel the invasion of Lagos court and bring those involved to book.
igbo: 5. Isoro ndị AG nke Lagos Steeti wee mee nchọpụta maka mwakpo e mere n'ụlọ ikpe Lagos ma weta ndị ahụ kpara mkpamkpa a.

english: 6. To visit CJ of Federal High Court and Hon Justice Ijeoma Ojukwu for solidarity and consultations.
igbo: 6. Ịga leta CJ nke ụlọ ikpe ukwuu nke etiti na Hon Justice Ijeoma Ojukwu maka nkwekọrịta na nkwurita okwu.

english: Henceforth, let the NBA get its members involved in any government to be held accountable for any breach of the rule of law by the government and its officers and agencies.
igbo: Site ugbu a, ka ndị NBA mee ka ndị otu ya so na gọọmentị ọbụla ga-aza ajụjụ maka ịda iwu ọbụla nke gọọmentị na ndị ọrụ ya.

english: In any state where there is glaring disobedience of the order of court or brazen infraction of the constitution, the AG of that state should be referred to the LPDC and if he's a SAN, also to the LPPC.
igbo: Steeti ọbụla ebe e nwere nnupụisi n'iwu ụlọ ikpe maọbụ imebi iwu, a ga-eziga AG nke steeti ahụ na LPDC ma ọ bụrụ na ọ bụ onye SAN, a ga-ezigakwara LPPC.

english: The same should happen to the AGF when it involves the Federal Government and its agencies.
igbo: Otu ihe a kwesịrị ịdị na AGF mgbe ọ gbasara Gọọmentị etiti na ndị ọrụ ya.

english: Then the counsel involved in such cases for the government should be held accountable by the NBA and the bar generally and be suspended forthwith.
igbo: Mgbe ahụ, ndị ndụmọdụ kwésị́rị́ itinye ọnụ n'okwu ndị a maka gọọmentị kwèsị̀rị̀ ka ndị NBA nabata ma kwụsị ya ozigbo.

english: Unless we act swiftly and urgently now, there seems to be more ahead in the coming days.
igbo: Beelụsọ ma anyị na-eme ngwa ngwa ugbu a, ọ dị ka a ga-enwe ọtụtụ ihe n'ọdịnihu.

english: Ebun-Olu Adegboruwa, Senior Advocate of Nigeria
igbo: Ebun-Olu Adegboruwa, nnukwu ọka iwu nke Naịjirịa a kpọrọ 'Senior Advocate of Nigeria'

english: BREAKING: 763,603 Votes To 162,180 — Wike Takes Unassailable Lead Over Awara In Rivers
igbo: Nhụsianya: 763,603 vootu na 162,180 - Wike ji gafee Awara na Rivers

english: In Degema Local Government, Wike polled 12,133 votes to Awara's 5,071 votes.
igbo: N'okpuru ọchịchị Degema, Wike nwetara vootu 12,133 ebe Awara nwere 5,071.

english: In the 12 wards of Asari-Toru Local Government, he had 32,172 votes to Awara's 18,945; while in the 12 wards of Ogo/Bolo Local Government, he polled 11,855 votes to Awara's 814.
igbo: N'ime ngalaba iri na abụọ e nwere n'okpuru ọchịchị Asari-Toru, o nwere vootu 32,172 ebe Awara ji 18,945; na ngalaba iri na abụọ e nwere n'okpuru ọchịchị Ogo/Bolo, o ji vootu 11,855 ebe Awara nwere 814.

english: The surprise of the day was in the 17 wards of Obio/Akpor Local Government, where he polled an astounding 281,164 votes to Awara's 7,495.
igbo: Ihe ịtụnanya n'ụbọchị ahụ bụ na ngalaba iri na asaa dị n'okpuru ọchịchị Obio/Akpor, ebe o nwetara vootu 281,164 ebe Awara ji naanị vootu 7,495.

english: Nyesom Wike, Governor of Rivers State, has taken a potentially unassailable lead in the March 9 governorship election contest in the state.
igbo: Nyesom Wike, Gọvanọ nke Rivers steeti eburula ụzọ na asọmpi ntuli aka ọchịchị gọvanọ na March 9 na steeti ahụ.

english: As of Tuesday, when the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) announced results from 15 local government areas, Wike, candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), had polled 426,369 votes against 129,855 votes secured by Biokpomabo Awara of the African Action Congress.
igbo: Dịka na Tuesday, mgbe Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) kwupụtara rezọọtụ sitere n'okpuru ọchịchị iri na ise, Wike, onye ndọrọndọrọ nke People's Democratic Party (PDP), ji vootu 426,369 merie Biokpomabo Awara nke African Action Congress onye nwere vootu 129,855.

english: Leaving a margin of 296,514 votes.
igbo: Nke o ji oke vootu 296,514 gafee Awara.

english: This lead was further extend when the commission announced four more results on Wednesday.
igbo: Mmeri ahụ karịrị mgbe kọmitii ahụ kwupụtara rezọọtụ anọ ọzọ na Wednesde.

english: In Degema Local Government, Wike polled 12,133 votes to Awara's 5,071 votes.
igbo: N'okpuru ọchịchị Degema, Wike nwetara vootu 12,133 ebe Awara nwere 5,071.

english: In the 12 wards of Asari-Toru Local Government, he had 32,172 votes to Awara's 18,945;
igbo: N'ime ngalaba iri na abụọ e nwere n'okpuru ọchịchị Asari-Toru, o nwere vootu 32,172 ebe Awara ji 18,945;

english: While in the 12 wards of Ogo/Bolo Local Government, he polled 11,855 votes to Awara's 814.
igbo: Nna ngalaba iri na abụọ e nwere n'okpuru ọchịchị Ogo/Bolo, o ji vootu 11,855 ebe Awara nwere 814.

english: The surprise of the day was in the 17 wards of Obio/Akpor Local Government, where he polled an astounding 281,164 votes to Awara's 7,495.
igbo: Ihe ịtụnanya n'ụbọchị ahụ bụ na ngalaba iri na asaa dị n'okpuru ọchịchị Obio/Akpor, ebe o nwetara vootu 281,164 ebe Awara ji naanị vootu 7,495.

english: These results brought Wike's total so far to 763,603 votes while Awara has 162,180 — a margin of 601,423 votes.
igbo: Rezọọtụ ndị a wetara ngụkọta vootu Wike 763,603 ebe Awara nwere 162,180 - òkè nke ruru 601,423 vootu.

english: The on going collation was temporarily suspended, and is set to resume at 3pm.
igbo: A kwụsịtụrụ ngagharị iwe ahụ nwa oge, ọ ga-amalite n’elekere atọ nke ehihie.

english: There are only four local governments left to be announced.
igbo: E nwere naanị okpuru ọchịchị anọ fọdụrụnụ a ga-akpọpụta.

english: BREAKING: Adamawa Governor-Elect Fintiri Survives First Scare Hours After Defeating Bindow
igbo: Nhụsianya: Gọvanọ a họpụtara n' Adamawa, Fintiri gafere ka o merichara Bindo

english: Reverend Eric Theman, candidate of the party, had approached the court with the suit, claiming exclusion of the party's logo on the ballot paper.
igbo: Ụkọchukwu Eric Theman, onye ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị, ejirila mkpesa gaa n'ụlọ ikpe ahụ, na-ekwu na mwepụ akara ngosi pati ahụ na mpempe akwụkwọ vootu.

english: But Justice Abdulaziz Waziri ruled that Theman and MRDD had failed to prove their case, saying 'he who asserts must prove'.
igbo: Mana Justice Abdulaziz Waziri kpebiri na Theman na MRDD emeghị ihe ha kwuru, na-ekwu na 'onye kwuru okwu aghaghị igosipụta ya.'

english: Ahmadu Umaru Fintiri, Governor-Elect of Adamawa State, has survived the first attempt to have his governorship victory taken away from him — just hours after securing it.
igbo: Ahmadu Umaru Fintiri, Gọvanọ-ahọpụtara nke steeti Adamawa, gbanarịrị ọnwụnwa mbụ ka e wepụ ya n'ọchịchị gọvanọ ya - naanị mgbe awa ole na ole gachara.

english: To emerge victor in the Adamawa State governorship election, Fintiri had polled a total of 376,552 votes to beat Jibrilla Bindow, incumbent Governor and candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), who secured 336,386 votes.
igbo: Iji bụrụ onye mmeri na ntuli aka gọvanọ steeti Adamawa, Fintiri enwetala vootu 376,552 nke o ji merie Jibrilla Bindow, Gọvanọ steeti ahụ bụ onye nhọpụta nke All Progressives Congress (APC), onye nwetara vootu 336,386.

english: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) had declared him winner shortly before 1am on Friday.
igbo: Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) e kwuputala na ọ bụ onye tuuru ugo mgbe ọ fọdụrụ obere oge ka ọ kụọ elekere mbụ nke ụtụtụ na Fraide.

english: Hours later, the High Court sitting in Yola dismissed the case filed by the Movement for The Restoration and Defence of Democracy (MRDD) seeking the cancellation of the election and the ordering of a fresh one.
igbo: Mgbe awa ole na ole gachara, ụlọ ikpe ukwuu ahụ dị na Yola kagburu ikpe nke Movement for The Restoration and Defense of Democracy (MRDD) gbara, na-achọ ka a kagbuo ntuli aka ka a tụọ nke ọhụrụ.

english: Reverend Eric Theman, candidate of the party, had approached the court with the suit, claiming exclusion of the party's logo on the ballot paper.
igbo: Reverend Eric Theman, onye ndoro ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị, ejirila mkpesa bịakwute ụlọikpe ahụ, na-ekwu na mwepụ akara ngosi pati ahụ na mpempe akwụkwọ vootu.

english: But Justice Abdulaziz Waziri ruled that Theman and MRDD had failed to prove their case, saying 'he who asserts must prove'.
igbo: Mana Justice Abdulaziz Waziri kpebiri na Theman na MRDD emeghị ihe ha kwuru, na-ekwu 'onye na-ekwu okwu aghaghi igosiputa.'

english: Also on Friday, Kassim Gaidam, the Resident Electoral Commissioner (REC) in charge of Adamawa State, issued Governor-Elect Fintiri with a Certificate of Return.
igbo: Ọzọkwa na Fraịdee, Kassim Gaidam, onye na-ahụ maka ndị ọrụ maka ntụliaka (REC) na-elekọta steeti Adamawa, nyere Gọvanọ-Elect Fintiri akwụkwọ Asambodo nlọghachi.

english: Speaking at the occasion, which held at the INEC headquarters in Yola on Friday, Fintiri thanked the electorate for their confidence in him.
igbo: Na-ekwu okwu na nnọkọ ahụ, nke e mere na isi ụlọ ọrụ INEC dị na Yola na Fraịde, Fintiri kelere ndị nhọpụta ndị ọchịchị maka ntụkwasị obi ha nwere n’ebe ọ nọ.

english: BREAKING: AGF Takes Over Prosecution Of Sowore's Case After DSS Court Invasion
igbo: Akụkọ mgbanye: AGF weghaara ebubo nke ikpe nke Sowore mgbe mwakpo ụlọ ikpe DSS gasịrị

english: Malami said the action was part of deliberate efforts by the government to probe emerging issues related to the court invasion by the secret police.
igbo: Malami kwuru na ihe a bụ akụkụ nke mbọ gọọmentị na-agba iji chọpụta ihe ndị batara na ndị uwe ojii nzuzo wakporo ụlọikpe.

english: The students had molested Boluwatife after accusing her of calling them names and also speaking bad about their escapades on campus.
igbo: Ụmụakwụkwọ ahụ emetọla Boluwatife mgbe ha bochara ya ebubo ịkpọ ha aha ha ma na-ekwukwa okwu ọjọọ banyere ihe mgbapụ ha na mahadum.

english: The expulsion is sequel to the recommendation of an investigative panel which probed the incident that took place in a hostel on Saturday, November 16, 2019 and adjudged them culpable of gross misconduct and breach of the University Matriculation Oath.
igbo: Nchụpụ ahụ bụ ihe dị na nkwanye aka nke ndị ọrụ nyocha nke nyochapụtara ihe mere n'ụlọ nkwaliakụ na Satọde, Nọvemba 16, 2019 wee maa ha ikpe na ha na-emebi iwu nke nnabata Mahadum.

english: The expulsion is in line with the position of page 48 of the 2019/2020 students handbook which prescribes expulsion from the university for students who engage in physical assault or battery on another student outside the university premise,' spokesperson for the school, Mr Adegbenro Adebanjo, said in the statement.
igbo: Nchụpụ ahụ dabara n'ọnọdụ dị na peeji nke iri anọ na asatọ nke akwụkwọ ntuziaka ụmụakwụkwọ nke ogo 2019/2020 nke na-amachibido ịchụpụ ụmụakwụkwọ na mahadum bụ ndị na-awakpo ụmụakwụkwọ ọzọ na-abụghị n'ime mahadum,' Onye nkwuchite ọnụ ụlọakwụkwọ ahụ, Mr Adegbenro Adebanjo, kwuru na nkwupụta ahụ.'

english: JUST IN: Inspector-General of Police Suspends APC Rally In Edo
igbo: Onyeisi nlekọta ndị uweojii kwụsịtụrụ ọgbakọ ndị APC n'Edo

english: The IGP's letter suspending the rally was communicated to the deputy governor of the state, Mr Philip Shuaibu, about one hour ago.
igbo: Akwụkwọ ozi nke IGP banyere ịkwụsị ngagharị ahụ bụ nke a gwara onye na-esote gọvanọ steeti ahụ, Mazị Philip Shuaibu, ihe dịka otu awa gara aga.

english: IGP Mohammed Adamu
igbo: IGP Mohammed Adamu

english: Inspector-General of Police, Mohammed Adamu, has suspended the rally of a faction of the All Progressives Congress scheduled for Benin, Edo State, on Friday.
igbo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii, Mohammed Adamu, amachibidola nnọkọ nke otu All Progressives Congress nke a ga-eme na Benin, Edo Steeti, na Fraịde.

english: The faction is loyal to the National Chairman of the party, Adams Oshiomhole, PUNCH reports.The IGP's letter suspending the rally was communicated to the deputy governor of the state, Mr Philip Shuaibu, about one hour ago.
igbo: Ngalaba ahụ na-akwado onyeisi oche otu ahụ, Adams Oshiomhole, akwụkwọ akụkọ PUNCH kpesara. Akwụkwọ ozi IGP na-egbochi ngagharị ahụ bụ nke a gwara osote gọvanọ steeti ahụ, Mazị Philip Shuaibu, ihe dịka otu awa gara aga.

english: JUST IN: Nigeria Comes From Behind To Defeat Benin Republic In AFCON Qualifiers
igbo: Nigeria sitere n'azụ bịa imeri Benin Republic na AFCON

english: Victory was eventually sealed in the 63rd minute when Samuel Kalu fired Nigeria in front.
igbo: E mechara nweta mmeri na nkeji 63 mgbe Samuel Kalu gbagburu ndị Naịjiria.

english: The Super Eagles of Nigeria, the country's national men's football team, on Wednesday evening came from behind to defeat the Squirrels of Benin Republic 2-1 at the Godswill Akpabio Stadium, Uyo, Akwa Ibom, in an African Cup of Nations qualification match.
igbo: Ndị Super Eagles nke Naịjiria, ndị Super Eagles nke Nigeria, ndị egwuregwu bọọlụ ụmụnwoke nke mba ahụ, na mgbede Wenezdee si n'azụ merie Squirrels nke Benin Republic 2-1 na Godswill Akpabio Stadium, Uyo, Akwa Ibom, n'asọmpi iko mba Africa.

english: The visitors took the lead in the third minute through Stephane Sessegnon to send shivers down the spine of spectators inside the packed stadium.
igbo: Ndị ọbịa ahụ butere ụzọ n'ime nkeji nke atọ site na mgbe Stephane Sessegnon tinyere egwu n'ime ndị na-elere egwuregwu nọ n'ama egwuregwu.

english: But in the 45th minute, in-form Lille of France striker, Victor Osimhen, restored parity from the penalty spot.
igbo: Mana na nkeji nke iri anọ na ise, onye egwu bọọlụ Lille nke France, Victor Osimhen sara ọkpụ ahụ/mere ka ha hara nha.

english: Victory was eventually sealed in the 63rd minute when Samuel Kalu fired Nigeria in front.
igbo: E mechara nweta mmeri na nkeji 63 mgbe Samuel Kalu gbagburu ndị Naịjiria.

english: The result sees Nigeria leading the log in Group L after Sierra Leone and Lesotho panned out a 1-1 in the other match of the group.
igbo: Rezọọtụ ahụ na-egosi na Naịjirịa na-edu na 'Group L' mgbe Sierra Leone na Lesotho gbara 1-1 n’egwuregwu ọzọ nke otu ahụ.

english: JUST IN: Nigeria Hits Highest Inflation Rate In Eight Months
igbo: Naịjiria ruru ọnụego kacha elu n'ọnwa asatọ

english: According to the consumer price index, which measures inflation, their is an increase of 0.37 per cent between the rate in September and October.
igbo: Dịka ntinye ọnụahịa nke ndị ahịa dị, nke e ji atụle ọnụego, e nwere mbawanye pasenti 0.37 n'etiti ọnụego ahụ na Septemba na Ọktọba.

english: Nigeria's inflation rate has risen to its highest in eight months by hitting 11.61 per cent, data released by the National Bureau of Statistics revealed.
igbo: Ọnụ ego Naịjiria eruola ebe kasị elu n'ọnwa asatọ site n' iru pacenti 11.16, 'data' sitere na 'National Bureau of Statistics' kpughere

english: According to the consumer price index, which measures inflation, their is an increase of 0.37 per cent between the rate in September and October.
igbo: Dịka ntinye ọnụahịa nke ndị ahịa dị, nke e ji atụle ọnụego, e nwere mbawanye pasenti 0.37 n'etiti ọnụego ahụ na Septemba na Ọktọba.

english: On a month-on-month basis, the headline index increased by 1.07 per cent in October 2019, or 0.03 percentage points higher than the rate recorded in September 2019.
igbo: N'ọnwa n'ọnwa, isiakụkọ ji pasent 1.07 rịa elu n'Ọktoba 2019, maọbụ pasenti 0.03 dị elu karịa ọnụego e dere na Septemba 2019.

english: The percentage change in the average composite CPI for the 12 months period ending October 2019 over the average of the CPI for the previous 12 months period was 11.30 per cent, showing 0.03 percentage point increase from 11.27 per cent recorded in September 2019.
igbo: Mgbanwe pasenti na nkezi ihe mejupụtara CPI maka ọnwa iri na abụọ nke na-akwụsị n'Ọktoba 2019 gafere nkezi nke CPI maka ọnwa iri na abụọ gara aga bụ pasenti 11.30, na-egosi pasenti 0.03 na-abawanye site na pasenti 11.27 nke e dere na Septemba 2019.

english: The urban inflation rate stood at 12.20 per cent (year-on-year) in October 2019 from 11.78 per cent recorded in September 2019, while the rural inflation rate was recorded at 11.07 per cent in October 2019 from 10.77 per cent in September 2019.
igbo: Ọnụego nke obodo mepere emepe guzooro na pasenti 12.20 (kwa afọ) n'Ọktoba 2019 site na pasenti 11.78 e dere na Septemba 2019, ebe e dere na ọnụego ime obodo dị pasenti 11.07 n'Ọktoba 2019 site na pasenti 10.77 na Septemba 2019.

english: Kano Govt To Pay N30m As Dowry For 1,500 Brides
igbo: Gọọmenti Kano ga-akwụ nde naịra iri atọ dịka ụgwọ isi ụmụagbọghọ otu puku na narị ise.

english: A complete set of cushion chairs would also be given to each and every couple, which includes three-seater chairs and other side chairs. Window blinds and plastic carpets will also be provided.
igbo: A ga-enye di na nwunye ọbụla oche zuru ezu, nke gụnyere oche mmadụ atọ ga-anọ na ya na oche ndị ọzọ. A ga-enyekwa ihe e ji emechi windo na kapeetị.

english: Abba Anwar, the Chief Press Secretary to Abdullahi Ganduje, Governor of Kano State, says the state government would pay N30million as dowry for 1,500 brides during a mass wedding scheduled for Sunday.
igbo: Abba Anwar, onyeisi ndị nta akụkọ mgbasa ozi nye Abdullahi Ganduje, Gọvanọ nke steeti Kano, kwuru na gọọmentị steeti ahụ ga-akwụ nde naịra iri atọ dịka ụgwọ isi nwaanyị mmadụ otu puku na narị ise n'oge agbamakwụkwọ a ga-eme na Sọnde.

english: In a statement issued on Saturday, Anwar said the government has concluded arrangements to conduct mass wedding for 1,500 prospective couples across the 44 Local Government Areas of the state.
igbo: Na nkwupụta e nyere na Satọde, Anwar kwuru na gọọmentị e kwubiela ịgba di na nwunye dị otu puku na narị ise akwụkwọ na mpaghara iri anọ na anọ nke steeti ahụ.

english: Anwar said the couples passed through different stages of screening before they got to the final wedding stage.
igbo: Anwar kwuru na di na nwunye ndị ahụ gafere nyocha dị iche iche tupu ha e ruo ogo ikpeazụ nke agbamakwụkwọ.

english: He said N20,000 would be given by the state government as dowry for every bride, amounting to N30million.
igbo: O kwuru na gọọmentị steeti ga-enye puku naịra iri abụọ dịka ụgwọ isi nwaanyị ọbụla, nke pụtara nde naịra iri atọ.

english: He said: 'While dowry would be paid, it is also part of the magnanimous engagement by the state government that complete sets of beds, side mirrors, wardrobes and mattresses would all be provided for each couple.
igbo: O kwuru sị: “Dịka a ga-akwụ ụgwọ ego nwaanyị, ọ bụkwa otu n'ime ihe ndị gọọmentị steeti ahụ haziri na a ga-ewetara di na nwunye ọbụla àkwà, enyo na ebe a na-ekonye ákwà (wọdrobu).

english: 'A complete set of cushion chairs would also be given to each and every couple, which includes three-seater chairs and other side chairs. Window blinds and plastic carpets will also be provided.
igbo: A ga-enye di na nwunye ọbụla oche zuru ezu, nke gụnyere oche mmadụ atọ ga-anọ na ya na oche ndị ọzọ. A ga-enyekwa ihe e ji emechi windo na kapeetị.

english: 'New clothing materials, popularly called 'Shadda' would be provided for all the would-be husbands, so that they can appear as happily wedded grooms, showcasing their happiness to families, friends and well wishers.'
igbo: A ga-enye ndị niile ga-abụ di ákwà/uwe ọhụrụ, nke a na-akpọ 'Shadda', ka ha wee na-enwe obi aṅụrị/ụtọ ma ha na-apụta dịka ndị lụrụ nwaanyị ọhụrụ, na-egosi obi aṅụrị/ụtọ ha nyere ndị ezinaụlọ ha, ndị enyi na ndị na-echere ha ezi echiche.

english: Anwar said it was the hope of the government that what is provided for the couples would go a long way in serving as relief for them after the marriage.
igbo: Anwar kwuru na olileanya gọọmentị bụ na ihe e nyere di na nwunye ndị ahụ ga-abara ha uru mgbe ha lụchara.

english: In 2018, the state government set up a 23-member committee on state-sponsored mass wedding, under the leadership of Professor Sani Zaharaddeen.
igbo: N'afọ 2018, gọọmentị steeti hiwere kọmitii mmadụ iri abụọ na atọ gbasara ọtụtụ agbamakwụkwọ (mass wedding) nke steeti ahụ, n’okpuru ọchịchị Prọfesọ Sani Zaharaddeen.

english: Kebbi Most Expensive State To Buy Food In Nigeria -Report
igbo: Kebbi, steeti kachasị ọnụ ịzụta nri na Naịjiria-Mkpesa

english: The urban inflation rate increased by 11.48 percent (year-on-year) in August 2019 from 11.43 percent recorded in July 2019, while the rural inflation rate increased by 10.61 percent in August 2019 from 10.64
igbo: Ọnụego nke obodo mepere emepe ji pasenti 11.48 bawanye (kwa afọ) n'Ọgọstụ 2019 site na pasenti 11.43 e dere na Julaị 2019, ebe e dere na ọnụego ime obodo ji pasenti 10.61 bawanye n'Ọgọstụ 2019 site na pasenti 10.64.

english: Data released by the National Bureau of Statistics on Tuesday indicated that Kebbi State was the costliest state in Nigeria to have a meal in August 2019.
igbo: Data nke 'National Bureau of Statistics' wepụtara na Tuzdee gosipụtara na Kebbi Steeti bụ steeti kachasị ọnụ na Naịjiria iji rie nri n'Ọgọstụ 2019.

english: The bureau noted that figures for the month under review did not account for the effect of the border closure, as it happened 11 days to the end of the period.
igbo: Ụlọ ọrụ ahụ (Bureau) kwuru na ọnụọgụgụ maka ọnwa a na-enyocha adịghị emetụta mmechi e mechiri ókèala, dịka o mere ụbọchị iri na otu ruo na njedebe nke oge a.

english: In August 2019, food inflation on a year on year basis was highest in Kebbi (17.20%), Kano (16.08%) and Adamawa (15.95%), while Bayelsa (10.22%), Katsina (9.64%) and Kogi (8.97%) recorded the slowest rise,' the report stated.
igbo: “N’ọnwa Ọgọstụ 2019, ọnụego nri n’afọ n’afọ bụ nke kacha elu na Kebbi (17.20%), Kano (16.08%) na Adamawa (15.95%), ebe Bayelsa (10.22%), Katsina (9.64%) na Kogi (8.97) ka e dere jiri nwayọọ bilie, akwụkwọ akụkọ kwuru.

english: Overall, Kebbi state was also the most expensive part of the country, as the cost of goods and services increased by 14.97 percent.
igbo: Na mkpokọta, steeti Kebbi bụkwa mpaghara kacha dị ọnụ n'ala maka na ọnụahịa nke ngwaahịa na ọrụ ji pasenti 14.97 bawanye.

english: In August 2019, all items inflation on year on year basis was highest in Kebbi (14.97%), Kano (13.24%) and Bauchi (13.00%), while Cross River (8.97%), Delta (8.63%) and Kwara (8.32%) recorded the slowest rise in headline Year on Year inflation,' the report observed.
igbo: N’ọnwa Ọgọstị 2019, ọnụego ihe niile n’afọ n’afọ bụ nke kacha elu na Kebbi (14.97%), Kano (13.24%) na Bauchi (13.00%), ebe Cross River (8.97%), Delta (8.63%) na Kwara (8.82%) bụ nke e dere ji nwayọọ rịa/mụba n'ọnụego afọ”, akụkọ ahụ kwuru.

english: All across the country, the rate at which the price of goods and services rose, reduced by six base points from 11.08 percent in July to 11.02 percent in August,' it said.
igbo: Gburugburu mba niile ahụ, etu ọnụego ngwa ahịa si bilie belatara site na pasenti 11.08 na Julaị ruo pasenti 11.02 n'Ọgọstụ, o kwuru.

english: The NBS report added, 'This was influenced by the reduction in the percentage increase of edibles, which soared by 13.17 percent in August as against 13.39 percent in July.
igbo: Akụkọ NBS gbakwụnyere, 'Nke a metụtara mbelata nke mbawanye pasent ihe oriri, nke gbagoro pasenti 13.17 n'Ọgọstụ dịka ọ dị iche na pasenti 13.39 e nwere na Julaị.

english: In August, it was only the rate of increase in the price of goods and services in urban areas that increased, when compared with July.
igbo: N'Ọgọstụ, ọ bụ naanị ọnụego nke ọnụahịa na ọrụ n'obodo mepere emepe mụbara, ma e jiri ya tụnyere Julaị.'

english: 'The urban inflation rate increased by 11.48 percent (year-on-year) in August 2019 from 11.43 percent recorded in July 2019, while the rural inflation rate increased by 10.61 percent in August 2019 from 10.64 percent in July 2019.'
igbo: Ọnụego nke obodo mepere emepe ji pasenti 11.48 bawanye (kwa afọ) n'Ọgọstụ 2019 site na pasenti 11.43 e dere na Julaị 2019, ebe e dere na ọnụego ime obodo ji pasenti 10.61 bawanye n'Ọgọstụ 2019 site na pasenti 10.64 na Julaị 2019.

english: Lagos Government Begins Demolition Of Distressed Buildings
igbo: Gọọmentị Legoosụ amalitela nkwatu ụlọ adịghị mma.

english: Oke-Osanyintolu said that not less than five distressed buildings in the state had been demolished.
igbo: Oke-Osanyintolu kwuru na ihe erughi ụlọ ise na steeti ahụ bụ nke a kwaturu.

english: The Lagos State Government has said it has begun the demolition of distressed buildings in the state.
igbo: Gọọmentị Lagos steeti ekwuola na ọ malitere ịkwatusi ụlọ ndị adịghị mma/esighi ike na steeti ahụ.

english: Director-General, Lagos State Emergency Management Agency, Dr Olufemi Oke-Osanyintolu, said this in an interview with the News Agency of Nigeria.
igbo: Onyeisi na-elekọta ngalaba 'Lagos State Emergency Management Agency', Dr Olufemi Oke-Osanyintolu kwuru nke a na n'ajụjụ ọnụ ya na ndị 'News Agency' nke Naịjiria nwere.

english: Oke-Osanyintolu said that not less than five distressed buildings in the state had been demolished.
igbo: Oke-Osanyintolu kwuru na ihe erughi ụlọ ise adịghị mma na steeti ahụ bụ nke a kwaturu.

english: According to him, before the agency carried out the exercise, the Lagos State Building Control Agency, Material Testing Agency and Ministry of Urban and Physical Planning had made recommendations to the government.
igbo: Dị ka o si kwuo, tupu ụlọọrụ ahụ e mezuo ihe ọmụmụ ahụ, ndị ụlọọrụ a kpọrọ 'Lagos State Building Control Agency', 'Material Testing Agency' na Ministry of Urban and Physical Planning' enyela gọọmentị nkwanye.

english: He said, 'The Ministry's recommendations are necessary to carry out stress tests to ascertain the integrity of the buildings.
igbo: kwuru, 'Nkwanye nke Mịnịstrị ahụ dị mkpa iji mee nyocha ma chọpụta iguzosi ike nke ụlọ ndị a.

english: 'After thorough investigations, the ministry agreed that the houses should be taken to ground zero.
igbo: Mgbe e nyochachara nke ọma, Mịnịstrị ahụ kwetere na-aga akwatu ụlọ ndị ahụ.

english: 'Consequently, residents of the buildings were advised to vacate the premises within five days for their safety.'
igbo: 'N'ihi ya, a dụrụ ndị bi n'ụlọ ndị ahụ ọdụ ka ha kwapụ ebe ahụ n'ime mkpụrụ ụbọchị ise maka nchekwa ha.'

english: LAUTECH Lecturers Begin Strike Over Non-payment Of Salaries
igbo: Ndị nkuzi LAUTECH na-amalite ịgba abụbọ ọrụ maka akwụghị ụgwọ ọrụ.

english: The Academic Staff Union of Universities of the institution recently issued a 10-day ultimatum, which lapsed last Friday.
igbo: Ndị Ọrụ mmụta nke Mahadum ahụ nyere ikike mkpụrụ ụbọchị iri, nke kwụsịrị Fraịde gara aga.

english: Lecturers of the Ladoke Akintola University of Technology, Oyo State, on Monday began total boycott of classrooms following the failure of the governments of Oyo and Osun states to pay their three-month salary arrears.
igbo: Ndị nkuzi nke mahadum Ladoke Akintola University of Technology, nke Oyo, na Mọnde jụrụ ịga klaasị kuzi ihe n'ihi enweghị ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ọnwa atọ ndị gọọmentị nke Oyo na Osun Steeti ji.

english: The Academic Staff Union of Universities of the institution recently issued a 10-day ultimatum, which lapsed last Friday.
igbo: Ndị Ọrụ mmụta nke Mahadum ahụ nyere ikike mkpụrụ ụbọchị iri, nke kwụsịrị Fraịde gara aga.

english: The lecturers decision was contained in a congress resolution jointly signed by the chairman, Dr Biodun Olaniran, and Secretary, Dr Toyin Abegunrin.
igbo: Mkpebi ndị nkuzi a dị na nzụkọ nke onyeisi oche, Dr Biodun Olaniran na odeakwụkwọ, Dr Toyin Abegunrin binyere aka.

english: The university teachers also threatened to withhold the results of 2018/2019 academic session until their salaries were paid.
igbo: Ndị nkuzi mahadum ahụ yikwara egwu igbochi rezọọtụ nke agụmakwụkwọ 2018/2019 ruo mgbe a kwụrụ ha ụgwọ ọnwa ha.

english: Lebron James Abandons California Mansion As Wildfire Ravages City
igbo: Lebron James hapụrụ California Mansion dị ka Wildfire mebiri obodo.

english: The NBA superstar took to Twitter to write about having to leave home suddenly with his family and looking for where to stay.
igbo: Na 'Twitter', onye 'superstar' NBA dere banyere ya na ezinaụlọ ya ịhapụ ụlọ ya na mberede, na-achọ ebe ọ ga-anọ.

english: Basketball legend, Lebron James, was forced to evacuate his home on Monday after wildfires raged just blocks away from his Brentwood, California mansion.
igbo: Ọ̀tụ́ bọọlụ aka, Lebron James ka a manyere ịpụ n'ụlọ ya na Mọnde ka ọkụ ọgbụgba malitere na mgbochi ụlọ ya dị na Brentwood, California.

english: The NBA superstar took to Twitter to write about having to leave home suddenly with his family and looking for where to stay.
igbo: Na 'Twitter', onye 'superstar' NBA dere banyere ya na ezinaụlọ ya ịhapụ ụlọ ya na mberede, na-achọ ebe ọ ga-anọ.

english: He said, 'Man these LA (fires) aren't no joke. Had to evacuate my house and I've been driving around with my family trying to get rooms.'
igbo: Ọ sịrị, 'Nwoke, ọkụ a abụghị ihe egwuregwu. A pụrụ m n'ụlọ m, mụ na ezinaụlọ m na-agagharị na-agbakwa mbọ inweta ụlọ.”

english: He later tweeted that he was able to find a safe place for his family.
igbo: O mechara dee na 'twitter' na ọ chọtara ebe nchekwa nke ezinaụlọ ya.

english: LIVE: Adamawa State Supplementary Governorship Election
igbo: Nke na-eme ozigbo: Ntuli aka mgbakwụnye ọchịchị nke steeti Adamawa

english: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) conducts a rerun in the 44 polling units where results of the March 9 governorship election in Adamawa State were cancelled.
igbo: Independent National Electoral Commission' (INEC) na-eme nhazị na ngalaba ntuli aka iri anọ na anọ ebe a kagburu rezọọtụ ntuli aka ọchịchị nke March 9 na Adamawa State.

english: LIVE: Collation Of Rivers Governorship Election Results
igbo: Nke na-eme ozigbo: Mkpokọ rezọọtụ ntuli aka gọvanọ nke Rivers

english: Finally, the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) proceeds with collation of results of the Rivers State governorship election held on March 9.
igbo: N'ikpeazụ, Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) gara n'ihu ikpokọta rezọọtụ nke ntuli aka gọvanọ Rivers steeti e mere na March 9.

english: LIVE FROM EAGLE SQUARE, ABUJA: President Buhari's Second Term Inauguration
igbo: Nke na-eme ozigbo site na 'Eagles Square', Abuja: Mmalite ọchịchị nke ugboro abụọ onyeisi ala bụ Buhari.

english: SaharaReporters is live at Eagle Square, Abuja for the second term inauguration of President Muhammadu Buhari and Vice-President Yemi Osinbajo.
igbo: Ndị 'SaharaReporters' nọ ugbu a na 'Eagles Square', Abuja maka mmalite ọchịchị ugboro abụọ nke onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari na osote ya bụ Yemi Osinbajo.

english: President Muhammadu Buhari Inspects Parade As His Biography Is Read Out
igbo: Onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari na-enyocha ijenlemanya (parade) ka a na-agụ akụkọ ya

english: 21 Gun Salute Is About To Commence, Onlookers Are Advised Not To Panic
igbo: Ọnụ egbe iri abụọ na otu iji kele ya ga-amalite ịda, a dụrụ ndị na-ele anya ọdụ ka ha ghara ịtụ ụjọ

english: Aisha Buhari, Wife Of President Muhammadu Buhari And Fierce Critic Of His Administration Looking Grumpy As President Muhammadu Buhari Is Sworn In For A Second Term.
igbo: Aisha Buhari, nwunye onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari na nnukwu onye nkatọ nke ọchịchị ya dị̀ kà onye iwe na-ewe dị́kà a na-edu onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari n'iyi ọrụ nke ugboro abụọ.

english: President Muhammadu Buhari Invited To Take The Oat Of Office
igbo: Akpọọla onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari ịṅụ iyi ọrụ.

english: Acting CJN Tanko About To Administer Oat Of Office
igbo: Onye na-arụ dịka CJN nwa mgbe nta, Tanko na-achọ idu n'iyi ọrụ

english: Vice President Yemi Osinbajo Arrives Eagle Square
igbo: Osote onyeisi ala, Yemi Osinbajo rutere Eagle Square

english: LIVE: INEC Announces Winner Of Adamawa Supplementary Governorship Election
igbo: Nke na-eme ozigbo: INEC akpọpụtara onye mmeri nke ntuli aka mgbakwụnye ọchịchị nke Adamawa

english: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) begins the announcement of results of the Adamawa State supplementary governorship election, culminating in the declaration of a winner for the Adamawa State governorship election.
igbo: Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) na-amalite m ịkpọpụ rezọọtụ ntuli aka mgbakwụnye ọchịchị gọvanọ steeti Adamawa, na-ekwupụta onye mmeri maka ntuli aka gọvanọ steeti Adamawa.

english: Liverpool, Barcelona, Juventus Record Remarkable Wins As Arsenal's Misery Continues
igbo: Liverpool, Barcelona, ​​Juventus na-enweta ihe mmeri dị egwu ka ahụhụ Arsenal na - aga n'ihu

english: For example, in the widely followed English Premier League, table toppers – Liverpool – fought a resilient Crystal Palace team to walk away 2-1 winners at the end of 90 minutes to keep their title hopes alive.
igbo: Ọmụmaatụ, na mgbaso nke 'English Premier League' na-agbaso, ndị nke mbụ n'egwuregwu - Liverpool - lụrụ ọgụ na mgba ma were ọkpụ abụọ a sara naanị otu merie ndị Crystal Palace na njedebe nkeji iri itoolu iji nọgidesi ike n'ọkwa ha.

english: In major European football league matches played on Saturday, spectators and viewers around the world including in Nigeria were treated to all sorts of experience – good, bad and ugly.
igbo: N'egwuregwu European bọọlụ a na-eme na Satọde, ndị na-ekiri bọọlụ gburugburu ụwa gụnyere na Naịjiria bụ ndị e ji ụdị ahụmịhe niile - ihe ọma, ihe ọjọọ na nke jọrọ njọ were mesoo.

english: For example, in the widely followed English Premier League, table toppers – Liverpool – fought a resilient Crystal Palace team to walk away 2-1 winners at the end of 90 minutes to keep their title hopes alive.
igbo: Ọmụmaatụ, na mgbaso nke 'English Premier League' na-agbaso, ndị nke mbụ n'egwuregwu - Liverpool - lụrụ ọgụ na mgba ma were ọkpụ abụọ a sara naanị otu merie ndị Crystal Palace na njedebe nkeji iri itoolu iji nọgidesi ike n'ọkwa ha.

english: Goals from Sadio Mane and Roberto Firmino delivered the maximum points for Jurgen Klopp' side after Wilfried Zaha had scored an equaliser late in the second half.
igbo: Ọkpọ sitere n'aka Sadio Mane na Roberto Firmino nyere ndị Jurgen Klopp ogo kachasị elu mgbe Wilfried Zaha sachara n'ọkara nke abụọ.

english: In other parts of England, Leicester City where Nigeria's Wilfred Ndidi is an integral member of the team, thrashed Brighton & Hove Albion 2-0 courtesy of goals from Ayoze Perez and Jamie Vardy.
igbo: N’akụkụ ndị ọzọ nke England, Leicester City, ebe Wilfred Ndidi nke Naịjiria bụ onye otu ahụ, ji ọkpụ abụọ a sara otu merie Brighton & Hove Albion nke sitere n’aka Ayoze Perez na Jamie Vardy.

english: But it was a different story for Arsenal Football Club of London as their troubles on the pitch continued on Saturday after they were held to a draw at home by Southampton.
igbo: Mana ọ bụ akụkọ dị iche nyéré ndị Arsenal Football Club nke London ka nsogbu ha gara n'ihu n'ámá egwuregwu na Satọde mgbe ha na ndị Southampton e nyeghị onwe ha ọkpụ ka ha (Southampton) bịara be ha.

english: The result could have been worse for Unai Emery's side had the visitors converted all their chances inside the 18-yard box.
igbo: Rezọọtụ ahụ nwere ike ịka njọ n'akụkụ Unai Emery ma ọ bụrụ na ndị ọbịa ahụ gbanwere ohere ha niile n'ime '18-yard'.

english: It took the artistry of Alexandre Lacazette late in extra-time to score the equalising goal for Arsenal and grab a point for them.
igbo: O were Alexandre Lacazette oge iji gosi nkà ya n'obere oge e nyere iji mee ka ndị Arsenal sàá ọkpụ e nyere ha ma nweta akara.

english: Following the team's poor performance in recent times, Emery had come under intense pressure with many of the fans already losing faith in him and his ability to deliver long-awaited success after the departure of Arsene Wenger last season.
igbo: Ísò arụmọrụ adịghị mma nke otu ahụ n'oge ndị na-adịbeghị anya, Emery bụ onye a na-akwagide ebe ọtụtụ n'ime ndị na-eto ya enweghi okwukwe na ya na ikike ya iji mee nke ọma kemgbe Arsene Wenger pụrụchara.

english: In Spain and Italy, Barcelona and Juventus both ground out important wins away from home against Laganes and Atalanta respectively despite strong resistance from their opponents.
igbo: Na Spain na Italy, Barcelona na Juventus nwetara mmeri na mba ọzọ ebe ha meriri Laganes na Atalanta n'otu n'otu n'agbanyeghị nguzosi ike sitere n'aka ndị ha meriri.

english: Goals from Luis Suarez and Arturo Vidal gave Barcelona a 2-1 win over the host team while a double from Gonzalo Higuain and one from Paulo Dybala saw Juventus come from behind to emerge victorious.
igbo: Ọkpụ sitere n'aka Luis Suarez na Arturo Vidal mere ka Barcelona jiri ọkpụ abụọ a sara otu (2-1) merie ndị otu egwuregwu ahụ ha gbara bọọlụ na be ha, ebe ọkpụ abụọ sitere n'aka Gonzalo Higuain na otu ọkpụ si n'aka Paulo Dybala mere ka ndị Juventus si n'azụ nweta mmeri.

english: Most top sides in Europe's biggest football leagues were all busy on Saturday as a result of the resumption of the Champions League and Europa League between Tuesday and Thursday.
igbo: Ọtụtụ otu egwuregwu bọọlụ kachasị na Europe niile enweghị oghere na Satọdee n'ihi mmalite nke Champions League na European League dị n'etiti Tuzdee na Tọzdee.

english: Magu Urges Corps Members To Shun Fraud
igbo: Magu na-agba ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ume ka ha zeere wayo

english: Magu said rather than engaging in criminal activities that will always lead to regret, youths should focus on building a beautiful future and corrupt-free Nigeria
igbo: Magu kwuru kama itinye aka na mpụ ndị ga-eduga n'ịkwa ụta, ndị ntorobịa kwesịrị ilekwasị anya n'iwuli ọdịnihu dị mma na Naịjiria nke na-enweghị nrụrụ aka.

english: Acting Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, Ibrahim Magu, has urged National Youth Service Corps members to shun acts of corruption especially cybercrime.
igbo: Onye na-arụ ka onyeisi oche Kọmitii na-ahụ maka ego na mmefu ego (Economic and Financial Crimes Commission), Ibrahim Magu, agbaala ndị otu ntorobịa ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ume ka ha zeere omume nrụrụ aka ọkachasị mpụ saịba 'cyber'.

english: Magu made the call on Tuesday at the Lagos State NYSC Orientation camp, Iyana Ipaja, during a sensitisation lecture.
igbo: Magu kpọrọ oku ahụ na Tuzdee na kampụ ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha (NYSC) dị n'Iyana Ipaja, Legoosụ steeti, n'oge okwu nkuzi.

english: Represented by Public Affairs Director, Lagos Office, Dolapo Adeniran, Magu said rather than engaging in criminal activities that will always lead to regret, youths should focus on building a beautiful future and corrupt-free Nigeria by upholding hard work, integrity and discipline.
igbo: Onye nọchiri anya ya bụ onye nlekọta ọha na eze n'ụlọ ọrụ dị na Legoosụ, Dolapo. Magu agbaala ndị otu ntorobịa ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ume ka ha zeere omume nrụrụ aka ọkachasị mpụ saịba 'cyber'site n'ịkwado ọrụ siri ike, iguzosi ike n'ezi ihe na ịdọ aka ná ntị.

english: Man Who Staged Wedding Without Reception Reveals How He Convinced Family To Support Idea
igbo: Nwoke nke gbara akwụkwọ n’akpọghị oriri na-ekpughe otu o siri kwenye ezinaụlọ iji kwado echiche

english: Speaking with SaharaReporters on Tuesday, Yusuf, said that the decision was one of the biggest he ever took in his life.
igbo: Mgbe ya na ndị SaharaReporters na-ekwu okwu na Tuzdee, Yusuf kwuru na mkpebi a bụ otu n'ime ihe kachasị ukwuu o kpebiri na ndụ ya.

english: A new groom, Adewale Yusuf, who recently shocked many Nigerians by indicating on his wedding invitation card that there would be no reception after the ceremony, has told SaharaReporters that it took him only two calls to convince his parents and other family members to buy into his idea.
igbo: Nwa okorobịa lụrụ nwunye ọhụrụ, Adewale Yusuf, onye nke tinyere ndị Naịjiria ụjọ site n’igosi na kaadị agbamakwụkwọ na a gaghị akpọ oriri mgbe e mechara emume a, agwala SaharaReporters na o were ya oku abụọ iji mee ka nne na nna ya na ndị ọzọ n’eme ka ha nabata echiche ya.

english: Though he said it was initially tough to persuade his bride, Blessing, to support the concept, he eventually won her over after a few debates on the issue.
igbo: N’agbanyeghi na o kwuru na o siiri ya ike ịkwagide nwunye ya bụ, Blessing, ikwado echiche a, o mechara merie ya mgbe ha rụchara ụka gbasara okwu a.

english: The new couple trended last weekend on the social media with many Nigerians applauding and also bashing their decision not to hold a reception for their guests.
igbo: Di na nwunye ọhụrụ a bụ ndị wuru ewu na ngwụcha izuụka gara aga na soshal midia ebe ọtụtụ ndị Naịjiria na-etiri ha mkpu ma na-agbagha mkpebi ha ịghara ịkpọ ndị ọbịa ha oriri.

english: Speaking with SaharaReporters on Tuesday, Yusuf, said that the decision was one of the biggest he ever took in his life.
igbo: Mgbe ya na ndị SaharaReporters na-ekwu okwu na Tuzdee, Yusuf kwuru na mkpebi a bụ otu n'ime ihe kachasị ukwuu o kpebiri na ndụ ya.

english: He said, 'When I first informed my parents of the idea not to have a reception after my wedding ceremony, they dropped the call on me.
igbo: O kwuru, sị, “Mgbe mbụ m gwara ndị mụrụ m na agaghị akpọ oriri ọbụla mgbe m gachara akwụkwọ, ha kwụsịrị oku ahụ.

english: Eventually, it took me about two more calls to be able to convince them to support my idea.
igbo: “N’ikpeazụ, ọ were m ihe ugboro abụọ ọzọ iji mee ka ha kweta ịkwado echiche m.

english: The truth is that I'm a man of my words. I'm a different person, I am not a loud type.
igbo: Eziokwu bụ na abụ m nwoke na-akwụ n'okwu m. A dị m iche, abụghị m onye a na-anụ olu ya.

english: Many people around me did not like the idea initially but I made sure to let them see reasons with me.
igbo: “Ọtụtụ ndị nọ m nso enweghị mmasị n'echiche ahụ na mbụ mana a gbara m mbọ mee ka ha mata ihe kpatara ya.'

english: At the end of the day, everyone appreciated my idea.'
igbo: 'Na ngwụsị ụbọchị ahụ, onye ọbụla ji echiche m kpọrọ ihe.”

english: But despite not staging a reception at their wedding, Yusuf told SaharaReporters that many of their guests didn't return home without having something to eat.
igbo: Mana n'agbanyeghị na ọ kpọghị oriri n'agbamakwụkwọ ha, Yusuf gwara SaharaReporters na ọtụtụ n'ime ndị ọ kpọrọ alaghị be ha n'enweghị ihe ha riri.

english: He added, 'We shared food for the few friends we invited. I made sure my friends that came from Ibadan went back that day.
igbo: Ọ gbakwụnyere, “Anyị nyere ndị enyi ole na ole anyị kpọrọ nri. A gbara mbọ hụ na ndị enyi m si Ibadan laghachiri n’ụbọchị ahụ.

english: 'One thing people should know is that there is nothing they want that they can't do as long as it makes them happy and fulfilled.
igbo: “Otu ihe ndị mmadụ kwesịrị ịma bụ na ọ nweghị ihe ha chọrọ ha agaghị emeli ma ọ bụrụhaala na ọ na-eme ha obi ụtọ.'

english: 'Having a loud reception after the wedding ceremony was unnecessary as far as I was concerned.'
igbo: 'Ịkpọ oriri dara ụda mgbe a gbachara akwụkwọ ekwesighi, ka m si chee.”

english: Mercy Becomes First Female To Win BBNaija
igbo: Mercy bụ nwaanyị mbụ nwetara mmeri BBNaija

english: Over 50 million Nigerians participated in the voting process that cost at least N30 per text message.
igbo: Ihe karịrị ndị Naịjiria nde iri ise sonyere na ntuli aka ịtụ vootu nke na-éwè opekata mpe naịra iri atọ kwa ederede ọbụla.

english: Mercy Eke, 26, made history on Saturday by becoming the first female to win BBNaija reality television show.
igbo: Mercy Eke, 26, wuru ewu na Satọdee site na ịghọ nwaanyị mbụ meriri n'ihe nkiri BBNaija.

english: Eke defeated Mike in the final round of the contest, walking away with the coveted prize of N30m cash, N25m Sports Utility Vehicle, a trip for two to Dubai among other things.
igbo: Eke meriri Mike na ngwụcha asọmpi ahụ, were ego dị nde naịra iri atọ, nde naịra iri abụọ na ise maka ụgbọala a kpọrọ 'Sports Utility Vehicle', njem nke abụọ ịga Dubai na ihe ndị ọzọ.

english: Frodd, Omatshola and Seyi Awolowo were the other contestants that made it into the top five.
igbo: Frodd, Omatshola na Seyi Awolowo bụ ndị ọzọ so sọọ mpi ma turu ugo na mmadụ ise kachasị elu.

english: Over 50 million Nigerians participated in the voting process that cost at least N30 per text message.
igbo: Ihe karịrị ndị Naịjiria nde iri ise sonyere na ntuli aka ịtụ vootu nke na-éwè opekata mpe naịra iri atọ kwa ederede ọbụla.

english: Eke's victory brings to end the three-month long widely followed show.
igbo: Mmeri nke Eke wetara njedebe ihe nkiri a gbasoro ọnwa atọ.

english: Ministerial Clutching At Straws By Barnabas Igho
igbo: Ịchọpụta olileanya nke ndị Mịnịsta nke sitere n’aka Banabas Igho

english: For now, let him know that his take-off was very bad and turbulent and everything boils down to his poor piloting skills, and not the army of imaginary saboteurs and enemies his aides are busy conjuring up for him.
igbo: Ka ọ dị ugbu a, mee ka ọ mata na nṅomi ya bụ ihe ọjọọ ma bụrụkwa ọgbaghara na ihe niile gbadara n'ihe banyere ikike ya na ọ bụghị ndị ụgha ndị echiche ha adịghị mma na ndị iro na-enyere ya aka

english: If you are supervising an important ministry like that of communication even without the recent fancy addition of 'digital economy' to its name, and you still need a spokesperson to pen almost 2,000 words of polemics in order to project your image, then your self-inflicted trouble is just starting in my reckoning.
igbo: Ma ọ bụrụ na ị na-elekọta ụlọ ọrụ Mịnịstrị dị mkpa dịka nke nkwukọrịta, ọbụlagodi mgbe agbakwunyeghi 'akụ na ụba dijitaalụ' n'aha ya, ị ka ga-achọkwa onye na-ekwuchite ọnụ ga-edetu ihe dịka okwu puku abụọ iji gosipụta ihe oyiyi gị, mgbe ahụ, nsogbu gị na-amalite n'ikpe m ga-ekpe.

english: Before her latest outburst in the media, thoughtlessly blaming imaginary saboteurs for trying to stop her 'unstoppable boss', Uwa Suleman had issued a disconcerting diatribe in form of a press release, accusing all critical stakeholders of the ministry her principal supervises including the media, of ganging up against him because he was the 'best thing' that happened to the industry since its liberalisation in the year 2000.
igbo: Tupu óké iwe ya na mgbasa ozi, na-ata ụta n'echiche echeghị maka ịgbalị ịkwụsị 'onyeisi nchịkwa ya', Uwa Suleman ewepụtala ekwumekwu na-akatọ mmadụ n'ụdị mgbasa ozi, na-ebo ndị ụlọọrụ Mịnịstrị ahụ gụnyere ndị mgbasa ozi, banyere ịkpa nkata megide ya n'ihi na ọ bụ 'ihe kachasị mma' nke meere ụlọọrụ ahụ kemgbe ọnụnọ ya n'afọ 2000.

english: This prompted ripostes of some respected columnists like Mr Sanya Oni of The Nation newspaper, who eloquently summed up the minister's tragedy as a case of exaggerated notion of the office that he occupies as 'he obviously didn't think that his remit stops at formulating and implementing policies for the digital economy; as he wants to play the regulator'.
igbo: Nke a kpaliri ọsịsa ụfọdụ ndị ntaakụkọ dịka Maazị Sanya Oni nke akwụkwọ akụkọ 'The Nation', onye chịkọtara ọdachi ahụ dakwasịrị mịnịsta ahụ dịka banyere ikwubiga okwu ókè banyere ọrụ ọ na-arụ dịka 'o doro anya na o cheghị na ọrụ ya kwụsịrị na nhazi na mmejupụta atụmatụ maka akụ na ụba dijitalụ; dịka ọ chọrọ ịrụ ka onye nhazi”.

english: Since his assuming office in August this year, Mr Pantami has indeed found it difficult to adjust from the regulatory role he used to enjoy at National Information Technology Development Agency to his new titular position as per regulating the industry is concerned, and his unconstitutional attempts to dabble into it has invited the resistance of major actors in the industry like Association of Licensed Telecoms Operators of Nigeria as well as that of the Association of Telecoms Companies of Nigeria.
igbo: Kemgbe ọ malitere ọkwá n'ọnwa Ọgọst afọ a, Maazị Pantami achọpụtala na o siri ike ịgbanwe ọrụ nchịkwa o jibu n'ụlọ ọrụ 'National Information Technology Development Agency' na ọkwa ọhụrụ ya, na ịgba mbọ ya o sonyere nke ịkpọ oku nguzogide nke ndị isi ụlọ ọrụ ahụ dịka 'Association of Licensed Telecoms Operators of Nigeria' yana nke 'Association of Telecoms of Nigeria.'

english: Coming back to Uwa's latest invectives however, there are some fundamental half-truths she raised in her slay-queen styled article, like ridiculous claim that South Africa and other countries are busy copying and pasting the minister's example of his failed data price reduction directive.
igbo: Na-alaghachi na okwu ọjọọ Uwa kwuru, e nwere ụfọdụ eziokwu nke o welitere n'edemede ya, dịka mkparị na-ekwu na South Africa na mba ndị ọzọ nọ na-arụsi ọrụ ike iwere ihe ịmaatụ nke minista ahụ banyere mbenata ọnụahịa 'data'.

english: While this, to say the least, is very disrespectful to the authorities in South Africa, who have never impliedly referred to Nigeria in taking their decisions, it's obviously not the actual representation of the truth of the matter.
igbo: Ebe nke a, akwanyeghị ndị ọchịchị nọ na South Africa ugwu, bụ ndị ezigabeghị Naịjiria na mkpebi ha, o doro anya na ọ bụghị ihe nnọchite nke eziokwu okwu ahụ.

english: Someone should wake Uwa up and hand over a mug of coffee to her together with the contrasting news of India's example that hiked data prices to as much as 40 per cent.
igbo: Mmadụ kwesịrị ịkpọte Uwa ma nyefee ya iko kọfị ma kọọ akụkọ dị iche iche banyere etu ndị India si mee ka ọnụ ahịa ruo pasenti iri anọ.

english: We don't know how this is ignored as a copy and pasting of what the policy of the man she obsequiously describes in ludicrous adjectives that late Idi Amin of Uganda would have rejected.
igbo: Anyị amataghị etu e si leghara nke a anya ma gosipụta ihe iwu banyere nwoke ọ kọwara n'ụzọ ọjọọ na Idi Amin nke Uganda gaara ịjụ.

english: To cut the story short, India used to enjoy the cheapest data in the world, but the industry could no longer sustain it without risking losing in further investment to support the telecom infrastructure in the country.
igbo: Iji bie akụkọ a nkenke, India na-enwebu 'data' adịbughị ọnụ n'ụwa, mana ụlọ ọrụ ahụ enweghị ike ịkwado ya na-etinyekwughi ego iji kwado akụrụngwa telecom na mba ahụ.

english: This still happened within the 21-day coincidence Uwa claimed to have provided the copy and paste effect in South Africa.
igbo: Nke a ka mere n'ime mkpụrụ ụbọchị iri abụọ na otu Uwa kwuru na ọ nyere nwepụghachi mpụtara na South Africa.

english: Still, what Uwa hasn't told us was that South Africa used to be among the top three in terms of the cost of data and even with 50 per cent reduction, it wouldn't come down to the level of Nigeria despite the fact that the challenges the telcos face and cost of production in Nigeria are clearly on a different scale.
igbo: N'agbanyeghị nke ahụ, ihe Uwa agwabeghị anyị bụ na South Africa na-anọkarị n'etiti ndị atọ kachasị elu n'ihe gbasara ọnụahịa 'data' yana n'agbanyeghị mbelata pasenti iri ise, ọ gaghị agbadata n'ọkwa nke Naịjiria n'agbanyeghị ihe ịma aka chere 'telcos' ihu na ọnụahịa mmepụta na Naịjirịa dị iche.

english: Even on the strength of TheCable report that Pantami quoted in the past, it put Nigeria and South Africa, with the average of $2.22 and $7.19 per 1GB respectively.
igbo: N'agbanyeghị akụkọ ndị otu 'Cable' nke kwuru na Pantami n'oge gara aga, tinyere Naịjiria na South Africa, were nwee ihe nkezi $2.22 na $7.19 kwa 1GB n'otu n'otu.

english: And one can forgive Uwa for her poor grasp of the issue as she embarrassingly attributed the directive in South Africa to the country's telecom regulator, while a little search on Google on the matter would have told her that the decision emanated from South Africa Competition Regulatory Authority, not the Independent Communications Authority of South Africa and the decision must have been scientifically based, not jejune subjective populist directive.
igbo: Mmadụ pụrụ ịgbaghara Uwa maka amaghị ihe na ihe ọmụma a dị na South Africa dị n’aka onyeisi ndị 'telecom', ebe obere ihe ọchịchọ n’igwe 'Google' banyere okwu a gaala agwa ya na mkpebi a sitere n'iwu asọmpi nke South Africa a kpọrọ 'South Africa Competition Regulatory Authority', na ọ bụghị Independent Communications Authority of South Africa na mkpebi ahụ kwesiri idabere na sayensị.

english: But such kinds of faux pas are understandable as Uwa and co in the new mandate are trying to learn the rope.
igbo: Mana ụdị ọnọdụ a ka a ga-aghọta dị ka Uwa na ndị ọzọ n'iwu ọhụrụ ahụ na-anwa ịmụta ya.

english: And they should be reminded of the fact that before their arrival on the scene, the industry had already matured.
igbo: Ha kwesiri ka e chetara ha na tupu ha abịa ebe a, ndị ọrụ ahụ adịrịla.

english: There were over 70 million Nigerians on the high-speed Internet, millions of active subscriber base as well as numerous sensational story in the industry, which has been on this sustained trajectory for long.
igbo: E nwere ihe karịrị nde ndị Naịjirịa iri asaa nọ n'ịntaneetị, ọtụtụ nde ndị na-edebanye aha na ọtụtụ akụkọ n'ụlọ ọrụ ahụ, bụ nke nọworo na-adigide ogologo oge a.

english: Hence, accusing both the providers and regulator of connivance is not only reckless but cheap as both the stakeholders collaboratively built the industry from the scratch.
igbo: N'ihi ya, ibo ma ndị na-eweta ya na ndị na-achịkwa nkwekọrịta abụghị naanị ihe enweghị isi kama ọ dị ọnụ ala ebe ndị ọrụ mpaghara ahụ rụkọtara ọrụ ọnụ wee rụpụta ụlọ ọrụ ahụ.

english: Some years ago, we saw how the regulator, NCC fined a major MNO over N1trn. Pray what kind of compromised regulator would dare?
igbo: Afọ ụfọdụ gara aga, anyị hụrụ ka onyeisi nchịkwa, NCC siri daa nnukwu onye MNO nha ihe karịrị N1trn. Kedu ụdị onye nchịkwa nke ga-eme ya.

english: It's not too late for the minister however, to curb himself of this seduction to 'populism' and court the important stakeholders of the ministry by beginning to put the cart before the horse – addressing industry issues – if he wants to succeed.
igbo: Oge agabeghị minista a igbochi onwe ya n'ụdị ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị a ma rịọ ndị ọrụ ozi dị mkpa n'ụlọ ọrụ ahụ - na-akọwa okwu metụtara ụlọ ọrụ a - ma ọ bụrụ na ọ chọrọ ime nke ọma.

english: Omobola Johnson was very effective as a minster because she fully understood the job and how to manage a delicate industry like telecommunications.
igbo: Omobola Johnson gbara ezigbo mbọ dịka onye mịnịsta n’ihi na ọ ghọtara ọrụ ahụ nke ọma yana otu esi ejikwa ụlọ ọrụ dịka nke telekọmunikeshọn.

english: If Mr Pantami wants to succeed, he needs all the regulators and operators on his side, and he can't achieve that by constantly pitching them against the consumers thereby making his narcissistic self-good and everybody that has contributed to the development of the industry bad.
igbo: Ọ bụrụ na Maazị Pantami chọrọ ime nke ọma, o nwee ndị niile na-ahụ maka nchịkwa na ndị na-arụ ọrụ n'akụkụ ya, ọ gaghị enwe ike imezu nke ahụ site n'imegide ha n'ebe ndị na-azụ ahịa nọ si otu ahụ na-eme ka a hụ ya dịka onye dị mma ebe onye ọbụla n'ụlọ ọrụ ahụ bụ onye ọjọọ.

english: For now, let him know that his take-off was very bad and turbulent and everything boils down to his poor piloting skills, and not the army of imaginary saboteurs and enemies his aides are busy conjuring up for him.
igbo: Ka ọ dị ugbu a, mee ka ọ mata na nṅomi ya bụ ihe ọjọọ ma bụrụkwa ọgbaghara na ihe niile gbadara n'ihe banyere ikike ya na ọ bụghị ndị ụgha ndị echiche ha adịghị mma na ndị iro na-enyere ya aka

english: Igho, a telecoms engineer cum public affairs analyst, writes from Lagos.
igbo: Igho, onye injinia ndị 'telecoms' yana onye nyocha ihe gbasara ọha na eze, si na Legoosụ dee.
