igbo: Ọ bụrụ na Maazị Pantami chọrọ ime nke ọma, o nwee ndị niile na-ahụ maka nchịkwa na ndị na-arụ ọrụ n'akụkụ ya, ọ gaghị enwe ike imezu nke ahụ site n'imegide ha n'ebe ndị na-azụ ahịa nọ si otu ahụ na-eme ka a hụ ya dịka onye dị mma ebe onye ọbụla n'ụlọ ọrụ ahụ bụ onye ọjọọ.

english: For now, let him know that his take-off was very bad and turbulent and everything boils down to his poor piloting skills, and not the army of imaginary saboteurs and enemies his aides are busy conjuring up for him.
igbo: Ka ọ dị ugbu a, mee ka ọ mata na nṅomi ya bụ ihe ọjọọ ma bụrụkwa ọgbaghara na ihe niile gbadara n'ihe banyere ikike ya na ọ bụghị ndị ụgha ndị echiche ha adịghị mma na ndị iro na-enyere ya aka

english: Igho, a telecoms engineer cum public affairs analyst, writes from Lagos.
igbo: Igho, onye injinia ndị 'telecoms' yana onye nyocha ihe gbasara ọha na eze, si na Legoosụ dee.

english: Mob Sets Suspected Ritualist Ablaze In Delta
igbo: Ìgwè mmadụ agbaala onye a na-enyo enyo dịka onye ọgwụ ego ọkụ na Delta.

english: The man was caught with a human skull and other items in his possession.
igbo: A nwụchiri nwoke ahụ ebe o ji okpokoro isi mmadụ na ihe ndị ọzọ.

english: There was pandemonium on Thursday at the Otokutu Bridge in Ughelli South Local Government Area of Delta State following the arrest of a middle-aged man suspected to be a ritualist.
igbo: E nwere ọgbaghara na Tọzdee n'àkwà mmiri Otokutu dị n'okpuru ọchịchị Ughelli South nke Delta State mgbe e jidere otu nwoke katagoro ahụ a na-enyo enyo na ọ bụ onye ọgwụ ego.

english: The man was caught with a human skull and other items in his possession.
igbo: A nwụchiri nwoke ahụ ebe o ji okpokoro isi mmadụ na ihe ndị ọzọ.

english: The suspected ritualist, who was said to have been caught by the vigilante group in the area, was set ablaze by an angry mob few minutes after his arrest.
igbo: Nwoke ahụ a na-enyo enyo na-agwọ ọgwụ ego, bụ onye e kwuru na ìgwè ndị nche jidere na mpaghara ahụ, bụ onye ndị mmadụ iwe na-ewe mụrụ ọkụ obere oge e jidere ya.

english: The incident, it was learnt, caused gridlock on the popular DSC Expressway as commuters and vehicle owners making use of that route spent several hours on top of the bridge.
igbo: Ihe ahụ merenụ, dịka a nụrụ, mere ka ọtụtụ ụgbọala dị n'okporo ụzọ DSC dịka ndị na-eme njem na ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala na-agba ụzọ ahụ nọrọ ọtụtụ awa n’elu àkwà ahụ.

english: Narrating the incident to our correspondent, a lady who witnessed the scenario, said the suspect had been acting like a deranged person around the bridge for the past months before he was discovered on Thursday when he tried to attack a motorcycle rider.
igbo: Nwaanyị nọ ka ihe mere na-akọwara onye nta akụkọ anyị ihe mere, kwuru na onye a na-enyo enyo na-eme dị ka onye isi mebiri na akụkụ àkwà ahụ ọnwa ole na ole tupu a chọpụta ya na Tọzdee mgbe ọ nwara ịwakpo onye na-agba ọgba tumtum.

english: The woman said, 'The ritualist who has been pretending to be a mad man for several months was about to attack and kill an Okada man who went close to the Otokutu Bridge when he was discovered.
igbo: Nwanyị ahụ kwuru, 'Onye ahụ na-agwọ ọgwụ ego nke mere ka ọ na-agba ara kemgbe ọtụtụ ọnwa na-achọ ịwakpo ma gbuo nwoke ọgba tumtum nke gara nso n'Osimiri Otokutu mgbe a chọpụtara ya. '

english: 'But as God will have it, the Okada rider escaped from the ritualist and he went to town and informed youths in the area.
igbo: “Mana dị ka Chukwu siri chọọ ya, onye ọgba tumtum gbanarịrị onye ọgwụ ego ahụ, ọ gara n'obodo ma kọọrọ ndị ntorobịa nọ n'ógbè ahụ.

english: On getting to the place, the mob saw the mad man making a call with a phone and upon sighting the people, he immediately threw the phone into a nearby river. The youths and the vigilante conducted a search and a human skull suspected to be that of a lady and other handsets were found with him.
igbo: Mgbe e rutere ebe ahụ, igwe mmadụ ahụ hụrụ nwoke onye ara ahụ ka o ji ekwentị akpọ oku ma mgbe ọ hụrụ ndị mmadụ, ọ tụbara ekwentị ozigbo n'otu osimiri dị nso. Ndị ntorobịa na ndị nche mere nyocha ma hụ okpokoro isi mmadụ nke e chere na ọ bụ nke nwanyị na ụfọdụ ekwentị ọzọ ka a hụrụ.

english: 'Upon questioning him, he confessed to belonging to a notorious ritualist gang but declined to give more details and at this point, a mob poured him fuel and set him ablaze.'
igbo: Mgbe a na-agba ya ajụjụ ọnụ, o kwupụtara na o so n'ótù òtù ndị ọgwụ ego a ma ama ma ọ jụrụ ịkọwapụta nke ọma, ndị mmadụ nọ ebe ahụ wụ̀rụ̀ ya mmanụ e ji ányà ụgbọala ma mụnye ya ọkụ.

english: It was gathered that despite the presence of policemen at the scene, the mob succeeded in setting ablaze the suspected ritualist.'
igbo: E nwetara ozi na n'agbanyeghị na ndị uweojii nọ n'ebe ahụ, ìgwè mmadụ ahụ gara n'ihi mụnye onye ahụ a na-enyo enyo na ọ bụ onye ọgwụ ego ọkụ.”

english: Calls and messages to the spokesperson for the police in the state, Onome Onovwakpoyeya, were not responded to.
igbo: Oku na ozi e zigaara onye nkwuchite ọnụ ndị uwe ojii na steeti ahụ, Onome Onovwakpoyeya, bụ nke azaghị ha.

english: Monkey Chants, Racist Abuse Make Players Abandon English FA Match
igbo: Mkparị ndị isi ojii n'aka ndị isi ọcha, mkpagbu ịkpa oke agbụrụ na-eme ka ndị egwuregwu hapụ egwuregwu English FA.

english: The incident during the match in the fourth qualifying round came just five days after England players endured racist abuse during their Euro 2020 qualifier against Bulgaria in Sofia.
igbo: Ihe ahụ mere n'oge egwuregwu ahụ n'agba nke anọ bịara naanị ụbọchị ise ka ndị egwuregwu England dìrì mkpagbu ịkpa oke agbụrụ n'oge egwuregwu Euro 2020 ha na ndị Bulgaria gbara na Sofia.

english: An FA Cup qualifying match between Haringey Borough and Yeovil Town was abandoned on Saturday after allegations that players were racially abused and spat on.
igbo: Egwuregwu isonye n'iko FA dị n'etiti Haringey Borough na Yeovil Town bụ nke a hapụrụ na Satọdee mgbe e boro ndị na-agba bọọlụ ebubo megide agbụrụ ha.

english: The players of seventh-tier outfit Haringey walked off the field with about 25 minutes to go, shortly after Yeovil had scored a penalty.
igbo: Ndị egwuregwu bọọlụ nke Haringey pụrụ n'ámá egwuregwu ka egwuregwu ahụ fọrọ ihe dịka nkeji iri abụọ na ise ka ọ kwụsị, obere oge Yeovil gbachara 'penalty' ma nye ọkpụ.

english: The incident during the match in the fourth qualifying round came just five days after England players endured racist abuse during their Euro 2020 qualifier against Bulgaria in Sofia.
igbo: Ihe ahụ mere n'oge egwuregwu ahụ n'agba nke anọ bịara naanị ụbọchị ise ka ndị egwuregwu England dìrì mkpagbu ịkpa oke agbụrụ n'oge egwuregwu Euro 2020 ha na ndị Bulgaria gbara na Sofia.

english: Haringey manager Tom Loizou said defender Coby Rowe suffered racial abuse while Cameroonian goalkeeper Douglas Pajetat was also spat at, prompting him to take his players off the pitch.
igbo: Onye njikwa Haringey, Tom Loizou kwuru na onye na-agbachi bọọlụ Coby Rowe tara ahụhụ maka mkpagbu/mkparị agbụrụ ebe onye Cameroon, Douglas Pajetat ka a gbụrụ asọ, na-akpali ya ịkpọpụta ndị egwuregwu ya n'ámá egwuregwu ahụ.

english: 'Early into the second half, we got a corner and a couple of the players said to me there was monkey chants,' Loizou told Sky News.
igbo: Lotizou gwara Sky News, 'N'oge a batara n'ọkara nke abụọ, anyị nwetara ịgba kọna 'corner', ụfọdụ n'ime ndị egwuregwu gwara m na e nwere mkparị ndị isi ojii site n'aka ndị isi ọcha.'

english: 'We got over that, we carried on playing. They got a penalty and my goalkeeper was spat at and had missiles thrown at him.
igbo: Anyị meriri nke ahụ, anyị gara n'ihu n'egwuregwu. Ha nwetara ịgba 'penalty' ebe onye na-echere m bọọlụ bụ onye a gbụrụ asọ ma tụọkwa ya ihe.

english: 'The referee halted the game briefly, they scored the penalty, one of players went to pick the ball out of the back of the net and Coby Rowe was racially abused.'
igbo: Onye na-egbu bọọlụ ahụ kwụsịrị egwuregwu ahụ obere oge, ha gbanyere ya n'ụgbụ, otu n'ime ndị egwuregwu gara ịtụtụrụ bọọlụ ahụ n'azụ ụgbụ ahụ ma a kparịrị Coby Rowe.

english: Loizou said he had to take his players off.
igbo: Loizou kwuru na ọ ghapụrụ ndị egwuregwu ya.

english: 'I looked at a couple of our players' faces and I was distraught myself, just to see their faces.
igbo: “Ahụrụ m ihu ndị egwuregwu anyị ụfọdụ, ọ na-ewutekwa m, naanị ịhụ ihu ha.

english: I gave it a couple of minutes and I went on the pitch and pulled my players off,' he said.
igbo: Enyere m ya nkeji ole na ole ma m gara n'ámá egwuregwu ahụ ma dọkpụrụ ndị egwuregwu m,' o kwuru.

english: 'There was no way that two or three of those players could have continued playing.
igbo: “O nweghị ụzọ mmadụ abụọ maọbụ atọ ga-esi gaa n'ihu na-egwu egwu.

english: What they heard was disgusting, they looked frightened.
igbo: Ihe ha nụrụ bụ ihe arụ, ha na-atụ ụjọ.

english: 'I can't sit down and watch young players being abused by a minority.'
igbo: 'Enweghị m ike ịnọdụ ala na-ele ebe ndị dị nta na-emegbu na-eto eto.”

english: Rowe later posted on Twitter: 'Can't believe I'm tweeting this and it's 2019 but today I was a victim of racism, in what was supposed to be a great day for @HaringeyBoroFC.
igbo: Rowe mechara zipu ozi na Twitter: 'Ekweghị na m ga-ede na tweeter, nke a bụ 2019 mana taa a bụụrụ m onye a na-akpagbu n'ihi agbụrụ, n'ihe ga-abụ nnukwu ụbọchị maka @HaringeyBoroFC.

english: Another game of football ruined by racists.'
igbo: Ndị na-akpa ókè agbụrụ emebiela egwuregwu bọọlụ ọzọ.”

english: Anti-discrimination charity Kick It Out praised the 'swift and decisive action' taken by Loizou and his players.
igbo: Ndị ọrụ na-egbochi ikpa oke ebere 'Kick It Out' toro “mkpebi ngwa ngwa na nke siri ike” nke Loizou na ndị egwuregwu ya wetaea.

english: The FA said it was looking into the incident 'as a matter of urgency'.
igbo: Ndị FA kwuru na ọ na-eleba anya na ihe a merenụ 'dịka ọ dị oke mkpa'.

english: In a statement, Yeovil said: 'We are aware that there are allegations that racist comments were made in the crowd and this allegation will be a key part of any investigation.
igbo: Na nkwupụta, Yeovil kwuru, “Anyị maara na e nwere ebubo na e kwuru okwu ịkpa ókè agbụrụ n'igwe mmadụ ma ebubo a ga-abụ ihe dị mkpa na nyocha ọbụla.

english: 'Irrespective of the outcome of any investigations, we would like to make it clear that the club will not accept racism or discrimination in any form.'
igbo: 'Agbanyeghị mepụtara nyocha ọbụla, anyị ga-achọ ịme ka o doo anya na otu klọb ahụ agaghị anabata ịkpa ókè agbụrụ maọbụ ịkpa ókè n'ụzọ ọbụla.

english: England players endured monkey chants and apparent Nazi salutes in Bulgaria.
igbo: Ndị egwuregwu England nagidere nkatọ ahụ na ekele nke Nazi na Bulgaria.

english: That match was stopped twice as England players made their feelings known to UEFA officials before the tie was eventually completed.
igbo: A kwụsịrị egwuregwu ahụ ugboro abụọ ka ndị egwuregwu England mere ka ndị ọrụ UEFA mara obi ha tupu emechaa ihe niile.

english: Aston Villa's Tyrone Mings, who made his international debut that night and was singled out by the Bulgarian crowd, applauded Haringey for 'taking a stance' against racism.
igbo: Teone Mings nke Aston Villa, gbara bọọlụ mbụ ya n'abalị ahụ, ìgwè ndị Bulgarian wepụtara ya, kụọlọ Haringey aka maka ikwu uche ya megide ịkpa ókè agbụrụ.

english: 'Sometimes it can get brushed off in lower leagues but everyone stands with you,' he tweeted. 'Our country isn't perfect either.'
igbo: “Mgbe ụfọdụ, ọ nwere ike sie ike n'obere egwuregwu mana onye ọbụla nọnywere gị,” ọ dere na tweeter. 'Ala anyị ezughịkwa òkè.'

english: Mourinho Named New Spurs Coach After Pochettino Sacking
igbo: Mourinho kpọrọ aha onye nkuzi ndị New Spurs ka a chụchara Pochettino

english: Mourinho, who has had successful spells at Real Madrid, Chelsea and Manchester United in recent times, replaces Mauricio Pochettino, who was sacked on Tuesday by the club.
igbo: Mourinho, onye mere nke ọma na Real Madrid, Chelsea na Manchester United n'oge na-adịbeghị anya, nọchiri anya Mauricio Pochettino, onye otu egwuregwu bọọlụ ahụ chụrụ na Tuesday.

english: Portuguese tactician, Jose Mourinho, has been named the new head coach of Tottenham Hotspurs.
igbo: Onye Portuguese, Jose Mourinho ka a kpọrọ dịka onyeisi ọhụụ nke Tottenham Hotspurs.

english: Mourinho, who has had successful spells at Real Madrid, Chelsea and Manchester United in recent times, replaces Mauricio Pochettino, who was sacked on Tuesday by the club.
igbo: Mourinho, onye mere nke ọma na Real Madrid, Chelsea na Manchester United n'oge na-adịbeghị anya, nọchiri anya Mauricio Pochettino, onye otu egwuregwu bọọlụ ahụ chụrụ na Tuesday.

english: The English Premiership side has had a slow start to the 2019/2020 season despite finishing second in the UEFA Champions League in May. FLASH: Jose Mourinho Appointed As The New @SpursOfficial Head Coach— Sahara Reporters (@SaharaReporters) November 20, 2019
igbo: Asọmpi a kpọrọ 'English Premiership' ji nwayọọ malite oge 2019/2020 n'agbanyeghị na ọ gbara nke abụọ na 'UEFA Champions League' na Mee. A họpụtara Jose Mourinho dịka onyeisi nkuzi ọhụụ nke @SpursOfficial Nọvemba 20, 2019.

english: Jose Mourinho Appointed As The New @SpursOfficial Head Coach
igbo: A họpụtara Jose Mourinho dịka onyeisi nkuzi ọhụụ nke @SpursOfficial

english: The team currently sit on 14th position on the Premier League table, 11 points behind the top four.
igbo: Otu ahụ nọ n'ọnọdụ nke iri na anọ ugbu a na Premier League, akara iri na otu n'azụ ndị nke anọ.

english: After his appointment, an elated Mourinho said, 'I am excited to be joining a club with such a great heritage and such passionate supporters.
igbo: Mgbe a họpụtara ya, onye ozi nke Mourinho kwuru, 'Obi dị m ụtọ isonye na otu egwu bọọlụ nwere nnukwu ihe nketa na ndị nkwado a.'

english: The quality in both the squad and the academy excites me.
igbo: 'Agwa ndị otu egwuregwu ahụ na ndị agụmakwụkwọ nwere masịrị m.

english: Working with these players is what has attracted me.'
igbo: Isoro ndị egwuregwu a na-arụ ọrụ bụ ihe dọtara mmasị m'.

english: Spurs faces West Ham this weekend and Mourinho is expected to lead them out in that game.
igbo: Ndị Spurs na ndị West Ham ga-achịpụ ya na ngwụsị izu a, a na-atụ anya na Mourinho ga-edu ha n'egwuregwu ahụ.

english: My Generation Too Weak, Cowardly To Fight For Nigeria, Says Don Jazzy
igbo: Ọgbọ m esighi ike, ịlụchitere Naịjiria ọgụ, Don Jazzy kwuru.

english: He said, 'I believe my generation has been weak and almost equally at fault for the state Nigeria is in today.
igbo: O kwuru, 'Ekwere m na ọgbọ m esighi ike ma ụta dịịrị ya n'ọnọdụ Naịjiria taa.'

english: Musician and producer, Don Jazzy, has blamed youths across Nigeria for failing to fight for a better country and accepting the status quo.
igbo: Onye na-akụ egwu na onye na-emepụta ihe, Don Jazzy, tara ndị ntorobịa Naịjiria ụta maka ịghara ịlụ ọgụ maka obodo ka mma na ịnakweere ọnọdụ ahụ.

english: In a post on Twitter on Thursday, the record label owner said he wondered why young Nigerians were reluctant to take up positions of leadership to change the fortunes of the country.
igbo: N'ihe o zigara na 'Twitter' na Tọzdee, onye nwe akara ndekọ ahụ kwuru na ọ na-eche ihe kpatara na ndị ntorobịa Naịjiria na-ala azụ iburu ọ́kwá iji gbanwee mba ahụ.

english: He said, 'I believe my generation has been weak and almost equally at fault for the state Nigeria is in today.
igbo: O kwuru, 'Ekwere m na ọgbọ m esighi ike ma ụta dịịrị ya n'ọnọdụ Naịjiria taa.'

english: 'We have been too weak and cowardly to challenge our fathers at the age they built the courage and decided to fight theirs.
igbo: Anyị esighi ike ma ndị nna anyị aka n'oge ha, ha nwere obi ike ma kpebie ịlụ ọgụ nke ha.

english: Not everyone, but I for one have been idle on the fence.
igbo: Ọ bụghị onye ọbụla, mana a bụ m otu onye gbara nkịtị.

english: The world's top 10 youngest heads of government/state are all below 40 years.
igbo: Ndị isi ọchịchị/steeti iri kacha elu n'ụwa niile dị afọ iri anọ gbadaa.

english: I also noticed many of them are heading parliamentary and monarchy governments.
igbo: Achọpụtakwara m na ọtụtụ n'ime ha na-achị ọchịchị omeiwu.'

english: 'My question: Is it a Herculean task for youths to be elected to rule in a unitary/presidential government?
igbo: Ajụjụ m: Ọ bụ nnukwu ọrụ ịhọpụta ndị ntorobịa ka ha bụrụ ndị ọchịchị n'otu ọchịchị onyeisi ala?'

english: Mystery, Controversy Over ABU Student's Suicide By Ibrahim Adeyemi
igbo: Ihe omimi, esemokwu banyere igbu onwe nke nwa akwụkwọ ABU nke sitere n’aka Ibrahim Adeyemi

english: She (Aisha's mother) has always loved her daughter and she feels she's old enough to know what she wants.
igbo: Ọ (nne Aisha) hụrụ nwa ya nwanyị n'anya mgbe nile na ọ na-adị ya ka o toruola ịmata ihe ọ chọrọ.

english: Religion has nothing, I mean nothing, to do with this.
igbo: Enweghị ihe ọbụla jikọrọ okpukpe na ihe a.

english: Aishat's mother had nothing to do with Aishat converting from this to that.
igbo: Nne Aisha enweghị ihe ọbụla jikọrọ ya na mgbanwe Aisha gbanwere n'okpuke.

english: The mom has no problem with Aisha being a Muslim.
igbo: Nwaanyị ahụ enweghị nsogbu na Aisha bụ onye alakụba.

english: Her mother has never interfered in it, her friend said.
igbo: Nne ya etinyebeghi aka na ya, ọ gbakwunyere.

english: Aisha Omolola
igbo: Aisha Omolola

english: Dead or alive?
igbo: Ịnwụ anwụ maọbụ ịdị ndụ?

english: Repressed and depressed by parents or not?
igbo: Mkpagide na mkpagbu ndị mụrụ ya maọbụ na ọ bụghị?

english: These are the controversial queries that filled the social media airwaves after the mysterious suicide action taken by Aisha Omolola, a 300 level student of Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria in her apartment at Samaru, Kaduna State.
igbo: Ajụjụ ndị a na-ese okwu jupụtara na soshal midia mgbe ihe omimi igbu onwe ya nke Aisha Omolola, nwa akwụkwọ (300L) nke Mahadum Ahmadu Bello, Zaria n'ụlọ ya na Samaru, Kaduna State.

english: Omolola was said to have committed suicide by drinking insecticide.
igbo: Omolola ka e kwuru na o gburu onwe ya site na ịṅụ ọgwụ ahụhụ.

english: She also reportedly dropped a note, stating why she took her life.
igbo: A kọrọ na o deturu akwụkwọ, na-ekwu ihe mere o jiri gbuo onwe ya.

english: According to the note, she wrote that her family should be held responsible for her suicide, especially her mother and father.
igbo: N'ederede ahụ, o dere na e kwesiri ijide ndị ezinaụlọ ya maka onwe ya o gburu, ọkachasị nne na nna ya.

english: She said the duo made life miserable for her and thus, killing herself was the only way she could save herself from the family's frustration.
igbo: O kwuru na ha mere ka ndụ ghara ịtọ ya ụtọ, yabụ igbu onwe ya bụ naanị ụzọ ọ ga-esi chebe onwe ya na ndakpọ ezinụlọ.

english: The letter reads below:
igbo: Ngụpụta edemede leta

english: Just like I said, if I am no more, please hold my family especially my mum and dad responsible.
igbo: Dịka m kwuru, ọ bụrụ na anọghịzi m, biko jide ezinaụlọ m ọkachasị nne na nna m.

english: I have tried to be the best I can be, stayed away from them just because they blame me for their mistakes and they can't love, help and take care of me like their own.
igbo: Agbalịala m ịdị mma, zeere ha n'ihi na ha na-ata m ụta maka mmehie ha na ha enweghị ike hụ m n'anya, nyere m aka ma lekọta m anya dịka nke ha.

english: My mum has made life a living hell for me only because she is bipolar and frustrated; accusing me of being a witch, trying to kill her and being a cursed child even though my brother is responsible for my education and upkeep.
igbo: Nne m emeela ka ndụ m bụrụ ọkụ ala mmụọ naanị n'ihi na obi agbawaala ya; na-ebo m ebubo ịbụ amoosu, na-achọ igbu ya na ịbụ onye a bụrụ ọnụ n'agbanyeghị na nwanne m nwoke na-ahụ maka agụmakwụkwọ na nlekọta m.

english: The only thing she helps me with is my feeding money.
igbo: Naanị ihe ọ na-enyere m aka bụ ego m ji enweta nri.

english: I have gone out of my way to take care of my mum by giving her food and money but I still end up being her problem.
igbo: A gara m n'ihu ilekọta nne m site n'inye ya nri na ego mana a ka m bụụrụ ya nsogbu.

english: My brother can't stick to his promise anymore because he feels I am not his responsibility and I have my own family.
igbo: Nwanne m enweghi ike imezu nkwa ya ike n'ihi na ọ na-eche na abụghị m ọrụ ya, enwekwara m ezinụlọ nke m.

english: I hope and believe that now that I am gone, it will bring them relief and happiness.
igbo: E nwere m olile anya ma kwere na ugbu a m nwụrụ, ọ ga-ewetara obi ụtọ.

english: I am so sorry Collins, I had to leave you this way, Maryam Olayemi you have [been] more than a bestie to me.
igbo: Ọ dị m nwute Collins, e kwesiri m ịhapụ gị otu a, Maryam Olayemi ị karịrị ịbụ ezigbo onye nke m. Ọ dịkwa m nwute nyere ndị enyi m niile na ndị na-echere m ezigbo echiche.

english: I am also sorry to all my friends and well wishers, I love to be happy but I'm nothing but a broken child.
igbo: Ahụrụ m inwe obi aṅụrị/ụtọ mana abụ m nwa obi gbawara.

english: I don't believe in God anymore, cos I can't see my purpose anymore.
igbo: Ekwetaghị m na Chineke ọzọ, n'ihi na enweghị m ike ịhụ nzube m ọzọ.

english: I love you all so much.
igbo: Ahụrụ m unu niile n'anya nke ukwuu.

english: When the news of the ABU student's suicide made headlines, most Nigerians condemned the act.
igbo: Mgbe akụkọ banyere nwa akwụkwọ ABU gburu onwe ya dị n'isi akụkọ, ọtụtụ ndị Naịjiria katọrọ ihe ahụ.

english: However, there are still some questions surrounding her demise left unanswered.
igbo: Otu o sila dị, a ka nwere ajụjụ ụfọdụ gbara ọkpụrụkpụ banyere ọnwụ ya azaghị.

english: Did Aisha Survive the Suicide Mission?
igbo: Aisha ọ gbanarịrị igbu onwe ya?

english: Few days after reactions followed Aisha's suicide action, it went viral on social media that she survived the attempt to commit suicide.
igbo: Ụbọchị ole na ole igbu ọchụ nke Aisha wuchara, ọ gbasara na soshal midia na ọ gbanarịrị ọnwụ ahụ.

english: The source of the rumour is traceable to the post on the Facebook page of Ahmadu Bello University, Samaru, Zaria.
igbo: Ihe kpatara asịrị ahụ bụ nke a ga-achọpụta n'ihe ntinye dị na 'Facebook' peeji nke Mahadum Ahmadu Bello, Samaru, Zaria.

english: The post, which has more than a thousand shares and likes have made many Nigerians wonder whether she really survived her suicide mission.
igbo: Ihe ntinye ahụ, nke ihe karịrị puku mmadụ tinyere ma nwee mmasị e meela ka ọtụtụ ndị Naịjirịa na-échè ma ọ gbanarịrị ọchụ ahụ (igbu onwe ya).

english: However, the picture attached to the Facebook post, showing Aisha in the hospital receiving treatment is the first fact that falsifies the rumours.
igbo: Otu o sila dị, foto a bụ nke e tinyere na 'Facebook', na-egosi Aisha n'ụlọ ọgwụ ebe ọ na-anata ọgwụgwọ bụ eziokwu mbụ gosiri na asịrị ahụ bụ ụgha.

english: This is because the said picture was posted on Twitter sometime in October 2018, when Aisha was said to have had an accident.
igbo: Nke a bụ n'ihi na otu foto a bụ nke e tinyere na 'Twitter' n'ime ọnwa Ọktoba 2018, mgbe e kwuru na Aisha nwere ihe mberede.

english: The rumour was further falsified by eye-witnesses who witnessed how Aisha died and was buried.
igbo: Asịrị ahụ bụ ụgha ka onye hụrụ ihe mere na-ekwu etu Aisha siri nwụọ e were lie ya.

english: Audu Abdulqudus, a recent graduate of Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria and close friend to Aisha affirmed that he was among many others who were present at her funeral on the same day she committed suicide.
igbo: Audu Abdulqudus, onye gụsịrị akwụkwọ na Mahadum Ahmadu Bello, Zaria na ezigbo enyi Aisha si kweta na ya so n'ọtụtụ ndị ọzọ bịara mmemme olili ozu ya n'otu ụbọchị ahụ o gburu onwe ya.

english: I was the main friend that carried her dead body the very day she died at the Jamaa hospital in Samaru.
igbo: Abụ m enyi ya buuru ozu ya ụbọchị ahụ ọ nwụrụ n'ụlọ ọgwụ Jamaa dị na Samaru.

english: I and her [best friend's father], Mr AbdulGaniu with two policemen took her to the Ahmadu Bello University Teaching Hospital mortuary.
igbo: Mụ na ezigbo enyi nna ya, Maazị AbdulGaniu na ndị uweojii abụọ kpọgara ya n'ụlọ ozu nke ụlọọgwụ Mahadum Ahmadu Bello.

english: I was called by Maryam Salami, Aisha's childhood friend on Thursday evening towards 4:00pm.
igbo: Maryam Salami, enyi nwaanyị Aisha kpọrọ m na mgbede Tọzdee ebe elekere anọ nke mgbede.

english: So, it was Maryam that now told me about the mum telling her that they were at the mortuary and they wanted to go and bury her that very evening on Thursday.
igbo: Yabụ, ọ bụ Maryam gwara m na nne ya na-agwa ya na ha nọ n'ụlọ ozu ahụ na ha chọrọ ịga lie ya na mgbede Tọọzde ahụ.

english: When contacted, Maryam Salami, a childhood friend of Aisha confirmed the death of her bosom friend, adding that Aisha's death was mysterious.
igbo: Mgbe a kpọtụụrụ, Maryam Salami, enyi nwaanyị Aisha mgbe ha dị n'obere kwupụtara ọnwụ ezigbo enyi ya, na-agbakwunye na ọnwụ Aisha bụ ihe dị omimi.

english: We don't know what to say.
igbo: Anyị amaghị ihe anyị ga-ekwu.

english: That's how God planned her own death; let's just put it that way,' she said.
igbo: Nke ahụ bụ ka Chineke si zubere ọnwụ nke ya; ka anyị tinye ya ụzọ ahụ,' o kwuru.'

english: Also, one Ruth Omole who was at Samaru hospital where Aisha gave up the ghost affirmed that Aisha did not survive the incident.
igbo: Ọzọ, Ruth Omole onye nọ n'ụlọ ọgwụ Samaru ebe Aisha nwụrụ kwupụtara na Aisha nwụrụ na ihe ahụ merenụ.

english: What to Note on the Suicide Note
igbo: ihe a ga-arịba ama na ndetu igbu onwe ya

english: The note left by Aisha about the cause of her suicide has created lots of controversies; there seems some mysterious issues thematically in the note.
igbo: Ihe e deturu nke Aisha hapụrụ maka ihe mere o jiri gbuo onwe ya kpatara ọtụtụ arụmụka; ọ dị ka e nwere ụfọdụ ihe omimi dị n'ederede ahụ.

english: The impression generally created in the letter was that Aisha's parents frustrated and repressed her so much that they made her 'not to believe in God anymore', most especially her mother.
igbo: Ederede ahụ gosiri na ndị mụrụ Aisha nwere kụdara mmụọ ya nke ukwuu nke ha mere ya ka 'ọ ghara ikwere na Chukwu ọzọ', karịchaa nne ya.'

english: As indicated in the note, Aisha frowned at how her mother so much rejected and dejected her while she was alive.
igbo: Dịka e gosiri na ihe ndetu ahụ, Aisha gbarụrụ ihu banyere etu nne ya siri jụ ya nke ukwuu mgbe ọ dị ndụ.

english: According to the note, she (her mother) would blame her for everything and even called her a witch.
igbo: Dịka ederede ahụ siri kwuo, ọ (nne ya) ga-ata ya ụta maka ihe ọbụla ma kpọọ ya onye amoosu.

english: Though all efforts to reach any of her parents proved abortive, the deceased's childhood friend, Maryam Salami, first confirmed that Aisha was the original author of the letter.
igbo: N'agbanyeghị mbọ niile a gbara inweta ndị mụrụ ya bụ nke kụrụ afọ n'ala, ọ bụ enyi onye ahụ nwụrụ anwụ bụ Maryam Salami bu ụzọ gosi na Aisha bụ onye dere akwụkwọ ozi ahụ.

english: Aisha wrote that letter.
igbo: Aisha bụ onye dere akwụkwọ ozi leta ahụ.

english: That's her handwriting,' she affirmed.
igbo: Ọ bụ aka edemede ya, o kwusiri ike.

english: She, however, added that the interpretation of the note could best be conveyed by its author.
igbo: Ọ gbakwụnyere na nkọwa ihe e deturu bụ onye dere ya kwesiri ịkọwa.'

english: Half of what she said could be true and could not be true.
igbo: Ọkara ihe o kwuru nwere ike ịbụ eziokwu ma nwee ike ịbụ asị.

english: It's a personal issue and we should leave it personal.
igbo: Ọ bụ okwu dịịrị onwe.

english: In that letter, she said something that has to do with herself and her mother or people around her.
igbo: N’akwụkwọ ozi ahụ, o kwuru ihe metụtara onwe ya na nne ya maọbụ ndị gbara ya gburugburu.

english: We shouldn't interfere.
igbo: Anyị ekwesighi igbochi ya.

english: That letter said a lot.
igbo: Akwụkwọ ozi ahụ kwuru ọtụtụ ihe.

english: I know what that letter means, but I don't want to say anything.
igbo: Ama m ihe akwụkwọ ozi ahụ pụtara, mana achọghị m ikwu ihe ọbụla.

english: That letter should just be left.
igbo: E kwesiri ịhapụ akwụkwọ ozi leta ahụ.

english: That letter is nothing.
igbo: Leta ahụ abụghị ihe ọbụla.

english: People should just let bygone be bygone.
igbo: Ndị mmadụ kwesiri íwè ihe gara aga dịka ihe gara aga.

english: We should just pray for her and God should forgive all of us, she said.
igbo: Anyị kwesiri ikpere ya ekpere, ma rịọ Chineke ka ọ gbaghara anyị niile, o kwuru.

english: Were religious differences ever a barrier between Aisha and her parents?
igbo: Ndịiche dị n'okpukpe a bụ ihe mgbochi n'etiti Aisha na ndị mụrụ ya?

english: Salami said religion could not have been the apple of discord.
igbo: Salami kwuru na okpukpe enweghị ike ịbụ nsogbu nke esemokwu.

english: This is contrary to what has been widely spread on social media.
igbo: Nke a megidere ozi gbasara na soshal midia.

english: BREAKING: DSS Releases Sowore After 125 Days Of Illegal Detention He was released on Thursday evening after the Federal High Court in Abuja ordered his release for the third time .
igbo: Ugbua: ndi DSS atoghapula Sowore ka mkpuru ubochi otu nari ,iri abuo na ise gachalu akpuolu esi uzo ezighi ezi nwere kpuru ya

english: Rights activist and pro-democracy campaigner, Omoyele Sowore, has regained his freedom more than three months after he was arrested by the Department of State Services in Lagos .
igbo: Ndi Right Activist na Pro-democracy campaigner, bu Omoyele Sowore aburugo onye nwere onwe ya, kemgbe onwa ato ngalaba nchekwa nwuchikolo ya na Legosu

english: Sowore was arrested and charged to court by the Nigerian Government for planning a nationawide protest tagged #RevolutionNow .
igbo: Nigerian Government, nwuchiri Sowore, kpuru ya ga uloikpe maka Ngaghari Iwe o na-akwado nke o kporo#Revolution Now

english: He was released on Thursday evening after the Federal High Court in Abuja ordered his release for the third time .
igbo: Ha toghapuru ya na uchichi Tozde ka uloikpe ukwu nyere iwu na ntuziaka ka atoghapu ya

english: Sowore is expected to appear in court on Friday for the commencement of his trial .
igbo: Sowore bu onye aturu anya ga-abia n'uloikpe ubochi Fride maka mmalite ikpe ya

english: The Nigerian Government is accusing Sowore of insulting President Muhammadu Buhari and planning to bring down his regime .
igbo: Ndi otu Nigerian government na aha bekee na- ebo Sowore ebubo na o na-akocha onyeisi ala bu Muhammadu Buhari, n'akpa nkata maka ichupu ya n' okwa ochichi ya

english: BREAKING: Falana To Take Up Case Of FUNAAB Student Rusticated Over Facebook Post .
igbo: Ugbua: Falana nwelu ikpe nwa akwukwo nke achupuru na Mahadum FUNAAB bu nke na-enwuzi na ihu akwukwo by Facebook na asusu bekee

english: Falana revealed this while speaking at a colloquium in Lagos on Thursday .
igbo: Falana kwuputara nke a, ebe enwere ogbako ndi nkuzi n legosu , ubochi Tozde

english: Femi Falana Leading lawyer, Femi Falana, has said he would take up the case of Ifemosu Adewale, a student of Federal University of Agriculture, Abeokuta, Ogun State, who was expelled over a post on Facebook .
igbo: Femi Falana- Onye nlekota Okaikpe bu Femi Falana ekwuola na ya ga - enwere okwu Ifemosu Adewale, nwata akwukwo mahadum Federal university of Agriculture nke di n'Abeokute, steeti Ogun, onye nke achupuru na ulo akwukwo maka ihe etinyele ya na Facebook

english: Falana revealed this while speaking at a colloquium in Lagos on Thursday .
igbo: Falana kwuputara nke a na ogbako ndi nkuzi nwere na legosu n'ubochi Tozde .

english: He said he had spoken with Adewale and the case would be taken to court .
igbo: Ọ sịrị na ya na Adewale ekwekoritago na-aga enwepu okwa ahu na uloikpe

english: He said, A young man just met me now that he wants to take his school to court .
igbo: O kwuru si:  otu Nwokolobia zutere m ugbua, na ya choro Inwepu ulo akwukwo ya uloikpe

english: FUNAAB Expels Student Over Letter To IGP, Alliance With Sowore
igbo: FUNAAB Achupuru nwa akwukwo ha, n'ihi ozi E zigara ndi otu IGP,Alliance na Sowore

english: He wrote an article on armed robbery case in FUNAAB and the school authority felt offended and rusticated him .
igbo: Ó dere na-akwukwo ozi gbasara ndi ohi na FUNAAB na ndi isi ulo akwukwo , nwere nwute ma chupu ya

english: I have asked him to see me next Tuesday .
igbo: A gwara m ya ka o biakwute m ubochi Tozde

english: We will take up the case and we will go to court.
igbo: Anyi ga-enwere okwu a ga n'uloikpe

english: FUNNAB's management had expelled Adewale after his post on Facebook condemning the indiscriminate arrests of students
igbo: Ndi nlekota FUNAAB achuola Adewale, n'ihi ihe akoro maka ya n'ihu akwukwo by Facebook,nwere Mee umu akwukwo ahu akpuolu akaja

english: And also the lack of adequate transportation system on the school's main campus .
igbo: Ozokwa na-ékwu maka , e nweghi ezigbo okporo uzo n'ime ulo akwukwo

english: The legal document also notes that “the Commission reserves the right to amend and review this Determination at any time, as well as to consider other options to incentivise the communications industry,” and not the ministry.
igbo: Akwụkwọ iwu ahụ kwukwara na kọmịshọn nwere ikike imenwo ma megharịa Mkpebi ahụ oge ọbụla, ma lelekwaa ohere ndị ọzọ iji wulie ụlọ ọrụ akpọm oku, ma ọbụghị ụlọ ozi.

english: It further states that such a review may be necessitated by major change in the market conditions and/or the underlining principles of this Determination.
igbo: Ọ gara n'ihu kwuo na ụdị nnyochagharị bụ nke oke mgbanwe n'ọnọdụ ahịa na ụzọ ọrụ nke Mkpebi ahụ

english: In the formulation of this Determination, it was gathered that the banks had applied to the NCC for USSD codes for their mobile transactions, where they were now directed to the Mobile Network Operators (MNOs) independently.
igbo: na mmebe Mkpebi nke a, emere ka a mata na ụlọakụ edeela akwụkwọ gara ndị NCC maka akara USSD nke eji akwụ ụgwọ site n'ekwentị, ebe enyere ha ikike ugbua nyere Mobile Network Operators (MNOs) nke nọọrọ onwe ya.

english: Meanwhile, ALTON’s accounts of how the USSD usage by the banks began and the support of the Commission in allowing the banks to use the USSD platform to facilitate digital financial inclusion is also revealing in the document obtained by The Guardian.
igbo: Etu ọ dị, akaụntụ ALTON etu esi eji USSD site n'aka ndị ụlọakụ malitere na nkwado nke kọmịshọn n'inye ndị ụlọakụ ikike iji USSD wee kwalite ntinye ego dijital na-egosi n'akwụkwọ nke Guardian nwetara.

english: According to ALTON, while telecommunication services and infrastructure became more accessible in the country, the banks identified the USSD channel as a cost-efficient way of delivering financial services to their customers.
igbo: Site n'aka ALTON, ebe ozi ọkpụkpọ oku ekwentị na arụrarụ bụ na-eruzi aka n'ala a, ndị ụlọakụ gosipụtara ọwara USSD dịka ụzọ dị ọnụ ala eji ezije ozi ego nye ndị ahịa ha.

english: “The banks subsequently applied for and were granted USSD shortcodes to deliver financial services to bank customers by the Nigerian Communications Commission (“the Commission”).
igbo: ndị ụlọakụ dere akwụkwọ ma nweta mkpụmkpụ akara USSD maka izije ozi ego nye ndị ahịa ụlọakụ site n'aka ndị Nigerian Communication Commission (the Commission).

english: ‘‘At the nascent stage of USSD development for the financial services sector, the billing mode adopted by our members was to charge the telecommunications service consumer directly, which is referred to as end-user billing.
igbo: N'oge mbilite nke mwuli USSD maka ngalaba ozi izije ego, ụzọ ịkwụ ụgwọ nke ndị otu anyị nabatara bụ ịna ndị ahịa telecommunication ozi n'aka ha, nke ana akpọ ịkwụ ụgwọ ngwụcha-onye ọrụ.

english: Green House won the track events while White House won in football match.
igbo: Ụlọ akwụkwọ ndụ meriri n'egwuregwu ọwara ebe Ụlọ akwa ọcha meriri n'egwuregwu bọọlụ ụkwụ

english: However, “following complaints by its customers with regard to disappearing/illegal airtime deductions, ALTON said there was a consensus with the banks to implement corporate billing where the banks absorbed the costs associated with deploying the USSD platform for financial services.
igbo: Etu ọ dị, site na mkpesa sitere n'aka ndị ahịa ya maka iwepụ ike oku ha n'ụzọ ezighị ezi, ALTON sịrị na ha na ndị ụlọakụ  nwere nkwekọrịta ịnara ego ọrụ nke dịnyeere inwere USSD maka ozi ego

english: Calisthenics and match past added glamour to the ceremony.
igbo: egwu kalịstenis na ife aka mere ka emume ahụ dị ụtọ

english: These are according to a letter obtained from the Ministry, which was dated October 28, 201 and addressed to the Minister Pantami and duly signed by ALTON Chairman and Executive Secretary, Gbenga Adebayo, and Kazeem Ladepo respectively.
igbo: Dịka ọ si dị na leta sitere n'ụlọ ọrụ, nke nwere akara ụbọchị iri abụọ na asatọ nke ọnwa Ọktoba n'afọ 2019 ma bụrụ nke edegaara Mịnịsta Pantami ma nwee mbinye aka site n'aka Onyeisi ALTON  na Ode akwụkwọ Ukwu, Gbenya Adebayo na Kazeem Lapedo
